input: name: roasted shrimp and cocktail sauce ; ingredients: frozen shrimp, light olive oil, kosher salt, black pepper, ketchup, prepared horseradish, lemon juice, tabasco sauce, worcestershire sauce ; preparation:Thaw shrimp. Toss shrimp with oil, salt and pepper. Put shrimp in a single layer on a foil lined sheet pan and roast at 350f for 5-10 minutes or until shrimp just start to turn pink. Remove from pan. Mix ketchup, horseradish, worcestershire, tabasco and lemon juice together. Serve cocktail sauce chilled along with shrimp. ; name: junk bars aka seven layer bars ; ingredients: fiber one cereal, water, unsweetened coconut, butterscotch chips, nuts, chocolate chips, fat-free sweetened condensed milk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Mix water and crumbs in a 13x9 pan. Using the bottom of a large measuring cup, press the moist crumbs down. Evenly distributing them using a smaller measuring cup, get the corners. Sprinkle coconut on top followed by butterscotch, nuts, and chocolate. Drizzle sweetened condensed milk evenly on top. Bake for 20-30 minutes. Drool and devour. ; name: mussels in white wine or beer 4 ingredients ; ingredients: dry white wine, mussels, fresh parsley, butter ; preparation:Melt butter in large pan. Pour in wine and bring to boil. Add mussels and cover pan with lid. Cook over medium heat for 4-5 minutes, lightly shake the pan every minute. Remove mussels with tongs onto serving dish and discard any mussels that are still closed. Bring the remaining liquid to a boil. Season with salt and pepper and stir in parsley. Pour liquid over the mussels and serve immediately. ; name: chocolate corn flake candy ; ingredients: chocolate, corn flakes, walnuts, pecans ; preparation:Melt chocolate in top of double boiler over hot water. Mix corn flakes and nuts in a large bowl. Pour melted chocolate over this mixture. Stir until well coated. Drop by teaspoon full onto wax paper. Can also be put into candy cups. ; name: chicken jerusalem ; ingredients: chicken thighs, butter, green onions, white wine, water, mushroom, salt, artichoke hearts, parmesan cheese ; preparation:In a large skillet, melt butter. Brown chicken pieces. Add green onions, water and wine. Simmer for 45 minutes. Add the mushrooms, salt, and artichoke hearts. Simmer for an additional 15 minutes. Before serving top with grated parmesan cheese. ; name: mocha almond bars ; ingredients: flour, sugar, butter, egg, instant coffee granules, sliced almonds, powdered sugar, almond extract, milk ; preparation:

name: chicken and rice with bacon ; ingredients: chicken pieces, bacon, rice, cream of chicken soup, chicken broth, milk, salt, pepper, poultry seasoning, paprika ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325. Line large baking dish with bacon. Pour rice evenly over top of bacon. Place chicken on top of rice. Season chicken with salt, pepper, poultry seasoning and paprika. Mix together soup, broth, milk and pour over chicken and rice. Cover and bake for 3 hours at 325. Uncover and bake for 15 minute more. ; name: so easy homemade truffles ; ingredients: semisweet chocolate, cream cheese, powdered sugar, vanilla, ground nuts ; preparation:Melt chocolate in microwave on med. Power. Stir occasionally. Set aside. Beat cream cheese until smooth. Gradually add sugar, beating until well blended. Add melted chocolate and vanilla, mix well. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Roll into 1 inch balls. Roll in nuts or coconut. Store in refrigerator. ; name: tomato olive caper tapenade ; ingredients: olive oil, shallot, cherry tomatoes, olive, capers, fresh oregano, balsamic vinegar ; preparation:Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add the shallot and cook until begins to soften. Add the tomatoes and cook, stirring until soft. Add olives and capers and cook for 30 seconds more. Stir in oregano and vinegar and remove from heat. Spoon over fish. ; name: savory chicken sandwiches from the crock pot ; ingredients: chicken breast halves, chicken thighs, onion soup mix, garlic salt, italian salad dressing, water, hamburger buns ; preparation:Place chicken in crockpot. Sprinkle with soup mix and garlic salt. Pour dressing and water over chicken. Cover and cook on low for 8-9 hours. Remove chicken and cool slightly. Skim fat from cooking juices. Remove chicken from bones and cut into bite-size pieces and return to crockpot. Serve with a slotted spoon on buns. I have also used boneless chicken pieces and cut them up before placing in the crockpot. You just need to adjust cooking time if doing it this way. ; name: fiery catfish fingers ; ingredients: prepared yellow mustard, coarse grain mustard, egg white, tabasco sauce, catfish fillets, yellow cornmeal, all-purpose flour, salt and pepper, vegetable oil ; preparation:In a large bowl, stir together the mustard, egg white, and tabasco sauce. Add the fish and toss to coat well. Cover and marinate for 1 hour. In a shallow dish, mix together the cornmeal, flour, salt, and pepper. Pour the oil into a heavy 3-quart saucepan or deep-fryer, filling it to no more than one-third full, and heat over medium heat to 350 degrees. Dredge the fish in the cornmeal mixture and shake off excess. Carefully add the fish to the oil, a few pieces at a time. Cook for 2 minutes or until golden brown and crispy. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with spicy mayonnaise or salsa. ; name: mushroom sausage stuffing ; ingredients: bread cubes, sausage, mushrooms, celery, onion, butter, chicken broth, salt, black pepper, sage ; preparation:

name: quick lemon curd ; ingredients: white sugar, eggs, fresh lemon juice, lemons, zest of, unsalted butter ; preparation:In a microwave bowl, whisk together the sugar and eggs until smooth. Stir in lemon juice, lemon zest, and butter. Cook in the microwave for one minute intervals, stirring after each minute until the mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a metal spoon. It will be quite liquid but will set up somewhat overnight. Remove from the microwave, and pour into sterile jars. Store for up to 3 weeks in the refrigerator. ; name: zucchini garlic pasta ; ingredients: wagon wheel macaroni, bacon, onion, garlic, zucchini, salt, lemon juice, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Prepare pasta according to package directions. In a large skillet cook bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon to drain on paper towel lined plate. Discard all but 2 tablespoons of drippings. Saute onion and garlic in bacon drippings for about 3 minutes or until tender. Add zucchini and salt. Saute about 6 minutes or until tender. Drain pasta and add to zucchini mixture. Add lemon juice and bacon. Toss well. Pour into a serving bowl and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. ; name: cauliflower and crab chowder ; ingredients: cauliflower florets, chicken broth, red bell pepper, lemon peel, half-and-half, all-purpose flour, imitation crabmeat, dill weed ; preparation:In a large saucepan combine cauliflower, broth, bell pepper and lemon peel. Bring to boiling, reduce heat. Cover and simmer 6 to 8 minutes or until cauliflower is crisp tender. Stir together half and half and flour. Stir into cauliflower mixture. Bring to boiling. Gently stir in crabmeat. Heat through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with dill weed, if desired. Serve immediately. ; name: chicken and stars soup ; ingredients: chicken, carrots, onion, celery, garlic cloves, pasta, parsley, salt and pepper ; preparation:In a stock pot, place chicken, carrots, garlic, onion and celery. Cover with water. Boil for thirty to forty minutes, remove chicken from pot. Allow chicken to cool remove skin and bones, then chop chicken into bite-size pieces. Add chicken back to soup, add parsley, pasta, salt and pepper. Allow to simmer until noodles are cooked. You may need to add water to keep soup soupy after pasta has cooked. Use your own judgment. ; name: ida s creamy kielbasa and potato soup ; ingredients: potatoes, onion, celery, beef broth, chicken broth, water, garlic cloves, kielbasa, condensed cream of chicken soup, ground black pepper ; preparation:Saute veggies and garlic in 2 t. Of olive oil for 5 minutes. Add remaining ingredients, and bring to a boil, then reduce heat, and simmer until potatoes are tender, 15-20 minutes. Season with pepper. Serve hot. ; name: turkey and stuffing ring ; ingredients: dry bread cubes, cooked turkey, swiss cheese, dry onion, eggs, milk, salt, pepper, poultry seasoning ; preparation:

name: e z banana creme bundt cake ; ingredients: bananas, banana instant pudding, water, yellow cake mix, eggs, oil, pecans ; preparation:In large mixing bowl, mash bananas. Add rest of ingredients, except pecans and mix for 2 minutes at medium speed of mixer. Add chopped pecans. Pour into greased and floured bundt pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 60 minutes. Cool in pan for 15 minutes. Remove from pan and let cool. Sprinkle with powdered sugar before serving. ; name: mini chicken burgers with herbs ; ingredients: panko breadcrumbs, ground chicken, garlic cloves, parsley, dried oregano, dried basil, lemon juice, salt & freshly ground black pepper, extra virgin olive oil ; preparation:Place bread crumbs in a small, shallow dish. Mix chicken, garlic, parsley, oregano, basil and lemon juice. Add salt and pepper. Form into 16 patties, each flattened and 2 inches in diameter. Press into bread crumbs to coat each side. In large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium heat. Add as many patties as will fit in a single layer and cook, turning once, until each side is brown and patties firm up, about 10 minutes. Repeat with remaining patties, adding more oil if necessary. Serve hot. ; name: chicken and avocado tortilla cups ; ingredients: cooked chicken, iceberg lettuce, avocado, tomatoes, mayonnaise, sweet chili sauce, basil, flour tortillas, mixed salad green ; preparation:Preheat oven to 200c. Lightly grease 4 holes of a 6 hole texas muffin tray. Combine chicken, lettuce, avocado, tomato, mayonnaise, chilli sauce and basil in a large bowl. Microwave tortillas on high in 15 second bursts until pliable and carefully place in prepared muffin holes, shaping into cups and then bake for 5 minutes or until golden and crisp. Place tortilla cups on serving plates and fill with chicken mixture and top with extra basil leaves. Serve with salad mix. ; name: old fashioned homemade lemonade concentrate ; ingredients: citric acid, tartaric, epsom salts, lemons, juice of, lemons, zest of, granulated sugar, boiling water ; preparation:Mix all ingredients together well. Pour boiling water over mixture. Stir shortly. Let stand overnight. Strain mixture and then bottle. When you wish to drink it, add the concentrate to water to taste. ; name: jackson family rice custard ; ingredients: rice, milk, eggs, brown sugar, butter, raisins, vanilla, nutmeg, whipped cream ; preparation:Heat oven to 350 degrees. Combine rice, milk, eggs, brown sugar and butter in 1 qt casserole or baking dish. Place casserole in baking pan. Fill pan with enough water to go halfway up side of casserole. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Stir in raisins and vanilla. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Return to oven. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve hot or chilled, topped with whipped cream. ; name: peanut szechuan pasta ; ingredients: spaghetti, broccoli florets, chunky peanut butter, vegetable stock, soy sauce, seasoned rice vinegar, oil, garlic cloves, dry crushed red pepper ; preparation:

name: creamy tomato basil garlic cheese tortellini soup ; ingredients: tomato juice, chicken broth, diced tomatoes, heavy whipping cream, dried basil leaves, garlic, vegetable oil, sweet unsalted butter, cheese tortellini ; preparation:Saut minced garlic in vegetable oil until slightly browned and fragrant. Combine garlic with tomato juice, chicken broth, and petite diced tomatoes in a sauce pan and bring to a boil. Let simmer for 15-20 minutes. Add cheese tortellini and basil leaves, then simmer for 5-10 minutes. Slowly add butter and heavy whipping cream, and stir continuously over low heat until heated through. Do not let boil. Goes great with side salad and bread. ; name: super simple chicken soup ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, carrot, celery, shallot, garlic, chunk chicken, hot water, chicken base, cold water, cornstarch ; preparation:Place first 5 ingredients in a soup pot and saute for 5 minutes. Add chicken, stir. Combine hot water and base then add to your pot. Cook for 15 minutes or until carrots are done enough for you. Combine cold water and corn starch then add to your pot while stirring. Your soup will thicken and be ready to serve. You can add more cornstarch mixture if you would like it thicker. I like mine somewhere between a soup and a stew consistency. ; name: polish stir fry ; ingredients: kielbasa, potatoes, carrot, onion, cabbage ; preparation:Lightly grease big, iron skillet, with canola oil. Brown the kielbasa. Take it out and put it aside. Drain excess grease. Fry potatoes and carrots, stirring often, until half-cooked. Add onion and keep frying, stirring frequently. When the onion is half-cooked, add the cabbage and continue until everything is completely cooked. Return kielbasa to the pan, mix well, and serve once it is reheated. This dish travels well and reheats well. ; name: moroccan style spicy chicken rice 25 minutes to make ; ingredients: skinless chicken breasts, ras el hanout spice mix, onion, butter, long grain rice, dried apricots, chicken stock cube, chickpeas, flat leaf parsley, pistachio nut ; preparation:Coat chicken with the ras el hanout. Fry the onion in butter until soft. Add the chicken, then cook for a few mins more. Stir in the rice and apricots, then add the stock cube with 700ml boiling water and the chickpeas. Cover the pan and simmer for 15 mins or until the rice is tender and has absorbed most of the liquid. Remove from heat, add parsley & mix. Serve each portion with a sprinkle of pistachios. ; name: baked caprese ravioli ; ingredients: cheese ravioli, tomatoes, fresh mozzarella cheese, fresh basil, extra virgin olive oil, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cook the ravioli according to package directions. Let cool to room temperature. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 425f and chop the basil. Place ravioli on a parchment lined baking pan. Layer each ravioli with a slice of tomato, then season with salt and pepper. Then continue with with the basil then the cheese. Bake for about 15 minutes. Drizzle with the olive oil and serve. ; name: vegan macaroni and yeast ; ingredients: small elbow macaroni, vegan mayonnaise, nutritional yeast, non-dairy milk substitute, salt and pepper, breadcrumbs ; preparation:

name: cream filled oat bars ; ingredients: sweetened condensed milk, lemon rind, fresh lemon juice, all-purpose flour, quick-cooking oats, brown sugar, butter, salt, baking soda ; preparation:Heat oven to 375f. Grease 9 x 9-inch square pan. Mix milk, lemon peel and lemon juice until thickened. Reserve. Mix remaining ingredients until crumbly. Press half of the crumbly mixture in pan. Bake about 10 minutes or until set. Spread milk mixture over baked layer. Sprinkle remaining crumbly mixture on milk mixture. Press gently into milk mixture. Bake about 20 minutes or until edge is golden brown and center is set but soft. Cool completely. ; name: tortellini alfredo with prosciutto artichoke hearts ; ingredients: cheese-filled egg tortellini, whipping cream, parmesan cheese, prosciutto, marinated artichoke hearts ; preparation:Prepare tortellini according to package instructions. Drain. Heat cream in a large skillet over low heat. Gradually sprinkle in cheese, stirring constantly, until blended. Simmer, stirring occasionally, 15 to 20 minutes. Add tortellini, prosciutto, and artichoke hearts. Simmer, stirring occasionally, 5 to 10 minutes or until sauce is slightly reduced. Serve immediately. Serve with crusty italian bread, if desired. ; name: fried bread cookies ; ingredients: bread, eggs, milk, salt, sugar, walnuts ; preparation:Cut crusts off of the bread and cut into 1 inch wide strips. Beat egg. Add egg to milk, salt, and sugar. Dip the bread strips into batter. Roll in chopped nuts. Deep fry until brown or bake in oven 15 minutes. ; name: ila s delightful sugar cookies ; ingredients: butter, powdered sugar, granulated sugar, eggs, flour, baking soda, cream of tartar, vanilla ; preparation:Cream butter, sugars and eggs until fluffy and mixed well. Add flour, soda cream of tarter and vanilla. Blending thoroughly. Roll out onto lightly floured surface to - inch thickness. Cut with cookie cutters. Sprinkle with sugar if desired. Bake for 12-15 min at 325. ; name: delicious coleslaw for diet ; ingredients: white cabbage, carrots, onion, mayonnaise, mustard, vinegar, salt and pepper, sugar, pasta, chicken ; preparation:Dice the white cabbage, carrots and onion long and thin. Mix carrots, cabbage and onion in a big bowl with a wooden spoon. Boil pasta and chicken separately. Then add all the ingredients and mix. Seal it with clingfilm and refrigerate. ; name: sausage vegetable casserole ; ingredients: sausages, onion, bacon, french onion soup mix, water, frozen mixed vegetables, fresh parsley ; preparation:

name: spiced blueberries ; ingredients: blueberries, vinegar, ground cinnamon, ground cloves, sugar ; preparation:Place berries in a large saucepan and add vinegar and spices. Boil for 30 minutes. Add sugar and boil for an additional 30 minutes or until thickened sufficiently. Stir occasionally after adding sugar to prevent scorching. Pour into sterilized jars and seal. ; name: miso soup with enoki mushrooms ; ingredients: boiling water, yellow miso, red miso, low sodium soy sauce, enoki mushrooms, firm tofu ; preparation:Combine water and bonito. Let stand 2 minutes. Strain the liquid through a fine sieve into a bowl. Discard solids. Bring the liquid to a boil in a large saucepan. Add yellow and red miso and soy sauce. Stir well with a whisk until smooth. Divide the enoki mushrooms and tofu evenly among 6 soup bowls, and ladle 1 cup soup into each bowl. ; name: pumpkin nacho cheese ball ; ingredients: cream cheese, salsa, cumin, onions, jalapeno, cheddar cheese, nacho cheese flavored tortilla chips, bell pepper ; preparation:With a mixer, blend 16 ounces room-temperature cream cheese with 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 3 tablespoons minced onion, 3 tablespoons salsa, 2 teaspoons ground cumin and 1 teaspoon minced jalapeno. Scoop the mix into plastic wrap and form into a ball. Chill approximately 1 hour. Once chilled unwrap and roll into crushed nacho tortilla chips, then press a bell pepper stem into top of ball. Serve with pepper slices and tortilla chips. Prep time does not include chilling time. ; name: creamy tomato basil garlic cheese tortellini soup ; ingredients: tomato juice, chicken broth, diced tomatoes, heavy whipping cream, dried basil leaves, garlic, vegetable oil, sweet unsalted butter, cheese tortellini ; preparation:Saut minced garlic in vegetable oil until slightly browned and fragrant. Combine garlic with tomato juice, chicken broth, and petite diced tomatoes in a sauce pan and bring to a boil. Let simmer for 15-20 minutes. Add cheese tortellini and basil leaves, then simmer for 5-10 minutes. Slowly add butter and heavy whipping cream, and stir continuously over low heat until heated through. Do not let boil. Goes great with side salad and bread. ; name: cashew golden rice ; ingredients: hot water, chicken bouillon cubes, onion powder, ground turmeric, long grain rice, unsalted cashews, golden raisin, candied ginger, fresh chives ; preparation:In a medium size pot, add water, bouillion cubes, onion powder and turmeric. Bring to a rapid boil. Remove from heat and add rice, stir gently. Cover and return to stove and simmer on low heat till all water is absorbed. Once all water has been absorbed remove pot from stove and let sit covered for 5 minutes. Fluff rice with a fork and add nuts, raisins, candied ginger and chopped chives. ; name: goldfish checkerboard sandwiches ; ingredients: white bread, crunchy peanut butter, whole wheat bread, grape jelly, goldfish crackers ; preparation:

name: sneak it to em broccoli soup ; ingredients: water, chicken stock, onion, frozen broccoli, salt, milk, instant mashed potatoes, butter, ground nutmeg ; preparation:Heat the stock mixture over medium heat, add the onion, broccoli, and salt, and cook about ten minutes or until tender. Puree half the vegetables with half of the liquid in a blender or processor until smooth, then repeat with the other half. Heat the milk in a large saucepan until bubbles form on the edges. Stir in the remaining ingredients and carefully simmer for three minutes. Stir in the pureed broccoli and onion, taste for seasoning, and ladle into individual bowls. Serves six. ; name: lemon oatmeal cookies diabetic ; ingredients: vegetable oil, brown sugar, egg white, lemon juice, lemon rind, all-purpose flour, rolled oats, baking powder, baking soda, crispy rice cereal ; preparation:Place oil and brown sugar in a mixer bowl in a mixer bowl and mix at medium speed until creamy. Add egg whites, lemon juice, rind and flavoring, and mix at medium speed until well blended. Stir flour, oatmeal, baking powder, and baking soda together to blend well. Add to creamy mixture while beating at medium speed. Stir in cereal. Drop by the tablespoonful onto cookie sheets left ungreased, or lined with aluminum foil. Bake at 350f for 8 to 10 minutes, or until cookies are lightly browned. Remove cookies to a wire rack and cool. ; name: thai noodles ; ingredients: angel hair pasta, soy sauce, peanut butter, sugar, vegetable oil, dark sesame oil, garlic, dry crushed red pepper, red chili oil, fresh cilantro ; preparation:Cook pasta according to the package directions. Drain well. Set aside, and keep warm. Combine soy sauce and the next seven ingredients in a small bowl. Stir well with a wire whisk. Pour over the pasta. Toss gently. Add toppings, if desired. ; name: reuben s creamed corn ; ingredients: half-and-half, chicken bouillon cubes, white pepper, sugar, frozen corn, butter, flour, parsley ; preparation:Blend together half and half, chicken bouillon cubes, pepper and sugar in saucepan. Bring to boil. Add corn to boiling liquid. Return to boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 3-5 minutes. Melt butter in separate small saucepan. Add flour and cook, stirring constantly until paste is formed. Add flour mixture to corn mixture and stir with wooden spoon to mix well. Bring to boil, stirring frequently, until thickened. Remove from heat. Sprinkle lightly with chopped parsley if desired. ; name: angel hair with tomatoes basil garlic ; ingredients: garlic, black pepper, diced tomatoes, angel hair pasta, salt, chicken broth, basil, low-fat parmesan cheese ; preparation:In a large saucepan, cook garlic until tender. Add tomatoes, salt, basil, and black pepper. Cook three minutes. Add cooked spaghetti. Toss well. Add chicken broth and stir. Toss with parmesan cheese. ; name: hawaiian chicken white rice made simple ; ingredients: chicken breast halves, flour, soy sauce, sugar, pineapple chunk, parsley, white rice, parsley sprig ; preparation:

name: jab your turkey with lemon garlic marinade ; ingredients: olive oil, fresh lemon juice, garlic, salt, pepper, lemon peel ; preparation:In blender, combine olive oil and lemon juice. While blending, drop in garlic cloves one at a time. Gradually add lemon peel strips. Continue to blend until mixture is pureed. Using an injector, inject marinade into all parts of the thawed turkey. Strain marinade if difficulty passing through injector. Gently massage turkey to distribute marinade. Place turkey in a large plastic bag cooking bag. Close bag and refrigerate overnight. ; name: easy applesauce muffins ; ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, salt, egg, unsweetened applesauce, butter ; preparation:Heat oven to 375 degrees. Spray muffin tins with nonstick spray. Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt in a bowl. Mix in beaten eggs, applesauce and melted butter. Evenly scoop mixture into muffin pans. Sprinkle crystal sugar sprinkles on tops of muffins. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes. Test to see if toothpick comes out clean. ; name: grilled salmon with peanut hoisin sauce ; ingredients: creamy peanut butter, hoisin sauce, onion, rice wine vinegar, water, garlic, salmon fillets, salt and pepper, scallion ; preparation:Combine all sauce ingredients in a saucepan. Bring to a boil then reduce the heat and simmer for about 5 minutes, stirring often. Sauce can be made several days ahead of time and refrigerated. If it is too thick, just add a little water when heating it before serving. Season the salmon filets with salt and pepper. Grill until done to your liking. Top each grilled salmon filet with warm peanut hoisin sauce and sprinkle with chopped scallions, just before serving. ; name: ortega s mexican rice ; ingredients: unsalted butter, long grain white rice, onion, thick & chunky salsa, water, carrot, frozen peas, cumin ; preparation:Melt butter in large saucepan over medium heat. Add rice, onion and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 3 to 4 minutes or until rice is golden. Stir in salsa, water, cumin, carrot and peas. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cook, covered, for 25 to 30 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. ; name: ear wax wieners on q tips ; ingredients: margarine, cocktail franks, mustard, mayonnaise, toothpicks, cotton balls ; preparation:Melt the margarine in a small pan over low heat. Place the franks on a broiling pan and brush them with the melted butter. Broil the franks until they are evenly browned. Combine the mustard and mayo in a small bowl and set aside-- this will be the ear wax. Stick each frank on a tooth pick. Wet the cotton balls slightly in order to compact them and stick one on the other end of the tooth pick-- this is your q-. Place the small bowl of ear wax in the middle of a platter and arrange the franks on q-. Dip franks in ear wax to eat. ; name: kennedy family chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: unsalted butter, light brown sugar, sugar, eggs, vanilla, flour, baking soda, salt, water, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:

name: baked orange roughy italian style ; ingredients: seasoned bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, romano cheese, garlic powder, salt, orange roughy fillet, butter, fresh parsley ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Coat a medium size baking dish with non-stick cooking spray. In a shallow bowl, mix bread crumbs, parmesan, romano, garlic powder and salt. Brush both sides of the fillets with butter, and dredge in the bread crumb mixture. Arrange fillets in a single layer in the prepared baking dish, and sprinkle with parsley. Bake in pre-heated oven 10-15 minutes, or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. ; name: low cal zucchini and mushroom frittata ; ingredients: zucchini, white mushrooms, garlic cloves, onions, egg whites, salt, pepper, chili powder, cayenne pepper, garlic powder ; preparation:Spray a non-stick skillet with fat-free, calorie free non-stick cooking spray. Saut onion and garlic for 3 minutes. Add zucchini and saut for 3 minutes. Add mushrooms and continue to saut all of the veggies until soft. In a large bowl, whisk eggs, salt, pepper, chili powder, cayenne pepper, and garlic powder until the eggs become slightly puffy. Drain vegetables and add to egg mixture. Fold veggies into egg whites and pour back into the skillet. Cook on medium for 8 minutes. Place a plate on top of the skillet and flip the frittata. Slide uncooked side down back onto skillet and cook for another 8 minutes. If you like the top to be crunchy, place the frittata under the broiler for an additional 10 minutes. ; name: fried perch ; ingredients: perch fillet, flour, cornmeal, light beer, salt, pepper, old bay seasoning, oil ; preparation:Heat skillet fryer with hot oil. Mix flour, cornmeal, beer, salt pepper and seasonings until a batter consistency. Coat filets with batter. Deep fry til golden brown. Approx 3 minutes per side. ; name: cos salad boats ; ingredients: cos lettuce, avocados, plum tomatoes, alfalfa sprouts, eggs, mayonnaise, water, dijon mustard, fresh dill, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Arrange the salad leaves on a large platter with the edges facing up so that they look like boats. Combine the avocados, tomatoes, and sprouts in a bowl, then fill each of the salad leaves with this mixture. Sprinkle each one with some chopped egg. Whisk all the salad dressing ingredients together in a small bowl. Check and adjust the seasoning to taste, then spoon over salad and serve at once. ; name: easy creamy pasta with veggies ; ingredients: fusilli, california-blend frozen vegetables, cream of mushroom soup, milk, parmesan cheese, mustard, cream cheese, salt and black pepper ; preparation:Bring a large saucepan of salted water to boil and cook pasta according to package directions. Add frozen veggies in with pasta during last five minutes of cooking. Drain pasta and veggies in colander. In the same pan, over low heat, whisk together soup, milk, parmesan, and mustard. Add cream cheese and whisk frequently while cream cheese melts. Once mixture is smooth, add veggies and pasta into sauce. Heat until mixture is combined and warmed through, stirring frequently. Taste. Add salt and pepper if desired. Serve. ; name: greyhound in the pink ; ingredients: grapefruit, maraschino cherries, white sugar, lime, vodka, ruby red grapefruit juice, ice ; preparation:

name: mrs field s soft and chewy peanut butter cookies ; ingredients: flour, baking soda, salt, dark brown sugar, granulated sugar, butter, eggs, creamy peanut butter, vanilla extract ; preparation:Preheat oven to 300 degrees f. Mix dry ingredients and set aside. On medium speed, in large bowl, blend sugars. Add butter, mix till grainy consistency. Add eggs, peanut butter and vanilla extract. Beat till fluffy. On low speed, add flour mixture until barely mixed into butter mixture. Drop by rounded tablespoonsful, 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet. Use a wet or flour coated fork to gently press a crisscross pattern on top of each cookie. Bake until the edges of the cookies are lightly browned, approximately 18 to 20 minutes. Remove to cool on a flat surface. ; name: 1 bowl fudgy brownies ; ingredients: unsweetened chocolate, butter, granulated sugar, eggs, vanilla, all-purpose flour, nuts, chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325f butter a 9x13-inch baking pan. Coarsely chop chocolate and place in a large microwave-safe bowl along with butter. Microwave, uncovered, on high for 2 minutes, then stir until chocolate is melted. Let mixture cool to room temperature. Stir in sugar, then eggs and vanilla. Gradually stir in flour, then nuts and chocolate chips, if using. Spread mixture in pan. Bake in center of oven for 30 minutes or until a skewer inserted in center of brownies comes out clean. ; name: roasted chickpeas ww core ; ingredients: chickpeas, garlic powder, salt, pepper, nonstick cooking spray ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Rinse and drain chickpeas. Lightly coat baking sheet with nonstick spray. Spread chickpeas on baking sheet and sprinkle with garlic powder, salt and pepper. Toss to coat. Bake on bottom rack of oven, shaking pan every 15 minutes. Bake 45 to 50 minutes, until browned and crunchy. Cool completely before serving. ; name: cranberry fluff ; ingredients: cranberries, miniature marshmallows, sugar, apples, walnuts, green grape, salt, heavy whipping cream ; preparation:Place cranberries in food processor. Cover and process until finely chopped. Transfer to a large bowl. Stir in marshmallows and sugar. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Just before serving, stir in the apples, grapes, walnuts and salt. Fold in the whipped cream. ; name: herbed pizza dough ; ingredients: bread flour, flour, water, yeast, mixed herbs, sun-dried tomato, salt, cooking spray ; preparation:Dissolve the yeast in the water until foamy. Place in mixer bowl and add salt, herbs, dried tomatoes and flour. Knead on low until ball forms and climbs up dough hook. Place in bowl that has been sprayed lightly with cooking spray. Cover and set in a warm place to rise. Makes a crust for a large pizza. You can probably knead this by hand for 10 minutes and get the same results. I topped the pizza with onions i dredged in flour and lightly sauteed in some cooking spray and some cooked, sliced potato. Baked on a perforated pizza pan for 20 minutes at 425f. ; name: hot orange almond drink ; ingredients: sugar, water, frozen orange juice, lemon juice, almond flavoring, vanilla, ground cloves, allspice, cinnamon ; preparation:

name: honey garlic pork chops ; ingredients: boneless pork chops, honey, lemon juice, low sodium soy sauce, garlic clove ; preparation:In lg. Skillet, coated with nonstick spray, brown chops on both sides. Cook over medium heat till juices run clear. In a bowl, combine the honey, lemon juice, soy sauce, and garlic. Remove chops and keep warm. Add honey mixture to the skillet. Cook over medium heat for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally. Pour over chops. ; name: family sausage supper ; ingredients: spaghetti, oleo, onion, green pepper, sliced mushrooms, frozen broccoli cuts, oregano, garlic powder, kielbasa, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook spaghetti according to package directions. While spaghetti is cooking, melt the 3 tbsp. Butter in large pot and brown the onion, green pepper, mushrooms and kielbasa, about 10 minutes. Add broccoli, oregano and garlic powder. Continue cooking over med heat until broccoli is heated through. Drain cooked spaghetti and stir 1 tbsp. Butter into it, stirring to coat well. Place spaghetti on platter and top with kielbasa-veggie mix then sprinkle with grated parm. ; name: apple mint granita ; ingredients: unsweetened apple juice, mint leaves, unsweetened applesauce, sugar, lemon juice, salt ; preparation:Mix apple juice and mint leaves and allow to combine overnight in refrigerator. Strain mint leaves out of apple juice. Place a shallow metal pan in freezer. In a nonreactive saucepan, combine applesauce, mint flavored apple juice, sugar, lemon juice and salt. Bring to a boil, then simmer uncovered about 20 minutes. Cool to room temperature. Pour apple mixture into chilled pan. Return to freezer. Stir every 20 minutes until it thickens into coarse crystals, about 1 hour. Stir granita and mound into small cups. Serve immediately. ; name: mulled cider ; ingredients: tea, orange juice, lemon juice, splenda granular, vanilla, orange extract, cinnamon stick, whole cloves ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in a large saucepan. Bring to a simmer. Simmer for 20 minutes to allow the spices to permeate the liquid. Ladle into mugs. Leftovers will keep in the refrigerator 2 to 3 days. Rewarm in the microwave. ; name: football bean dip ; ingredients: refried beans, velveeta cheese, chunky picante sauce, tabasco sauce ; preparation:Begin heating refried beans in a suacepan. Cut velveeta into cubes and add to beans. Heat until cheese is melted. Stir in picante sauce and as much tabasco as you like. Serve with chips, a cold beer, and a good football game. ; name: cheesy scrambled eggs with green onions ; ingredients: eggs, milk, cheddar cheese, green onions, salt, pepper, jalapeno ; preparation:

name: brussels sprouts extraordinaire ; ingredients: onion, butter, flour, sugar, tomato juice, salt, pepper, frozen brussels sprouts, shredded cheddar cheese ; preparation:In a skillet, saute onion in butter until tender. Remove onion and set aside. Blend flour into the drippings. Add tomato juice. Cook and stir over low heat until thickened and smooth. Stir in the sugar, salt, pepper and onion. Arrange the brussels sprouts in a greased 1 quart baking dish. Top with the tomato sauce. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. ; name: crisp sage and parmesan pork ; ingredients: pork loin steaks, white bread, sage leaf, parmesan cheese, black pepper, egg, oil ; preparation:Lay the pork steaks between two sheets of cling film and bash them with a rolling pin until approximately 1 cm thick. Whiz the bread in a food processor to make bread crumbs. Add the sage leaves. Pulse a few times to roughly chop the leaves. Mix in the grated parmesan. Pour onto a large plate. Season with black pepper. One by one, dip the steaks into the beaten egg, allowing the excess to drip off. Press steaks into the bread crumb mixture on both sides. Heat the oil in a large non stick frying pan. Fry the steaks for 3 to 4 minutes on each side until cooked through. ; name: crock pot creamy country style pork ribs ; ingredients: country-style pork ribs, cream of mushroom soup, lipton onion soup mix, pork gravy, carrots, fresh mushrooms, salt, pepper ; preparation:Season pork ribs with salt and pepper. Set aside. Mix condensed soup, lipton soup mix, and pork gravy in crock pot. Place ribs in crock pot. Layer on whole carrots and sliced mushrooms. Cover with lid and cook on low heat 8-10 hours. I like to cook mine a long time so they fall apart in the crock pot. Serve with brown rice and a green veggie. ; name: brussels sprouts mushroom casserole ; ingredients: brussels sprouts, sliced mushrooms, mayonnaise, lemon juice, celery salt, parmesan cheese, sliced almonds ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Cook the brussels sprouts till the are crisp tender. Place in a lightly greased one quart casserole dish. Meanwhile combine mushrooms. Mayo, lemon juice and celery salt. Spoon over brussels sprouts and sprinkle with parmesan cheese and almonds. Bake at 325 degrees for 20 minutes or until heated through. ; name: sea scallops in sweet pepper sauce ; ingredients: sea scallops, butter, sweet pepper, onion, garlic, dry white wine, chicken broth, milk, fresh parsley ; preparation:In lg skillet, melt butter and cook scallops for about 7 minutes, until golden brown. Remove and keep warm. In same skillet, add pepper, onion and garlic. Cook 2 minutes. Add wine, stir 1 minute. Add broth, milk, and parsley. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until sauce thickens, 1-2 minutes. Add scallops and heat through. ; name: chilled berry soup ; ingredients: fresh strawberries, ginger ale, milk, sugar, lemon juice, vanilla extract, sour cream ; preparation:

name: cheese and rosemary breadsticks ; ingredients: parmesan cheese, gruyere, fresh rosemary leaf, refrigerated breadstick dough, olive oil, sea salt ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Line 2 heavy large baking sheets with silicone baking sheets or parchment paper. In a food processor, chop the parmesan, gruyere and rosemary together until coarsely chopped. Set the cheese mixture aside. Separate the dough strips. Using a pizza cutter or a large sharp knife, cut each dough strip in half lengthwise to form thin strips. Working with dough strip at a time, coat each strip with the olive oil and then the cheese mixture, pressing very gently. Twist each cheese covered dough strip and place onto prepared baking sheets. Sprinkle with the salt, if you wish. Bake until the breadsticks are golden brown, about 10 to 15 minutes. Transfer the warm breadsticks to a basket and serve. ; name: salmon burgers ; ingredients: salmon, lemon juice, dijon-style mustard, dry breadcrumbs, green onion, egg whites ; preparation:Drain and flake salmon. Combine lemon juice and mustard. Blend flaked salmon with breadcrumbs, green onions, and lemon juice-mustard mixture. Mix in egg whites until well blended. Form mixture into 4 patties and cook on a lightly oiled grill or saut in skillet until golden brown on both sides. Serve each burger on a bun with lettuce, tomato slices. ; name: parmesan almond chicken ; ingredients: boneless chicken breasts, butter, parmesan cheese, almonds, oregano leaves, parsley, paprika, pepper, salt ; preparation:Heat oven to 400 degrees. Spray a cookie sheet with no stick cooking spray. Dip chicken in butter, coat with combined remaining ingredients. Place on cookie sheet. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or till tender. ; name: lebanese olive pizza ; ingredients: lebanese bread, tomato paste, mozzarella cheese, kalamata olives, dried oregano, dried basil, ground black pepper ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 225 c. Spread tomato paste even over leabanese bread and top with grated mozzarella, followed by evenly spaced olives. Sprinkle herbs over the top. Bake in oven for 10 - 15 minutes. Allow to rest a few minutes before cutting and serving. ; name: peach cobbler with cream cheese ; ingredients: crescent rolls, cream cheese, sugar, pie filling ; preparation:Spray a 9 x13 pan with pam. Lay one can of crescent rolls on bottom of pan and mash to seal edges. Mix softened cream cheese with sugar and spread on top of rolls. Pour two cans of pie filling on top of that. Separate second can of crescent rolls into triangles and place on top. Bake in 350 oven until top rolls are brown. ; name: hoisin salmon ; ingredients: orange juice, hoisin sauce, honey, salmon fillets ; preparation:

name: spicy udon salad ; ingredients: udon noodles, tamari, dark sesame oil, scallion, pea pods, red bell pepper, peanuts, sesame seeds, szechuan sauce ; preparation:Cook udon noodles in a large pan of boiling water about 5 minutes, or until just tender. Drain and rinse with cold water. Chill. Combine tamari and sesame oil in a small bowl. Combine noodles and vegetables in another bowl and toss with dressing. Sprinkle with peanuts and sesame seeds and drizzle with szechuan sauce. ; name: weight watchers chocolate chip blondies 3 points ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, table salt, brown sugar, light butter, egg whites, vanilla extract, mini chocolate chip, water ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f in a small bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt. In a large bowl, beat brown sugar and butter until fluffy. Add egg whites and vanilla. Gradually beat in flour mixture alternating with water. Stir in chips. Spread into a foil-lined 9- x 13-inch baking pan. Bake until golden, about 20 to 25 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Remove foil and cut into 24 two-inch squares. ; name: ricotta stuffed potatoes ; ingredients: baking potatoes, ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, fresh parsley, pepper, egg ; preparation:Heat oven to 375 degrees. Bake potatoes about 1 hour, until tender. Cut thin lengthwise slice from each potato. Scoop out inside, leaving a thin shell. Mash potatoes in a large bowl until no lumps remain. Mix in remaining ingredients and blend well. Increase oven temperature to 400 degrees. Place potato shells on ungreased cookie sheet. Fill shells with potato mixture. Bake uncovered 20 minutes until filling is hot. ; name: mom s hot crab dip ; ingredients: cream cheese, white crab meat, shallots, lemon juice, hot pepper sauce, toasted almond, butter ; preparation:In a medium bowl, beat heese, then mash in crab meat. Stir in shallots, lemon juice and hot pepper sauce. Spoon into 3 cup baking dish. Sprinkle with almonds, dot with butter. Bake in 350 f oven for 30 minutes or until hot and bubbly. ; name: dee s spanish rice ; ingredients: cooked rice, onion, green pepper, bacon, tomato soup, chili powder, sugar, water ; preparation:Cook rice as usual. Fry bacon till crisp. It should be crisp, not soggy. Crumble bacon. In the bacon fat, fry the onion and green pepper till onion turns translucent. Combine cooked rice, onion, green pepper and crumbled bacon. Add a little salt and pepper and mix well. Add one can of tomato soup, chili powder and sugar. Add water to the consistency you like and cook till hot. Add extra tomato soup and water if needed. Can be a side dish or main meal. Tastes great reheated as well. ; name: grilled chicken skewers with red pepper pesto ; ingredients: roasted red peppers, fresh cilantro leaves, balsamic vinegar, garlic clove, dry mustard, ground coriander, ground cinnamon, olive oil, whole almond, chicken breasts ; preparation:

name: honey roasted sweet potatoes ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, butter, honey, fresh lemon juice, salt, cinnamon ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small micorwave safe bowl combine butter, honey and lemon juice. Microwave until butter melts, add cinnamon. Place cubed potatoes in a large bowl and pour honey mixture over potatoes, toss to coat. Place in a roasting pan, salt and bake for about 50 minutes, or until tender, stirring occasionally. ; name: mo s margarita pie ; ingredients: egg yolks, sweetened condensed milk, fresh lime juice, lime zest, tequila, triple sec, 9-inch graham cracker crust, cool whip ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Whisk together yolks, condensed milk, lime juice, zest, tequila, and triple. Pour in pie shell. Bake until filling is evenly set and shell is light browned, about 15-20 minutes. Cool to room temperature and then refrigerate for 2 hours. Serve with a spoonful of cool whip on top. ; name: frozen adobe pie ; ingredients: coffee ice cream, chocolate cookie pie crust, fudge sauce, chocolate ice cream, almonds, chocolate curls ; preparation:Let coffee ice cream warm slightly out of the freezer for about 20 minutes or until soft enough to spread. Spread coffee ice cream over crust and drizzle with half of the fudge sauce. Freeze until slightly firm. Remove chocolate ice cream and warm slightly for about 20 minutes or until soft enough to spread. Drizzle remaining fudge sauce over pie and sprinlke with almonds if desired. Freeze at least 2-3 hours before serving, if freezing longer, wrap well to prevent freezer burn. Serve with chocolate curls for garnish. ; name: green bean salad with radishes and prosciutto ; ingredients: green beans, radishes, prosciutto, sherry wine, dijon mustard, fresh chives, olive oil, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook beans in a large pot of salted water until crisp-tender, about 4-5 minutes. Drain well and cool. Whisk sherry, mustard, and chives, then gradually whisk in the oil. Season with salt and pepper. Toss beans, radishes, and prosciutto, then toss with enough dresing to coat. Using a vegetable peeler, shave parmesan or reggiatto on top of salad. ; name: sour cream coconut quick bread ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, coconut extract, sour cream, coconut, flour, baking powder, baking soda ; preparation:Cream together butter and sugar. Beat in eggs and coconut extract. Mix in sour cream, then add coconut and mix well. Stir flour, baking powder and baking soda together and add to batter and mix well. Place batter into greased loaf pan and bake at 350 for 45 to 50 minutes or until done. ; name: grilled vegetable medley with blue cheese butter ; ingredients: blue cheese, unsalted butter, fresh lemon juice, salt and pepper, olive oil, fresh basil, garlic cloves, vegetables ; preparation:

name: marsala chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, flour, garlic salt, pepper, dried oregano, olive oil, butter, mushroom, marsala wine, chicken stock ; preparation:Mix flour and herbs. Cut chicken horizontally i find it easier to cut it horizontally. Dredge chicken in flour and herbs. Heat oil and butter until it sizzles. Saute chicken on both sides until lightly browned, about 3 minutes on each side. Remove chicken from pan. Add muchrooms to pan. Saute muchrooms about 4-5 minutes. Add chicken back to pan. Add wine. Cover skillet, simmer on low for about 10 minutes. ; name: deviled chicken thighs ; ingredients: chicken thighs, salt, fresh ground black pepper, dijon mustard, shallots, cayenne pepper, fresh parsley ; preparation:Preheat broiler to its maximum. Set the rack about 4 inches from the heat. Season chicken on both sides and place it in a pan, skin side up. Broil, watching carefully, until the skin is golden brown, about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the mustard, shallot, and cayenne. When the chicken has browned, remove it from the oven and turn it. Spread just a teaspoon or so of the mustard mixture on the underside of the chicken and broil for about 5 minutes. Turn the chicken and spread the remaining mixture on the skin side. Broil until the mustard begins to brown, about 5 minutes. At this point, the chicken may be done, an instant read thermometer inserted into the meat will read 160. If it is not, turn off the broiler and let the chicken remain in the oven for another 5 minutes or so. Garnish with the parsley if you like and serve. ; name: maureen s festive cheese ball ; ingredients: cheddar cheese, cream cheese, mayonnaise, worcestershire sauce, onion salt, garlic salt, celery salt, green olives, dried beef, fresh parsley ; preparation:Combine, cheeses, mayonnaise, worcestershire sauce, and salts. Blend until smooth. If too stiff add a bit more mayonaise. Add olives and shape into ball. Combine dried beef and fresh parsley and roll ball in the mixture. Cover with plastic wrap and chill. For a difference you can roll in crushed walnuts or pecans. Serve with crackers. ; name: soy and lime calamari skewers ; ingredients: rice wine vinegar, reduced sodium soy sauce, lime juice, caster sugar, sesame oil, gingerroot, green onions, calamari, olive oil flavored cooking spray ; preparation:Soak skewers in water for 30 minutes. Drain. Combine vinegar, soy, lime juice, sugar, oil, ginger and onions. Stir until sugar dissolves. Cut each calamari ring in half. Thread onto skewers in a concertina fashion. Heat a barbecue plate on high heat. Spray skewers with oil. Season with salt and pepper. Barbecue for 2 minutes, turning, or until tender. Serve with soy and lime sauce. ; name: sweet sour glaze chicken wings ; ingredients: chicken wings, ketchup, brown sugar, rice vinegar, soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic ; preparation:Rinse and drain chicken wings. Combine remaining ingredients to make glaze. Add chicken wings and stir gently to coat. Cover bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Line a baking pan with aluminum foil and arrange wings on pan. Bake for 25 minutes, turn wings and bake for another 25 minutes until golden brown. Serve immediately. ; name: roasted pork tenderloin with garlic ; ingredients: pork loin, garlic, salt, pepper, butter, onion, olive oil ; preparation:

name: beef bean and tomato soup ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, green pepper, onion soup mix, kidney beans, tomatoes, parsley, basil, pasta, water ; preparation:Brown the ground beef in a dutch oven or heavy stock pot, season with salt and pepper. Add the chopped onion and green pepper, and saute for 5 to 10 minutes. Add the kidney beans, tomatoes, onion soup mix, parsley, basil, water. Bring to a boil, add the pasta. Reduce heat and simmer for 10- 20 minutes, until pasta is cooked. Add salt and pepper to taste. ; name: lightened up bechamel sauce 2 ww pts ; ingredients: low-fat milk, all-purpose flour, sea salt, white pepper, nutmeg, paprika, parmesan cheese ; preparation:In a small saucepan, add milk. While whisking, slowly add in flour. When blended, add salt, pepper, nutmeg and cayenne. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, whisking constantly. Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring for about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and and stir in parmesan. ; name: honey berry vinaigrette ; ingredients: vinegar, honey, dijon mustard, onion, salad oil, salt and pepper ; preparation:Whisk together vinegar, honey and mustard. Add onion. Whisk while adding oil. Season with salt and pepper. Chill at least one hour. Store in refrigerator. Shake before using. ; name: tuna fish and spaghetti casserole ; ingredients: solid white tuna, spaghetti, cream of mushroom soup, milk, onion, green peppers, potato chips ; preparation:Boil spaghetti for 10 minutes. Drain. Spray frying pan with nonstick cooking spray. Saute pepper and onion until softened slightly. Season with salt and pepper. Mix together onion, pepper, tuna, spaghetti, soup, and milk. Add to greased casserole dish. Top mixture with chips. Bake at 375 for 35 minutes. ; name: healthy slow cooker polynesian chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, pineapple juice, vinegar, light soy sauce, fresh ginger, garlic clove, sesame seeds, crushed red pepper flakes, rice, nonstick cooking spray ; preparation:Spray inside of slow cooker with non-stick cooking spray. Place chicken on the bottom of the slow cooker. Add all other ingredients into slow cooker, cover. Cook on high heat for 4 - 6 hours. As slow cooker temperatutres can vary, you may need to cook for more or less time. Chicken pieces will break apart durring cooking. Spoon chicken and sauce over rice. ; name: pumpkin figs pie ; ingredients: unbaked 9-inch pie crust, pears, pumpkin puree, dried fig, brown sugar ; preparation:

name: 21 club burger ; ingredients: celery, butter, ground sirloin, breadcrumbs, au jus mix, buns ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large, ovenproof skillet saute celery in 1 tablespoon butter over medium heat for about 4 minutes. Remove celery and let cool. In bowl, combine sirloin, bread crumbs, au jus, and celery. Form in to 4 patties. Melt remaining butter in skillet. Place patties in skillet and cook 2-3 minutes or until bron on one side. Flip patties and place in oven. Cook for 12-15 minutes for medium doneness. Place on buns. ; name: cheesy green chili rice ; ingredients: onion, butter, cooked long-grain rice, sour cream, small curd cottage cheese, salt, pepper, green chilies, cheddar cheese ; preparation:In a large skillet, cook onion in butter until tender. Remove from the heat. Stir in the rice, sour cream, cottage cheese, salt and pepper. Spoon half of the mixture into a greased 11-in. X 7-in x 2-in baking dish. Top with half of the chilies and cheese. Repeat layers. Bake, uncovered, at 375 for 20-25 minutes or until heated through and bubbly. ; name: mom s tangy beef casserole ; ingredients: lean ground beef, onion, green beans, corn, condensed tomato soup, steak sauce, seasoned pepper, crushed red pepper flakes, potatoes ; preparation:Start potatoes to boil for mashing. Brown beef with peppers and steak sauce, add onions towards the end of the browning so they soften slightly. Drain browned beef leaving enough of the juices for flavor and place in a medium casserole dish. Add beans, soup and corn if desired and stir to mix well. Spread mashed potatoes on top of mixture. Bake covered in an oven preheated to 375 for 25 minutes. Optionally remove covering and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes to brown the potato. ; name: classy spinach bundles with pistachio dressing ; ingredients: vegetable oil, vinegar, honey, orange zest, pistachios, fresh spinach leaves, green onions ; preparation:Blend oil, vinegar, honey and orange peel. Stir in pistachios and set aside. Place spinach in 2-quart microwave-safe container. Cover with plastic wrap and vent. Microwave at high for 3 to 5 minutes or until spinach is wilted. Rinse with cold water. Squeeze to drain. Divide into 4 bundles. Wrap each bundle with green onion tie. Drizzle with pistachio dressing. Serve warm or chilled. ; name: sweet dip with cookies and fruit ; ingredients: cream cheese, butter, yogurt, orange zest, powdered sugar, cookie, berries, dark chocolate squares ; preparation:Beat first 4 ingredients at medium-high speed with an electric mixer until smooth. Gradually add sugar, beating until creamy. Cover and chill at least 1 hour or up to 3 days covered. Let stand at room temperature 30 minutes before serving. Serve with cookies, berries, and dark chocolate squares. ; name: rocky road s mores bars ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, vanilla, flour, graham cracker crumbs, mini marshmallows, semi-sweet chocolate chips, walnuts ; preparation:

name: hot chocolate deluxe ; ingredients: boiling water, chocolate syrup, milk, kahlua, whipped cream ; preparation:In a saucepan, mix together the boiling water and chocolate syrup. Add in the milk and stir until blended. Cook and stir over medium heat for 6-8 minutes or until well heated. Add in kahlua. Stir to combine. Pour into mugs or cups. Garnish with whipped cream. ; name: sunday pot roast ; ingredients: chuck roast, dry onion soup mix, condensed cream of mushroom soup, condensed cream of celery soup, worcestershire sauce, potato, carrot, mushrooms ; preparation:For slow cooker cooking put the vegetables on the bottom to infuse the flavors of the meat into the vegetables. Place the roast on the veggies. Put the worchester or 57 sauce on the roast. Open the condensed soups and add them over the top of the roast. You can use an extra can of the soup for more gravy for putting over rice or potatoes. Slow cook for 8-10 hours. Serve with yellow rice or whole grain rice and i promise it will be a feast for your family with almost no effort. It tastes much better and is much less expensive than going out to eat after church or work. ; name: farfalle pasta with zucchini mint and almonds ; ingredients: zucchini, garlic cloves, extra virgin olive oil, almonds, fresh mint leaves, salt & freshly ground black pepper, farfalle pasta ; preparation:Set the pasta water to boil. Place zucchini in saucepan, cover with water, bring to a boil and cook till tender. Drain. Place mint, almonds, garlic and olive oil in a food processor. Mince finely. Add zucchini. Puree. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cook and drain the pasta, pour into serving bowl. Add zucchini mixture and toss well. ; name: rum mustard glazed ham ; ingredients: ham, brown sugar, dark rum, dijon mustard, maple syrup ; preparation:Lightly score the ham- criss-cross and place in a roasting pan. Mix remaining ingredients. Spoon sauce over the ham and bake in 425f oven for 30 minutes. Lower temperature to 375f and continue to roast for another hour. Baste frequently. The top should be well browned and crispy in texture. Allow to sit for 30 minutes covered with foil before carving. ; name: duxelle with ham ; ingredients: butter, fresh mushrooms, shallot, onion, ham, dry white wine, thyme ; preparation:In a skillet, heat ham with butter over a moderate fire. Saute for a few minutes, then add onion, shallots, and saute one more minute. Add mushrooms and thyme and let cook until most of the moisture is gone. Then add white wine and mix together. Season to taste. ; name: power granola ; ingredients: oats, almonds, wheat germ, honey, cinnamon, nutmeg, vanilla, craisins, raisins, dried apricot ; preparation:

name: potato egg casserole a la hot potato salad ; ingredients: potatoes, hard-boiled eggs, green onions, parsley, mustard, fresh ground black pepper, low-fat sour cream, bacon, milk, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Cook potatoes in boiling water until tender. Drain and cool. Combine potatoes, eggs, bacon, parsley and spring onions in a casserole dish. Combine sour cream, mustard and black pepper and then mix through potato mixture, if mixture needs more moisture then add a little milk. Cover and bake at 180c for 15-20 minutes, then sprinkle with cheese and grill until golden. ; name: mexican cornbread hamburger casserole ; ingredients: ground chuck, salt, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, mexican cornbread mix, eggs, milk, cream-style corn, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Brown meat with salt and bell peppers. Drain. Put into 13 x 9 baking dish. Pour cream corn over meat mixture. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Mix cornbread mix, eggs, and milk until blended and pour over casserole. Bake at 425 for 25-30 minutes until lightly browned. ; name: chocolate peanut butter gooey cake ; ingredients: chocolate cake mix, egg, butter, cream cheese, creamy peanut butter, eggs, powdered sugar, vanilla ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9x13 inch pan. For crust, mix cake mix, egg, and 1 stick of melted butter with a large spoon and pat into the bottom and up the sides of pan. For filling mix cream cheese, peanut butter, and eggs together with mixer until smooth, scraping down the sides. Add powdered sugar and vanilla. Mix until smooth. Slowly add melted butter to filling and mix until smooth. Pour the filling over the crust and bake 25 - 30 minutes. Check after 25 minutes. When it is done, the edges will pull away from the sides of pan and the filling will have browned, but middle should be very gooey. It will still jiggle. ; name: carob walnut fudge ; ingredients: almond butter, brown rice syrup, carob powder, walnuts ; preparation:Mist an 8-inch square pan with nonstick cooking spray and set aside. Combine nut butter and syrup in a saucepan and heat over low heat, stirring almost constantly until mixture is soft and blended. Remove from heat and beat in carob powder with a sturdy wooden spoon. When well blended, stir in walnuts. Spread evenly in prepared pan. Chill in refridgerator. Cut into 16 squares when cool and firm. ; name: roasted root vegetable ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, thyme, salt, pepper, small red potato, onion, carrots, turnips ; preparation:Preheat to 425f. Combine the oil and garlic in a large roasting pan and place in the oven for 2 minutes until the garlic starts to sizzle. Remove the pan from the oven and stir in the thyme, salt and pepper. Add the potatoes, onion, carrots, and turnips, toss until well coated. Cover and bake for 30 minutes. Increase oven temp to 450f, and bake, uncovered for 30 minutes until the veggies are lightly browned and can easily be pierced with a fork. ; name: liqueur oranges ; ingredients: oranges, caster sugar, vanilla bean, orange-flavored liqueur, brandy ; preparation:

name: creamy cheddar potatoes ; ingredients: butter, potatoes, salt, fresh ground black pepper, milk, cheddar cheese, parsley ; preparation:In large, nonstick skillet, melt butter. Add potatoes and cook over medium heat until almost tender and lightly browned. Add salt, pepper, and milk, continuing to cook until milk is absorbed and potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with cheese, heating until melted. Stir well, sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve. ; name: ranch chicken nuggets ; ingredients: chicken tenders, ranch dressing, butter, garlic salt, pepper, potato chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Rinse chicken and pat dry. Stir together dressing, butter, garlic salt and pepper in a medium bowl. Add chicken and toss well to coat with mixture. Roll each piece in crushed chips and place on a shallow baking sheet. Sprinkle with any remaining chips. Bake for 30 minutes or until crispy and lightly browned. ; name: trio hoagie ; ingredients: hoagie rolls, mustard, roasted turkey, deli roast beef, salami, swiss cheese, lettuce leaf ; preparation:Place hoagies on a work surface. Spread one side of each roll with 1 tbsp of the mustard. Arrange turkey, roast beef, salami, cheese, and lettuce over mustard. Top with remaining bread half. Serve immediately or wrap and store in the refrigerator for up to 2 hours. ; name: baked cheese grits ; ingredients: chicken broth, quick-cooking grits, extra-sharp cheddar cheese, monterey jack cheese, whipping cream, hot sauce, black pepper, cayenne pepper, worcestershire sauce, eggs ; preparation:Bring chicken broth to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Gradually whisk in grits. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer, stirring occasionally, 10 minutes or until grits are thick. Stir in cheddar cheese, next 5 ingredients, and, if desired, worcestershire sauce, stirring until cheese melts. Remove from heat. Stir in eggs. Pour grits into lightly greased 2 quart baking dish. Bake, uncovered, at 350 degress for 40-45 minutes. Stone ground grits maybe substititued. Increase liquid to 6 cups and increase cook time to 50 minutes. ; name: jolean s baked spam loaf ; ingredients: spam, cloves, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, prepared yellow mustard, unsalted butter, water ; preparation:Lay both spam loaves side by side in glass 8 x 4 inch loaf pan. Insert 5 cloves into each spam loaf, spaced evenly. Mix remaining ingredients well, and spread this glaze on top of both spam loaves. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 20-25 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes, slice and remove cloves before serving. ; name: silver state brownies ; ingredients: margarine, sugar, eggs, vanilla, cocoa, flour, nuts, mini chocolate chip ; preparation:

name: pork chops with rice ; ingredients: pork chops, rice, beef bouillon, water, mushrooms, onion, green pepper ; preparation:Brown chops in skillet. Saute onion in drippings where chops were browned. Place dry rice in casserole dish and pour boullion and water over rice. Add mushrooms, onions and pepper in skillet. Place chops on top and cover with foil. Bake for 1 hour in a 350 oven. ; name: japenese style crispy pork ; ingredients: boneless pork chop, chinese rice wine, ginger, eggs, panko breadcrumbs, cornstarch, tonkatsu sauce ; preparation:Season the pork with salt. Mix the rice wine and 1 tsp ginger and spread on the pork. Set aside. Beat the eggs with cup water in a shallow bowl. Put the panko and cornstarch in 2 separate shallow bowls. Dredge each piece of pork in cornstarch, dip in egg, then coat with panko. Heat inch of oil in large skillet over high heat. Fry the pork in batches until golden, 3-4 minutes per side. Drain on paper towel lined plate. Mix the tonkatsu sauce and the remaining tsp ginger in a bowl. Serve with pork. ; name: gerstensuppe barley soup ; ingredients: butter, barley, celery, onion, flour, chicken broth, salt & pepper, heavy cream ; preparation:Heat butter in heavy saucepan. Saut onions, celery, and barley in it. Sprinkle with flour. Gradually stir in hot broth. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer, covered, for about 1 hour, stirring occasionally, until barley is very tender. Remove from heat and add cream. ; name: mexican fun chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, avocado, cheddar cheese, salsa, taco seasoning ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spray baking dish with cooking spray. Season breasts with taco seasoning. Bake breasts uncovered for 20 minutes. Remove from oven, spoon salsa over each piece, taking care not to drench them. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes. Remove from oven, top breasts with more salsa, sliced avocado and cheese. Bake uncovered 5 minutes. The ones i used were very thick. ; name: pepper lime chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, lime zest, lime juice, cooking oil, dried thyme, black pepper, salt, garlic cloves, salsa, lime wedge ; preparation:Place chicken breast halves in a resealable plastic bag set in a shallow dish. For marinade, stir together lime peel, lime juice, oil, thyme, pepper, salt, and garlic. Pour over chicken seal bag. Marinate in refrigerator for 30 minutes. Preheat broiler. Drain chicken, reserving marinade. Place chicken on the unheated rack of a broiler pan. Broil 4 to 5 inches from the heat about 6 minutes or until light brown. Turn chicken and brush lightly with reserved marinade. Discard any remaining marinade. Broil for 6 to 8 minutes more or until chicken is no longer pink. If desired serve with salsa and lime wedges. ; name: amazing pineapple bread ; ingredients: butter, splenda sugar substitute, sugar, egg substitute, crushed pineapple, flour, whole wheat flour, baking soda, salt, vanilla ; preparation:

name: dressed up baby carrots ; ingredients: baby carrots, brown sugar, butter, salt ; preparation:Use either a bag of whole baby carrots from the produce section or 2 15 ounce cans of sliced carrots. Add carrots to a medium sized sauce pan over medium heat. Quickly add the butter and brown sugar and toss the carrots in the melting butter. Just when they begin to bubble, reduce to low heat and simmer 15 minutes. Remember, sugar can scorch quickly, so stir occasionally and keep the heat low. ; name: luscious rhubarb sponge dessert ; ingredients: rhubarb, golden brown sugar, water, flour, baking powder, sugar, butter, eggs, whole milk, whipping cream ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375. Butter 11 x 7 x 2 baking dish. Place rhubarb slices in an even layer. Scatter the brown sugar and 2 tablespoons water overtop of rhubarb slices. Mix sugar into flour and baking powder mixture. Add butter and beat for about 3 minutes. Add eggs one at a time, beating after each addition. Alternate adding milk in 2 additions and fold in flour in 3 additions. Blend slightly after each addition and pour batter over the rhubarb slices. Smooth over the top. Bake about 40 minutes at 375 until the top is golden brown. Cool 30 minutes and serve with a nice dollop of whipping cream. ; name: barbecued pecans ; ingredients: butter, worcestershire sauce, catsup, hot sauce, pecan halves, salt, black pepper ; preparation:Melt butter in a dutch oven. Remove from heat. Add worcestershire sauce, catsup, and hot sauce, stirring well. Add pecans, stirring to coat. Spread pecans evenly in a 15x10x1 jellyroll pan. Bake at 400 degrees for 13 to 15 minute, stirring every 5 minutes. Place pecans on paper towels. Sprinkle with salt and pepper, cool completely. ; name: slow cooker chicken mole ; ingredients: onion, chicken breasts, baking chocolate squares, green chilies, jalapenos, stewed tomatoes, cumin, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt ; preparation:Place chicken breasts and chocolate in crock pot. Half onion and chop halves into large slices. Add to crock pot. In blender or food processor, blend remaining ingredients and pour into crock pot. Heat on high for 4 hours, stirring once or twice. ; name: diabetic chai tea ; ingredients: water, black tea, nonfat milk, splenda sugar substitute, ground ginger, ground nutmeg, ground cinnamon ; preparation:Heat water to boiling. Add tea bags. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 to 4 minutes, depending on how strong you like your tea. Remove tea bags and add spices. Simmer for additional 2 minutes. Add milk and splenda, heat to a near boil stirring constantly. Serve and enjoy. ; name: deliciously sinful fudge brownies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, dutch-processed cocoa powder, salt, baking powder, vanilla, eggs, all-purpose flour, chocolate chips ; preparation:

name: chilled cucumber and red bell soup with a kick ; ingredients: cucumbers, red bell pepper, rice wine vinegar, fat free sour cream, chicken broth, salt, cayenne pepper, ground oregano, ground coriander, ice cubes ; preparation:Chop the cucumber and bell pepper. Add all ingredients to the blender and puree. Add more liquid if needed. Adjust taste to your liking. Store in the fridge until ready to serve or serve right away. ; name: greek pork chops ; ingredients: tomatoes, low-carb balsamic vinaigrette, boneless pork chops, lemon-pepper seasoning, feta cheese with garlic and herbs, fresh oregano ; preparation:In a small bowl combine tomato and salad dressing, set aside. Trim fat from meat. Rub lemon-pepper seasoning on both sides of chops. For a charcoal grill, grill chops on the rack of an uncovered grill directly over medium coals for 12 to 15 minutes or until juices run clear, turning once halfway through grilling. Transfer chops to serving plates. Top each chop with some feta cheese and some of the tomato mixture. If desired, sprinkle with snipped oregano. ; name: amazing deviled eggs ; ingredients: hard-boiled eggs, mayonnaise, sour cream, prepared yellow mustard, sweet pickle relish, garlic powder, salt and pepper, paprika ; preparation:Peel shells off cooled hard-boiled eggs and slice into halves lengthwise. Remove yolks from whites and put into small round bowl and mash yolks with a fork into fine pieces. Add next 5 ingredients. Try not to add too much vinegar from the relish. Stir mixture until creamy. Spoon mixture into egg white halves or pipe. Dust the tops of the filled eggs with paprika. Chill in fridge for at least 1-2 hours before serving. ; name: marinara marcaroni salad ; ingredients: salad macaroni, mayonnaise, chili powder, marinara sauce, sweet pickle relish, celery, onion, olive, salt and pepper ; preparation:Boil macaroni to al dente. Rinse with cold water and set aside to dry. Combine mayo, marinara, relish, celery, onion and olives. Add macaroni to mixture. Add salt and pepper to taste. Refrigerate 3-4 hours. ; name: tex mex mocha ; ingredients: whole milk, cinnamon, vanilla extract, chili powder, powdered cocoa mix, boiling water, instant coffee granules, whipped cream ; preparation:Combine first four ingredients in a large sauce pan. Cook over medium heat until thoroughly heated. Do not boil. Stir in instant cocoa mix. Combine boiling water and coffee granules, then stir into milk mixture. Pour into mugs. Serve with a dollop of whipped cream and garnish with cinnamon sticks and a small, bright red chili pepper. Makes 3 quarts. ; name: summer broccoli salad ; ingredients: sugar, vinegar, miracle whip, bacon, cheddar cheese, broccoli, onion ; preparation:

name: cheddar bacon and apple panini ; ingredients: white bread, sharp cheddar cheese, bacon, apple, dijon mustard ; preparation:Heat panini press to medium-low heat. Spread dijon on 4 slices of bread. Top with slices of cheddar, 2 pieces of bacon, apple slices and additional cheddar. Place the remaining bread on top. Place on panini press and cook until cheese is slightly melted and bread is browned and crispy. ; name: cajun blackened skillet chicken ; ingredients: dried oregano, paprika, ground ginger, black pepper, cayenne, olive oil, boneless skinless chicken breasts, salt ; preparation:Combine the oregano, spices, and oil in a bowl, then rub over the chicken breasts to coat. Heat a large nonstick saut pan over high heat for 2 minutes. Add the chicken, smooth side down. Pan fry for 2-3 minutes, until just beginning to blacken. Turn the chicken over, reduce heat, and cook for 3-6 minutes, until juices run clear. Sprinkle with a little salt and thyme just before serving. ; name: savoury cheese traditional british sandwich filler ; ingredients: cheddar cheese, red leicester cheese, mozzarella cheese, mayonnaise, spring onion, onion, salt & pepper ; preparation:Mix the cheeses in a bowl. Add mayonnaise to desired creamyness. Add pepper and salt, finely diced spring onion and finely diced onion in quantities that suit you. You may omit the red leicester and mozzarella cheese and use only cheddar or similarly strong cheese. This tastes best if made the day before and not served straight from the fridge. Can be used as filler for sandwiches and baked potato, but is also gorgeous as a dip for vegetable crudities. ; name: cherry magic cookie bars ; ingredients: graham cracker crumbs, butter, sweetened condensed milk, semi-sweet chocolate chips, maraschino cherries, flaked coconut ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. In small bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs and butter. Mix well. Press crumb mixture firmly on bottom of 13x9-inch baking pan. Pour eagle brand evenly over crumb mixture. Layer evenly with remaining ingredients. Press down firmly with fork. Bake 25 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool. Chill if desired. Cut into bars or diamonds. Store covered at room temperature. ; name: old fashioned scrapple ; ingredients: boneless pork loin, cornmeal, chicken broth, dried thyme, salt, all-purpose flour, pepper, vegetable oil ; preparation:In a large saucepan combine pork, cornmeal, chicken broth, thyme and salt. Bring to a boil, stirring often. Reduce heat and simmer about 2 minutes or until mixture is very thick, stirring constantly. Line an 8x8x2-inch baking pan or a 9x5x3-inch loaf pan with waxed paper, letting paper extend 3-4 inches above top of pan. Spoon pork mixture into pan. Cover and chill in the refrigerator 4 hours or overnight. Unmold. Cut scrapple into squares. Combine flour and pepper. Dust squares with flour mixture. In large skillet brown scrapple on both sides in a small amount of hot oil. Serves 12. ; name: barcardi limon lemonade ; ingredients: ice, bacardi limon, lemonade, lemon concentrate, lime, lemon ; preparation:

name: roasted potatoes with sage and garlic ; ingredients: small potatoes, flour, oil, garlic cloves, sage leaf, unsalted butter, kosher salt, fresh pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450f and place a large, heavy skillet or roasting pan in the oven to heat. Place the potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with cold salted water. Put on high heat to boil. Once boiling, lower heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Drain the potatoes well, and place on paper towels. Put the flour on a plate. When the potatoes are dry, roll them in the flour to coat. Remove the hot skillet from the oven and add the oil and potatoes. Roast, shaking the pan occasionally until the potatoes are golden brown all over, about 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and add the garlic, sage and butter. Return to the oven for one minute. Season generously with salt and pepper and serve. ; name: greek red snapper ; ingredients: red snapper, onion, green pepper, garlic cloves, whole tomatoes, white wine, parsley, basil, greek olives ; preparation:Saute onion, pepper, and garlic in hot oil. Add tomatoes. Simmer 15 minutes. Brush a shallow baking dish with olive oil and place fish in dish. Pour wine over top. Pour hot tomato mixture over fish. Dot with a little butter. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes to 1 hour. Combine parsley, basil and olives and sprinkle over fish. ; name: new york style potato salad ; ingredients: new potatoes, lemon juice, vegetable oil, salt and pepper, celery ribs, hard-boiled eggs, red onion, fresh parsley, mayonnaise, cider vinegar ; preparation:Boil the potatoes just until tender when pierced with a fork. Drain, peel and dice. Toss with the lemon juice, oil and salt and pepper to taste. Let cool. Add the celery, eggs, chopped red onion, and parsley toss gently. Combine 1 cup mayonnaise with vinegar, blend well then toss over the potato salad, gently folding until completely coated. Add more mayonnaise, if necessary. ; name: grandma s cowcumber salad vegan friendly ; ingredients: cucumber, tomatoes, onions, salt, black pepper, extra virgin olive oil, apple cider vinegar, honey ; preparation:Arrange the vegetables on a large platter. Whisk together the dressing and pour over the vegetables. Set aside for 30 minutes to marinate. The salad is best served at room temperature. Before serving, season with salt and cracked black pepper. ; name: hot seasoned french bread with ham and tomatoes ; ingredients: french bread, sharp white cheddar cheese, red onion, olive oil, red wine vinegar, dried oregano, pitted black olives, tomatoes, black forest ham ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Split loaf of bread in half, lengthwise. Set the bread, crusts side down, on a baking sheet. In a mixing bowl, combine the cheese, onion, olive oil, vinegar, oregano and olves. Season to taste. Spread the mixture over each bread half. Bake until hot. Remove from oven. Top the hot loaves with tomato slices, then ham. Eat hot accompanied with a green salad. ; name: layered berries in port ; ingredients: red currant jelly, port wine, orange rind, cherries, red currants, blueberries, strawberries, raspberries, blackberries, mint ; preparation:

name: coconut balls coquitos ; ingredients: coconut in heavy syrup, brown sugar, vanilla extract, white sugar ; preparation:Drain syrup from coconut. Reserve syrup. Mix coconut, brown sugar, and vanilla in a medium size saucepan. Cook over medium heat for a few minutes then allow to cool. Make small balls on buttered cookie sheet and set aside. Mix coconut syrup and white sugar in small saucepan and cook over medium heat. Stir frequently until it becomes dark brown. Pour over balls and allow to cool. ; name: crab casserole ; ingredients: butter, flour, heavy cream, salt, pepper, sherry wine, lump crabmeat, sharp cheddar cheese ; preparation:In a double boiler, make cream sauce by melting the butter. Add the flour and stir. Add the cream and stir constantly until sauce is thick. Add salt, pepper and sherry to the double boiler. Take the double boiler off the heat and fold in the crab gently. Pour into buttered 1 quart casserole. Sprinkle with grated cheese.
