Bake, uncovered, for about 30 minutes, or until cheese melts, at 400 degrees f. ; name: mexi ranch chicken ; ingredients: prepared pizza crust, monterey jack cheese, mild green chilies, chicken strips, tortilla chips, taco seasoning, butter, salsa, ranch dressing ; preparation:Heat oven to 375 degrees f. And line a baking sheet with foil. Lightly coat foil with nonstick cooking spray. On a floured board roll out pizza crust into an 15x11-inch rectangle. Divide into four equal pieces and lay one slice of cheese on each section of crust. Top each with equal amounts of chilies and chicken strips. Starting at long end of dough, roll up each piece tucking and sealing ends. On a piece of wax paper mix tortilla chips and taco seasoning. Brush rolls with melted butter and roll in crushed chips mixture, pressing to adhere. Transfer to prepared baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes, until golden brown. Meanwhile, in a small bowl mix salsa and ranch dressing. Remove from oven and serve with salsa mixture for dipping. ; name: great eggplant dip ; ingredients: eggplant, onion, breadcrumbs, plain yogurt, cloves, parsley, cider vinegar, lemon juice, olive oil ; preparation:Place whole eggplant on oven tray. Bake in a hot oven for one hour or till soft. Remove from oven, cool slightly. Peel eggplant, chop flesh roughly. Combine flesh with remaining ingredients in food processor. Process till smooth. Refrigerate mixture overnight. ; name: double chocolate kisses ; ingredients: almonds, chocolate frosting, butter, graham cracker crumbs, almond extract, milk chocolate kisses ; preparation:Pulse almonds in a food processor until very finely ground, like coarse sand. Pour ground almonds into a pie pan or other shallow bowl and set aside. Beat chocolate frosting and butter in large bowl with a hand mixer until well blended. Stir in graham cracker crumbs and almond extract. Shape chocolate mixture into 1-inch balls. Roll each ball in almonds to coat. Place balls on a cookie sheet. Using your finger, make a deep indentation in the center of each ball. Fill the indentations with chocolate kiss candies. Refrigerate for 30 minutes, or until cold. ; name: mango frappe ; ingredients: mangoes, orange juice, lime juice, club soda, ice cubes ; preparation:

name: betsy s quick easy artichoke dip ; ingredients: artichoke hearts, parmesan cheese, mozzarella cheese, mayonnaise, garlic clove, salt and pepper ; preparation:Drain the artichokes from the can. Coarsely chop them. Combine chopped chokes, cheeses, mayo, and garlic in a small oven-proof serving dish. Add fresh ground pepper and salt to taste. Bake in oven at 375 - 400 until melted. To be served next day, just re-heat in microwave. Recipe can be doubled. ; name: oatmeal porridge with raisins apricots and figs ; ingredients: water, quick-cooking rolled oats, raisins, dried apricot, dried figs, sugar, vanilla extract, ground cinnamon, ground cardamom, salt ; preparation:Add water to a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Stir in the oats, raisins, apricots, figs, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, cardamom, and salt. Bring to a boil. Lower heat to med-low. Simmer, uncovered, for about 5-10 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed and the fruit softened. ; name: pineapple salad ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, white sugar, dry tapioca, cider vinegar, crushed pineapple, apples, unsalted peanuts, frozen whipped topping ; preparation:In a medium saucepan, stir together the flour, sugar, tapioca, vinegar, and the reserved pineapple juice. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until thick. Remove from heat and chill. In a large bowl, combine the pineapple, apples, peanuts, and chilled tapioca mixture. Fold in the whipped topping and chill for at least 1 hour before serving. ; name: sandwich press recipe homestyle ham and cheese ; ingredients: white bread, american cheese, cheddar cheese, deli ham ; preparation:Heat sandwich press. Add first piece of bread. Top with cheese slice. Add ham. Then top with shredded cheddar. Add remaining slice of bread. Close press and cook for 5 minutes. ; name: asian tilapia in foil ; ingredients: tilapia fillets, soy sauce, toasted sesame oil, fresh gingerroot, green onion, pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450 f. Wash fillets and pat dry. Tuck thin ends under so the whole fillets will be of equal thickness. Place each fillet on 12x15 pieces of foil. Combine soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger, and pepper and spoon over fillets. Sprinkle scallions on top of each fillet. Fold the foil over fish and crimp edges to seal. Place packets on baking sheet in a single layer. Bake at 450 f for 12 to 15 minutes, until foil is puffed and fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. ; name: merry mountain trail mix ; ingredients: honey-nut flavor toasted oat cereal, sunflower seeds, sliced almonds, flaked coconut, dried sweetened cranberries, dried apple, golden raisin, sweetened condensed milk ; preparation:

name: lemon linguini with shrimp ; ingredients: linguine, olive oil, lemons, juice of, green onion, fresh parsley, salt, fresh ground pepper, parmesan cheese, asparagus, shrimp ; preparation:Cook linguini according to diretions. Combine next 4 ingredients in large serving bowl. Add pasta and toss well. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Toss in parmesan cheese. Add asparagus and shrimp. ; name: crunchy biscuit chicken casserole ; ingredients: cooked chicken, cream of chicken soup, green beans, sliced mushrooms, cheddar cheese, mayonnaise, lemon juice, pillsbury grands refrigerated buttermilk biscuits, butter, seasoned croutons ; preparation:In medium saucepan, combine chicken, soup, green beans, mushrooms, cheese, mayonnaise and lemon juice. Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally. Pour hot chicken mixture into ungreased 13x9-inch glass baking dish. Separate dough into 8 biscuits. Arrange over hot chicken mixture in dish. Brush each biscuit with butter. Sprinkle with crushed croutons. Bake at 375 degrees for 23-27 minutes or until biscuits are deep golden brown and bottoms are no longer doughy. ; name: quick santa fe chili ; ingredients: roasted deli chicken, onions, diced tomatoes, whole green chilies, ro-tel mexican festival tomatoes, black beans, white shoepeg corn, taco seasoning mix, dry ranch dressing mix ; preparation:Saute onion in olive oil until soft. As onion cooks, remove meat from chicken and add to onion. Stir in taco seasoning and dressing mixes. Add 1 can of tomatoes and 1 rotel, with all liquids. Pour 1 can of black beans into blender with liquid, add the chilis, puree and add to pan. Puree 1 can corn, 1 can tomatoes and 1 can rotel with can liquids 1 and add to pan. Drain and rinse 1 can of black beans, add to pan. Add 1 can of corn with liquid to pan. Bring all ingredients to a boil, turn to simmer. Cook for 30 minutes. ; name: crab noodle bowl ; ingredients: stir fry vegetables, imitation crabmeat, ramen noodles, water, teriyaki marinade ; preparation:In large non-stick pan, cook veggies on medium heat covered for about 3 minutes. Mix 1 packet of seasoning with water. Add water, ramen and crab to veggies and stir continuously until noodles are soft and most of water is absorbed. Pour over marinade. Heat through and serve. ; name: golden flapjacks ; ingredients: butter, demerara sugar, golden syrup, porridge oats ; preparation:Pre heat oven to 160 degrees celsius grease and base line a 20cm round cake tin. To measure the golden syrup easier, measure the sugar first, keep it in the scales and pour the syrup on top to avoid sticking to plate. Put butter, syrup and sugar in a saucepan and heat gently until butter has melted and sugar dissolved. Remove from heat and stir in oats. Pour into lined tin and press down with back of a spoon until is surface is level. Bake in oven about 25-30 minutes until golden brown. Remove from oven and loosen from the sides of the tin with a palette knife and leave to cool for about 10 minutes. ; name: beer hush puppies ; ingredients: yellow cornmeal, all-purpose flour, baking powder, sugar, salt, eggs, beer, onion, jalapeno pepper, vegetable oil ; preparation:

name: beef dip ; ingredients: chuck roast, water, soy sauce, rosemary, thyme, garlic powder, bay leaf, peppercorns, french rolls ; preparation:Place roast in slow cooker. Add water, soy sauce, rosemary, thyme, garlic powder, bay leaf, peppercorns. Cover and cook for 5-6 hours on high or until beef is tender. Remove meat from broth, shred with forks and keep warm. Strain broth. Pour broth into cups for dipping. Serve beef on rolls. ; name: simple avgolemono ; ingredients: chicken stock, long grain rice, egg yolks, lemon juice, fresh parsley, salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Bring stock to boil in large saucepan, turn down to a simmer and add the rice, cook for about 12 minutes or until rice is tender, season with salt and pepper. Whisk the egg yolks together and add half the lemon juice. Whisk to combine and keep whisking until smooth and bubbly. Add a ladle of the hot liquid to the egg yolks and whisk inches. Remove soup from the heat and slowly add the egg mixture, whisking constantly. Taste the soup and add the other 2 tbsp of lemon juice if necessary, stir in parsley and serve immediately. ; name: red onion borscht ; ingredients: butter, red onions, beets, red wine vinegar, flour, chicken broth, port wine, salt & freshly ground black pepper, sour cream, fresh chives ; preparation:Melt butter in a large pot, add onions, beets and vinegar. Cook vegetables over low heat, 25-30 minutes or until soft. Add flour, cook and stir 1-2 minutes until flour is incorporated. Remove pot from heat, gradually add broth while stirring. Return pot to stove, increase heat to medium high and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, simmer 10 minutes, add port and season with salt and pepper. Ladle into soup bowls and top with sour cream and chives. ; name: chocolate chip pie ; ingredients: graham cracker crust, marshmallows, milk, whipping cream, chocolate candy bars ; preparation:Make crust. Melt marshmallows with milk in double boiler. Let cool. Fold in whipping cream and grated chocolate bar. Spread in pan and refrigerate. ; name: zucchini mix in tomato sauce ; ingredients: tomatoes, olive oil, onion, celery, zucchini, sugar, salt ; preparation:Chop or partially puree tomatoes to your liking. Heat oil in large pan. Add onion and celery, saute for about 10 minutes or until onion and celery are soft. Add zucchini and cook until soft. Add tomatoes, sugar and salt. Bring to boil, and turn down to a simmer. Simmer for 30 minutes. Cool and pack into freezer containers. Freeze up to 3 months. ; name: buenos aires press sandwich ; ingredients: challah, brie cheese, fresh basil, tomatoes, butter ; preparation:

name: easy sweet and spicy kettle corn ; ingredients: paprika, salt, ground coriander, white pepper, cayenne pepper, microwave popcorn, sugar, butter ; preparation:Mix first 5 ingredients in a small bowl. Make a bag of microwave popcorn. While it pops, cook 5 tablespoons sugar in a small sauce pan over medium heat until it melts and turns light brown. Remove from heat. Stir in 1 tablespoon butter. Pour the caramel over the popcorn in a bowl, sprinkle with the spice mix and toss to coat. Spread out on a baking sheet to cool. ; name: herb roasted lamb chops ; ingredients: garlic cloves, fresh thyme leave, fresh rosemary leaf, kosher salt, extra virgin olive oil, lamb loin chops ; preparation:Mix first 4 ingredients and 1 tb olive oil in a large bowl. Add lamb. Turn to coat. Let marinate at room temperature at least 30 minutes and up to 1 hour. Preheat oven to 400f. Heat remaining 1 tb olive oil in heavy large ovenproof skillet over high heat. Add lamb. Cook until browned, about 3 minutes per side. Transfer skillet to oven and roast lamb chops to desired doneness, about 10 minutes for medium-rare. Transfer lamb to platter, cover, and let rest 5 minutes. ; name: quick ham and potato scallop ; ingredients: scalloped potatoes mix, boiling water, butter, milk, ham, frozen cut green beans, cheddar cheese ; preparation:In an ungreased 2 qt baking dish, combine potatoes with sauce mix. Boiling water and butter. Stir in milk, ham, and beans. Bake, uncovered, in a 400 degree oven for 35 minutes or until potatoes are tender, stirring occassionaly. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. ; name: easy salmon ball ; ingredients: cream cheese, fresh lemon juice, onion, prepared horseradish, salt, liquid smoke, green peppers, cucumber, salmon, fresh parsley ; preparation:Cream all of the ingredients together except for the salmon and parsley. Fold into the salmon until well mixed. Chill overnight. Form into a firm ball and roll in the parsley mixture. Chill until ready to serve. Can be made up to 24 hours in advance. ; name: basil carrots ; ingredients: carrots, butter, salt, basil ; preparation:Slice carrots. Simmer, covered, in salted water until tender, about 10 to 15 minutes. Drain. Combine remaining ingredients. Toss with carrots. ; name: marinated lemon lamb cutlets or chops ; ingredients: lamb chops, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, lemon juice, rosemary ; preparation:

name: marshmallow muffins ; ingredients: marshmallows, all-purpose flour, unsweetened cocoa, baking powder, salt, light brown sugar, eggs, milk, sunflower oil ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Grease a 12-cup muffin pan or line with 12 muffin paper liners. Using scissors, cut the marshmallows in half. Sift together the flour, cocoa, baking powder and salt into a large bowl. Stir in the sugar and marshmallows. Lightly beat the eggs in a large bowl, then beat in the milk and oil. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and pour in the beaten liquid ingredients. Stir gently until just combined. Do not overmix. Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin pan. Bake in the preheated oven for about 25 minutes, until well risen and firm to the touch. Let the muffins cool in the pan for 5 minutes, then serve warm or transfer to a wire rack and let cool completely. ; name: campbell s seafood tomato alfredo ; ingredients: butter, onion, condensed cream of mushroom & garlic soup, milk, canned tomato, fish fillet, linguine ; preparation:Heat butter in skillet. Add onion and cook until tender. Add soup, milk and tomatoes. Heat to a boil. Add fish and cook over low heat 10 minutes or until fish is done. Serve over linguine. ; name: copycat killer shrimp ; ingredients: dried rosemary, dried thyme, black pepper, minced garlic cloves, celery seed, crushed red pepper flakes, clam broth, tomato paste, butter, shrimp ; preparation:Combine all spices, partially crush and grind using a mortar and pestle or heavy bottom pan - just to partially crush spices, they should still be recognizable. Mix all spices and remaining ingredients except shrimp in a large pot, simmer partially covered for a minimum of one to two hours. Add shrimp, cook for approximately 5 minutes, or until shrimp is just pink and starting to curl. Allow to sit in broth for a few minutes off the heat. Serve in bowls with a lot of broth and a plate full of crusty bread for dipping. ; name: tex mex cheeseburgers ; ingredients: egg, chunky salsa, mexican seasoning, lean ground beef, monterey jack cheese, fine breadcrumbs ; preparation:In medium sized bowl whisk egg. Add salsa and seasoning. Mix in cheese, meat and bread crumbs. Shape into 4 patties. Grill over medium heat until done- about 15 minutes. ; name: fried chicken drumsticks southern style ; ingredients: chicken legs, eggs, vegetable oil, flour, cayenne pepper, paprika, salt ; preparation:Before frying, boil chicken legs in a pot of water for 10 minutes. In a large saucepan, heat vegetable oil on medium heat. On a large plate, combine flour, cayenne pepper, paprika, and salt. Keep beaten eggs in a separate bowl. Take 1 chicken leg and cover it is flour mixture. Place the chicken leg in eggs and cover it in egg. Place the chicken leg back into the flour mixture and cover it again in flour. Once oil is hot and ready for frying, place chicken leg into the oil for frying. Repeat steps 5-8 for each chicken leg allowing up to 3 legs to fry at one time. Once legs are fried to a golden brown, remove from oil and place on a double-folded paper towel on a plate. Allow plenty of time to cool before serving. ; name: summer squash with toasted garlic and lime ; ingredients: zucchini, salt, chicken broth, garlic cloves, lime juice, black pepper, dried oregano, flat leaf parsley ; preparation:

name: whipped lingonberry porridge vispipuuro ; ingredients: water, lingonberries, sugar, salt, semolina ; preparation:Bring the water to a boil in a saucepan. Mash the lingonberries and add them to the saucepan together with the sugar and salt. Boil for approximately 10 minutes. Strain the liquid and pour it back into the saucepan. Add the semolina, stir well and cook at a low heat for 15 more minutes. Set aside to cool. When the porridge has cooled, pour it into a mixing bowl and whip it with a hand mixer, until light. Serve with sugar and milk. ; name: laughing cow fettuccine ; ingredients: spinach fettuccine, salt, pepper, laughing cow light garlic and herb cheese, skim milk, parmesan cheese, chives ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, melt laughing cow cheese over low heat. Stir in milk and parmesan. Stir constantly until smooth. Pour sauce over cooked pasta and top with chives. ; name: cherry sake cocktails ; ingredients: frozen dark sweet cherries, ice, sake, ginger ale ; preparation:Divide cherries among two tall glasses. Gently muddle cherries with the back of a wooden spoon in the bottom of each glass. Top with plenty of ice. Add 2 shots of sake to each glass. Fill to the top with ginger ale. Sip and enjoy. ; name: green bean medley ; ingredients: fresh green beans, carrots, butter, onion, fresh mushrooms, seasoning salt, garlic, white pepper ; preparation:Steam or cook carrots and green beans in boiling water. Cook until tender, but still firm. Melt butter over medium heat. Saute onions and mushrooms until almost tender. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 3 minutes. Stir in green beans, carrots, seasoned salt, garlic, and white pepper. Cover and cook five minutes on low heat. ; name: seasoned chicken with soup gravy ; ingredients: chicken tenders, creole seasoning, olive oil, cream of mushroom soup, cream of chicken soup, chicken broth ; preparation:Coat the chicken with the seasoning, and let sit in the refridgerator for at least an hour. After marinating, brown the chicken in olive oil in a large pan. In a separate bowl, mix together the soups with the chicken broth, stir until smooth. Add the soup mixture to the pan, mix well. Let simmer for 10-15 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve with the soup gravy. ; name: mustard dill pretzel dip ; ingredients: sugar, olive oil, mayonnaise, stone ground mustard, prepared mustard, garlic powder, dill weed ; preparation:

name: spinach sausage soup ; ingredients: bulk italian sausage, chicken broth, red potatoes, italian salad dressing mix, fresh spinach ; preparation:Brown the sausage in a skillet, over medium heat. Drain well. In a large soup pot, add the broth, potatoes, and salad dressing mix. Stir well. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 10-12 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Add in the sausage and spinach. Cook until well heated. ; name: cereal cookies for babies ; ingredients: shortening, sugar, egg, baking powder, salt, vanilla, water, infant cereal ; preparation:Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Cream together shortening and sugar. Add eggs, baking powder, salt, vanilla, and water. Mix until well blended. Gradually stir in cereal. Knead until smooth. Shape into 12 cookies or bars with your hands. Place on an ungreased sheet. Bake 20-30 miuntes or until dry. Store uncovered overnight. ; name: poppy seed pasta salad ; ingredients: pasta, cucumber, kiwi, strawberry, cashews, swiss cheese, poppy seed dressing ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package. Allow to cool, or rinse under cold water. Add cucumber, kiwi, strawberries, cashews, and swiss cheese. Stir gently to mix. Mix in dressing. Chill until ready to serve. ; name: slow cooker german style pork roast ; ingredients: white potatoes, garlic, salt and pepper, boneless pork loin roast, sauerkraut, caraway seeds ; preparation:Place the potatoes, garlic, salt and pepper in a slow cooker. Stir to coat. Season the pork roast with salt and pepper. Lay atop the potatoes. Pour the sauerkraut over the roast, sprinkle with caraway seeds. Cook in slow cooker on low 8-10 hours. ; name: cheesy chicken breasts ; ingredients: boneless chicken breasts, reduced-fat cheddar cheese, plain flour, ground black pepper, unsalted butter, reduced-sodium chicken broth, dry white wine, dried oregano ; preparation:Beat fillets between 2 sheets of waxed paper until 5mm thick. Cut each slice of cheese in half and place 1 half on top of each fillet. Starting with short end tightly roll up fillets. Tie with kitchen string. On waxed paper, mix flour and pepper. Add chicken and toss gently. In a non-stick fry pan melt butter over medium heat. Add chicken fillets and fry turning occasionaly until golden about 3 minutes. Add chicken stock, wine and dried oregano. Increase heat and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low simmer until chicken is cooked through and sauce has thickened about 10-12 minutes. ; name: field greens with roasted bacon wrapped pears ; ingredients: bacon, pears, mixed salad greens, pecans, parmesan cheese, vinaigrette ; preparation:

name: hot n spicy fried chicken ; ingredients: hot sauce, garlic salt, chicken, bisquick baking mix, onion salt, black pepper, vegetable oil ; preparation:Combine the hot sauce and garlic salt. Pour over the chicken in a large bowl. Combine the bisquick, onion salt and pepper in another bowl. Remove the chicken from the sauce and drain. Dredge chicken in bisquick mixture. Heat the oil over medium high heat until hot. Reduce the heat to medium and add chicken pieces. Fry the chicken for about 15 minutes on each side until the juices are clear and chicken is golden brown. ; name: hot salami chicken stroganoff ; ingredients: onion, garlic clove, mushrooms, salami, chicken strips, tomato paste, sour cream, ground pepper ; preparation:Saute onions and garlic in a large frypan until brown. Add mushrooms and salami to the pan with the chicken strips. Cook for 6-8 mins and add tomato paste, simmer for 2 minutes. Turn heat to low and stir in sour cream, simmer for another 2 minutes. Season with ground pepper and serve over rice or noodles. ; name: easy peanut butter balls ; ingredients: peanut butter, margarine, vanilla, powdered sugar, chocolate chips ; preparation:In a medium bowl knead peanut butter, margarine, vanilla and sugar, with your hands, until smooth dough is formed. Shape into half-inch balls, place on tray lined with wax paper and freeze for at least one hour. Melt chocolate in the microwave. Use 20-second zaps and mix in between each zap until smooth. Insert a toothpick into each peanut butter ball and dip ball into melted chocolate. Return to wax paper and refreeze. Store in airtight container and serve from frozen. ; name: irish carrot parsnip mash ; ingredients: carrots, sugar, parsnips, butter, salt, pepper, fresh parsley ; preparation:Boil the carrots in a little lightly salted water with a pinch of sugar in it, until soft and drain. Boil the parsnips separately in lightly salted water until soft and drain. Marsh or puree them together. Add the butter. Season and sprinkle with the parsley. Serve. ; name: jasmine rice and barley ; ingredients: jasmine rice, chicken broth, quick-cooking barley, peanuts, salt ; preparation:Rinse the rice under cold water. In med saucepan, bring broth to a boil. Add rice and all ingredients. Cover and reduce heat to simmer. Cook for 15 minutes, or until all liquid is absorbed. ; name: peppy egg strata ; ingredients: white bread, jalapeno jack cheese, cheddar cheese, bacon, eggs, milk, salt, pepper ; preparation:

name: somebody stole my cookie cookies ; ingredients: corn syrup, sugar, peanut butter, rice krispies, chocolate chips, butterscotch chips ; preparation:Bring the corn syrup and sugar to a boil. Stir in the peanut butter and pour the mixture over the cereal, stir. Put into a greased 9 x 13 pan. Melt the chocolate chips and the butterscotch chips, pour over the cereal mixture and spread evenly. Cool, cut into squares and eat. ; name: easter fruit salad ; ingredients: grand marnier, orange marmalade, dried apricot, orange, pineapple, strawberries ; preparation:In a large bowl combine grand marnier, marmalade, apricots, orange zest and sectioned oranges and pinepapple. Can be made up to 1 day ahead and refrigerated. Wash berries, hull strawberies and half. Half anyother large berries otherwise leave whole. Toss berries with marinated fruit. Can be prepared up to 1 hour before serving and refrigerated. ; name: apple dumpling bake ; ingredients: refrigerated crescent dinner rolls, granny smith apples, sugar, butter, mountain dew soda, ground cinnamon, vanilla ice cream ; preparation:Seperate crescent rolls into 16 triangles. Cut each apple into eight wedges. Wrap a triangle around each apple wedge. Place in a greased 13-in. X 9-in. X 2-in. Baking dish. In a bowl, combine sugar and butter and sprinkle over rolls. Slowly pour the soda around the rolls. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake, uncovered, at 350 for 35-40 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with ice cream. ; name: roasted asparagus mushrooms ; ingredients: fresh asparagus, fresh mushrooms, garlic cloves, salt, fresh ground black pepper, butter ; preparation:Heat oven to 425 degrees f. Arrange asparagus and mushrooms on aluminum foil-lined 15x10x1-inch jelly roll pan. Sprinkle garlic, salt and pepper on top. Drizzle melted butter over vegetables. Bake, stirring occasionally, for 15-20 minutes or until vegetables are tender and lightly browned. Serve immediately. ; name: tender flank steak ; ingredients: soy sauce, water, garlic cloves, brown sugar, vegetable oil, ground ginger, black pepper, flank steak ; preparation:In large, resealable plastic bag, or shallow glass container, combine the first seven ingredients and mix well. Add steak, turn to coat. Seal bag, or cover container, and refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight, turning occasionally. Drain and discard marinade. Grill, covered, over medium-hot coals for 6-8 minutes on each side, or until meat reaches desired doneness. ; name: fish fillet and scallops in green peppercorn sauce ; ingredients: fresh boneless fish fillets, butter, lemon rind, scallops, green peppercorn, lemon juice, salt and black pepper ; preparation:

name: sunday dinner chicken ; ingredients: rice, broiler-fryer chicken, salt and pepper, onion soup mix, cream of mushroom soup, milk ; preparation:Grease a 2-3 quart casserole dish. Spread rice on bottom. Add chicken. Salt and pepper. Sprinkle onion soup mix over chicken. Mix cream of mushroom soup with milk. Pour over chicken. Bake at 325f for 2 hours. ; name: sweet lemon and spice pork chops or ribs ; ingredients: boneless pork chops, honey mustard, tomato ketchup, lemon & herb seasoning, garlic, onion, black pepper ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees f. Spread chops or full rack of ribs in roasting pan. Mix honey mustard, ketchup, lemon and herb spice, and dices garlic. Spread mixture over meat. Place cut onion over meat and sauce. Spinkle black pepper over entire dish. Bake for 30-40 minutes, until tender. Serve with your choice of vegetables for a little sweeter sauce add granulated sugar to taste. ; name: curried chicken and artichoke hearts casserole ; ingredients: chicken breasts, garlic, artichoke hearts, mayonnaise, cream of chicken soup, lemon juice, curry powder, soft bread cubes, sharp cheddar cheese, butter ; preparation:Heat olive oil and saute garlic and drained artichoke hearts together. Put mixture in a greased 9 x 13 pan. Mix together mayonnaise, soup, lemon juice and curry powder and pour over the chicken and artichoke hearts. Top with bread cubes and cheese then drizzle melted butter over top. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes or until bubbly. ; name: yellow squash with basil ; ingredients: olive oil, yellow squash, garlic, water, salt, black pepper, basil ; preparation:Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Saute squash until browned, about 5 minutes. Add garlic. Saute 1 minute. Add water, salt and pepper. Simmer until squash is tender, 6-7 minutes. Stir in basil. ; name: todd s broccoli salad ; ingredients: mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar, broccoli, baby spinach, red onion, bacon bits, dark raisin, golden raisin ; preparation:Mix mayonnaise, sugar, and vinegar in a bowl. Set aside. In a large bowl, mix broccoli, spinach, onion, bacon bits, and raisins. Pour the dressing over the mixture and mix thoroughly but gently. Allow at least 1 hour of refrigeration before serving. ; name: chocolate chip cookies 10 ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, granulated sugar, brown sugar, unsalted butter, egg yolks, vanilla extract, chocolate chips ; preparation:

name: onion mushroom and spinach saute for two ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, mushrooms, garlic clove, spinach leaves, balsamic vinegar, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat a medium saute pan on medium heat. Add olive oil. Add onions and mushrooms, stirring for 5-10 minutes, until golden brown, adding garlic halfway through. Add spinach and stir a minute or two, until spinach is just wilted. Remove from heat and add balsamic vinegar, salt and pepper to taste. ; name: granola yogurt berry parfait ; ingredients: plain yogurt, granola cereal, berries, bananas, honey ; preparation:Line up 4 parfait, white wine or other tall glasses. Spoon 2 tablespoons of yogurt, into each glass and smooth surface. Spoon 2 tablespoons of granola overtop and smooth surface. Spoon 2 tablespoons of fruit overtop and smooth surface. Repeat the process, adding a bit of honey here and there, to taste. ; name: reese s cup pie ; ingredients: graham cracker pie crust, peanut butter, milk, chocolate pudding mix ; preparation:In medium mixing bowl with mixer on low. Cream peanutbutter until soft. Gradually add milk while continuely to mix. When all milk is mixed with peanutbutter, add pudding mix and continue to blend until ingredients are smooth and combined well. Pour mix into baked shell, chill at least 4 hours. ; name: portuguese custard cupcakes ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, eggs, butter, milk, lemon zest ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 300f grease cupcake tins with butter. Beat the eggs until lemon coloured. Add the sugar and butter and continue to beat until thick, then add the lemon rind. Pour warm milk into egg mixture while continuing to beat. Once blended, fold in the flour until well mixed. Fill the tins half way up and bake for approximately 1 hour, or until a tester inserted comes out clean. Cool in pans on a rack. Cupcakes will sink during the cooling process. ; name: crock pot stuffed chicken breasts ; ingredients: ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, pesto sauce, chicken breasts, salt, pepper, cream of mushroom soup, milk, white wine, fresh basil leaf ; preparation:Combine cheeses and pesto sauce. Place a spoonful of the pesto cheese mixture onto each chicken breast. Roll up and secure with a toothpick. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and place into crock. In a bowl whisk the soup, milk and wine together and pour over the chicken breasts. Cook on low 4-6 hours, or on high 3-4 hours. Garnish with basil leaves. ; name: no bake cherry cheesecake pie ; ingredients: prepared graham cracker crust, cream cheese, sugar, frozen dessert topping, cherry pie filling ; preparation:

name: sweet soy glazed salmon ; ingredients: light brown sugar, olive oil, soy sauce, fresh lemon juice, dry white wine, salmon fillets ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Mix glaze ingredients together, stirring until dissolved. Marinate fish filets for at least 30 minutes. Arrange salmon, skin-side down, in a baking dish lined with aluminum foil & lightly sprayed with cooking spray. Brush glaze on all sides of fish. Bake approximately 15-20 minutes, basting once with pan sauces. Fish is done when it flakes easily and center is cooked through. ; name: baby food banana teething biscuits ; ingredients: brown sugar, oil, eggs, mashed banana, flour, baking powder, baking soda ; preparation:Combine ingredients and stir only until smooth. Pour into a greased loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees f for about 1 hour or until firmly set. Cool, remove from pan, and cut into sticks. Spread sticks out on a cookie sheet and bake at 150 degrees f for 1 hour or longer until the sticks are hard and crunchy. Store in a tightly covered container. ; name: seared tuna with ginger noodles ; ingredients: somen noodles, sesame oil, lime juice, wasabi, pickled ginger, fresh chives, tuna, sesame seeds ; preparation:Boil a large pot of water, throw in the noodles and cook for two minutes or until soft. Drain, rinse and cool. Mix the sesame oil, lime juice and wasabi paste together. Pour this over the noodles and mix in the pickled ginger and garlic chives. Press the tuna into the sesame seeds until the fish is coated on all sides. Heat a non-stick frying pan and cook the tuna for one minute on all sides or until just seared. Transfer to a chopping board, let the tuna rest for a moment and then cut it into thick slices. Serve with soy sauce and wasabi in dipping bowls. ; name: broccoli and noodles supreme ; ingredients: medium egg noodles, broccoli florets, cream of chicken and broccoli soup, sour cream, parmesan cheese, pepper, garlic powder ; preparation:In large saucepan prepare noodles according to package directions. Add broccoli for last five minutes of cooking time. Drain. In same pan mix soup, sour cream, cheese, pepper, garlic powder, and noodle mixture. Over medium heat, heat through, stirring occasionally. ; name: chocolate chip pie no crust ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, brown sugar, butter, eggs, vanilla extract, semisweet chocolate morsels, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Lightly spray the pie plate with cooking spray. Combine flour, baking powder, salt and brown sugar in a medium bowl. Add the butter, eggs, and vanilla. Stir well. Stir in the chocolate morsels and nuts. Spoon into a greased 9-inch pieplate. Bake at 350 for 35 to 40 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack. ; name: copycat sizzler rice ; ingredients: orzo pasta, butter, chicken bouillon powder, garlic powder, onion powder, long-grain rice, lemon juice, warm water ; preparation:

name: braised lettuce with peas and lemon ; ingredients: olive oil, shallots, boston lettuce, chicken broth, dried thyme, sugar, frozen peas, lemon zest, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Heat the oil in a large skillet over moderate heat. Saut the shallots until tender, about 5 minutes. Add the lettuce, chicken broth. Thyme, and sugar and simmer covered over low heat for about 5 minutes, until the lettuce is tender. Add the peas and cook an additional 5 minutes. Add the lemon zest, salt, and pepper, and serve immediately. ; name: comforting cold and flu tea ; ingredients: water, fresh ginger, sage leaves, rosemary sprigs, fresh thyme sprigs, lemon, juice of, cinnamon sticks, honey ; preparation:Place all ingredients in a large pot. Bring to a boil. Turn off heat and steep for about 10 minutes. Strain into a pitcher. Stir in honey while still warm. Store pitcher in refrigerator. Reheat one cup at a time in the microwave, adding more honey to taste, if desired. Drink twice a day, breathing steam through nose, for maximum benefit. ; name: lemon tomato salmon ; ingredients: salmon fillets, lemon, juice of, tomatoes, zucchini, yellow squash, extra virgin olive oil, salt, fresh coarse ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat the over to 325 degrees f. Slice zucchini and yellow squash into thin slices. Dice the tomato. Place the salmon fillet in a glass or ceramic oven-safe casserole dish. Drizzle about a tablespoon of olive oil onto the fillet, season with salt and pepper lightly. Lightly cover the fillet with slices of zucchini and yellow squash. Place excess around the fillet. Place the remaining olive oil, lemon juice and diced tomato in a small bowl. Lightly crush the tomato and mix everything together. Pour tomatoes, lemon juice and olive oil mixture over the fillet and vegetables. Season lightly and let bake for about 15-20 minutes. ; name: italian pizzaiola beefsteak pizza style ; ingredients: round steaks, italian stewed tomatoes, dried oregano, dried parsley, onion salt, black pepper, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, olive oil, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Place steaks, in one layer, in a 9x13-inch baking pan. Mash up tomatoes and pour on top of steaks, spreading to cover steaks. Sprinkle with oregano, parsley, onion salt, black pepper, crushed red pepper, and minced garlic. Drizzle olive oil on top and bake, uncovered for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Take steaks out of oven. Sprinkle tops with shredded mozzarella cheese. Return to oven and bake until cheese is melted. ; name: apple baked bean casserole ; ingredients: onion, baked beans, granny smith apple, prepared mustard, brown sugar, salt, bacon ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Coat a 2-quart baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine all the ingredients except the bacon and mix well. Pour into the baking dish and lay the raw strips of bacon on top. Cover and bake for approximately 45 minutes, or until thick and bubbly. Uncover and bake for 5 more minute. ; name: sweet and spicy coleslaw ; ingredients: green cabbage, carrots, yellow onion, mayonnaise, mustard, apple cider vinegar, sugar, black pepper, cayenne, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:

name: pork scaloppine 6 weight watchers points ; ingredients: unsalted butter, olive oil, pork loin, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, reduced-sodium fat-free chicken broth, fresh lemon juice, lemon zest ; preparation:Heat the butter and oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Season the 10 pork cutlets with 2 tsp of the salt and pepper. Cook the cutlets until lightly browned and cooked through, about 1 min per side or until tender. Remove from pan. Set aside 4 cutlets and keep warm, and save the other 6 for another meal. Add the chicken broth to the pan and simmer, scraping up the brown bits with a wooden spoon until slightly thickened, about minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the lemon juice and the remaining salt. Drizzle the meat with the pan juices and sprinkle with the zest. Serve with lemon asparagus. ; name: lemon lime rice ; ingredients: white rice, boiling water, butter, fresh herb, lemon peel, lime zest, salt, lime juice ; preparation:Cook rice for 5 minutes in a saucepan with briskly boiling water and butter, stirring once. Cover the pan, turn the heat off, but leave the pan on the burner undisturbed for 15-20 minutes. After the rice has absorbed the liquid and is light and fluffy, add the selected herb, lemon peel, lime peel, salt, and lime juice. Stir well. Serve warm. ; name: mexican dinner pronto ; ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, tamales, chili without beans, chili with beans, oregano, monterey jack cheese ; preparation:In skillet heat oil. Saute onion until tender. Transfer to ovenproof baking dish. Arrange half the tamales and gravy over onions. Add the two cans of chili. Sprinkle with oregano. Top with remaining tamales. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes, or until bubbling hot. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 15 minutes more or until cheese has melted. ; name: amish lime salad ; ingredients: marshmallows, milk, lime gelatin, cream cheese, crushed pineapple, salad dressing, whipped cream ; preparation:Melt the marshmallows and milk in a double boiler. Pour that mixture over the gelatin, stirring it until the gelatin is dissolved. Stir in the cream cheese until it dissolves. Add the pineapple and cool the mixture. Add salad dressing and whipped cream and chill until firm. ; name: pepperoni pinwheels ; ingredients: pizza crusts, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, pepperoni slice, spaghetti sauce ; preparation:On a lightly floured surface, roll dough into a 16 inch x 10 inch rectangle. Sprinkle with cheeses and pepperoni. Roll up jelly-roll style, starting with a long side. Cut into 2 inch slices,. Place cut side down in a greased 15 inch x 10 inch x 1 inch baking pan, lightly press down to flatten. Bake at 400 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with spaghetti sauce if desired. ; name: japanese soy glazed sweet potato ; ingredients: brown sugar, low sodium soy sauce, mirin, dark sesame oil, garlic cloves, sweet potatoes, toasted sesame seeds, nori ; preparation:

name: grandma solberg s apple brown betty ; ingredients: apples, brown sugar, flour, oats, cinnamon, nutmeg, butter, water ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375. Mix all ingredients except the apples and water together until the butter is broken up into small pea shapes. Alternate layers of apples and crumb mixture in an 8x8 greased baking pan, finishing with crumb mixture on top. Pour the water over the top. Bake for 30 - 35 minutes. ; name: grandma patteson s creamed carrots ; ingredients: carrot, butter, onion, flour, chicken broth, salt, pepper, dill weed, light cream ; preparation:Boil carrots for 10 minutes or until tender then drain and place in a buttered casserole dish. Saut onions in butter until transparent. Stir flour into onions. Then gradually stir in chicken broth, salt, pepper and dillweed. Cook until thickened and smooth. Add cream and stir well. Pour sauce over carrots. Bake at 350 f for 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated. ; name: banana cake x ; ingredients: butter recipe cake mix, baking soda, sour cream, butter, eggs, bananas, vanilla extract ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour two cake pans and set aside. Mash banana and set aside. Combine cake mix and baking soda in the large bowl of an electric mixer. Add the rest of the ingredients and beat on low speed until combined. Beat at medium speed for 4-5 minutes. Divide batter between the two pans and bake 30-35 minutes or until center of cake springs back with lightly tapped. Allow to cool on a wire rack and frost. ; name: croatian potato restani krumpir ; ingredients: potatoes, onions, lard, salt ; preparation:Do not peel potato, just wash the dirt and put it in cold water and cook until soft. In the meantime saut sliced onion until soft or almost brownish. Peel cooked potato and slice it. Add salt and into onion and lard and fry it just until potato starts to hold of the pot. Serve hot. ; name: roasted eggplant and tomato pizza ; ingredients: pizza dough, japanese eggplant, mozzarella cheese, plum tomatoes, pesto sauce, olive oil, salt ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450. Arrange eggplant slices in single layer on greased baking tray. Sprinkle eggplant slices with salt, bake until soft and golden. Turn heat up to 515 and place pizza stone in oven. Roll out pizza dough on cornmeal coated paddle, lightly coat with oil. Sprinkle dough with mozzarella and arrange eggplant in a spoke pattern. Sprinkle with tomatoes and dot with pesto. Bake 8-10 minutes. ; name: clams with cherry tomatoes ; ingredients: olive oil, cherry tomatoes, dry white wine, littleneck clams, garlic cloves, lemon, fresh parsley, french bread ; preparation:

name: cream cheese candy ; ingredients: pecans, butter, cream cheese, powdered sugar, vanilla ; preparation:Put pecans & butter in oven and toast about 15 minutes at 300f. Melt cream cheese over low heat until creamy. Add powdered sugar, vanilla and nuts. Mix very well. Put in fridge until set. ; name: mama s beef a roni ; ingredients: ground beef, green pepper, onion, celery, garlic powder, italian seasoning, small shell pasta, mozzarella cheese, pasta sauce ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. While pasta is cooking, on medium heat brown ground beef in large skillet. Add onions, peppers, celery, italian seasoning and garlic powder, stirring until vegetables are tender. Drain and return to skillet. Stir in pasta sauce. Add pasta and mix thoroughly. Sprinkle cheese over top. Cover with lid and let cheese melt. Let sit for about 5 minutes then serve and enjoy. ; name: ww 4 pt diet soda cake ; ingredients: cake mix, diet soda, sugar free fat free instant pudding mix, cool whip free ; preparation:Mix cake mix and can of drink together using mixer. Pour into a greased 9 x 13 baking pan. Bake according to package directions. While cake is baking, make pudding mixture using ff milk. When cake is cooled, top with pudding then cool whip. ; name: brined turkey breast with maple glaze ; ingredients: turkey breast, kosher salt, brown sugar, hot water, apple juice, ice, maple syrup, butter ; preparation:Stir the kosher salt and brown sugar into hot water until dissolved. Mix in apple juice and ice. Place the turkey breast in a 2 gallon resalable plastic bag. Pour the brine over, seal and place in refrigerator for about 2 hours. Preheat oven to 375 degrees and roast the turkey breast side up on a rack over a shallow roasting pan. After the first hour begin basting the breast with the maple-butter glaze. Baste every 15 minutes until the temperature of the breast reaches 165 degrees. Remove from the oven, tent with foil and allow to rest for 15 to 20 minutes before slicing. ; name: guam s red rice ; ingredients: achiote seeds, salt, cooking oil, onion, water, rice, bacon ; preparation:Place the achiote seeds in 2 cups of water to soak, and lightly grind along the edge until the water is a deep red. The darker the water the darker shade of red the rice will be. The water will stain most material so i recommend a clear glass and a stainless steel spoon. After you have the desired color, filter the water through a cloth or fine sieve that will separate the colored water from any seeds and foreign material. Set the colored water aside. Wash rice and drain. Place in a rice cooker with the achiote water from above, salt, onions, oil, and bacon, if using. Close the rice pot and push the start button. ; name: crusty fried chicken ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, garlic salt, salt, celery salt, pepper, paprika, chicken pieces, canola oil ; preparation:

name: roasted apples with fig hazelnut stuffing ; ingredients: dried figs, hazelnuts, orange zest, allspice, granny smith apples, brown sugar, butter, fresh orange juice ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 180c. Combine the chopped figs, hazelnuts, orange zest and allspice. Using an apple corer, remove the apple cores. Place the apples in a baking dish and loosely press the fig mixture into the centre of the apples. Combine the sugar, butter and orange juice and drizzle it over the apples. Bake the apples for 25 minutes or until tender, then set aside for 10 minutes for the sauce to thicken slightly. Serve with the sauce spooned over the apples with cream or icecream. ; name: special occasion chicken ; ingredients: butter, boneless skinless chicken breasts, sliced mushrooms, shallots, salt, pepper, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and cook 10 minutes. Turn chicken. Add shallots and mushrooms, sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook 10 minutes or until cooked through. Chicken should be browned on both sides. Remove and sprinkle with cheese. ; name: hot layered hero sandwich ; ingredients: honey mustard, deli turkey, genoa salami, mozzarella cheese, red onions, deli ham, monterey jack cheese, tomatoes, romaine leaves, bread ; preparation:Cut bread in half. Carefully hollow out part of the bottom and top of bread and discard this or give it to the birds. Spread mustard on cut sides of bread. On the bread bottom layer in the order given above except for the lettuce. The lettuce goes on after it comes out of the oven. Replace top and wrap in heavy-duty foil. Place on baking sheet. Bake at 450 degrees for 12-15 minutes or till heated through. Unwrap and put the lettuce on top of the tomato layer. Cut into wedges. ; name: baked sesame chicken with soy dip ; ingredients: breadcrumbs, sesame seeds, chinese five spice powder, boneless skinless chicken breasts, egg, soy sauce, lemon, juice of, lime, juice of, caster sugar ; preparation:Heat oven to 400 degrees and line a baking tray with baking paper. Mix the breadcrumbs, sesame seeds, five-spice and a little seasoning on a plate. Pat dry the chicken, dip into egg, then roll in the breadcumb mix. Arrange on the baking tray, then bake for 25 to 30 minutes until crips and cooked through. Mix the soy sauce with the citrus juices and sogar to make a dipping sauce. Serve the chicken with little dishes of the sauce for dipping, plus lime wedges for squeezing over. ; name: easy scrumptious peach crisp ; ingredients: peaches in light syrup, ground cinnamon, nutmeg, sugar, flour, old fashioned oats, brown sugar, butter, cool whip ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly grease 9 x 13 glass pan. Drain and mix peaches, cinnamon, nutmeg, sugar and 3 tablespoons flour. Add to pan. Mix rest of flour, oats and brown sugar. Cut in butter. Sprinkle butter mixture over peaches. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. Best served warm with whipped or ice cream. ; name: baked pears with raisins ; ingredients: pears, raisins, maple syrup, butter, vanilla extract, cinnamon ; preparation:

name: lazy mini okonomiyaki ; ingredients: cabbage, flour, dashi, sake, light soy sauce, eggs, green onions, ham, oil, mayonnaise ; preparation:In a non-stick skillet, saute the cabbage mix. Allow to cool to room temperature before adding to the batter. Mix flour, dashi, sake, soy sauce, and eggs together in a large bowl until smooth, although a few small lumps are fine. To the batter, add the cooled cabbage mixture, ham and the green onions. Mix well. Using the same non-stick skillet that you used to cook the cabbage, heat over medium, a small amount of oil or spray with cooking spray. Drop the batter by tablespoonfuls into the pan. Cook until golden on each side. Serve hot, room temperature, or cold with kewpie mayonnaise and bull-dog tonkatsu sauce. ; name: porked sauerkraut ; ingredients: pork rib rack, sauerkraut, onion, beer ; preparation:Place all ingredients in a roaster. Cover the roaster with plastic wrap and then foil to seal. Bake at 250 for 8 hours. Remove coverings and stir. Remove bone and cartilage as meat will have fallen off. Turn oven up to 350. Continue cooking for 1 hour stirring occasionally as the dish caramelizes. Serve with mashed potatoes. ; name: lollipops ; ingredients: sugar, cream of tartar, water, any desired flavoring, any desired food coloring ; preparation:Combine sugar and cream of tartar with water. Stir until completely dissolved. Boil mixture until it reaches 290. Add the amount of flavoring and the amount of coloring you wish. Test by dropping a small amount of the candy into cold water. If it forms immediately then it is ready. Remove from heat and pour into greased molds. When it is partially cooled, add wooden sticks to the center. Let cool off completely. ; name: apple cinnamon pork tenderloin ; ingredients: pork tenderloin, cornstarch, ground cinnamon, brown sugar, apples, dried cranberries ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place the tenderloin in a roasting pan or casserole dish. Combine the remaining ingredients together and stir. Spoon the apple mixture around the tenderloin, cover and bake for 30 minutes. Remove the lid and spoon the apple mix over top of the tenderloin. Place back in the oven and bake 15 to 20 minutes or until tenderloin registers at least 155 to 160 degrees on a meat thermometer. ; name: after the gold rush ; ingredients: whole kernel corn, chopped tomato, green pepper, green onion, brown sugar, jalapeno pepper, tarragon vinegar, salt, fresh dill ; preparation:Combine the first 7 ingredients in a heavy, non-aluminum saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, uncovered, for 20-25 minutes or until liquid has evaporated, stirring frequently. Remove from the heat. Stir in salt, if desired. Let cool for 5 minutes. Stir in the dill. Spoon into a serving bowl. Serve at room temperature and refrigerate unused portion. ; name: mashed garlic carrots ; ingredients: carrots, garlic, vegetable stock, dried thyme, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: orange cocoa ; ingredients: sugar, cocoa, water, milk, orange rind, vanilla ; preparation:In a large saucepan, stir together the cocoa and sugar. Add water. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Allow to boil for two minutes, still stirring. Add milk and orange peel and heat to serving temperature. Add vanilla and serve. ; name: pecan bread ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, sugar, salt, milk, egg, pecans ; preparation:Sift dry ingredients together. Mix milk and egg and add to dry ingredients. Mix, do not beat. Stir in pecans. Baked in greased loaf pan in a 350 preheated oven about 1 hour. Best kept a day or two before eating. Freezes well, great thinly sliced with cream cheese. ; name: greek layer dip ; ingredients: plain yogurt, chickpeas, garlic cloves, oregano, black pepper, kalamata olives, green pepper, tomatoes, feta cheese ; preparation:Place the yogurt, chickpeas and garlic in the bowl of a food processor or blender and process until completely smooth and creamy. Spread the mixture in a large flat circle on a dinner plate or serving dish. Sprinkle the tomatoes and green pepper evenly over the top of the mixture. Sprinkle with black pepper and oregano and top with the feta cheese and olives. Refrigerate for 30 minutes to allow the flavors to mingle. Serve with plenty of tortilla chips, toasted pita triangles or crackers. ; name: mika s honey and soy glazed salmon ; ingredients: honey, soy sauce, fresh lime juice, water, dijon mustard, canola oil, salmon fillets, toasted sesame seeds, green onion ; preparation:In a small bowl, whisk together honey, soy sauce, lime juice, water and mustard. In a small non-stick skillet, heat oil over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking and cook salmon 2-3 minutes on each side, or until golden and just cooked through. Transfer salmon to 4 plates. Add honey mixture to skillet and simmer stirring occasionally, until it reaches a glaze-like consistency. Pour glaze over salmon and sprinkle with sesame seeds and green onions. ; name: caesar salmon pizzas ; ingredients: boboli pizza crusts, caesar salad dressing, fresh spinach, smoked salmon, walnut pieces, parmesan cheese, green onions, capers ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Lightly spread the bread shells with some of the caesar dressing. Place the bread shells on a baking sheet. Top the shells with spinach, salmon, walnuts, half of the parmesan cheese, green onion, and if desired, capers. Bake, uncovered, for 8-10 min or just until heated through. Drizzle with remaining caesar dressing. Sprinkle with remaining parmesan cheese. Cut and serve. ; name: cream cheese dessert wedges ; ingredients: refrigerated buttermilk biscuits, cream cheese, sugar, egg, all-purpose flour, ground cinnamon ; preparation:

name: magic cookie bars or seven layer cookies ; ingredients: graham cracker crumbs, butter, sweetened condensed milk, semi-sweet chocolate chips, white chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, peanut butter chips, flaked coconut, nuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahreheit. In a small bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs and melted butter. Mix well. Press crumb mixture firmly in the bottom of a 13x9 baking pan. Pour sweetened condensed milk evenly over crumb mixture. Layer evenly with semi-sweet chocolate chips, white chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, peanut butter chips, coconut, and nuts. Press down firmly with a fork. Bake for 25 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool. Cut into bars. Store leftovers covered. ; name: herb and garlic goat cheese truffles ; ingredients: cream cheese, goat cheese, fresh lemon juice, fresh chives, fresh basil, garlic, black pepper, pecans, fruit ; preparation:Beat the cream cheese, goat cheese and lemon juice with an electric mixer until smooth. Stir in chives, basil, garlic, and black pepper. Cover and chill for 2 hours or until firm. Shape cheese mixture into 24 balls. Roll each ball in the pecans. Cover and chill for at least 1 hour. Serve with fruit. ; name: arabic salad ; ingredients: english seedless cucumbers, tomatoes, parsley, onion, salt, lemon, juice of, olive oil ; preparation:Dice cucumber and tomatoes. Place in bowl. Add parsley and onion. Just before serving, add the salt, lemon and olive oil and combine all ingredients. Serve in small bowls to accompany rice dishes. ; name: ratatouille rice ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, garlic cloves, mushroom, red bell pepper, eggplant, tomato sauce, chicken broth, dried thyme leaves, brown rice ; preparation:Prheat oven to 350 degrees. Heat oil in 12 inch fry pan over medium heat. Add onion, cooking til soft, about 7 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 more minute. Add mushrooms, bell pepper and eggplant. Cook, stirring, until liquid has evaporated, about 5 minutes. In a 3 or 4 quart casserole, combine eggplant mixture with tomato sauce, broth, thyme and rice. Cover and bake till rice is tender. ; name: johnsonville italian meatballs ; ingredients: johnsonville mild italian sausages, egg, dry breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, milk, onion ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl, combine the egg, breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, milk and onion. Remove sausage from casings. Add sausage to the bread crumb mixture and mix well. Shape into 20 meatballs. Arrange meatballs on a shallow baking pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until meatballs are cooked through. Serve with your favorite sauce and spaghetti. ; name: low carb taco potatoes ; ingredients: aluminum foil, onion, red potatoes, taco seasoning, olive oil, mexican blend cheese ; preparation:

name: jenni s spinach artichoke dip ; ingredients: frozen spinach, marinated artichoke hearts, parmesan cheese, mozzarella cheese, mayonnaise, garlic ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Thaw spinch according to package directions. Drain well. Chop up artichoke hearts. Add all ingredients in a medium sized casserole dish. Bake in middle oven rack for 25 to 30 minutes, or until slightly golden and bubbly. Serve with tortilla chips. ; name: molded seafood spread ; ingredients: cream of mushroom soup, cream cheese, unflavored gelatin, cold water, mayonnaise, scallion, baby shrimp, celery ; preparation:Heat soup and cream cheese together in saucepan over low heat, whisking until smooth. In small bowl, soften gelatine in cold water and add to cream cheese mixture. Stir until well blended. In separate bowl, mix together mayonnaise, scallions and celery. Stir into cream cheese mixture until well blended. Gently fold in shrimp until well mixed and turn into a lightly oiled 4 cup mold. Chill several hours or overnight. To unmold, place mold in warm water for a few seconds and invert onto a plate. Place crackers around. ; name: designated driver margaritas ; ingredients: lime wedge, coarse salt, ice cube, cold water, frozen limeade concentrate, frozen orange juice concentrate, lime juice, lime slice ; preparation:Run the lime wedge around the rim of 3 glasses to moisten them. Dip the rims into the salt to lightly coat the edges of the glasses. Place the glasses in the freezer to chill. Place the ice, water, limeade, orange juice concentrate and lime juice in the container of a blender. Process until combined and slushy. Pour into the prepared glasses. Garnish each glass with a lime slice, if desired. Serve immediately. ; name: crock pot cherry pork chops recipe ; ingredients: pork chops, salt, pepper, cherry pie filling, lemon juice, instant chicken bouillon granules, ground mace ; preparation:Brown pork chops quickly in a little fat in a heavy skillet. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. In slow cooker stir together half of the can of cherry pie filling, lemon juice, mace, and bouillon granules. Mix well. Place pork chops on top of mixture. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 7 hours. Warm the other half of cherry pie filling and pass in sauce dish when serving chops. ; name: low carb sugar free spiced cocoa ; ingredients: unsweetened cocoa powder, fructevia, ground cinnamon, ground cardamom, ground nutmeg, salt, milk, hot water, vanilla extract ; preparation:In a saucepan, combine cocoa, steviva brand stevia blend, fructevia or steviva brand stevia powder, cinnamon, cardamom, nutmeg, and salt. Blend in hot water. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil, stirring for 2 minutes. Add milk. Stir and heat thoroughly, but do not boil. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla. Beat until foamy. Serve hot with cinnamon sticks, if desired. ; name: crunchy banana cinnamon oatmeal ; ingredients: oatmeal, milk, cinnamon, banana, cereal ; preparation:

name: albuquerque pinon red chile fudge ; ingredients: semi-sweet chocolate chips, pine nuts, red chili powder, sweetened condensed milk, vanilla extract ; preparation:Heat condensed milk in the top of a double boiler. Heat until very warm, but not boiling. Add chocolate chips and stir until melted. Add remaining ingredients and stir until thoroughly mixed and smooth. Turn out into a 9 inch x 9 inch square pan. Cool in the refrigerator until hardened. Using a sharp narrow knife, cut into 1x1 inch squares. Store in an airtight container in one layer. ; name: mop smoothies ; ingredients: mango, orange, fresh pineapple, vanilla yogurt, honey ; preparation:In blender add yogurt first. Then add orange. Blend until smooth. Add pineapple and honey. Blend. Add mango last and blend until smooth. ; name: viva la chicken ; ingredients: chicken breasts, corn tortilla, black olives, green chili salsa, sharp cheddar cheese, milk, cream of mushroom soup, cream of chicken soup ; preparation:In buttered casserole dish, form layers of chicken, torn pieces of tortilla, cheese, chillies, and olives. Save some cheese and olives for the top. Mix milk and soups together and pour over the layers. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes, uncovered for most of the baking time. Cover with foil if the top becomes too brown. ; name: sopa seca de arroz mexican rice ; ingredients: long grain rice, butter, onions, garlic cloves, tomatoes, regular-strength chicken broth, chilies, fresh cilantro, pimento stuffed olive ; preparation:In a wide frying pan over medium-high heat, brown rice lightly in butter or margarine. Add onion, garlic, tomato, and chiles, if used and cook for 2 or 3 minutes. Add 3 cups of the broth. Cover and simmer 25 to 35 minutes or bake, covered, in a 350f oven 50 to 60 minutes. Add more broth, if needed, to cook rice. However, there should be no liquid remaining when rice is tender to bite. Add cilantro, if desired, during last 10 minutes. Garnish rice with olives. ; name: the best baked potato casserole ever ; ingredients: potatoes, salt, pepper, bacon, sour cream, cheddar cheese, green onions ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking dish with nonstick pan coating or grease lightly with solid shortening. Cut baked potatoes into 1 inch cubes. Place half in a prepared baking dish. Sprinkle half of the salt, pepper and bacon. Top with half of the sour cream & cheese. Repeat layers. Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted. Sprinkle with chopped green onions to garnish. ; name: world s easiest chili ; ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, ground turkey, cumin seed, tomatoes, kidney beans, red chili powder, black pepper, sazon goya, salt ; preparation:

name: chilli jam beef stir fry ; ingredients: red chilies, gingerroot, onion, shrimp paste, brown sugar, vegetable oil, beef, scallions, green beans ; preparation:Place first 6 ingredients into a food processor and process until finely chopped. Over medium-high, heat a non-stick frying pan then add the chilli paste. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring, until the mix is thick and fragrant. Depending on the water content of the ingredients this may take even longer. Now add the beef and cook for 3 more minutes, stirring the whole time. Add the scallions and beans. Cover. Cook for another 3 minutes, or until beef & vegetables are tender. Serve with steamed rice. ; name: german noodle salad ; ingredients: pasta noodles, mayonnaise, green onions, gherkins, eggs, fresh parsley ; preparation:Mix all other ingredients in a salad bowl. If you prefer, add some vinegar from the gherkins to taste. You can also add more mayo. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour and up to 24 hours. Garnish with optional egg slices. ; name: fajita wings ; ingredients: honey, lime juice, chili powder, soy sauce, chicken wings ; preparation:In a large plastic bag, mix honey, lime juice, chili powder, and soy sauce. Add wings. Seal bag and mix to coat. Chill, turning occasionally, at least 1 hour or up to a day. Lift out wings and place in a single layer on racks in 2 broiler pans, each about 10 by 15 inches. Bake in a 450f oven for 15 minutes. Turn the pieces over and continue baking for another 25 to 30 minutes. ; name: chocolate almond butter crunch ; ingredients: butter, sugar, light corn syrup, water, vanilla extract, toasted almonds, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Melt the butter in a heavy 3-liter saucepan on low heat. Add the sugar, corn syrup and water. Cook over medium heat. Stir constantly until it reaches hard crack stage, 300 on candy thermometer. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract and the almonds. Spread into a buttered 13 x 9-inch pan. Let stand 5 minutes. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. When chocolate is melted, spread evenly over candy. Let cool completely, and when chocolate is set, break into pieces. ; name: pollo fra diavolo ; ingredients: chicken, olive oil, garlic cloves, onions, italian tomatoes, dry white wine, parsley, ground pepper, dried red pepper ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Heat the oil in a large skillet and brown the chicken pieces on all sides for about 15 minutes. Remove the chicken to a large casserole. In the same oil saute the garlic and onions until golden, then stir in the tomatoes, white wine, chopped parsley, salt, and a little black and red pepper. Simmer over low heat for about 10 minutes, then pour over the chicken in the casserole. Now cover and place the casserole in the oven for 1 hour. While the chicken cooks, prepare whatever pasta you desire and serve with the chicken peices and sauce poured over. ; name: crunchy cheese potatoes ; ingredients: sour cream, milk, chives, salt, pepper, potatoes, sharp cheddar cheese, corn flakes ; preparation:

name: baked garlic lemon tilapia ; ingredients: tilapia fillets, garlic cloves, butter, lemon juice, parsley, salt and pepper, cooking spray ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Melt butter on a low flame in a small sauce pan. Add garlic and saute on low for about 1 minute. Add the lemon juice and shut off flame. Spray the bottom of a baking dish lightly with cooking spray. Place the fish on top and season with salt and pepper. Pour the lemon butter mixture on the fish and top with fresh parsley. Bake at 400 until cooked, about 15 minutes. ; name: chicken brie onions and mango chutney on focaccia sandwich ; ingredients: chicken cutlet, brie cheese, sweet onion, light olive oil, mango chutney, focaccia bread ; preparation:Grill chicken on the bbq or on a george forman grill-set aside. Slice onions thin and saute in oil over medium until onions are soft and browned-set aside. Slice brie into thin slices-set aside. Slice foccacia bread into 2 sides - toast. Assemble sandwich. Cut in half and eat. ; name: healthy black bean soup ; ingredients: diced onions, minced garlic clove, extra virgin olive oil, ground cumin, black beans, chunky salsa, lime juice, plain yogurt ; preparation:In a medium pot, saut onions in olive oil until they are soft and translucent. Sprinkle in cumin and garlic and saut for a minute. Pour in black beans, salsa, and lime. Stir to combine and bring to a simmer. Simmer covered for 20 minutes. Ladle soup into individual bowls and top with a dollop of yogurt. Chili and lime tortilla chips or other white corn tortilla chips go nicely on the side. ; name: salt roasted salmon ; ingredients: olive oil, salmon fillets, coarse salt, fresh ground black pepper, extra virgin olive oil, lemon ; preparation:Heat the oven to 400 degrees f. Heat 1 t oil in a ovenproof skillet until it just shimmers. Add the salmon skin side down and cook until the skin begins to crisp, about 2-3 minutes. Mound the salt around and over each piece, trying to get it to really make a cohesive crust on each one. Roast in oven for 5 minutes per inch of thickness. Remove the salmon from the oven and let sit for 2 minutes in the crust. Carefully brush away the salt. Transfer to a clean work surface and finish removing salt with a pastry brush. Season with a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil, fresh ground black pepper, and serve with a little lemon. The salmon will seem a little dry but will not be overcooked. This really brings out the flavor of the salmon. ; name: ham cheese macaroni bake ; ingredients: onion, macaroni noodles, ham, cheddar cheese, milk, sour cream, cream of mushroom soup, parsley ; preparation:Using a layered effect, place onion, noodles, ham and cheese in a large 9 x 13 baking dish. Repeat for second layer using onion, noodles, ham and cheese. In a small bowl mix milk, sour cream and cream of mushroom soup. Pour over top of ham mixture. Sprinkle top with parsley. Bake in a 360 degree oven for 45 minutes. ; name: fakes salata lentil salad ; ingredients: french lentils, bay leaves, olive oil, oranges, salt, fresh ground black pepper, red onion, orange ; preparation:

name: pumpkin soup ; ingredients: olive oil, leeks, carrots, garlic cloves, pumpkin flesh, water, chicken stock, cream, pepper ; preparation:Heat the oil in a pan add leeks and garlic and cook until soft. Add carrots, pumpkin, stock and water and cook covered until pumpkin is soft. Spoon 2 cups of liquid out, blend or process soup until smooth. Add pepper to your liking. Serve soup in bowls pour a about 1-2 tablespoons of cream over top and serve immediately. Makes about 6-8 servings great for lunches or as a starter. ; name: baked sole fillets ; ingredients: sole fillets, onion, sour cream, white wine, all-purpose flour, lemon, juice of, paprika, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f degrees. Butter a shallow baking dish and arrange fish pieces in it. Cover fish with onion slices. In a small bowl, whisk together sour cream, wine, flour, lemon juice and the seasonings. Pour over the fish and onions. Bake, uncovered, for 25 minutes or until fish is tender. Do not overcook or fish will dry out. ; name: greek stuffed mushrooms ; ingredients: mixed mushrooms, tomatoes, black olives, feta cheese, garlic clove, fresh basil ; preparation:Put mushrooms, smooth side on top, on a baking sheet that has parchment paper. Cook in a preheated oven of 425 f for 5 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool a little bit. Flip the mushrooms, hollow side on top. In a bowl, mix tomatoes, olives, feta, garlic and basil. With a spoon, distribute this mixture in the mushrooms. Keep cooking at 425f 8 to 10 minutes or until mushrooms are tender and hot. ; name: pineapple coconut cream pie lactose free ; ingredients: coconut cream, honey, cornflour, pineapple ; preparation:Mix all ingredients of base together using just a little of the coconut cream to mix the cornflour with first. Cook on low heat till bubbling slowly and then till thickened. Spread cooked mix into 2 medium size pie dishes and refrigerate. Blend all pineapple from can and add juice last with a little mixed with all the cornflour. Cook slowly till thickened and cooked. Spread onto cooled bases covering whiteness. Decorate with lemon slices, pieces of pineapple, strawberry or kiwifruit. ; name: pork with carrots and snow peas ; ingredients: oil, boneless pork chops, salt and pepper, carrots, snow peas, chicken broth, flour, lemon juice ; preparation:Heat oil in a skillet. Slice chops horizontally into thirds. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and fry in oil on medium high heat until browned on both sides, 2-3 minutes per side. Remove from pan. Set aside. Add carrots and snow peas to pan. Cook, stirring, one minute. Combine broth, flour and lemon juice. Add to carrots in skillet. Cook, stirring, 1 minute, or until liquid is slightly thickened. Return pork to pan. Heat through. ; name: peanut butter and chocolate chip bars ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, salt, butter, sugar, eggs, vanilla, walnuts, chocolate chips, peanut butter ; preparation:

name: chicken in creamy buttery mushroom sauce ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, butter, sliced mushrooms, flour, salt, white pepper, chicken broth, half-and-half ; preparation:In a large skillet, in 4 tablespoons hot butter over medium heat, brown chicken breasts on both sides. Set chicken aside. Add remaining 2 tablespoons butter to drippings in skillet. Add sliced mushrooms and cook for about 5 minutes, until golden. Remove mushrooms with a slotted spoon and set aside. Stir flour, salt and pepper into skillet drippings. Pour chicken broth and half-and-half gradually into skillet, stirring constantly, and cook until mixture is thickened. Return chicken and mushrooms to skillet with sauce. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer 25 to 30 minutes, until breasts are cooked through and tender. Remove chicken breasts and cut into bite sized pieces and return to skillet. Stir and enjoy over a bed of white rice. ; name: marinated green beans ; ingredients: green beans, sweet onions, balsamic vinegar, white vinegar, garlic clove, sugar, extra virgin olive oil, salt, pepper ; preparation:Cook green beans in boiling water for 4- 5 minutes until tender, but still crisp. Drain, immerse in ice water till cool. Drain. Whisk vinegars, sugar, evoo, salt and pepper together in a serving bowl. Add onion and green beans, stir together. Marinate in refrigerator for at least five hours. Shake it up once in awhile. Over night is even better. Enjoy. ; name: zucchini oven chips ; ingredients: zucchini, italian style breadcrumbs, fresh parmesan cheese, seasoning salt, garlic powder, fresh ground black pepper, whole milk, pam cooking spray ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425f. Combine all ingredients except for zucchini and milk in a medium bowl, stirring well with a whisk. Place milk in shallow bowl. Dip zucchini slices in milk, and dredge in breadcrumb mixture. Place coated slices on an ovenproof wire rack coated with pam cooking spray. Place rack on a cookie sheet. Bake at 425f for 25 to 30 minutes, or until browned and slightly crisp. ; name: jalapeno pepper stuffed cherry peppers ; ingredients: sweet red cherry peppers, cream cheese, green onions, garlic sausage, jalapeno peppers, mayonnaise ; preparation:Cut cherry peppers in half, vertically, leaving stem for presentation. Remove seeds. Drain well on paper towel. In a small bowl combine all remaining ingredients and mix well. Spoon filling into pepper halves. ; name: sweet bread bread pudding ; ingredients: sweet bread, raisins, butter, milk, sugar, eggs, apple pie filling, cinnamon, vanilla ; preparation:Grease a 9x12 pan. Scald milk. Add sugar and butter. Mix until butter is melted. Cool. Break sweet bread into pieces. Spread apple pie filling on top of the sweet bread. Sprinkle raisins over the filling. Combine cooled milk mixture with beaten eggs. Pour liquid over the bread. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes. ; name: super easy cheese enchiladas ; ingredients: extra-sharp cheddar cheese, corn tortillas, vegetable oil, onion, enchilada sauce, chili without beans ; preparation:

name: english pub style pickled eggs ; ingredients: hard-boiled eggs, vinegar, allspice berries, bay leaves, whole black peppercorn ; preparation:Pack eggs into 1 quart widemouthed jar. Bring vinegar to boil in non aluminum saucepan and let boil about 10 minutes. Add remaining ingredients to jar and ladle hot vinegar over eggs. Cap tightly. Let cool, then refrigerate at least 3 days before serving. Can be refrigerated up to 2 weeks. ; name: crock pot chicken and dumplings spend with pennies version ; ingredients: onion, cream of celery soup, cream of chicken soup, fresh parsley, poultry seasoning, black pepper, boneless skinless chicken breasts, low sodium chicken broth, frozen vegetables, refrigerated biscuits ; preparation:Add onion to 6 qt crock pot and top with chicken breasts. In a small bowl, combine cream of celery soup, cream of chicken soup, parsley, poultry seasoning and pepper. Spread over chicken breasts. Top with chicken broth and cook on high 5 hours. Approximately 1 hour before serving, roll each biscuit thin and flat. Cut into 4 strips. Add vegetables and biscuit strips to the slow cooker and stir. Remove chicken breasts and slightly shred. Add back into slow cooker and stir. Let cook an additional 10 minutes and serve. ; name: pasta salad with chicken and artichokes ; ingredients: pasta shells, oil, mayonnaise, lemon juice, parsley, dried basil, chicken, artichokes, tabasco sauce, toasted almond ; preparation:Cook pasta in large pot of boiling, salted water until tender, but firm, 8 to 12 minutes, stirring often. Drain well and rinse with cold water. Shake out excess water and toss pasta with oil. Combine mayonnaise, lemon juice, parsley and basil. Place pasta in large bowl. Add mayonnaise mixture, chicken, artichokes and tabasco. Toss well. Garnish with almonds. For a decorative presentation, serve in avacado halves, in tomato cups or on lettuce leaves. ; name: herb marinated ostrich ; ingredients: ostrich steak, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, garlic, fresh rosemary, fresh thyme leave, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Combine marinade ingredients in plastic bag. Add meat, turning to coat. Close bag securely and marinate in refrigerator one hour, turning occasionally. Preheat oven broiler. Remove meat from marinade. Discard marinade. Place meat on rack in broiler pan so that surface of meat is three to four inches from heat. Broil 12 to 16 minutes per side for medium-rare to medium doneness. Carve into slices and serve. ; name: herb and garlic goat cheese truffles ; ingredients: cream cheese, goat cheese, fresh lemon juice, fresh chives, fresh basil, garlic, black pepper, pecans, fruit ; preparation:Beat the cream cheese, goat cheese and lemon juice with an electric mixer until smooth. Stir in chives, basil, garlic, and black pepper. Cover and chill for 2 hours or until firm. Shape cheese mixture into 24 balls. Roll each ball in the pecans. Cover and chill for at least 1 hour. Serve with fruit. ; name: boy scout foil dinner ; ingredients: hamburger, lipton onion soup mix, onions, red potatoes, baby carrots, olive oil, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: linguine with clams bacon and tomato ; ingredients: bacon, garlic cloves, dry white wine, crushed tomatoes, bottled clam juice, clam, flat leaf parsley, salt, dried red pepper flakes, linguine ; preparation:In large frying pan, cook the bacon over moderate heat until almost crisp. Remove bacon with slotted spoon and pour off all but 2 tbs fat. Add garlic and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds. Add wine. Stir in bacon, tomatoes and clam juice and heat to a simmer. Cook for 10 minutes. Add the clams, parsley, salt and red-pepper flakes and cook for one minute longer. In the meantime, boil the linguine until just done, about 12 minutes.
