Drain the linguine well and add to the sauce. Allow the linguine to sit for 2 to 3 minutes to absorb some of the liquid. ; name: saucy italian roast ; ingredients: boneless beef rump roast, salt, garlic powder, pepper, sliced mushrooms, onion, spaghetti sauce, red wine, cooked pasta ; preparation:Cut the roast in half. Combine the salt, garlic powder, and pepper. Rub over roast. Place in a 5 quart slow-cooker. Top with mushroom and onion. Combine the spaghetti sauce and wine or broth. Pour over meat and vegetables. Cover and cook on low for 8-9 hours or until meat is tender. Slice roast. Serve over pasta with pan juices. ; name: bahamian sky juice ; ingredients: coconuts, evaporated milk, gin, sugar, ground cinnamon, nutmeg ; preparation:Using a screwdriver and a hammer, poke through the eyes of the coconuts, and drain out the liquid through a strainer into a mixing bowl. There should be a total of about 2 cups. Set the shells aside. Add the evaporated milk, gin, sugar if using, cinnamon and nutmeg to the coconut water. Stir to dissolve the sugar. Refrigerate the mixture until cold, at least 2 hours, or cool mixture down with ice. To serve, carefully pour the mixture through a funnel into the reserved coconut shells. Insert straws. ; name: fresh orange butter cookies ; ingredients: orange zest, lemon, rind of, butter, salt, sugar, egg, fresh orange juice, all-purpose flour ; preparation:Blend orange and lemon peels with softened butter or margarine. Mix in salt and sugar. Beat in egg and orange juice. Stir in flour. Mix well. Chill dough until stiff enough to handle, the shape into 1 inch balls. Place 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake in preheated oven at 375 for 10-12 minutes. Cool on wire racks. ; name: famous red lobster shrimp scampi ; ingredients: medium shrimp, pure olive oil, garlic, white wine, fresh lemon, italian seasoning, butter, parsley, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Heat cast iron skillet and add olive oil. Add shrimp and cook until tender and no longer translucent, reduce heat. Remove shrimp and set aside. Add garlic and cook 2-3 minutes. Do not allow garlic to brown - it will make it bitter. Add white wine, and lemon juice. Cook until wine is reduced by half. After it is reduced, add italian seasoning. Reduce heat to low, and add butter. If pan is too hot, the butter will separate. Add shrimp back into sauce, add parsley, and season to taste with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with grated parmesan cheese. ; name: extra sharp cheddar oven omelet ; ingredients: bacon, green onions, eggs, light cream, seasoning salt, extra-sharp cheddar cheese, sweet onion ; preparation:

name: sweet sour crock pot turkey meatballs ; ingredients: ground turkey, dry breadcrumbs, fresh parsley, onions, egg, jellied cranberry sauce, ketchup, chili sauce ; preparation:Combine turkey, bread crumbs, parsley, onion and egg in a large bowl. Mix well and shape into 24 meatballs. In a 6 quart. Slow cooker, mix cranberry sauce, ketchup and chili sauce. Carefully add the meatballs, coating them with the sauce mixture. Put the lid on and cook on low for 8-10 hours. ; name: ginger cabbage ; ingredients: canola oil, fresh ginger, ground cinnamon, ground cloves, red cabbage, granny smith apples, pure maple syrup, salt, cider vinegar, pumpkin seeds ; preparation:In a large heavy skillet with lid, warm canola oil over medium-low heat. Add the ginger, cinnamon, and cloves. Cook, stirring, for 10 to 15 seconds. Add the cabbage, apples, maple syrup, and salt. Stir, reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for about 30 minutes. After the 30 minutes, add the vinegar and increase heat to medium. Cook for about 5 minutes, or until most of the liquid evaporates. Sprinkle each serving of cabbage with 2 tablespoons of the pumpkin seeds. ; name: gluten free buckwheat bread ; ingredients: gluten-free flour, buckwheat flour, gluten free baking powder, salt, sugar, egg whites, reduced-fat milk, vegetable oil, sesame seeds ; preparation:Pre heat oven to 180 c. Grease 9 x 19 cms loaf tin. Sift flours, baking powder and salt into large bowl. Stir in sugar. Lightly beat egg whites with electric mixer until just frothy. Stir in milk and oil and add to flour mixture. Beat 3 minutes until smooth. Pour mixture into prepared pan, smooth top. Press seeds lightly into mixture. Bake 55 - 60 minutes then stand 10 minutes. Turn out to cool. ; name: ham and cheese bars ; ingredients: bisquick, ham, cheddar cheese, onion, parmesan cheese, sour cream, salt, garlic powder, whole milk, egg ; preparation:In a bowl, combine all the ingredients in a mixing bowl, and mix by hand. Spread in a greased 9x13 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until lightly brown. Cut in rectangles, about 2 inches by 1 inch. Serve hot or at room temperature. ; name: cavatappi with prosciutto and parmesan ; ingredients: cavatappi pasta, cooking spray, garlic clove, fresh parsley, extra virgin olive oil, salt, fresh ground black pepper, italian seasoning, prosciutto, parmigiano-reggiano cheese ; preparation:Cook pasta according to the package directions, omitting salt and fat. Drain in a colander over a bowl, reserving 3 tablespoons cooking liquid. Heat pan over medium heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add garlic to pan, and saut 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add reserved 3 tablespoons cooking liquid and pasta to pan. Let stand 2 minutes. Stir in parsley, oil, salt, pepper, italian seasoning and prosciutto. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve immediately. ; name: white chocolate chip brownies ; ingredients: margarine, sugar, eggs, flour, cocoa powder, white chocolate chips ; preparation:

name: onion frittata ; ingredients: butter, onions, eggs, garlic cloves, salt & freshly ground black pepper, chili ; preparation:Put the butter, garlic, diced chili and onions in a frying pan and fry gently until the onions are a nice golden brown. Beat the six eggs well with the salt and pepper. Scoop the onions out of the pan and mix with the eggs. Melt the extra butter in the pan and pour in the egg mixture. Cook on both sides until browned slice in wedges and serve hot. ; name: brown swedish cookies ; ingredients: butter, white sugar, honey, flour, baking soda ; preparation:Cream together butter, sugar and honey. Then add flour and baking soda to make dough. Roll the dough into small balls and place on a baking sheet. Use a cookie press or the bottom of a drinking glass dipped in sugar to flatten the dough balls. Pre-heat an oven to 300f. Bake cookies for about 10 minutes. When cookies are light brown, remove from oven and place on a wire rack to cool. ; name: pepperoni breadtwists ; ingredients: bisquick baking mix, water, pepperoni, butter, parmesan cheese, pizza sauce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Mix baking mix, cold water and pepperoni until dough forms. Beat 20 strokes. Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead 5 times. Roll dough into a 10 inch square and cut in half. Cut each half crosswise into 14 strips. Twist ends of strips in opposite directions until pieces are twirled. Place on ungreased cookie sheet, pressing ends to sheet to fasten securely. Brush with melted butter and sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until light golden brown. Heat pizza sauce and serve with breadtwists for dipping. ; name: pressure cooker cranberry chicken ; ingredients: boneless chicken breasts, onion soup mix, whole berry cranberry sauce, french dressing, egg noodles ; preparation:Mix onion soup, cranberry sauce and french dressing together. Place chicken in pressure cooker and top with cranberry mixture. Bring to pressure and cook 12 minutes. Meanwhile cook egg noodles according to package directions on your stove. When pressure is released, open top and stir in cooked egg noodles. The dish is ready to serve. ; name: rice pudding for one ; ingredients: water, long-grain rice, milk, egg, sugar, vanilla extract, raisins ; preparation:Bring water to a boil and add rice. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Whisk milk and egg together, then whisk in sugar and vanilla. Stir into the hot cooked rice and then stir in raisins. Pour rice mixture into a small greased casserole dish and bake, uncovered, for 20 minutes. Serve warm with pouring cream. ; name: chef boy i be illinois ligurian pasta ; ingredients: pasta, french style green beans, potatoes, pesto sauce ; preparation:

name: habit forming shrimp dip ; ingredients: cream of shrimp soup, cream cheese, baby shrimp, garlic salt ; preparation:Mix softened cream cheese with soup. Pat excess water from thawed shrimp. Chop into small pieces. Add to cheese mixture, blend in garlic salt. Serve with veggies or crackers. ; name: orzo and snap pea salad ; ingredients: coarse salt, orzo pasta, sugar snap pea, yellow squash, lemon juice, olive oil, parmesan cheese, ground pepper ; preparation:In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook orzo 5 minutes. Add sugar snap peas and squash. Cook until orzo is al dente and vegetables are crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Drain well. Return to pot. Add lemon juice, olive oil, and parmesan. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine and serve. ; name: the ultimate chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: butter flavor crisco, brown sugar, egg, vanilla, milk, flour, baking soda, salt, chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Mix the butter and brown sugar together until creamy. Add egg, mix thoroughly. Add vanilla and milk, blend. In a separate bowl, mix together flour, baking soda and salt. Add to brown sugar mixture, blend until flour is all mixed. Add chocolate chips. On a non-greased cookie sheet, drop spoonfuls of dough to form round cookies. Bake form 8-10 minutes for chewy cookies, or longer for crunchy. ; name: red pepper savory jam ; ingredients: sweet red peppers, salt, red wine vinegar, sugar, hot pepper sauce ; preparation:Cut peppers in half and seed them. In the food processor, grind them coarsely. Place in a bowl, add salt and cover with plastic wrap. Leave overnight in a cool place. The next day drain off half the liquid. Combine the ground peppers, remaining liquid, vinegar, sugar and cayenne in a saucepan. Bring to a boil and reduce it and then reduce to a simmer. Cook for one hour, until thickened, stirring occasionally. When thick, pour into sterilized jars and either seal or refrigerate. Jam will keep for up to 3 months. Makes 2 cups. ; name: clam pie ; ingredients: bacon, onion, corn kernel, condensed new england clam chowder, clams, dried thyme, tabasco sauce, soft breadcrumbs, butter, fresh italian parsley ; preparation:Coat a 9-inch pie pan or individual ramekins with cooking spray. In a 3-quart saucepan, fry bacon over medium-high heat until crisp. Add in the onion. Cook and stir 3-4 minutes or until softened. Stir in corn, chowder, clams, thyme, and tabasco. Bring to a boil. Transfer mixture to the prepared pie pan. In a small bowl, toss the breadcrumbs, melted butter, and parsley. Sprinkle crumbes evenly over the top. Bake in a 350 oven for about 30 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: southern macaroni pie ; ingredients: elbow macaroni, egg, flour, salt, milk, shredded cheddar cheese ; preparation:

name: grecian green beans ; ingredients: fresh green beans, sweet onion, olive oil, tomatoes, dried oregano, salt, pepper ; preparation:Place the beans in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Cook for 3-4 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain. In a small skillet, saute onion in oil for 3 minutes. Add the beans. Saute for 5 minutes or until tender. Reduce heat. Add the tomato, oregano, salt and pepper. Cook 1 minutes longer or until heated through. ; name: festive carrots pineapple ; ingredients: pineapple chunks, brown sugar, butter, cornstarch, cinnamon, carrots ; preparation:Combine reserved pineapple juice, sugar, butter, cornstarch and cinnamon. Cook and stir until sauce is clear and thickened. Add pineapple and carrots. Heat and serve immediately. If desired, garnish with lime peel. ; name: warm chanterelle salad ; ingredients: chanterelle mushrooms, butter, salt, fresh ground black pepper, dill, romaine lettuce, lettuce, rocket, olive oil, white balsamic vinegar ; preparation:Clean the mushrooms, place them in a saucepan and sweat them dry. Strain them and allow them to drip completely dry through a sieve. Then saut them golden brown in butter and season them with salt and black pepper. Wash the lettuces and let them drip dry. Tear them up into a bowl and dress them with olive oil, salt and balsamic vinegar just prior to serving. Put the mixed salad in mounds on the plates and lay the mushrooms on them directly from the pan. Garnish with onion flowers, crown dill, dill sprigs or chopped dill. ; name: cranberry white chocolate nut pie ; ingredients: dried cranberries, brandy, pie crust, butter, sugar, eggs, salt, walnuts, flour, white baking bar ; preparation:In a small bowl combine dried cranberries and brandy. Cover and chill at least 1 hour. Drain and reserve 1 tablespoons brandy. Preheat oven to 325. Prepare pastry and line a 9 inches pie plate. In a medium bowl wisk together butter, sugar, eggs, and salt. Stir in walnuts, flour and chopped baking bars until just combined. Stir in drained cranberries and 1 tablespoons brandy. Spoon into crust lined pie plate. Bake for 65 minutes, loosely covering pie with foil the last 30 minutes of baking. Cool on rack. ; name: roast pork italian style ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, salt, dried oregano, dried marjoram, dried basil, pepper, boneless pork roast ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Make a paste with olive oil, garlic, salt and seasonings. Trim visible fat from the exterior of the roast. Place in shallow roasting pan on a rack. Rub seasoned garlic paste over the pork. Bake for 45 minute and check temp with meat thermometer. Continue roasting until the internal temp is 155-160 degrees. Remove from oven and allow to rest about 10 min before slicing. ; name: ground beef soup ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, carrots, potatoes, corn, tomato paste, water, beef bouillon, garlic ; preparation:

name: carrot and pink grapefruit soup ; ingredients: butter, onion, pink grapefruit juice, chicken stock, carrot, potato, salt and pepper, heavy cream ; preparation:In a saucepan, melt the butter and add onion. Cook until the onions are softened. Deglaze with grapefruit juice. Add chicken stock, carrots and potatoes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Bring to boil and cook 20 to 25 minutes. Put the soup in the food processor until creamy. Incorporate the cream and serve. ; name: jicama apple salad ; ingredients: jicama, granny smith apple, carrot, mayonnaise, lemon juice, water, sugar, salt, pepper, cayenne pepper ; preparation:Peel jicama and cut into chunks. Wash apple, core and cut into chunks. Wash carrot, peel if needed, cut into chunks. Add above chunks to food processor and pulse until desired texture is reached. Transfer to bowl and set aside. Combine remaining ingredients, whisk until smooth. Taste for desired seasoning, adjust accordingly. Pour over vegetable mixture and toss. May be served immediately or refrigerate and let flavors meld. ; name: chicken lazone ; ingredients: salt, chili powder, onion powder, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, chicken tenders, butter, heavy cream ; preparation:Combine salt, chili powder, onion powder, garlic powder, and cayenne pepper. Sprinkle over both sides of chicken tenders. In large saute pan, melt half of the butter over medium-high heat. Cook the chicken tenders until done, about 8 minutes. Pour the cream and remaining butter into the skillet. Lower heat and simmer until the sauce thickens, about 5-7 minutes. Serve chicken and sauce over pasta or mashed potatoes, if desired. ; name: orange roughy ; ingredients: orange roughy fillet, reduced-calorie margarine, parmesan cheese, green onion ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Spray pan with nonstick cooking spray. Arrange filets in a single layer. Mix cheese and margarine. Spread over filets. Sprinkle with onion. Bake for 10 minutes or until fish flakes. ; name: creamy scrambled eggs with fines herbes ; ingredients: eggs, mixed herbs, kosher salt, butter, baguette, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs, herbs, and salt. Stir in 1 tablespoon of the butter. Heat a small skillet over medium low heat. Add egg mixture and cook, while stirring, so that the eggs do not set too fast. The eggs will begin to set and form a creamy sauce. Add in the remaining butter, one piece at a time, continuing to stir. Arrange the toasts on serving plates. Once the eggs set spoon them over the toast, season with pepper and the remaining herbs, and serve immediately. ; name: red beans rice with tvp ; ingredients: dried kidney beans, onion, fresh garlic cloves, boiling water, brown rice, textured vegetable protein, chili powder, ground cumin, sea salt ; preparation:

name: khumbi aur besan kibhaji ; ingredients: white mushrooms, cooking oil, garlic, salt, chili powder, coriander, lemon juice, besan flour, water ; preparation:Wash mushrooms and cut them in quarters. Heat the oil on a medium heatand add the garlic. Allow the garlic to turn slightly brown and add the mushrooms. Stir and and cook for 2 minutes. Add the salt, chilli and coriander stir and cook for 1 minute. Add the lemon juice and mix well. Sprinkle the flour over the mushroom mixture, stir and mix immediately. Cook for a few seconds then add water mix well till you have a nice sauce. ; name: melt in your mouth cookies ; ingredients: butter, icing sugar, water, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, nuts ; preparation:Cream butter and sugar together. Add water and vanilla to the mixture. Gradually add flour, fold in nuts. Roll dough into 1 inch balls. Place on ungreased baking sheets and flatten with fingers. Bake at 300 f for 20-25 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. ; name: roma style spinach ; ingredients: golden raisin, pine nuts, garlic, salt, ground red pepper, extra virgin olive oil, fresh spinach, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook raisins, pine nuts or pecans, garlic, salt and ground red pepper in hot oil in a 6-quart dutch oven over medium heat for 1 to 2 minutes or until garlic is light brown. Add spinach. Toss well to coat. Cook and stir 2 minutes more or just until spinach is wilted and heated through. To serve, sprinkle with parmesan cheese. ; name: wild alaskan sweet bourbon salmon ; ingredients: salmon fillets, lemon, brown sugar, bourbon, crushed red pepper flakes ; preparation:Pre-heat your oven to 450 degrees. Juice lemon and combine with brown sugar into a medium sized bowl. Add bourbon until it becomes a spreadable paste. Cover a lipped baking pan with foil. If using fillets place salmon skin side down directly on the foil - do not grease. Spread bourbon paste on top of your salmon. Cook on middle shelf for about 20 to 25 minutes or until fully cooked. Wedge a spatula between the salmon and the skin and remove fillet. The skin will remain on the foil. ; name: pan fried cumin chile crusted fish ; ingredients: flour, ground cumin, chili powder, salt, pepper, egg white, white fish fillet, canola oil ; preparation:In a pie pan or shallow bowl combine first 5 ingredients. In a second pie pan or shallow bowl beat egg white. Dip fish in egg white and then into flour mixture, coating well and shaking off excess. Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat. Saute fish for 3 minutes and then flip fish and saute for 5 minutes of other side or until fish is done. ; name: cheesy spaghetti with bacon and peas ; ingredients: spaghetti, frozen peas, olive oil, onion, bacon, garlic cloves, ricotta cheese, light cream, parmesan cheese, flat leaf parsley ; preparation:

name: herby redcurrant lamb chops ; ingredients: red wine vinegar, red currant jelly, fresh rosemary, garlic cloves, lamb loin chops, olive oil ; preparation:In a shallow, non-metallic dish, mix together the red wine vinegar and redcurrant jelly. Strip the leaves from the rosemary stalks, set a few aside to garnish, and finely chop the remainder. Stir into the redcurrant mixture with the garlic. Add the lamb and turn in the mixture. Then allow to marinate for 5-10 minutes. Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan over a medium heat, then add the lamb with its marinade and cook for 15-20 minutes, turning halfway through, until the lamb is done to your liking and the sauce has reduced to a sticky consistency. Serve the lamb with mashed potatoes and steamed snow peas. Garnish with the reserved rosemary. ; name: raisin pecan pie diabetic ; ingredients: unbaked pie shell, evaporated skim milk, sugar substitute, butter, eggs, cornstarch, salt, pecans, vanilla, raisins ; preparation:Prepare but do not bake pie shell. Combine milk, sugar replacement, butter, eggs, cornstarch and salt in heavy saucepan. Cook and stir over medium-low heat til well blended and slightly thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in pecans and vanilla, and allow filling to rest 10 minutes. Sprinkle raisins on bottom of unbaked pie shell and pour pecan mixture on top. Bake 375f 45-50 mins or til knife inserted in centre comes out clean. ; name: ww shrimp haiti ; ingredients: onions, chicken bouillon, tomato puree, garlic clove, tomatoes, green pepper, cooked shrimp, cooked white rice, fresh parsley, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat a non-stick pan on medium, add the onion and garlic, brown lightly. Add bouillon and blend in tomato puree. Add the tomato and green pepper. Simmer for about 5 minutes until the green pepper is done. Add the shrimp, rice and parsley to the mixture. Salt and pepper mixture to taste. Serve when heated through. ; name: green tomato pie ; ingredients: pie crust, green tomatoes, lemons, sugar ; preparation:Place the crust in a 9-inch pie plate and flute the edges. Place a layer of green tomatoes in bottom of pie. Cover with a layer of lemon slices, sprinkle with a layer of sugar. Layer tomatoes, lemon and sugar until pie is full. Bake at 350f until brown and bubbly, about 50 to 60 minutes. ; name: hard chargin blue cheese stampede blue cheese hamburger ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, tabasco sauce, honey, garlic salt, crushed red pepper flakes, black pepper, blue cheese, roasted red peppers, portabella mushrooms ; preparation:Preheat grill to a medium-high heat. Combine ground beef, onion, tabasco, honey, garlic salt, red pepper and pepper in a bowl. Mix well. Cut the blue cheese into 1oz squares. Divide meat into 6 portions and form patties around the pieces of blue cheese. Grill 8-10 minutes or until done. Toast your buns and grill the portabella mushrooms. Place patties on bun and top with roasted red peppers and portabellas. Enjoy. ; name: honey mustard chicken pot with parsnips ; ingredients: olive oil, chicken thighs, onions, parsnips, vegetable broth, coarse grain mustard, honey, thyme, flat leaf parsley ; preparation:

name: smoked turkey mozzarella and blackberry sandwiches ; ingredients: fresh blackberries, balsamic vinegar, sugar, lemon juice, smoked turkey, smoked mozzarella cheese, white bread, fresh sage ; preparation:In a mixing bowl, add the first 4 ingredients. Toss to combine and let set for 30 minutes. Lay turkey and cheese slices on 6 bread slices. Spoon blackberry mixture over cheese. Sprinkle with minced sage and top with remaining bread slices to make sandwiches. ; name: basic rolls ; ingredients: warm water, active dry yeast, sugar, butter, egg, salt, flour ; preparation:Measure water into a warm bowl. Dissolve yeast into water. Add sugar, butter, egg, and salt. Add enough flour to make the dough easy to handle. Knead the dough until it becomes smooth and elastic. Place in a greased bowl to rise until double in size. Divide the dough into small balls and place in greased muffin cups. Brush with butter, if desired. Let rise again until double in size, about another hour. Bake at 375 for 10 - 15 minutes. ; name: grilled bourbon salmon ; ingredients: pineapple juice, soy sauce, brown sugar, bourbon, fresh cracked pepper, garlic powder, vegetable oil, salmon fillet ; preparation:Combine juice, soy, brown sugar, bourbon, pepper, garlic powder and oil in a bowl. Remove all skin from the salmon. Place the salmon in a glass dish side by side. Pour some of the marinade over. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour a few hours will be even better. Drain and grill over med. -high about 5-7 minutes per side or until fish flakes-basting with the reserved marinade. ; name: chicken liver and bacon appetizer ; ingredients: chicken liver, butter, bacon, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cut livers in two, season with salt and pepper. Melt butter in saute pan and add livers. Cook for one minute. Wrap each piece of liver in a strip of bacon and fasten with a toothpick. About ten minutes before serving, place bacon wrapped livers in a baking pan and broil until bacon is crisp. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot, either with toothpicks or on a small square of toast. ; name: shrimp tomato coleslaw ; ingredients: baby shrimp, mayonnaise, sherry wine vinegar, onion, celery seed, salt, pepper, coleslaw, grape tomatoes ; preparation:In a large bowl, whisk mayonnaise, vinegar, onion, celery seed, salt and pepper until smooth. Add the cabbage, tomatoes and shrimp. Toss well until combined. Cover and refrigeratoe until well chilled. Serve chilled. ; name: oatmeal fudge cookies ; ingredients: granulated sugar, butter, milk, peanut butter, vanilla, cocoa, quick-cooking rolled oats ; preparation:

name: creamy ham and asparagus tagliatelle ; ingredients: asparagus, butter, olive oil, onion, ham, tagliatelle pasta noodles, heavy cream, parsley, salt and pepper, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook the asparagus in boiling water until just tender. Drain, setting aside some of the cooking water. Cool and slice on the diagonal. Heat the butter and olive oil in a frying pan, before adding the onion. Saut until soft and then add the ham, cooking for a further minute. Add the asparagus and a ladle full of the cooking water. Simmer until most of the water has evaporated. Set aside while cooking the pasta in a separate pot, until al dente. When the pasta is nearly ready, reheat the sauce and add the cream, parsley, salt and pepper. Simmer for five minutes or until reduced by half. Drain the pasta and toss with the sauce. Sprinkle parmesan on top. ; name: andreas fault bagel sandwich ; ingredients: bagel, egg, avocado, sun-dried tomatoes, red onions, monterey jack cheese, alfalfa sprout, cooked bacon, salt & pepper ; preparation:Split bagel in half and toast lightly. Meanwhile, scramble eggs and cook in a small frying pan sprayed with nonstick cooking spray until done, trying to keep the eggs in one large piece. Butter bagel if desired and place cooked egg on top of one half. Top with a sprinkling of cheese, a slice of red onion, some avocado slices, and the sun-dried tomatoes. Top with bacon strips and alfalfa sprouts if desired. Season to taste with some salt and pepper. Place remaining bagel half on top and cut into two halves. Serve warm. ; name: ginger lime melon balls ; ingredients: fresh lime juice, water, crystallized ginger, lime zest, melon balls, of fresh mint ; preparation:In small saucepan, combine juice, water, ginger and zest. Set pan over medium-high heat and bring to boil. Boil 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until mixture reduces to 2 tablespoons. Strain mixture though fine sieve to remove zest. Place melon in bowl, toss with ginger-lime mixture. Let sit for 15 minutes. You can drain the sauce or serve it with the melon. Garnish with mint. ; name: pasta shells with chicken and broccoli ; ingredients: oil, broccoli, onion, garlic cloves, carrot, cooked chicken, salt, tomatoes, pasta shells, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Heat oil in a 10-inch skillet over medium heat. Cook broccoli, onion, garlic and carrot in oil about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until broccoli is crisp- tender. Stir in chicken, salt, and tomatoes. Cook about 3 minutes, stirring occasionally, just until chicken is hot. Toss with pasta. Sprinkle with cheese and parsley. ; name: mexican zucchini oven fries ; ingredients: zucchini, vegetable oil cooking spray, dried oregano, ground cumin, seasoning, chili sauce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 500 degrees arrange zucchini on nonstick cookie sheet. Spray zucchini with cooking spray. Combine spices and sprinkle over the zucchini fries. Place in very hot oven and cook 15 to 18 minutes. Serve hot. Dip chili sauce or taco sauce. ; name: cool breeze ; ingredients: light rum, apricot brandy, triple sec, ice cubes, orange juice, pineapple juice, grenadine ; preparation:

name: easy crescent sausage and cheese appetizers ; ingredients: refrigerated crescent dinner rolls, honey mustard, gruyere cheese, sausages ; preparation:Prepare a lage baking sheet and spray with non-stick cooking spray. Unroll the crescent dough and separate on the perforations into individual triangles. Spread about 1 teaspoon honey mustard on each crescent. Sprinkle about 1 tablespoon grated cheese on the mustard. Arrange one sausage quarter on the triangle. Fold the short side of the dough over the sausage, continue to roll up. Arrange sausage rolls seam-side down on the prepared baking sheet. At this point you can cover and refrigerate up to 1 day until ready to bake. Set oven to 375 degrees. Bake the crescents until the dough is golden, about 20 minutes. ; name: hot hot hot chocolate spicy chili ; ingredients: hot chocolate powder, cayenne pepper, milk, boiling water ; preparation:Put the hot chocolate powder into a mug and add a little cold milk. Mix to a paste. Add the cayenne. Add enough boiling water to fill the mug, mixing well as you pour. Serve immediately. ; name: salmon souffle ; ingredients: butter, flour, milk, salt, pepper, salmon, eggs ; preparation:Melt butter in small sauce pan. Add flour, milk, salt and pepper. Boil until thick and then remove from heat. Add salmon and slighty beaten egg yolks. Beat egg whites until stiff and fold inches. Pour into greased souffle dish or other deep baking dish. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: nam jim satay thai peanut sauce ; ingredients: roasted unsalted peanuts, garlic cloves, onion, red curry paste, fish sauce, coconut milk, lime juice, palm sugar, chicken stock ; preparation:If you wish use peanut butter rather than fresh peanuts. First grind or crush the peanuts to a fairly fine powder. Then combine them with the remaining ingredients, to form a smooth sauce. If the sauce is too thick, you can thin it with a little chicken stock. Now add the lime juice, tasting as you progress to check the balance of flavors is correct. If you are doing shrimp satay then use half the quantity of massaman paste. ; name: peanut butter smores cocoa ; ingredients: hot cocoa mix, creamy peanut butter, milk, marshmallow creme, chocolate graham crackers ; preparation:Place cocoa mix and peanut butter in small, heat-proof container. Stir in milk until peanut butter is dissolved. Divide between two mugs. Top each with 3 tablespoons marshmallow creme. Serve immediately with chocolate graham crackers. ; name: glazed carrots with cider ; ingredients: carrot, butter, brown sugar, cider, vegetable stock, dijon mustard, fresh parsley ; preparation:

name: orzo with blue cheese and walnuts ; ingredients: salt, orzo pasta, butter, parmesan cheese, blue cheese, walnuts ; preparation:In a large saucepan, bring 1 quart of water to a boil. Add the salt and orzo and cook until the orzo is tender and has absorbed almost all of the cooking liquid, 8 to 9 minutes. Stir in the butter, parmesan and blue cheeses and walnuts. Serve immediately. Watch carefully because nuts will burn quickly. ; name: pork scaloppine 6 weight watchers points ; ingredients: unsalted butter, olive oil, pork loin, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, reduced-sodium fat-free chicken broth, fresh lemon juice, lemon zest ; preparation:Heat the butter and oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Season the 10 pork cutlets with 2 tsp of the salt and pepper. Cook the cutlets until lightly browned and cooked through, about 1 min per side or until tender. Remove from pan. Set aside 4 cutlets and keep warm, and save the other 6 for another meal. Add the chicken broth to the pan and simmer, scraping up the brown bits with a wooden spoon until slightly thickened, about minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the lemon juice and the remaining salt. Drizzle the meat with the pan juices and sprinkle with the zest. Serve with lemon asparagus. ; name: squash snackers ; ingredients: yellow squash, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, fresh garlic, fresh basil, celery salt, asiago cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Coat the bottom of a casserole dish with olive oil. Line the bottom of the dish with the squash making sure that they are laid out evenly and sprinkle with vinegar. Top with even amounts of garlic, basil and celery salt. Bake uncovered at 350 for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and add about one cube of cheese per slice. Cook for another 15 minutes remove and let cool for five minutes and serve on crackers or eat by themselves. ; name: quick asian style vegetable beef skillet ; ingredients: ground beef, garlic powder, seasoning salt, carrots, white onion, water, cabbage, green pepper, soy sauce, beef-flavor ramen noodles ; preparation:In a large skillet, cook the beef, seasoned salt, garlic powder, carrots and onions until beef is browned and veggies are crisp tender. Drain and return to skillet. Add water, cabbage, green peppers, soy sauce and seasoning packet from the noodles. Break noodles into small pieces, add to pan and stir well to cover noodles with liquid. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and noodles are tender. ; name: mint glazed rack of lamb for one ; ingredients: rack of lamb, oregano, rosemary, salt, pepper, mint jelly, garlic, dried parsley ; preparation:Season your rack with the rosemary, oregano& salt& pepper. Have your oven temp at 375 degrees f. Place your rack in an open oven proof pan and cook for about 20- 25 minutes. Meanwhile, melt the jelly with the garlic and parsley in a small saucepan. Take out the rack and pour the glaze over it. Return to oven, apprx 10 minutes, until the internal temp reaches 160-165 degrees f. This will have the rack still a bit pink. ; name: roasted red bell pepper pasta ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, sliced mushrooms, roasted red peppers, penne pasta, parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, onion powder, garlic ; preparation:

name: pecan brie tarts ; ingredients: prepared tart shells, brie cheese, pecans, brown sugar, whiskey ; preparation:Bake tart shells blind, or if bought according to directions on package. Divide brie into 24 wedges and place in baked tart shells. In a saucepan, heat pecans, sugar and whiskey over medium heat, stirring until bubbly. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 minutes or until thickened. Working quickly, spoon pecan mixture over brie. Bake in 375f oven for 10 minutes or until hot and bubbly. ; name: lava flow ; ingredients: light rum, pineapple juice, pina colada nonalcoholic drink mix, strawberry puree, chunk pineapple ; preparation:Blend rum, pineapple juice, and pina colada mix with 1 cup of ice. Next, take a glass and coat the inside with strawberry puree. Pour in colada blend. Finally, use a spoon to drag the strawberry puree up through the colada drink, creating a pink stripe. Garnish with a pineapple chunk, and serve. ; name: delicious and easy lentils ; ingredients: canadian bacon, butter, carrot, onion, water, lentils, salt, marjoram, dried parsley, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Lightly brown the canadian bacon over med heat. Add butter, onion, and carrots and saute for 5 minutes. Add water, lentils, salt and herbs. Cover and simmer on low for 20 minutes. Uncover and simmer for 5 more minutes. Add the parmesan cheese and serve. ; name: funfetti bars ; ingredients: pillsbury funfetti cake mix, margarine, eggs, chocolate frosting ; preparation:Heat oven to 375f grease 15x10-inch baking pan. In large bowl, combine cake mix, margarine and eggs. Stir by hand until thoroughly moistened. Stir in candy bits from cake mix. Spread in pan. Bake for 13 to 17 minutes or until light golden brown and toothpick comes out clean. Cool completely. Frost bars and sprinkle with candy bits from frosting. Cut into bars. ; name: farina cookies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, egg, vanilla, flour, baking powder, salt, farina, raisins ; preparation:Cream together butter and sugar. Add egg. Add remaining ingredients and stir. Drop onto cookie sheet with spoon. Bake at preheated 350 oven for 15 minutes. ; name: mistakes ; ingredients: bulk sausage, lean ground beef, velveeta cheese, oregano, garlic powder, worcestershire sauce, miniature party rye rounds ; preparation:

name: roasted red pepper provolone panini ; ingredients: bread, prosciutto, roasted red pepper, provolone cheese, olive oil ; preparation:Place prosciutto, pepper, and cheese on bread. Heat grill pan and have something heavy near by to weigh down the lid. Lighty oil pan and add panini. Press down on top with another pan or heavy plate, cook untill ightly browned. Flip and cook other side. Enoy. Add whatever additions. ; name: thai iced coffee 12 hour brew technique ; ingredients: ground coffee, cold water, vanilla extract, sweetened condensed milk ; preparation:Stir together ground coffee and cold water in a pitcher until well combined. Let stand at room temperature for 12 hours. Pour coffee mixture through a large, fine wire mesh strainer into a dutch oven or other large container, discarding grounds. Clean strainer. Place a coffee filter or double layer of cheesecloth in strainer. Pour coffee mixture through lined strainer into a pitcher. Add vanilla extract. Cover and store in refrigerator up to 1 week, if desired. Stir together coffee mixture and sweetened condensed milk. Serve over ice. ; name: swedish spritz ; ingredients: butter, sugar, egg, vanilla, almond extract, all-purpose flour, baking powder ; preparation:Thoroughly cream the butter and sugar. Add the egg the vanilla and almond extract. Beat well. Sift the flour and baking powder together. Add to the creamed mixture, mix until smooth. Do not chill. Do not double. Force cookies through a cookie press onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Decorate the cookies with redhots, sprinkles or whatever you like. Bake in a 400 oven for 8-10 minutes. Cool on newspaper. These freeze well but shouldnt be left out for more than a week or so. ; name: cranberry truffles ; ingredients: fresh cranberries, light corn syrup, water, butter, sweetened condensed milk, unsweetened cocoa, powdered sugar ; preparation:In a medium saucepan, combine cranberries, corn syrup and water. Cook stirring until berries are popped and mixture is thickened. Let cool. In a heavy saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Stir in cocoa then condensed milk. Stir until mixture thickens. Stir in cooled cranberries. Refrigerate 3 to 4 hours or until well chilled. Shape into one inch balls. Roll in powdered sugar. Store in refrigerator. ; name: warm and creamy bacon dressing ; ingredients: bacon, garlic clove, miracle whip, milk ; preparation:Cook bacon until crisp. Drain, reserving 1 tablespoon drippings. Heat reserved drippings, bacon and garlic over low heat 1 minute. Stir in salad dressing and milk. Cook, stirring occasionally, until thoroughly heated. ; name: roasted peppers and aubergine eggplant sandwich ; ingredients: eggplant, onion, roasted red peppers, garlic, diced tomatoes, olive oil ; preparation:

name: just right vegetable beef stew ; ingredients: stew meat, baking potatoes, carrots, onion, okra, mixed vegetables, sweet corn, crushed tomatoes, tomato juice, salt and pepper ; preparation:Place meat, onions, potatoes, and carrots into a dutch oven, cover with water and boil for twenty minutes or until potatoes are tender. Add canned vegetables. You probably will not need the entire can of tomato juice. Simmer on stove for thirty minutes. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve with hot corn bread. ; name: red curry with vegetables ; ingredients: coconut milk, red curry paste, chicken stock, fish sauce, brown sugar, zucchini, sugar snap peas, mushroom, bamboo shoot ; preparation:Combine 4 ounces coconut milk, curry paste, stock, fish sauce, and sugar and bring to a boil. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add vegetables and remaining coconut milk and simmer an additional 15 minutes. If using snow peas, add just before serving. Serve with rice. ; name: chocolate cream pie dairy free ; ingredients: bittersweet baking chocolate, non-dairy whipped topping, margarine, eggs, vanilla extract, chocolate pudding, sugar, chocolate wafer pie crust ; preparation:Over a double boiler or super low flame melt baking chocolate. Add sugar, pudding and vanilla until dissolved. Add eggs one at a time and stir continuously until incorporated. In a separate bowl whip up the topping until stiff with a tablespoon of sugar. In a separate bowl add chocolate mixture to margarine stick and beat well. Add topping until all is well combined. Pour into prepared cookie pie crust and refrigerate or freeze. Cut into slices and serve with whipped cream and chocolate shavings. Enjoy. ; name: pasta with turkey sausage tomatoes mozzarella ; ingredients: hot sausage, olive oil, garlic, onion, tomatoes with juice, dried red pepper flakes, pasta, smoked mozzarella cheese, parsley, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Discard garlic. Add onion and cook until softened. Add tomatoes with juice, sausage and pepper flakes. Cook over medium high heat, until sauce is thickened. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and toss with sausage in large bowl. Toss with mozzarella. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and chopped parsley. Serve hot. ; name: yellow squash pie ; ingredients: evaporated milk, eggs, honey, cinnamon, yellow squash, unbaked pie shells ; preparation:Slice and cook squash in small amount of water until tender. Drain and cool. In blender, blend milk, eggs, cinnamon and honey. Add cooked squash. Blend together for 2 to 3 minutes. Pour into pie shell. Bake at 400f for ten minutes, then turn oven down to 350f and cook for 35 minutes or until set. Cool. Refrigerate until cold then serve. Or you can eat it warm like my family prefers--your choice. ; name: chicken cheese balls ; ingredients: chicken, philadelphia cream cheese, prepared mustard, lemon juice, mixed nuts ; preparation:

name: ham mushroom pie ; ingredients: ham steak, pastry shells, condensed cream of mushroom soup, sour cream, eggs, chives, pepper ; preparation:Cut ham to fit the bottom of pastry shell. Place into shell. In a bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Mix well. Pour over ham. Cover edges of piecrust loosely with foil to prevent over-browning. Bake at 425 for 35-40 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. ; name: pineapple garlic pork chops ; ingredients: pork loin chops, unsweetened pineapple juice, dry sherry, brown sugar, dried rosemary leaves, garlic cloves ; preparation:Combine all ingredients, except pork chops, mix well. Place chops in shallow dish and pour marinade over them. Cover a refrigerate overnight, turning occasionally. Remove pork from marinade. Broil 5-6 minutes on each side basting once with the marinade or grill and marinade once during cooking. ; name: spicy chicken with pineapple ; ingredients: cooking oil, boneless skinless chicken breasts, onion, paprika, chili powder, red pepper, pineapple slices in juice, tomatoes, red kidney beans ; preparation:Heat the oil in a large saute pan. Add the chicken and onion, and cook together until golden. Add the spices and red pepper, and cook for 1 minute. Halve the pineapple slices, add to the pan with the juice, tomatoes and kidney beans. Cover and simmer 20-25 minutes until the chicken is tender. Serve with rice or mashed potatoes. ; name: russian berry custard kissel ; ingredients: fresh cranberries, water, sugar, potato starch ; preparation:Place the berries and 4 cups of the water in a medium size saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium-low and cook until the cranberries pop open or the strawberries or raspberries get somewhat mushy, 10 to 15 minutes. Allow to cool slightly, then with the back of a spoon, press the berries through a fine-mesh sieve set over a bowl. Be sure to extract as much juice as possible. Return the sieved berries and liquid to the saucepan. Add the sugar and bring to a boil, stirring over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until the sugar is completely dissolved, 2 to 3 minutes. In a small bowl, dilute the potato starch with the remaining 1 cup water, stirring carefully until there are no lumps. Whisk the mixture into the simmering berry mixture and bring to a boil, stirring vigorously until the mixture thickens. Remove from the heat and cool, stirring from time to time. Spoon into serving glasses or bowls and refrigerate. ; name: english toffee candy ; ingredients: butter, sugar, water, semi-sweet chocolate chips, walnuts ; preparation:Heat butter, sugar and water in a 3 quart sauce-pan to a rolling boil. When mix reaches 305 degrees pour onto a greased large cookie sheet. Sprinkle chocolate chips over the candy. As chocolate melts spread with a butter knife. Spread nuts evenly over the pan, shaking lightly until all nuts stick. Cool until hard. Break into pieces. Enjoy. ; name: enchiritos micro mexican meal ; ingredients: flour tortillas, refried beans, lean ground beef, taco seasoning mix, water, cheddar cheese, taco sauce, onion, sour cream ; preparation:

name: mini meatloaves 3 variations kraft food and family magazine ; ingredients: extra lean ground beef, stove top stuffing mix, water, cheddar cheese, garlic powder, barbecue sauce, italian seasoning, spaghetti sauce, chili powder, salsa ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 375f. Mix ground beef, stuffing mix, water, and the powder ingredient from the variation you chose. Press into 12 muffin cups sprayed with cooking spray. Make an indentation in center of each meatloaf. With spoon fill indentation with sauce. Bake 30 min or until cooked through. Top with cheese, continue baking 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. ; name: pineapple cheese ball or spread ; ingredients: cream cheese, crushed pineapple, pecans, green pepper, onions, salt ; preparation:Mix cream cheese and add pineapple, pecans, green pepper, onion and salt. Mix and form into ball. Refrigerate overnight. Serve with crackers. Will not form ball, but makes a creamy spread. ; name: creamy pumpkin pie ; ingredients: 9 inch pie shell, pumpkin, sweetened condensed milk, eggs, cinnamon, salt, ginger, nutmeg, clove ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f degrees. Mix all ingredients in lg bowl. Mix well. Pour into crust. Bake for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 and bake another 40 min, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Garnish with pecans if desired. ; name: the ultimate chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: butter flavor crisco, brown sugar, egg, vanilla, milk, flour, baking soda, salt, chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Mix the butter and brown sugar together until creamy. Add egg, mix thoroughly. Add vanilla and milk, blend. In a separate bowl, mix together flour, baking soda and salt. Add to brown sugar mixture, blend until flour is all mixed. Add chocolate chips. On a non-greased cookie sheet, drop spoonfuls of dough to form round cookies. Bake form 8-10 minutes for chewy cookies, or longer for crunchy. ; name: boiled chocolate cake ; ingredients: sugar, water, butter, bicarbonate of soda, cocoa, self raising flour, egg ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180 degrees c. Place sugar, water, butter, bicarb soda& cocoa in a saucepan& bring to the boil. Once boiling, time for 2 minutes, then remove from heat. Grease& line base of a loaf pan. Once chocolate mixture has cooled, add the flour& egg. Mix well until smooth. Place in pan& cook in oven for 35 minutes. ; name: carrot bake ; ingredients: carrot, onions, mayonnaise, water, prepared horseradish, pepper, dry breadcrumbs, butter, sharp cheddar cheese ; preparation:

name: crab rice primavera ; ingredients: frozen broccoli green beans onions and peppers mix, water, milk, crabmeat, margarine, garlic powder, dried basil, minute rice, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Bring vegitables & water to boil in medium saucepan, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat. Cover & simmer 3 minutes. Add milk, crabmeat, margarine, garlic powder and basil. Bring to full boil. Stir in rice & cheese. Cover, remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with fork. ; name: diabetic herb roasted pork chops ; ingredients: fresh lemon juice, scallions, garlic cloves, dried rosemary, black pepper, pork chops ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 400f. Coat an 8-inch square baking dish with cooking spray. Combine the lemon juice, scallions, garlic, rosemary, and pepper in a shallow dish. Dip each pork chop into the mixture to coat completely then place in the baking dish. Lightly coat the chops with cooking spray and bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until desired doneness. ; name: ham and asparagus roll ups ; ingredients: asparagus, cream cheese, horseradish, dijon-style mustard, worcestershire sauce, ham ; preparation:Cook asparagus until crisp-tender. Mix together cream cheese, horseradish, mustard and worcestershire sauce. On each slice of ham spread a thin layer of cheese mixture. Place one spear of asparagus at one end of ham slice, and roll up, jelly roll-style. Slice into bite-sized pieces. Chill. ; name: nacho potato soup ; ingredients: au gratin potato mix, corn, tomatoes and green chilies, water, skim milk, fat free cream cheese, hot sauce, fresh parsley sprig ; preparation:In large pot, combine au gratin potato mix, tomatoes, and water. Mix well and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer 15-18 minutes until potatoes are done. Add cheese chunks and cook, stirring with a whisk, until the cheese melts. Add milk, corn, and hot sauce, stirring until soup is hot. Garnish with parsley. ; name: jailhouse doughnuts ; ingredients: white bread, eggs, milk, sugar, vanilla extract, jam, icing sugar ; preparation:Heat oil in your deep fryer to 375-380 degrees f. Spread your favorite jam on 12 slices of the bread. Cover with another slice of the crustless bread and cut the sandwich into any shape you want, into thre pieces to make a bismark type of doughnut, or cut them into four squares, whatever pleases you. Beat the eggs, milk, sugar and vanilla together. Lightly dip both sides of the dougnut in the egg mixture. When deepfryer has reached the right temperature drop in a few doughnuts and fry about 2 minutes on each side. It is extremely important that you have the temperature high enough and do not soak the bread in the egg just dip them or you will end up with soggy, greasy lumps. They should be golden and crisp. Wait a few minutes between batches to ensure the temp is hot enough or you will end up with a grease soaked doughnut. Drain on a rack. If you wish you can drizzle icing sugar over them just after you remove them from the fryer or have them plain. ; name: winnie s cheese cookies ; ingredients: butter, cheddar cheese, flour, rice krispies, worcestershire sauce, tabasco sauce ; preparation:

name: suzie s oatmeal chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: margarine, granulated sugar, brown sugar, eggs, water, vanilla, flour, baking soda, oatmeal, chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream the margarine and sugars. Add the eggs and mix. Add the water and vanilla, mix. Mix together the flour and baking soda and add to the mixture fold in the oatmeal and chocolate chips. Spoon on a cookie sheet and bake at 350 until they just start to turn brown, if you like them chewy. ; name: sweet sour brussels sprouts ; ingredients: frozen brussels sprouts, olive oil, cider vinegar, sugar, coarse salt, pepper, garlic clove, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Place brussels sprouts in shallow baking dish. In a small bowl, combine oil, vinegar, sugar, salt, pepper, and garlic. Pour evenly over sprouts then sprinkle with the cheese. Bake at 350 for about 20 minutes, or until brussels sprouts are tender. ; name: avocado bacon and tomato salad ; ingredients: garlic cloves, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, dijon mustard, bacon, salad leaves, red onion, avocados, tomatoes, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180deg. Place garlic on baking tray and roast for 30 mins, allow garlic to cool and then squeeze out the flesh and mash in a small bowl. Add the olive oil, balsamic vinegar and dijon mustard and whish well together. Season with salt and pepper. Chop bacon into bite sized pieces, then grill or dry fry for 3-5 mins or until crisp. Place salad leaves into bowl and add bacon, onion, tomato and avocado. Toss well. Whisk the dressing ingredients again to ensure they are mixed well and then pour over salad. ; name: hovis granary hand baked bread ; ingredients: bread flour, salt, butter, yeast, warm water ; preparation:In a large bowl mix together the flour salt, butter and yeast. Stir in the water and mix into a soft dough. Turn out onto a floured surface and knead well for 10 minutes by hand or 5 in a electric mixer fitted with a dough hook. Let the dough rise for 1 hour or until double in size, covered and in a warm place. When the dough has risen shape as required and place in a greased tin or tray. Cover with a polythene and leave in a warm place until doubled in size. Uncover and bake in an ove, pre-heated to 230c, 450f, gas mark 8, for around 30-35 minutes. Baked loaf should sound hollow when tapped underneath. For a soft, moist crust remove from the oven and wrap in a clean te-towel to cool. ; name: lava flow ; ingredients: light rum, pineapple juice, pina colada nonalcoholic drink mix, strawberry puree, chunk pineapple ; preparation:Blend rum, pineapple juice, and pina colada mix with 1 cup of ice. Next, take a glass and coat the inside with strawberry puree. Pour in colada blend. Finally, use a spoon to drag the strawberry puree up through the colada drink, creating a pink stripe. Garnish with a pineapple chunk, and serve. ; name: angel hair with avocado and tomatoes ; ingredients: angel hair pasta, olive oil, garlic cloves, fresh basil leaf, avocado, tomatoes, salt, pepper ; preparation:

name: peppy mex popcorn snack ; ingredients: popped popcorn, miniature pretzels, crunchy cheetos cheese-flavored snacks, margarine, lemon pepper seasoning, dried oregano leaves, chili powder, garlic powder, onion powder ; preparation:Heat oven to 325f. In large bowl, combine popcorn, pretzels and cheese-flavored snacks. Melt margarine in small saucepan over low heat. Stir in lemon pepper seasoning, oregano, chili powder, garlic powder and onion powder. Pour margarine mixture over popcorn mixture. Stir gently to coat. Spread mixture in ungreased 15x10x1-inch baking pan. Bake at 325f for 10 to 15 minutes, stirring once. Cool completely. Store in airtight container. ; name: hot quinoa drink ; ingredients: quinoa, soymilk, apples, light brown sugar, ground cinnamon, vanilla extract ; preparation:Place quinoa and 2 cups water in a medium saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer 15 minutes or until quinoa is tender. Drain well and return quinoa to saucepan. Add soymilk, apples, sugar and cinnamon. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium and simmer 5 minutes. Transfer mixture to a blender, add vanilla and puree until smooth. Serve hot. ; name: scallop thermidor ; ingredients: sea scallops, olive oil, onion, sliced mushrooms, garlic, dry vermouth, heavy cream, sharp cheddar cheese ; preparation:Heat a sauce pan to med high. Add olive oil to hot pan then sear scallops for 4 minutes on each side. Remove and keep warm. Saute onions and mushrooms on high heat, till browned and cooked though. Add garlic and saute for 30 more seconds. Add vermouth, stir to get all brown bits off bottom, reduce heat. When most of liquid has cooked off, add cream. Bring to a boil for 3 minutes. Turn off heat, leave pan on burner add cheese. When cheese is melted, stir, add salt and pepper to taste and serve over scallops. ; name: sweet pineapple yellow rice ; ingredients: basmati rice, turmeric powder, sugar, water, saffron, ghee, cinnamon sticks, cardamom pods, canned crushed pineapple, lemon ; preparation:Boil rice with turmeric until al dente. Combine sugar, water and saffron. Boil until it forms a sticky syrup. Add lemon. Heat ghee with cinnamon. Add pineapple and syrup. Add rice and toss well. Simmer on medium heat for 10 minutes. Reduce heat and simmer on low until slightly moist. ; name: cool raspberry soup ; ingredients: frozen raspberries, water, white wine, cranberry-raspberry juice, sugar, cinnamon, whole cloves, lemon juice, raspberry yogurt ; preparation:In a blender, puree raspberries, water and wine. Pour into a large saucepan, add the cranberry-raspberry juice, sugar, cinnamon and cloves. Bring just to the boil over a medium heat. Strain into a large bowl, and let cool. Whisk in the lemon juice and yogurt, then chill several hours before serving. ; name: fish fillets dijon ; ingredients: orange roughy fillets, butter, dijon mustard, fresh lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, fresh white breadcrumbs, fresh parsley, lemon wedge ; preparation:

name: grilled ham with glaze ; ingredients: brown sugar, prepared horseradish, lemon juice, ham steak ; preparation:In small saucepan, bring first 3 ingredients to a boil. Boil 1 minute. Remove from heat. Brush on the ham. Grill over med hot coals, turning once, until hot. Baste with more glaze. ; name: butternut squash with garlic and olive oil ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, butternut squash, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Peel and cube squash. In a large bowl mix minced garlic and olive oil. Add cubed squash and coat with the oil mixture. Dump all ingredients out of bowl and in to a glass casserole dish. Any size will do really but it will cook faster if it is more spread out. Cook 40-45 minutes, stirring once or twice. Squash is done when it is tender. ; name: arugula salad with shaved manchego ; ingredients: honey, white balsamic vinegar, olive oil, coarse salt, fresh ground black pepper, slivered almonds, arugula, sun-dried tomato packed in oil, manchego cheese ; preparation:In a large bowl, whisk honey and vinegar until combined. Whisk in oil. Season with salt and pepper. Add arugula, sun-dried tomatoes and almonds to the dressing. Lightly toss. Using a vegetable peeler, thinly shave the manchego. Add half to the bowl, and toss to combine. Divide among four serving or salad plates. Top with remaining manchego. Serve immediately. ; name: walnut brownie bites ; ingredients: walnuts, butter, dark chocolate, brown sugar, egg, plain flour, sour cream, rolo chocolates ; preparation:Preheat oven to moderate. Lightly grease 2 non-stick 12 hole mini muffin pans. Divide walnuts among holes. Stir butter and chocolate in small saucepan over low heat until smooth. Stir in sugar, cool to just warm. Stir in egg, then flour and cream. Spoon mixture into prepared pan. Press one rolo into centre of each quantity of mixture. Spread mixture so that rolo is completely enclosed. Bake in oven about 15 minutes. Using a sharp pointed knife, loosen sides of brownies from pan, stand 10 minutes. Remove brownies gently from pan. ; name: sloppy curts ; ingredients: lean ground beef, american cheese, salt, pepper, garlic powder ; preparation:Brown ground beef in skillet til well done and crumbled. Drain well. Unwrap and place each slice of cheese over ground beef and slowly melt on a low heat, stirring occasionally until burger is sticking together with cheese. Season to taste. Serve warm on a bun. Garnish with favorite hamburger toppings or enjoy plain. ; name: sushine carrots ; ingredients: frozen baby carrots, lemon, zest of, orange juice, dark corn syrup, cornstarch, hot water ; preparation:

name: chocolate orange fudge ; ingredients: semi-sweet chocolate chips, sweetened condensed milk, pecans, orange zest ; preparation:Line a 8x8x2-inch baking pan with lightly buttered waxed paper or aluminum foil. Set aside. Melt chocolate chips with condensed milk in the top of a double boiler or in a bowl in the microwave. Stir until smooth. Remove from heat and stir in pecans and grated orange peel. Spread in prepared dish and chill until firm. Carefully remove fudge from pan using the edges of the foil. Cut into squares. Store covered in refrigerator. ; name: captain s tilapia ; ingredients: tilapia fillets, onion, roma tomatoes, garlic clove, fresh basil leaves, salt and pepper, cooking spray ; preparation:Pre heat oven to 375 degrees f. In a med saute pan spray with non stick cooking spray. Saute onions about 2-3 minutes until translucent. Add tilapia filets on top of sauteed onions. Add chopped garlic on each filet. Add chopped fresh basil. Add tomato slices or chopped tomatoes. Place pan with topped filets in the oven. Bake 12-15 minutes until fish is white. ; name: pork scaloppine 6 weight watchers points ; ingredients: unsalted butter, olive oil, pork loin, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, reduced-sodium fat-free chicken broth, fresh lemon juice, lemon zest ; preparation:Heat the butter and oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Season the 10 pork cutlets with 2 tsp of the salt and pepper. Cook the cutlets until lightly browned and cooked through, about 1 min per side or until tender. Remove from pan. Set aside 4 cutlets and keep warm, and save the other 6 for another meal. Add the chicken broth to the pan and simmer, scraping up the brown bits with a wooden spoon until slightly thickened, about minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the lemon juice and the remaining salt. Drizzle the meat with the pan juices and sprinkle with the zest. Serve with lemon asparagus. ; name: penzey s chocolate chip kisses ; ingredients: egg whites, cream of tartar, salt, vanilla extract, red food coloring, superfine sugar, mini chocolate chip ; preparation:Preheat oven to 250. Beat egg whites, cream of tartar, and salt on high speed until peaks form. Add vanilla extract and food coloring. Gradually add the sugar, beating until stiff. Gently fold in chocolate chips. Drop by scant teaspoons onto a greased cookie sheet about 2 inches apart. Bake at 250 for 25 minutes. The kisses will be chewy on the inside and slightly brown on the botom and will retain their pink color. ; name: oktoberfest curry catsup ; ingredients: oil, onions, curry powder, sweet hungarian paprika, ketchup, water ; preparation:Saute the onion in oil until it is transparent, about 2-3 minutes. Do not brown. Add curry powder and paprika to onion and continue to saute for a about 1 minute. Add ketchup and water to the onion mixture and simmer uncovered until sauce thickens a bit about 5 minutes. Taste and adjust the seasoning. Refrigerate and serve with brats, hamburger or hot dogs. ; name: herbed potatoes n peas ; ingredients: small red potato, bay leaves, butter, salt, dried marjoram, thyme, pepper, frozen peas ; preparation:

name: margarita soaked cake ; ingredients: instant vanilla pudding, yellow cake mix, eggs, vegetable oil, cold water, margarita mix, butter, sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a large bundt pan. Combine all of the ingredients for the cake and mix on medium speed for 2 minutes or until smooth. Pour batter into bundt pan. Bake for 35-45 minutes or until knife insterted comes out clean. Invert onto a plate. Combine ingredients for the topping in a saucepan. Boil mixture for about 2 minutes. While still warm, poke holes in the top and sides of the cake with a fork. Pour margarita mixture over cake. ; name: skillet beef enchiladas ; ingredients: ground round, onion, green chilies, cream of mushroom soup, enchilada sauce, milk, corn tortillas, cheese ; preparation:Brown meat and onion in large skillet. Drain fat. Stir in chilies, cream of mushroom soup, enchilada sauce, and milk. Bring to a boil and then simmer for 20 minutes. Soften tortillas in the microwave wrapped in paper towels. Place grated cheese inside each tortilla and roll up. Place tortillas in sauce in skillet and spoon sauce over tortillas. Top with any remaining cheese. Cover and heat on medium for 5 minutes. ; name: pecan chocolate chip pound cake ; ingredients: sugar, butter, eggs, almond extract, all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, milk, miniature semisweet chocolate chips, pecans ; preparation:In a large mixing bowl, beat sugar, butter, eggs and almond extract on low just until mixed. Beat on high for 5 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally. In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt. On low speed, add flour mixture alternately with milk, mixing just until blended. Fold in chocolate chips. Sprinkle pecans in the bottom of a greased and floured 10-in. Tube pan. Carefully pour batter over pecans. Bake at 325 for 1 hour and 40 minutes or until cake tests done. Cool 20 minutes in pan before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. ; name: pecan crunch salmon ; ingredients: salmon fillets, salt, pepper, dijon mustard, butter, honey, soft breadcrumbs, pecans, fresh parsley ; preparation:Sprinkle salmon with salt and pepper. Place fillets, skin side down, in a lightly greased baking sheet. Combine dijon mustard, butter, and honey. Brush on salmon fillets. Combine breadcrumbs, pecans and parsley. Spoon mixture evenly on top of each fillet. Bake at 450f for 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily. ; name: tomato basil chicken ; ingredients: vegetable oil, water, boneless skinless chicken breast halves, tomato soup, milk, parmesan cheese, dried basil leaves, garlic powder ; preparation:In medium skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil. Add chicken and water and cook 10 minutes or until browned. Add more water if necessary to prevent chicken from getting too dry. Set chicken aside. Pour off fat and water. Add remaining ingredients. Heat to a boil. Return chicken to pan. Reduce heat to low. Cover and cook 5 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. ; name: jimmy dean sauce for omelets ; ingredients: jimmy dean sausage, butter, flour, pepper, sour cream, milk, salt ; preparation:

name: mushroom guacamole ; ingredients: avocado, white mushroom, cilantro, vinaigrette, lime juice ; preparation:Dice mushrooms & place in bowl. Mix with vinaigrette. Let sit 5 minutes to marinate a bit. While mushrooms are marinating, prepare avocado & cilantro. Add remaining ingredients to bowl & mash avocado as you are mixing together. ; name: kittencal s parmesan egg noodles ; ingredients: wide egg noodles, butter, garlic, crushed red pepper flakes, parmesan cheese, green onions, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Cook the egg noodles in a large pot of boiling salted water until tender. Drain and set aside. Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add in garlic and chili flakes. Cook stirring for 2 minutes or until the garlic is softened. Add in the cooked noodles and toss to heat through. Mix in the parmesan cheese and green onion, then season with salt and fresh ground black pepper. Serve with more parmesan cheese. ; name: no bake corn flake chews ; ingredients: brown sugar, honey, butter, corn flakes, slivered almonds, glace cherries, milk chocolate ; preparation:Combine sugar, honey, & butter in a saucepan. Stir constantly over a medium heat until butter melts & sugar dissolves. Remove from heat. Add cornflakes, almonds and cherries. Press tablespoons of mixture onto a greased tray & refrigerate until firm. Spread each biscuit with chocolate. ; name: frozen pineapple salad good use for those muffin tins ; ingredients: cream cheese, sugar, brown sugar, crushed pineapple, pineapple yogurt, pecans ; preparation:Blend cream cheese and sugars, beating well. Add pineapple and yogurt. Spoon into cupcake liners placed in a muffin tray. Sprinkle with chopped nuts. Cover and freeze until firm. Remove from freezer about 10 minutes prior to serving. ; name: barbecued apricot hot dogs ; ingredients: apricot preserves, tomato sauce, vinegar, soy sauce, honey, oil, salt, ground ginger, hot dogs ; preparation:Combine all ingredients except hot dogs in a slow cooker. Cover. Cook on high for 30 minutes, and then add hot dog pieces. Cover and cook on low for 4 hours. Serve over rice as a main dish if desired, or as an appetizer. ; name: chocolate dipped spritz cookies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, egg, vanilla, flour, salt, baking powder, dark chocolate confectionary coating, nuts ; preparation:

name: 4 cheese mexican tortilla appetizers ; ingredients: flour tortillas, refried beans, taco sauce, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, green onion, crushed red pepper flakes, four-cheese mexican blend cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 f. Place tortillas on baking sheet. Bake for 3 to 4 minutes or until crisp. Spread refried beans evenly on tortillas. Spread 1 tablespoon taco sauce over beans. Top with bell peppers, green onions and crushed red pepper. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 7 to 8 minutes or until cheese is melted. Cut into wedges. A pizza cutter works great for this. ; name: healthier nutella peanut butter brownies ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, salt, eggs, nutella, brown sugar, vanilla extract, reduced-fat peanut butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f and grease a 8x8-inch pan. In a small bowl mix flour and salt then set aside. In a large bowl, beat the remaining ingredients, adding the peanut butter last. At low speed, add the flour mixture. Spread in pan and cook for 35-45 minutes. Let cool then cut into 16 squares. ; name: 7 layer sombrero dip ; ingredients: original ranch dressing mix, sour cream, refried beans, diced tomato, green chilies, black olives, cheddar cheese, monterey jack cheese, avocado ; preparation:Spread beans on a 10-inch serving platter. Blend sour cream and dressing mix together. Spread over beans. Layer remaining ingredients. Serve with tortilla chips. ; name: cooked chicken for dumplings ; ingredients: whole chickens, water, onions, carrots, celery & leaves, garlic cloves, salt, pepper ; preparation:Put chicken, vegetables and seasoning in largest stockpot you have. Cover with water to fill almost to top. Bring to boil, then reduce heat to simmer for 30-45 minutes. Carefully lift chicken out of broth, it will most likely fall apart. Place in bowl to cool so you can pick meat off bones. Strain the broth to remove the soggy vegetables. Pour broth back into stock pot. Check for seasoning. Pick chicken meat off bones and tear into bite size pieces. Return chicken to broth. Bring stew back to boil and reduce heat to simmer. Add dumplings of your choice. ; name: pepperoncini cream cheese dip ; ingredients: pepperoncini peppers, cream cheese, parmesan cheese, sour cream ; preparation:Position knife blade in food processor bowl. Add first 3 ingredients. Pulse several times or until smooth. Stir in sour cream. Cover and chill until ready to serve. Serve with crackers. ; name: diabetic cranberry soul warming tea ; ingredients: family-size tea bags, whole cloves, cinnamon sticks, boiling water, sugar, water, splenda sweetened cranberry juice, orange juice, lemon juice, orange ; preparation:

name: simple baked chicken drumsticks ; ingredients: chicken drumsticks, garlic powder, pepper, salt, olive oil, rosemary, parsley ; preparation:Put some olive oil in the bottom of a 9x13 pan. Add drumsticks. Sprinkle generously with pepper and garlic powder. Sprinkle lightly with salt. Add rosemary to the chicken, if desired. Bake at 375 f for half an hour. Turn drumsticks over and add more garlic powder, pepper and salt. Top with the parsley. Bake another half an hour, or until cooked until 160f. ; name: lakeside mushroom quiche ; ingredients: 9-inch deep dish pie crust, cheddar cheese, mushrooms, french fried onion rings, eggs ; preparation:Sprinkle the shredded cheese on the pie crust. Layer the mushrooms over the cheese, then the onion rings. Beat the eggs and pour over the layers in the pie crust. The onion rings will rise to the top. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 50 minutes. ; name: fruit salsa and cinnamon chips ; ingredients: kiwi fruits, golden delicious apples, raspberries, strawberry, white sugar, brown sugar, fruit preserves, flour tortillas, butter-flavored cooking spray, cinnamon sugar ; preparation:In a large bowl, thoroughly mix kiwis, golden delicious apples, raspberries, strawberries, white sugar, brown sugar and fruit preserves. Cover and chill in the refrigerator at least 15 minutes. Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Coat one side of each flour tortilla with butter flavored cooking spray. Cut into wedges and arrange in a single layer on a large baking sheet. Sprinkle wedges with desired amount of cinnamon sugar. Spray again with cooking spray. Bake in the preheated oven 8 to 10 minutes. Repeat with any remaining tortilla wedges. Allow to cool approximately 15 minutes. Serve with chilled fruit and spice mixture. ; name: lemon myrtle biscuits cookies ; ingredients: white sugar, butter, self raising flour, eggs, ground lemon myrtle ; preparation:Cream together sugar and butter. Add the eggs one at a time. Mix together the sifted flour and lemon myrtle. Once the eggs are combined stir in the flour and lemon myrtle mix until combined. Do not over mix the dough. Roll dough mixute into small balls about the size of a walnut. Place on to greased biscuit baking trays. With a floured fork, press each ball slightly. Bake in a moderate oven for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on a tray. Store in an airtight container. ; name: mussels in guinness garlic ; ingredients: fresh mussels, shallot, garlic cloves, fresh thyme, guinness stout, half-and-half, unsalted butter, parsley, lemon wedge, french bread ; preparation:Put a stockpot or dutch oven over medium heat. When the pot is hot, add the mussels and remaining ingredients cook, stirring once or twice, for 6 to 8 minutes, or until mussels open. Discard any that do not open. To serve, divide the mussels among shallow bowls and ladle the broth over them. Sprinkle with the fresh parsley, and serve with a lemon wedge and slices of bread to sop up the juices. ; name: cajun oven fried potato chips ; ingredients: russet potatoes, butter, coarse salt, cajun seasoning ; preparation:

name: spicy country ribs ; ingredients: onion, ketchup, cider vinegar, brown sugar, kosher salt, worcestershire sauce, dried chipotle powder, dried oregano, country-style pork ribs ; preparation:Combine the onion, ketchup, vinegar, brown sugar, salt, worcestershire, chili powder and oregano in a 4 6 quart slow cooker. Stir in the ribs. Cook on low heat for 6 hours, or on high for 3 hours. Using tongs, remove the ribs from the cooker and arrange on a broiler pan. Heat the broiler. Pour the juices from the cooker into a bowl and place in the freezer for 10 minutes to hasten the separation of the fat. Remove and discard the fat. Pour the defatted juices into a saucepan. Boil over high heat until reduced by half, about 15 minutes. Broil the ribs about 6 inches from the heat until browned. Serve with the remaining sauce on the side. ; name: grilled lime chicken with pineapple salsa ; ingredients: honey mustard, frozen limeade concentrate, ground cumin, boneless skinless chicken breasts, fresh pineapple, red bell pepper, cilantro ; preparation:Mix 3 tablespoons mustard, 3 tablespoons limeade concentrate and cumin in plastic food storage bag. Add chicken, seal bag. Marinate in refrigerator 1-2 hours. Stir together pineapple, bell pepper, cilantro and remaining mustard and limeade concentreate in medium bowl. Grill chicken over medium heat until no longer pink in center. Serve with salsa. ; name: smoothie quick sob no dairy ; ingredients: tangelo, strawberries, splenda sugar substitute, banana, ice cubes ; preparation:Peel tangelo, section, and remove white strings. Place in blender. Hull strawberries and cut in quarters. Place in blender. Add splenda or sugar to blender. Peel banana and place 1 inch chunks in blender. Place ice cubes in blender. Blend for 30-40 seconds until smoothie reaches desired consistency. The blender may need to be jiggled at the beginning as there is no liquid in the bottom. ; name: cherry pineapple nut cake ; ingredients: crushed pineapple in syrup, cherry pie filling, yellow cake mix, pecans, margarine ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 13 x 9 baking dish. Spread pineapple with juice evenly in dish. Spread cherry pie filling over pineapple. Sprinkle dry cake mix over cherries, then spread pecans over cake mix. Cut margarine into thin slices and place over pecans. Bake for 50 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream, if desired. ; name: curry cheese and broccoli soup ; ingredients: fresh broccoli, butter, curry powder, onion, chicken broth, potatoes, carrots, milk, sharp cheddar cheese ; preparation:Trim the flowerets from broccoli and cut into small pieces. Discard tough ends of stems. Peel remaining stems and slice thin in a 6 to 8 quart kettle, melt butter over medium heat. Add curry powder and onion and stir for 5 minutes. Add broth, potatoes, broccoli stems and carrots. Cover and simmer until potatoes mash easily, about 30 minutes. Whirl about half the broth and vegetables in a blender or food processor until pureed. Return to kettle. Heat soup to boiling and add broccoli flowerets and milk. Simmer, uncovered, until flowerets are tender when pierced. Stir in cheese a little at a time until melted. ; name: asparagus bundles ; ingredients: fresh asparagus, bacon, worcestershire sauce, brown sugar, butter, fresh garlic ; preparation:

name: sweet and sour stir fry chicken ; ingredients: cornstarch, boneless skinless chicken breasts, vegetable oil, red bell pepper, sugar snap peas, sliced water chestnuts, sweet and sour sauce ; preparation:Put cornstarch in a plastic food bag. Add chicken and toss to coat. Heat oil in wok or nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking. Add chicken and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until golden brown on all sides. Remove to a bowl with a slotted spoon. Add bell pepper, snap peas and water chestnuts to drippings in skillet. Stir-fry 2 to 3 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Pour in stir-fry sauce and return chicken to skillet. Stir to coat chicken and vegetables. Garnish with scallions. Serves 4. ; name: one pot pork chops ; ingredients: pork loin chops with bone, all-purpose flour, potatoes, baby carrots, water, worcestershire sauce, salt, dried oregano, condensed tomato soup ; preparation:Coat the pork chops with the flour and cook in large skillet until brown on both sides. Add the potatoes and carrots. Combine the water, worcestershire sauce, salt, and oregano in a small bowl. Pour over the pork and vegetables, cover and simmer for 25 minutes. Stir in the soup, recover, and simmer for an additional 10-15 minutes. ; name: sweet potato and coriander mash ; ingredients: sweet potato, garlic clove, fresh coriander, creme fraiche, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Bring a large pan of lightly salted water to the boil. Peel and cube the potatoes and add to the pan with the garlic. Return to the boil and simmer for 15-20 minutes until tender. Add the coriander and cook for 10 seconds. Drain well, then return to the pan. Set the pan over a gentle flame and stir with a wooden spoon for 1-2 minutes to evaporate any excess water, but be careful not to let the potatoes catch and burn on the bottom of the pan.
