Turn off the heat and mash well. Add the creme fraiche and some salt and pepper and mash together until smooth and creamy. Serve warm. ; name: pineapple garlic pork chops ; ingredients: pork loin chops, unsweetened pineapple juice, dry sherry, brown sugar, dried rosemary leaves, garlic cloves ; preparation:Combine all ingredients, except pork chops, mix well. Place chops in shallow dish and pour marinade over them. Cover a refrigerate overnight, turning occasionally. Remove pork from marinade. Broil 5-6 minutes on each side basting once with the marinade or grill and marinade once during cooking. ; name: mexican cornbread hamburger casserole ; ingredients: ground chuck, salt, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, mexican cornbread mix, eggs, milk, cream-style corn, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Brown meat with salt and bell peppers. Drain. Put into 13 x 9 baking dish. Pour cream corn over meat mixture. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Mix cornbread mix, eggs, and milk until blended and pour over casserole. Bake at 425 for 25-30 minutes until lightly browned. ; name: fudge frosting ; ingredients: sugar, light corn syrup, milk, unsweetened chocolate, butter, vanilla ; preparation:

name: red ruby strawberry sauce ; ingredients: sugar, cornstarch, orange juice concentrate, fresh strawberries, vanilla extract ; preparation:In a large saucepan, combine the sugar and cornstarch. Stir in orange juice concentrate until smooth. Add strawberries. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Remove from the heat. Stir in vanilla. Cool. Store in the refrigerator. ; name: canned green beans that don t taste like canned green beans ; ingredients: green beans, onion, garlic, crushed red pepper flakes, olive oil, soy sauce, red wine vinegar, water, salt and pepper ; preparation:Saute the onion, garlic and crushed red pepper flakes in 2 tablespoons of the olive oil over medium heat until the onions begin to start getting tender. Pour the green beans on top of the onion mixture and cover with a lid. Cook for about 5 minutes on low heat so that the beans can begin to take on the onion flavor. Add in the soy sauce, vinegar and two more tablespoons of the olive oil and half of a cup of water. Stir mixture together and cover with a lid and cook on low heat for 20-30 minutes. Before serving, drizzle the last tablespoon of the olive oil over the beans and season to taste with salt and pepper. ; name: rice fritta ; ingredients: rice, eggs, swiss chard, onion, parsley, rosemary, thyme, salt and pepper, parmesan cheese, olive oil ; preparation:Preheat oven 325f. Cook rice and saut onion. Combine cooked rice, onion, and chard. Add beaten eggs, parsley, rosemary, thyme, salt, pepper and parmesan cheese. Mix well. Put olive oil in glass pan. Pour mixture into pan. Bake 35 to 40 minutes or until firm. ; name: quick and easy garlic soup for one ; ingredients: garlic, extra virgin olive oil, tomatoes, chicken broth, egg, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper, hot sauce ; preparation:In a small saucepan over medium-low heat, saute the garlic until aromatic. Add the tomatoes, and saute for another minute or so, then add the broth. Scramble the egg, parmesean cheese, hot sauce, salt and pepper in a serving bowl. When the broth comes to a boil, add the egg mixture while stirring. Remove from heat, place in a bowl, top with fresh ground pepper, and enjoy. ; name: granny smith cake ; ingredients: walnuts, spice cake mix, instant butterscotch pudding mix, eggs, canola oil, cold water, granny smith apples, golden raisin, icing sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325f. Grease and flour a tube or bundt pan, then sprinkle walnuts in the bottom. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine cake mix, pudding mix, eggs, oil and water. With mixer at medium speed, beat for 3 minutes or until well blended. Stir in chopped apples, plus raisins if desired. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake in preheated oven for 55 to 65 minutes or until a tester inserted in centre comes out clean. Cool in pan for 15 minutes, then turn out onto a rack and cool completely. Dust with icing sugar, if desired. ; name: swiss chard or spinach with pine nuts and raisins ww ; ingredients: raisins, hot water, olive oil, garlic clove, spinach, pine nuts, salt, black pepper ; preparation:

name: oysters with soy and sesame dressing ; ingredients: light soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, sesame oil, oysters, green onions ; preparation:Place the soy sauce, vinegar and oil in a screw-top jar and shake until well combined. Place the oysters on a large serving platter. Drizzle over the soy and sesame dressing. Sprinkle with the green shallots. Serve immediately. ; name: cheesy potato salad ; ingredients: red potatoes, sour cream, mayonnaise, white sugar, green onion, shredded cheddar cheese, bacon bits ; preparation:Place the potatoes into a pot, and fill with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, and cook for about 10 minutes, or until easily pierced with a fork. Drain, and set aside to cool. In a large bowl, mix together the sour cream, mayonnaise, sugar, half of the onions, and half of the cheese. Gently stir in the cooled potatoes. Top with remaining cheese and onions, and sprinkle bacon bits over the top. ; name: kissey face cream cheese cookies ; ingredients: butter, cream cheese, granulated sugar, all-purpose flour, egg, vanilla extract, hershey chocolate kisses ; preparation:Cream butter and cream cheese. Gradually add sugar, beating until light and fluffy. Add flour. Beat well. Stir in egg and vanilla. Shape dough into 1-inch balls. Place 2 inches apart a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 f for 8 minutes. Remove the cookies from the oven and place one unwrapped hershey kiss in the middle of each cookie. Return to oven and bake 5 minutes. Cool 2-3 minutes on cookie sheets before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. ; name: splendiferous guacamole with sour cream dip ; ingredients: avocados, lime juice, hot sauce, sour cream, fresh cilantro, dried cilantro, jalapeno pepper, yellow onion ; preparation:Peel and pit the avocados, then coarsely mash them in a bowl with a fork. Mix in the lime juice, blending well. Add the other ingredients and combine well. Garnish with sour cream and sprinkle a little cilantro on top. May be served at room temperature or chilled. Serve with warm tortilla chilps or veggie dippers. ; name: puffed pancake ; ingredients: eggs, milk, unbleached flour, granulated sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, butter ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 425f. You will need a 12-inch cast iron skillet, or oven-proof skillet, and a blender. In a blender at medium speed, mix together the eggs, milk, flour, granulated sugar, vanilla, and cinnamon, until just combined, about 15 seconds. The batter should be a little bit lumpy. Melt the butter or margarine in a 12-inch cast iron skillet by putting it in the hot oven for about 30 seconds. Remove the skillet from the oven, spread the butter to coat the bottom and sides of the skillet, and pour in the batter. Return the skillet to the center oven rack and bake for about 20 minutes, or until the pancake is puffed and lightly browned. ; name: arby s jamocha shake copycat recipe fat free version ; ingredients: coffee, milk, granulated sugar, fat free vanilla ice cream, fat free chocolate syrup ; preparation:

name: fiesta shrimp and avocado salsa ; ingredients: avocados, roma tomatoes, baby shrimp, spring onions, minced garlic cloves, chili sauce, serrano pepper, lime, cilantro, salt and pepper ; preparation:Mix all ingredients except for avocados. Blend well to incorporate flavors. Finally mix in avocados. Chill till serving. We serve with flour tortillas cut into triangles and deep fried till lightly browned. ; name: brownie recipe adapted from the shomron chef ; ingredients: cocoa, oil, splenda granular, eggs, flour, salt, baking powder, nuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180c or 350f. Mix cocoa and oil. Beat sugar and eggs. Stir in flour, salt, baking powder and nuts or other additions. Bake for 30-35 minutes and cut while warm. ; name: guinness brined pork chops ; ingredients: water, guinness stout, dark brown sugar, light molasses, salt, garlic cloves, black pepper, sage leaves, pork chops ; preparation:For brine, combine water, guinness, brown sugar, molasses and salt. Soak the pork chops in mixture for at least 4 hours overnight is fine. Combine garlic, pepper, salt and sage to create rub. Remove pork chops from brine and pat dry. Rub with the rub mixture on both sides. Grill chops until they are done to your satisfaction. Serve and enjoy. ; name: syrian feta spread ; ingredients: feta cheese, ricotta cheese, butter, garlic clove, dill, parsley, scallion, lemon juice ; preparation:Process feta until it is crumbly. Add garlic, dill, parsley, scallions, lemon juice and process until almost smooth. By hand, blend in the ricotta and butter. Mix well. Can be served at room temperature or chilled. ; name: cream cheese and bacon stuffed mushrooms ; ingredients: bacon, cream cheese, onion, worcestershire sauce, fresh white mushroom ; preparation:Dice bacon and fry until very crisp. Drain on paper towel. Mix onion and worcestershire sauce with softened cream cheese. Add bacon. Mix well. Clean and remove stems from mushrooms. Fill mushroom caps with cream cheese mixture. Mushrooms can be refrigerated at this point, if made in advance. Bake in preheated oven, 375f for 13 to 15 minutes, or until tops are lightly golden. Watch carefully the last few minutes. ; name: asparagus ham potato topper ; ingredients: potatoes, cooked ham, cream of asparagus soup, cheddar cheese ; preparation:

name: macaroni tuna casserole ; ingredients: macaroni and cheese mix, milk, butter, condensed cream of celery soup, canned tuna, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Prepare macaroni and cheese according to package directions. Stir in soup, tuna and milk. Pour into a greased 2-qt. Baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake, uncovered, for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted. ; name: mushroom hotcakes pancakes ; ingredients: olive oil, swiss brown mushrooms, plain flour, baking powder, salt, buttermilk, eggs, chives ; preparation:Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat and add the mushrooms and cook for 10 minutes stirring often until the mushrooms are tender and all moisture has evaporated. Remove to a plate lined with paper towel and set aside to cool. Wipe pan clean. Sift flour, baking powder and salt into a bowl. Whisk buttermilk and eggs in a jug with a fork until well combined. Stir buttermilk mixture into dry ingredients until combined. Stir in mushrooms and chives. Brush frying pan with a little of the oil and heat over medium heat until hot. Using about 2 tablespoons of the mixture per hotcake, spoon mixture into pan and cook for about 2 minutes, until bubbles appear on the surgace and then turn hotcakes and cook for a further 1 to 2 minutes or until golden. Keep warm while cooking the remaining batter. Serve - suggestions given are reduced fat cream cheese or a dollop of tomato chutney and cottage cheese. ; name: easy awesome guacamole ; ingredients: avocados, salsa, sour cream, mayonnaise, onion powder, pepper, salt, garlic, lemon juice, fresh chives ; preparation:Cut avocados in half and take out the seed, scoop out meat with a spoon and place in bowl. Mash the avocado with a fork. Add the salsa, mayonnaise, sour cream, salt, pepper, garlic and onion powder. Mix together well. Add lemon juice, mix and serve. Garnish with fresh chives. ; name: fruit shake ; ingredients: fresh peaches, strawberry, apple juice, vanilla frozen yogurt ; preparation:Combine peaches, strawberries, and apple juice in container of blender or food processor, process until smooth. Add frozen yogurt, and process until blended. Serve immediately. Can exchange fresh peaches with frozen ones. Use 2 cups frozen peach slices. ; name: pan seared t bone steak ; ingredients: beef t-bone steaks, kosher salt, black pepper, canola oil ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 450 degrees f. A half-hour before cooking, remove steak from refrigerator. Heat a large skillet over high heat. Pat steak dry and season generously with salt and pepper. Add oil to hot skillet and when it begins to smoke add steak. Reduce heat slightly and cook steak until browned, about 4 minutes on each side. Transfer skillet to the oven. Roast until an instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into the steak registers 120 degrees f for medium-rare, about 6 to 8 minutes. Transfer steak to a cutting board and let it rest for 10 minutes. Cut steak from the bone and carve meat across the grain. ; name: blue corn chile bacon muffins ; ingredients: flour, blue cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, salt, buttermilk, egg, butter, bacon bits, jalapenos ; preparation:

name: cotter s kettle ; ingredients: chicken stock, carrots, leek, rutabagas, bratwursts, salt and pepper ; preparation:Bring the vegetables to a boil in chicken stock. Reduce heat to simmer and cook for 15 to 20 minutes or until vegetables are fork tender. Remove the skin from sausage, cut in thick slices, and add to vegetables. Adjust salt and pepper to taste and simmer covered for a few minutes. Serve with coarse grain mustard, dark rye bread and boiled potatoes. ; name: crunchy peanut butter wraps ; ingredients: flour tortillas, peanut butter, granny smith apple, granola cereal ; preparation:Spread peanut butter over each tortilla. Warm in the microwave for 10-15 seconds. Sprinkle with chopped apple and granola. Roll up tortillas and cut in half. Enjoy. ; name: buffalo stew tanka me a lo ; ingredients: celery, stewed tomatoes, buffalo stew meat, water, red potatoes, barley ; preparation:Brown the buffalo cubes on high heat until seared about 3 minutes. Add 4 quarts of water, potatoes and boil until veggies are tender. Add stewed tomatoes and celery and barley cook an additional 5 minutes. Remove from fire and place into baking dish. Bake at 425f for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and enjoy. ; name: sugar hill inn s sour cream maple muffins ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, unsalted butter, maple syrup, sour cream, egg, raisins ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Butter standard muffin tins. In a small bowl, stir and toss the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Set aside. In a medium bowl, beat the butter until smooth then slowly add the maple syrup, beating constantly. Beat in the sour cream and egg. Fold in the raisins. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, and stir until just blended. Spoon mixture into the prepared muffin tins, filling each cup about two-thirds full. Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 15 - 18 minutes. Cool in the tin for 5 minutes, then remove. ; name: simple spiced cider ; ingredients: apple cider, whole cloves, ground nutmeg, cinnamon sticks ; preparation:Heat all ingredients to boiling in 3-quart saucepan over medium-high heat. Reduce heat. Simmer uncovered 10 minutes. Strain cider mixture to remove cloves and cinnamon if desired. Serve hot. ; name: crispy eggplant aubergine fingers ; ingredients: eggplant, seasoned bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, salt, celery salt, pepper, eggs, milk, olive oil ; preparation:

name: vikki s cheese fries ; ingredients: frozen french fries, butter, flour, milk, shredded cheddar cheese, ketchup ; preparation:Cook fries accoding to package directions. Melt butter in a saucepan and then whisk in flour to form a roux. Whisk milk into pot. Then stir in cheese and stir until thick and well mixed. Add in ketchup and serve cheese over fries. ; name: field salad with snow peas grapes and feta ; ingredients: white wine vinegar, fresh orange juice, extra virgin olive oil, sugar, salt, fresh ground black pepper, gourmet salad greens, snow peas, red seedless grapes, feta cheese ; preparation:Combine first 6 ingredients in a small bowl. Stir well with a whisk. Combine remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Drizzle dressing over salad. Toss well. ; name: fiesta tacos ; ingredients: lean ground beef, mccormick taco seasoning mix, water, taco shells ; preparation:Brown meat in large skillet on medium-high heat. Drain fat. Stir in seasoning mix and water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Spoon into warmed taco shells. Serve with assorted toppings. ; name: chicken taco fettuccine ; ingredients: fettuccine pasta, cooked chicken, garlic, olive oil, heavy whipping cream, taco seasoning, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium heat, cook the chicken and garlic in oil for 4 to 5 minutes or until heated through. Whisk in cream and taco seasoning until blended. Cook until heated through, do not boil. Stir in parmesan cheese. Drain pasta, toss with chicken mixture. ; name: mung bean stew ; ingredients: mung beans, onion, turmeric powder, cumin, gluten-free vegetable bouillon cubes, carrots, butternut squash, celery, tamari soy sauce, coriander leaves ; preparation:Method. Rinse the mung beans thoroughly and drain. Place the onion, mung beans, turmeric, cumin and vegetable stock cube in a saucepan with 750ml water and bring to the boil. Simmer for 30 minutes. Add the carrot, celery, squash and tamari and simmer for 10 minutes. Serve with brown rice and sprinkled with coriander leaves. To turn this into a soup for the next day, add more water, extra fresh herbs of your choice, some more stock and blend until smooth. Fabulous. ; name: spicy sun dried tomato and feta sauce ; ingredients: sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, garlic, crushed tomatoes, kalamata olive, sugar, fresh basil, feta cheese, parmesan cheese, dry pasta ; preparation:

name: 2blueberry pineapple ring ; ingredients: berry gelatin, water, blueberries in light syrup, crushed pineapple ; preparation:Completely dissolve gelatin in boiling water by gently stirring for 3-4 minutes. Let cool to room temperature. Stir in blueberries and crushed pineapple. Pour into a bundt pan sprayed with non-stick cooking spray. Refrigerate for 4 hours or longer to congeal. To loosen ring from mold, place mold in larger bowl of hot water for a few seconds, then remove by placing the serving platter on top, and flip over. ; name: spinach and shrimp ; ingredients: shrimp, garlic, butter, fresh parmesan cheese, baby spinach, lemon juice ; preparation:Boil shrimp till pink. Drain and set aside. Saute garlic in butter till barely brown. Add shrimp back into pan, along with parmesan. Turn off heat but leave pan on burner. For gas turn lowest. Add spinach and stir, till barely barely limp. If desired, add lemon juice. Serve with dressing. ; name: the best no kidding buttermilk pancakes ; ingredients: eggs, buttermilk, baking soda, baking powder, salt, flour, sugar, unsalted butter ; preparation:Beat the yolks until pale and smooth. Beat in the buttermilk and then the baking soda and mix well. Sift in the dry ingredients mixing as you add. Make sure the batter is smooth. Add in the melted butter and mix well. Beat the egg whites in another bowl until stiff. Fold into the batter until no bits of white are visible. Let batter stand about 20 minutes before making pancakes. Make sure your griddle is really hot. Ladle batter onto griddle. Turn when bubbles form across the cakes and allow to lightly brown on the second side. Serve with warm maple syrup and sweet butter. ; name: italian chicken pasta toss ; ingredients: spaghetti, italian salad dressing, olive oil, tomatoes, cooked chicken, parmesan cheese ; preparation:In a large pot with boiling salted water cook pasta until al dente. Drain. In a large saucepan heat the italian dressing and olive oil together over medium heat. Add drained spaghetti. Toss well to coat. Add chopped tomatoes, cooked chicken, and grated parmesan cheese and toss lightly. Serve warm. ; name: texas crock pot roast ; ingredients: beef chuck, salt, black pepper, paprika, garlic clove, oil, beef broth, onion, bottled chili sauce ; preparation:Mix together salt, pepper, paprika and garlic and rub into roast. Cover and chill to marinate. Brown well on both sides in oil, then place in crock pot and add beef broth and onions. Cook 6 to 8 hours on low or until tender. Add chili sauce the last hour of cooking. ; name: salmon with orange marmalade ; ingredients: orange marmalade, low sodium soy sauce, garlic cloves, salmon fillets, salt ; preparation:

name: lolo s whiskey sour the best ; ingredients: whiskey, lemon juice, sugar, water, maraschino cherries, maraschino cherry juice ; preparation:Combine lemon juice and sugar. Add water and stir until sugar is dissolved. Add 4 teaspoons cherry juice from the jar. Pour one jigger, whiskey to each of two ice filled glasses. Fill both glasses with the sour mixture. Top with cherries. ; name: cream of morel mushroom soup ; ingredients: morel, chicken stock, heavy cream, celery, onion, black pepper, kosher salt, butter, flour, olive oil ; preparation:Cook onions and the celery in the olive oil. Stir often till soft. Add morel mushrooms and cook about 6 to 7 more minutes. Add butter and slowly stir in the flour. Now add the chicken stock, salt and pepper. Bring to a low boil, reduce to a simmer and cook 10 to 15 more minutes. Add heavy cream and continue to cook another 10 minutes. ; name: pig eatin good cake ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, mandarin oranges, eggs, oil, cool whip, crushed pineapple, instant vanilla pudding ; preparation:Mix cake mix with undrained mandarin oranges, eggs and oil. Bake in 13 x 9 inch greased and floured pan at 350 for 30-35 minutes. Let cool mix coolwhip, drained pineapple and instant pudding together. Frost cooled cake. Store in refrigerator. ; name: cranberry truffles ; ingredients: fresh cranberries, light corn syrup, water, butter, sweetened condensed milk, unsweetened cocoa, powdered sugar ; preparation:In a medium saucepan, combine cranberries, corn syrup and water. Cook stirring until berries are popped and mixture is thickened. Let cool. In a heavy saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Stir in cocoa then condensed milk. Stir until mixture thickens. Stir in cooled cranberries. Refrigerate 3 to 4 hours or until well chilled. Shape into one inch balls. Roll in powdered sugar. Store in refrigerator. ; name: garden veggies and beef salad ; ingredients: lean ground beef, hot water, hamburger helper mix for beef pasta, garlic clove, head lettuce, green bell pepper, red onion, cherry tomatoes, italian dressing, italian seasoning ; preparation:In a large skillet brown ground beef, stirring occasionally. When browned, add hot water, uncooked pasta, sauce mix and garlic and bring to boil. Reduce heat, cover skillet and simmer 10 minutes. Uncover and simmer 5 minutes longer stirring occasionally. Let cool 5 minutes. Add remaining ingredients and beef mixture to large bowl. Toss and serve immediately. ; name: sauteed sweetbreads lamb or veal ; ingredients: lamb sweetbreads, salt, vinegar, bacon, flour, garlic powder, butter, oil ; preparation:

name: i miss my desserts tropical fruit and yogurt something ; ingredients: unflavored gelatin, cold water, fat-free cottage cheese, nonfat yogurt, artificial sweetener, coconut flavoring, ground allspice, mango, banana ; preparation:In a small bowl, sprinkle gelatin over cold water and let stand for 1 minute to soften. Then heat in microwave for high for 30 seconds. Stir until gelatin is dissolved. Cool completely. Place cottage cheese and yogurt in blender. Process until smooth. Add splenda and coconut flavoring. With blender on low, gradually add cooled gelatin, blending well. Place fruit in 4 small serving dishes or containers. Pour gelatin mixture over the fruit. Sprinkle with allspice. Cover and chill until set. ; name: barbecued spiced lime corn on the cob ; ingredients: corn cobs, limes, salt, cayenne pepper ; preparation:Pull the husks back from the corn, then remove and discard the silks. Rub each cob with a wedge of lime the fold back the husks to cover the kernels. Cook over medium hot coals for about 10 mins turning frequently until the corn is dark golden and the kernels tender. Mix together the salt and the cayenne pepper. Pull the husks away from the corn and sprinkle over the salt mixture. Serve with a wedge of lime for extra rubbing. ; name: grandma s pecan balls from aunt katie ; ingredients: flour, ground pecans, butter, sugar, superfine sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Cream butter with sugar. Add flour and pecans, mix well. Roll into balls, about the size of a large gumball, and place on a cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes, or until very lightly browned. While still warm, roll in superfine sugar - this is important because the dough does not have much sugar. ; name: strawberry jello pie ; ingredients: 10-inch baked pie shells, strawberries, strawberry jell-o gelatin dessert, vanilla pudding mix, water, cool whip ; preparation:Place strawberries in the pie shell. Set aside. Mix jello and pudding with water. Heat to a full boil, then remove from heat. Pour over berries and chill. Top with 1 t. Cool whip, if desired. ; name: roasted garlic and tomato savoury custard ; ingredients: cherry tomatoes, bulb of garlic, olive oil, italian seasoning, salt, pepper, eggs, milk, flour, provolone cheese ; preparation:Arrange tomatoes single layer in 1. 5 litre casserole dish. Sprinkle on the garlic slices. Add oil, seasonings and toss to coat. Roast in 425f oven about 20 minutes or until tomato skins start to shrivel. Remove from oven and reduce oven temperature to 350f. In bowl, whisk together eggs, milk and flour. Pour over tomato mixture. Sprinkle with provolone cheese. Bake 40-45 minutes or until puffed and golden. ; name: spiced pork chops squash and apples ; ingredients: boneless pork chops, cooking apple, acorn squash, apple juice, maple syrup, cinnamon, nutmeg, brown rice ; preparation:

name: better for you egg salad ; ingredients: hard-boiled eggs, celery, onion, green pepper, fat-free mayonnaise, spicy brown mustard, table salt, black pepper ; preparation:Peel and rinse eggs. Discard two of the egg yolks. Chop remaining 4 whites and 2 yolks. Mix remaining ingredients. Refrigerate any leftovers, or chill. ; name: spicy sweet barbecued beans vegan ; ingredients: dried kidney beans, water, onion, garlic cloves, tomato sauce, dark brown sugar, smoked paprika, ground cinnamon, chipotle chiles in adobo, soy sauce ; preparation:I soaked the beans the day before in a crock pot. Later in the day i drained the soaking water and replaced with fresh water then cooked the beans overnight on low in the crock pot. The next day i drained the beans and proceeded with the recipe. Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Dump everything in a lightly oiled casserole dish, cover and bake in a low oven for about 2-3 hours, stirring about once an hour. If the beans look like they may be drying out, you can stir in a small amount of leftover bean liquid or some broth. ; name: bourbon mustard glazed pork chops ; ingredients: olive oil, pork chops, salt and pepper, grainy mustard, stock, honey, butter, bourbon ; preparation:Preheat oven 400. Place large oven skillet over medium high heat with 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Season the chops and sear until deep golden brown. When chops are seared, add 1 tablespoon olive oil along with the mustard, stock, honey and butter. When liquids come up to a bubble, pour bourbon into the skillet, remove from heat and carefully flame with a lighter. Or just continue boiling the sauce and the alcohol will cook away. Season the sauce with salt and pepper, and continue cooking until it starts to thicken, 2-3 minutes. Flip the chops over and transfer the entire pan to the oven to finish cooking, about 5 minutes. ; name: crisp sage and parmesan pork ; ingredients: pork loin steaks, white bread, sage leaf, parmesan cheese, black pepper, egg, oil ; preparation:Lay the pork steaks between two sheets of cling film and bash them with a rolling pin until approximately 1 cm thick. Whiz the bread in a food processor to make bread crumbs. Add the sage leaves. Pulse a few times to roughly chop the leaves. Mix in the grated parmesan. Pour onto a large plate. Season with black pepper. One by one, dip the steaks into the beaten egg, allowing the excess to drip off. Press steaks into the bread crumb mixture on both sides. Heat the oil in a large non stick frying pan. Fry the steaks for 3 to 4 minutes on each side until cooked through. ; name: almond poppy seed muffins ; ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, milk, vegetable oil, eggs, almond extract, poppy seeds ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Grease, spray, or placed liners in muffin tins to hold 24 muffins. Combine flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Add milk, eggs, oil, and almond extract. Whisk until smooth. Gently stir in poppyseeds. Fill muffin tins and bake for 25- 30 minutes. ; name: southwestern scrambled eggs ; ingredients: butter, country ham, red bell pepper, eggs, heavy cream, salt, pepper, chili powder, garlic powder, cheddar cheese ; preparation:

name: ginger lime salmon ; ingredients: salmon fillets, extra virgin olive oil, salt, cracked black pepper, lemons, ginger, limes ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Rub a 10 ounce skinless salmon fillet with just enough olive oil to coat. Place in a 10-inch nonstick skillet with an ovenproof handle. Season with salt and pepper, a squeeze of lemon or lime, and freshly grated ginger or garlic to taste. Bake 12-15 minutes or until firm to the touch or to your liking. ; name: black bean nachos with chipotle tabasco ; ingredients: black beans, ground cumin, tabasco brand chipotle pepper sauce, tortilla chips, red onion, tomatoes, shredded cheddar cheese, cilantro ; preparation:In a bowl, combine beans, cumin and tabasco brand chipotle pepper sauce and mix well. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spread tortilla chips in a single layer over large baking sheet with edges slightly overlapping. Spoon approximately one teaspoonful of black beans onto each corn chip and top with onion, tomato, and cheese. Bake in oven 6 to 8 minutes or until cheese melts and nachos are heated through. Sprinkle with the fresh cilantro. Serve hot. ; name: nora ephron s mashed potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, heavy cream, butter, salt, pepper ; preparation:Put potato in a large pot of salted water and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer for 20 minutes, until tender. Drain and place potatoes back in the pot over low heat and shake the pan to remove excess moisture. Peel. Put through a potato ricer and immediately add 1 tablespoons of heavy cream and add as much melted butter and salt and pepper as you feel like. Eat immediately. ; name: moroccan fried eggs with cumin and salt ; ingredients: eggs, olive oil, salt, cumin ; preparation:Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the eggs, break the yolks with a spatula, and allow the eggs to set. Occasionally lift the edges of the eggs to let the uncooked egg run underneath. This allows more egg to make contact with the pan for faster cooking. When the eggs have cooked, sprinkle with salt and cumin, and serve. ; name: english style baked chips ; ingredients: baking potatoes, water, canola oil, cooking spray, lemon pepper, kosher salt ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Scrub potato with a brush. Cut potato crosswise into 40 very thin slices using mandoline slicer or very sharp knife. Combine potato slices and hot water in a large bowl. Let stand 10 minutes. Drain. Arrange potato slices on a layer of paper towels. Pat dry. Coat 2 jelly roll pans evenly with oil. Arrange potato slices in a single layer on pans. Coat potato slices with cooking spray, and sprinkle evenly with lemon pepper and salt. Bake at 400 degrees for 18 minutes or until lightly browned. ; name: flapjacks ; ingredients: light muscovado sugar, butter, golden syrup, honey, porridge oats ; preparation:

name: molded corned beef spread ; ingredients: cream cheese, corned beef, dijon mustard, prepared horseradish, mayonnaise ; preparation:Spray mold of your choice with non-stick cooking spray. In food processor, combine cream cheese, corned beef, mustard, horseradish and mayonnaise. Pulse until all ingredients are fully combined, then pour into mold. Chill the mold least 6 hours. To serve, unmold onto serving dish and line with crackers to serve. ; name: 7 up cake ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, flour, lemon extract, 7-up soda ; preparation:Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in flour. Beat in lemon extract and 7up. Pour batter into well greased and floured 12 cup fluted mold. Bake at 325 degrees for 60 minutes to an hour and 25 minutes. Cool. Dust with conf. Sugar if desired. ; name: grilled honey garlic pork chops ; ingredients: ketchup, honey, soy sauce, garlic, boneless pork chops, salt and pepper ; preparation:Combine ketchup, honey, soy sauce and garlic. Set aside. Lightly season pork with salt and pepper. Brush each chop with sauce to coat. Cook chops on greased grill 4 to 6 inches from medium-hot coals or on medium setting, basting with sauce often, for about 5 minutes on each side or until meat is cooked through. ; name: cilantro dressing for salads ; ingredients: garlic cloves, salt, cilantro, parsley, sherry wine vinegar, olive oil, hot pepper sauce, sugar ; preparation:Using your steel knife in the food processor mix garlic and salt. Process until it is a paste. Add cilantro and parsley. Process to a fine mince. Add vinegar. Process for 10 seconds. Add oil in a slow steady stream with the processor on. Add hot pepper sauce and a pinch of sugar. Chill the dressing for several hours in a glass jar. Shake to combine before using. ; name: banana lemon tea bread ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, bananas, fresh lemon juice, all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, fresh lemon zest ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Butter a 9 x 5 x 3 inch loaf pan. Cream butter with sugar for 6 minutes, until light. Beat in eggs, one at a time. Blend in bananas and lemon juice. Sift together flour, baking soda and salt. Blend into banana mixture along with lemon zest. Turn into prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour or until tested done. Remove, cool for 15 minutes and turn out of pan. Cool completely. ; name: amy s special raspberry jam bars ; ingredients: sugar cookie mix, egg, oil, water, white chocolate chips, milk, cream cheese frosting, sugar-free raspberry jam ; preparation:

name: caramel frosting ; ingredients: unsalted butter, powdered sugar, light brown sugar, milk, dark corn syrup, vanilla ; preparation:In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter until smooth. Add in the sugars. Beat on low for 2 minutes. Add in the milk, syrup, and vanilla. Beat 3-5 minutes until smooth and creamy. Use immediately or store, covered, at room temperature for up to 2 days. Reportedly, the icing tastes better if made the day before because the brown sugar gives the icing a slightly grainy texture that improves if allowed to set overnight. ; name: oven crusty fish ; ingredients: egg, water, tabasco sauce, salt, fish fillets, corn flake crumbs, butter ; preparation:Combine egg, water, tabasco, and salt, beat until well blended. Dip fish fillets in egg mixture. Coat generously with corn flake crumbs. Place on foil-lined baking sheet. Drizzle with melted butter. Bake at 375 degrees for 20-30 minutes. ; name: capirotada ; ingredients: piloncillo cones, water, cinnamon sticks, green onions, french bread, soft margarine, raisins, pecans, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Combine water, piloncillos, cinnamon sticks and green onions in large pot or dutch oven. Bring to a boil and cook until the piloncillos are dissolved and the syrup is dark from the spices. Taste- you may want to add additional brown sugar or spices depending on your personal tastes. Remove from heat and take out onions and cinnamon sticks. Toast the french bread. Spread margarine liberally on both sides of toast. Layer toast, cheese, raisins, and nuts in 2 9x13 pans, repeating until both pans are full, ending with a layer of cheese, raisins and nuts. Pour the syrup over the top, dividing evenly between both pans, and making sure that all the bread is moistened. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 30 to 40 minutes. Serve hot or cold. Store in the refrigerator. ; name: honey mustard pork tenderloin ; ingredients: pork tenderloin, honey, dijon mustard, olive oil, garlic, dried oregano leaves ; preparation:Heat oven to 425. Line baking sheet with foil. Place pork in pan. In small bowl, mix remaining ingredients. Brush over pork tenderloin. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until pork has slight blush of pink in center and meat thermometer inserted reads 160. Let stand 5 minutes. Cut diagonally into slices. ; name: cheese tortellini with vegetables ; ingredients: cheese tortellini, extra virgin olive oil, red onion, red pepper, sun-dried tomatoes, broccoli, dry white wine, lemon juice, tarragon, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Spray a nonstick skillet with non-fat cooking spray. On medium heat, saute onion and pepper for about 10 minutes. Stir in chopped broccoli. Pour in the lemon juice and wine. Add the tarragon. Cover and cook over low heat for about 15 minutes. Prepare tortellini according to package directions while veggies are cooking. Stir the olive oil and sun-dried tomatoes with the veggie mixture. Serve over prepared tortellini. ; name: grandmothers famous cranberry bread ; ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, baking soda, butter, eggs, orange peel, orange juice, cranberries ; preparation:

name: p90x beef and broccoli stir fry ; ingredients: soy sauce, red onion, garlic, top sirloin steaks, sesame oil, rice vinegar, ginger, broccoli florets ; preparation:Bring 2 quarts of water to a boil. Meanwhile, heat a small amount of soy sauce in a large saut pan, add the onions and garlic, and saut until opaque. Add beef and saut, turning often with tongs, for 7 to 10 minutes. Stir together the oil, vinegar, and ginger and add to the saut mixture. Blanch broccoli in the boiling water. Add to the meat mixture and keep warm. Prepare soba noodles according to package directions. Drain, toss with the beef and broccoli, and serve. ; name: vegan chocolate mocha pie ; ingredients: water, agar-agar flakes, instant espresso, firm silken tofu, maple syrup, unsweetened cocoa powder, vanilla extract, sea salt, vegan pie crusts ; preparation:In a small saucepan, combine water and agar-agar flakes and bring to a boil. Gently simmer until agar has dissolved completely, about 5 minutes. Add espresso and stir until dissolved. Cool slightly. In a food processor or blender, blend tofu, maple syrup, cocoa powder, vanilla, salt and cooled espresso mixture until completely smooth. Pour into the prepared pie shell. Refrigerate for several hours or overnight until firm. Serve topped with non-dairy topping. ; name: creamy shrimp salad on romaine ; ingredients: shrimp, celery, egg whites, walnuts, onions, fat-free thousand island salad dressing, romaine lettuce ; preparation:In a large bowl, combine the shrimp, celery, egg whites, walnuts and onions. Add the dressing and stir until the shrimp-mixture is coated. Cover and chill in the refrigerator about 30 minutes to blend the flavors. To serve, divide the lettuce among four plates. Then top with shrimp mixture. ; name: grilled provolone tomato and oregano sandwich ; ingredients: baguette, olive oil, dried oregano, garlic powder, provolone cheese, beefsteak tomatoes, salt and pepper ; preparation:Use a serrated knife to slice off the domed top of the baguette, removing just a half inch or so. Then slice the baguette in half horizontally. Combine the olive oil, oregano and garlic powder in a small bowl. Drizzle the mixture over both baguette halves. Preheat the grill to medium. Arrange half the cheese slices over the bottom half of the baguette, followed by the tomato slices. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper, then add the remaining provolone. Top with the remaining baguette half. Grill the sandwiches for about 3 minutes, until the cheese melts. Cut the sandwich into 4 pieces and serve immediately. ; name: evil jungle prince with tofu ; ingredients: bird chiles, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, peanut oil, coconut milk, tofu, fresh basil leaves, thai fish sauce, cabbage ; preparation:Pound the peppers, lemongrass and lime leaves to a paste. Heat the oil in a skillet and add the paste. Fry until fragrant. Add the chicken or tofu and cook until chicken is cooked through. Add the basil and fish sauce to taste. Serve on thinly shredded cabbage. ; name: kahlua crunch coconut cake ; ingredients: semi-sweet chocolate chips, pecan pieces, yellow cake mix, kahlua, half-and-half, egg, egg substitute, sweetened flaked coconut ; preparation:

name: fantastic meat lasagna ; ingredients: extra lean ground beef, tomato paste, crushed tomatoes, pasta sauce, ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, dry basil, lasagna noodles, salt & pepper ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 375 degrees. In a non-stick skillet brown meat with salt and pepper. When browned stir in basil, tomato paste, crushed tomatoes, pasta sauce, ricotta and parmesan, and simmer for a couple of minutes. Place 3 lasagna noodles on the bottom of bake dish and top with half the sauce. Add another layer of noodles and then the remaining sauce. Top with mozzarella cheese and cover dish with foil. Bake for 45 minutes, remove from oven and let sit for 15 minutes before serving. ; name: mandarin jell o salad ; ingredients: orange jell-o, boiling water, lemon juice, mandarin oranges, pineapple tidbits, orange sherbet, miniature marshmallow, whipped topping ; preparation:Add lemon juice to boiling water, then add water to jell-o. Stir in sherbet until dissolved. Mix oranges, pineapple, marshmallows and whipped topping together. Fold into mixture. Chill for two hours. ; name: easy canned green beans ; ingredients: cut green beans, white vinegar, beef bouillon cube, water, vegetable oil ; preparation:Pour green beans into small cooking pot. Add water, vinegar, boulion cube and oil. Bring to a boil. Turn down to medium. Simmer for approximatly 45 minutes, or until most all the liquid has evaporated. ; name: ham quiche ; ingredients: cooked ham, red bell pepper, green onion, swiss cheese, all-purpose flour, half-and-half, eggs, pie crusts ; preparation:Mix ham, bell pepper, green onion, cheese and flour. Toss all ingredients lightly. Mix half-and-half gently into eggs. Still gently. Fold ham mixture into egg mixture. Pour this mixture into unbaked pie shell. Bake 10 minutes at 425 degrees, and then lower heat to 325 degrees and bake 20 minutes more or till done. ; name: lovely simple bolognese sauce ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, carrot, garlic, ground beef, crushed tomatoes, fresh italian parsley, fresh basil leaves, romano cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Saute onion and garlic in large pan till soft. Add carrot and celery and cook a few minutes, then add beef and saute on higher heat for about 8 minutes. Add parsley, basil and tomatoes and cook until sauce gets thick. Season with salt and pepper. Top off with romano cheese. Optional- sometimes i add just a touch of jar marinara sauce at the end to give it a saucier consistency. ; name: asparagus with toasted almonds ; ingredients: asparagus, almonds, extra virgin olive oil, garlic cloves, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:

name: chocolate covered pretzels ; ingredients: semisweet chocolate, vegetable shortening, pretzels, white chocolate ; preparation:Cover a baking sheet with waxed paper. In a double broiler set over simmering water, melt the semisweet chocolate with 2 teaspoons shortening, stirring gently constantly. Remove from heat. Using tongs dip each pretzel in chocolate allowing excess to drip off. Place onto waxed paper. If you are sprinkling any toppings on do it right after dipping into the chocolate so it will stick. Place the coated pretzels in the refrigerator to harden. After the pretzels have hardened place the white chocolate in a double boiler and melt over simmering water. Drizzle the white chocolate in small strands over each pretzel. Return to waxed paper and refrigerate. ; name: ham and swiss double pinwheels pillsbury ; ingredients: lean ham, neufchatel cheese, refrigerated crescent dinner rolls, reduced-fat parmesan cheese, reduced-fat swiss cheese, green onions ; preparation:Heat oven to 350f spray cookie sheet with cooking spray. In food processor bowl with metal blade, process ham and cream cheese until smooth and well blended. Unroll dough into 1 large rectangle. Press into 13x8-inch rectangle, firmly pressing perforations to seal. Spread ham mixture over rectangle. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese, swiss cheese and onions. Starting with both short sides of rectangle, roll up both towards center. With serrated knife, cut into 16 slices. Place cut side down on cookie sheet. Bake 13 to 17 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Immediately remove from cookie sheet. Serve warm. ; name: scotch butterscotch sauce ; ingredients: light brown sugar, heavy cream, unsalted butter, dark corn syrup, scotch whisky, vanilla ; preparation:In a medium saucepan, bring the sugar, cream, butter and corn syrup to a boil over medium heat stirring constantly. Lower heat and boil gently, stirring often, until sauce thickens and coats the back of a wooden spoon. Remove from heat and stir in whiskey and vanilla. Allow to cool slightly before serving. Can be refrigerated up to one week. Warm gently before serving. ; name: aunt pauline s fruit salad ; ingredients: mandarin oranges, pineapple tidbits, mini marshmallows, sour cream, nuts, maraschino cherries, shredded coconut ; preparation:Drain the juice from all the fruits. Discard, or use for something else. Put sour cream in bowl. Add remaining ingredients in the following order, stirring to blend after each ingredient is added - pineapple, marshmallows, nuts, mandarin oranges, cherries. Add coconut last. ; name: rainbow popcorn balls ; ingredients: butter, marshmallows, popped popcorn, jello gelatin ; preparation:Melt butter and marshmallows over low heat. Add jello and stir well to combine. Put popcorn in a large bowl and pour this mixture over, mixing well to be sure to coat all popcorn. When cool enough to handle, butter your hands and form into balls. Wrap balls in plastic wrap to show off the color. ; name: granny s rice pudding ; ingredients: cooked rice, eggs, sugar, milk, flour, margarine, vanilla ; preparation:

name: arabian spinach ; ingredients: onion, oil, garlic, spinach, cumin, chickpeas, butter ; preparation:In a large wok, fry onion in oil for about 5 minutes, until softened. Add the garlic and cumin, and then fry for another minute. Add spinach in stages, stirring until leaves begin to wilt. Stir in chickpeas, butter and salt and pepper to taste. Reheat. ; name: mushrooms with sour cream ; ingredients: fresh mushrooms, butter, all-purpose flour, sour cream, salt, pepper, dill weed ; preparation:Cook and stir mushrooms in butter for 3 minutes. Stir in flour. Cook and stir for 1 minute. Stir in sour cream, salt and pepper. Heat, stirring occasionally, just until hot. Sprinkle with dill weed. ; name: corn and bacon pancakes ; ingredients: yellow cornmeal, all-purpose flour, sugar, double-acting baking powder, salt, fresh corn kernels, eggs, milk, unsalted butter, lean bacon ; preparation:In a bowl whisk together the cornmeal, the flour, the sugar, the baking powder, and the salt. In a blender pure coarse the corn. In another bowl whisk together the corn pure, the eggs, the milk, and 2 tablespoons of the melted butter, add the egg mixture to the cornmeal mixture, and stir the batter until it is just combined. Let the batter stand, covered, for 10 minutes and stir in the bacon, crumbled. Heat a griddle over moderate heat until it is hot and brush it lightly with some of the melted butter. Working in batches, pour the batter onto the griddle and cook the pancakes for 1 minute on each side, or until they are golden, transferring them as they are cooked to a heated platter and brushing the griddle with some of the additional melted butter as necessary. ; name: peach melba jam ; ingredients: peaches, sugar, fresh raspberry, chambord raspberry liquor ; preparation:Combine peaches and sugar in a saucepan. Cover and let stand at least an hour to macerate, tossing once or twice. Cook over low heat until sugar dissolves and mixture darkens and turns clear, 25 to 30 minutes stirring as needed to keep from sticking add raspberries, continue cooking over low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is thick, about 10 minutes. Stir in chambord and remove from heat. Immediately pour into 2 hot sterilized 1 pint canning jars. Once jars are sealed, let them cool completely upside down on top of a clean kitchen towel, and store in the fridge or in the freezer. ; name: roasted potatoes and baby carrots with garlic ; ingredients: red potatoes, baby carrots, garlic cloves, olive oil, coarse salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Dry the veggies well with a paper towel and place in a large bowl. Prepare a large non-stick baking sheet, you can line with foil and spray the foil liberally with cooking spray. In a small bowl combine olive oil, chopped garlic, coarse salt and black pepper. Mix well to combine. Pour over the veggies and toss to coat with a wooden spoon or clean hands. Set oven to 400 degrees f. Roast in oven for about 30 minutes or until the potatoes are fork-tender, tossing occasionally with a spatula. ; name: homemade chicken shake bake coating ; ingredients: fine breadcrumbs, flour, paprika, margarine, salt, poultry seasoning, pepper ; preparation:

name: kale with tomatoes and green chiles ; ingredients: kale, garlic, yellow onions, olive oil, tomatoes and green chilies, salt, pepper ; preparation:Rinse the kale and remove the fibrous middle rib, slice the leaves into ribbons. Over medium heat, saute the garlic in the olive oil until fragrant. Then add the onions and saute together, stirring constantly until the onions are limp. Do not allow the garlic or onions to brown. Add the kale and saute for 15-20 minutes or until tender, stirring frequently to prevent the greens from scorching. Add the tomatoes and green chiles and salt and pepper to taste, stirring everything together and cooking until heated through--about 1-2 minutes. Serve over rice or combine with blackeyed peas or refried beans and rice to make a tasty and hearty filling for vegetarian wraps. ; name: the ultimate salmon fillets ; ingredients: salmon fillet, sour cream, prepared mustard, onions, dried dill weed, mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, cheddar cheese, paprika ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450 degrees. If frozen, partially thaw fillets and cut into serving size pieces. Place in a greased baking dish. Combine sour cream or yogurt, mustard, onion, dill, and mayonnaise. Season with salt and pepper. Spread mixture over fish. Bake 20 minutes per inch of thickness of fish if frozen or 10-12 minutes if thawed. When just done, sprinkle with the cheeses and a dash of paprika. Broil 1 minute or until the cheese is bubbly and flecked with brown. Serve with lemon wedges. ; name: peanut butter pudding ; ingredients: sugar, cornstarch, salt, milk, half-and-half, creamy peanut butter, vanilla extract, whipped cream, chocolate curls ; preparation:Combine first 3 ingredients in a medium-size heavy saucepan. Gradually whisk in milk and half-and-half. Bring to a boil over medium heat, whisking constantly. Boil, whisking constantly, 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add peanut butter and vanilla, whisking until smooth. Pour into a bowl. Place plastic wrap directly over warm pudding. Chill 2 hours. Garnish, if desired. ; name: natural non dairy pink frosting ; ingredients: coconut oil, powdered sugar, vanilla, coconut milk, cherry preserves ; preparation:Cream coconut oil until light. Add vanilla and sugar. Mix well. Add coconut milk and preserves. Beat on high until creamy. ; name: beer cheese logs ; ingredients: cream cheese, cheddar cheese, fresh italian parsley, paprika, beer, toasted almond ; preparation:Beat cream cheese, and cheddar. Add snipped fresh parsley and paprika. Beat until combined. Gradually beat in the warmed beer and beat until nearly smooth. Cover and chill one hour. Mould with hands and shape into a log. Insert almonds along the top. Some times i add a little more beer and spoon into little crocks-- chill 3 to 24 hours. ; name: pork tenderloin with cranberry and porto wine sauce ; ingredients: butter, pork tenderloin, onion, fresh cranberries, wine, liquid honey, dried rosemary, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: one dish chicken rice bake ; ingredients: cream soup, water, white rice, paprika, pepper, boneless chicken breast halves ; preparation:Mix soup, water, rice, paprika, and pepper in 2-qt. Shallow baking dish. Top with chicken. Season with additional paprika and pepper. Cover. Bake at 375 f for 45 minutes or until done. ; name: cornmeal crusted chicken legs ; ingredients: cornmeal, breadcrumbs, cayenne pepper, salt & freshly ground black pepper, chicken legs, dijon mustard, liquid honey ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Combine the cornmeal, breadcrumbs cayenne, salt and pepper in a shallow sided dish. Brush the chicken all over wth the mustard. Place the chicken in the crust mixture and pat the mixture onto the chicken to coat it on all sides. Set on a baking sheet skin side down and bake for 20 minutes. Turn the pieces over and bake for 15 minutes more. Drizzle the top of the chicken with honey and bake for 10-15 more, or until cooked through. For a calorie reduced version of this dish, remove the skin from the chicken before coating. I made this tonight using boneless, skinless chicken breasts, it was really tasty -- just decrease the cooking time. ; name: french onion brussels sprouts ; ingredients: fresh brussels sprout, butter, olive oil, french onion soup mix, water, salt and pepper ; preparation:Trim the root end off the sprouts, peel off the first layer of leaves and cut each one on half. Heat butter and oil in a large frying pan until the butter just starts to brown. Add the sprouts being careful not to get splattered with hot oil. Stir or toss frequently until the sprouts are nicely browned. Add the water and soup mix and simmer uncovered for about 7 minutes. Taste a sprout and season to taste with salt and pepper. ; name: easy cocoa 1 layer cake ; ingredients: flour, unsweetened cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, unsalted butter, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla, water, powdered sugar ; preparation:Stir dry ingredients together in a bowl. Cream butter and sugar in another bowl, add eggs, vanilla and water. Mix in dry ingredients. Mix well. Bake in preheated 350 oven in buttered and floured 9 inch cake pan for about an hour or til cake tests done with a toothpick. Cool in pan for an hour then remove to rack and sift powdered sugar over top. ; name: salmon with brown sugar glaze ; ingredients: light brown sugar, dijon mustard, fresh dill, salmon fillets, salt, fresh coarse ground black pepper ; preparation:Spray rack of boiler pan with nonstick spray. Preheat the broiler. Whisk together the brown sugar, mustard, and dill in a small bowl. Sprinkle on the broiler rack and spoon the brown sugar glaze on top. Position 7 inches from the heat and broil until lightly browned and just opaque in the center, about 6 minutes. ; name: t s favorite chicken and wild rice ; ingredients: chicken, long grain and wild rice blend, water, vegetables, butter ; preparation:

name: cafe au lait ; ingredients: coffee, water, milk, sugar ; preparation:Brew coffee. Heat milk, almost to a boil. Pour coffee and hot milk, preferably simultaneously, into large cups or mugs. Sweeten to taste. If you like the frothy finish that traditional steam infusers give to cafe au lait, whirl the hot milk in a blender before filling cups. ; name: easy bake oven english muffin pizza ; ingredients: english muffin, tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese, pepperoni, sliced mushrooms ; preparation:Separate the english muffins and place on a baking sheet. Top each with about 1 tbs. Of prepared sauce. Top with any additional pre-cooked toppings. Top with shredded cheese. Bake in your easy-bake oven for about 15-20 minutes. ; name: baked mexican brown rice ; ingredients: canola oil, onion, garlic cloves, jalapeno peppers, long grain brown rice, water, canned tomato, dried ancho chile powder, fine sea salt ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In an ovenproof saucepan or dutch oven, heat oil on medium-high heat. Add onion, garlic, and jalapeos and cook, stirring, 4 minutes. Add rice and cook, stirring, 1 minute. Add remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil, stir, and cover. Place in oven and bake until rice is tender, about 50 minutes. Fluff with fork before serving. ; name: chocolate chip pie no crust ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, brown sugar, butter, eggs, vanilla extract, semisweet chocolate morsels, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Lightly spray the pie plate with cooking spray. Combine flour, baking powder, salt and brown sugar in a medium bowl. Add the butter, eggs, and vanilla. Stir well. Stir in the chocolate morsels and nuts. Spoon into a greased 9-inch pieplate. Bake at 350 for 35 to 40 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack. ; name: skippy quick cookies ; ingredients: skippy creamy peanut butter, sugar, egg, vanilla extract ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325f. In medium bowl, combine all the ingredients. Shape dough into 1-inch balls and place on ungreased baking sheets, arrange cookies 2- inches apart. With fork, gently flatten cookie and press criss-cross pattern into top. Bake 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned and slightly puffed. Immediately top, if desired with sprinkles, chocolate chips or chocolate candies. Cool completely before removing from baking sheets. ; name: apple pecan and blue cheese salad with dried cherries ; ingredients: salad greens, apples, pecan halves, dried cherries, blue cheese, dijon mustard, maple syrup, apple cider vinegar, olive oil, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: hovis granary hand baked bread ; ingredients: bread flour, salt, butter, yeast, warm water ; preparation:In a large bowl mix together the flour salt, butter and yeast. Stir in the water and mix into a soft dough. Turn out onto a floured surface and knead well for 10 minutes by hand or 5 in a electric mixer fitted with a dough hook. Let the dough rise for 1 hour or until double in size, covered and in a warm place. When the dough has risen shape as required and place in a greased tin or tray. Cover with a polythene and leave in a warm place until doubled in size. Uncover and bake in an ove, pre-heated to 230c, 450f, gas mark 8, for around 30-35 minutes. Baked loaf should sound hollow when tapped underneath. For a soft, moist crust remove from the oven and wrap in a clean te-towel to cool. ; name: asian turkey burger ; ingredients: lean ground turkey, applesauce, hoisin sauce, soy sauce, toasted sesame oil, gingerroot, garlic cloves, salt & freshly ground black pepper, scallions ; preparation:In a large bowl, combine the turkey, applesauce, hoisin and soy sauces, sesame oil, ginger, garlic, scallions and salt and pepper to taste. Form the meat into 6 patties. Lightly brush a grill pan or skillet with the sesame oil and place over medium-high heat. Add the patties and fry until golden, about 4 minutes. Turn and cook until the other side is golden and the turkey is cooked through, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a bun. Serve immediately. ; name: german french toast ; ingredients: eggs, white bread, muenster cheese, milk, butter, salt ; preparation:Melt butter in a skillet on medium heat. In a small bowl, beat together eggs, milk and salt. Dip bread slices one at a time in egg mixture, and fry in butter until bolden brown. After turning once, top each slice of bread with a slice of muenster cheese. Cover skillet until the cheese is melted. Serve and enjoy. ; name: annie s pecan pralines ; ingredients: white sugar, baking soda, buttermilk, salt, butter, pecan halves ; preparation:Combine in a large pan the sugar, soda, buttermilk and salt. Cook briskly, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes. Add butter and pecans. Cook for approximately 5 minutes more, or until mixture reaches softball stage. Remove from heat and beat until just creamy. Drop by spoonsful onto waxed paper. Store in airtight containers. ; name: butternut bisque ; ingredients: carrots, celery ribs, leeks, butter, butternut squash, chicken broth, ground ginger, half-and-half cream, salt, white pepper ; preparation:In a large saucepan, saute carrots, celery and leeks in butter for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the squash, broth and ginger. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer until the squash is tender, about 25 minutes. Cool until lukewarm. In a blender or food processor puree squash mixture in small batches until smooth. Return to pan. Add cream, salt and pepper. Mix well. Heat through but do not boil. ; name: fresh herb butter ; ingredients: unsalted butter, fresh basil, fresh marjoram, fresh rosemary, fresh chives, fresh lemon juice, lemon, zest of, garlic ; preparation:

name: nourishing traditions waffles grain soaking method ; ingredients: whole wheat flour, buttermilk, egg yolks, pure maple syrup, butter, sea salt, egg whites ; preparation:Soak flour in buttermilk in a warm place for 12-24 hours. Stir in egg yolks, syrup, butter, and salt. In a clean bowl, beat egg whites with a pinch of salt until stiff. Fold into batter. Cook in a hot, well-coted waffle iron. Serve with melted butter and maple syrup. ; name: spicy cheeseburger nachos ; ingredients: lean ground beef, garlic, velveeta mexican cheese, rotel tomatoes, green onion, tortilla chips ; preparation:In a big non-stick skillet, cook the ground beef and garlic until the beef is no longer pink, stir frequently. Drain. In a 4-quart slow cooker, add the ground beef mixture, cheese, and tomatoes. Stir to mix. Cover and cook on low for 3-4 hours or until the cheese is melted and mixture is well heated. Stir after 2 hours. Add in the onions, stir to combine. Serve with tortilla chips. ; name: cherry chocolate fruit decadence ; ingredients: low-fat cherry yogurt, chocolate flavored syrup, coconut, whipped cream, strawberry ; preparation:Mix yogurt, chocolate syrup and coconut in large bowl. Fold in whipped cream. Arrange layer of strawberries in each of 8 dessert or parfait dishes. Top with half of the yogurt mixture. Repeat layers. Serve immediately. ; name: homemade honey ; ingredients: white sugar, alum, water, fireweed blossoms, red clover blossoms, white clover blossoms ; preparation:In a large saucepan, bring water, sugar and alum to a boil and boil for 10 minutes. Take off heat. Rinse off blossoms in strainer and drain well. Stir in blossoms and steep for 3 hours. Remove flowers, strain through cheesecloth if necessary. Reheat to a boil, then pour into jars and seal. ; name: cheesy corn bites ; ingredients: cream cheese, monterey jack pepper cheese, egg, frozen corn kernels, tortilla chips, chives ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, mix the cream cheese, pepper jack cheese, egg & corn. Arrange the chips on a large baking sheet and place 1 tsp corn mixture in each. Bake until the filling sets, approx 20 minute. Sprinkle the corn bites with garnish, serve warm. ; name: copycat costco r deli mac and cheese ; ingredients: cavatappi pasta, butter, heavy cream, pepper, garlic salt, pecorino romano cheese, parmesan cheese, shredded cheddar cheese ; preparation:

name: banana cardamom muffins ; ingredients: butter, sugar, bananas, eggs, buttermilk, vanilla, salt, baking powder, ground cardamom, flour ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425f, spray muffin tin with non-stick cooking spray. In a bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add the bananas, eggs, buttermilk and vanilla and mix well. In another bowl, mix the salt, baking powder, cardamom and flour. Add the flour to the banana mixture and mix until just combined. Fill muffin tin and bake for 19 minutes. ; name: s more smoothies ; ingredients: marshmallow creme, chocolate syrup, milk, ice, graham cracker squares, mini marshmallows, mini chocolate chip ; preparation:Add the marshmallow creme to the container of an electric blender. Add in the chocolate syrup and milk. Add the ice on top and crumble the graham crackers over the ice. Cover and blend on high until smooth and all the marshmallow creme has been incorporated. Pour mixture into 2 chilled glasses. Garnish with the mini marshmallows and chocolate chips. ; name: roasted mushroom medley ; ingredients: fresh mushrooms, garlic cloves, olive oil, salt & pepper, fresh rosemary, fresh sage, fresh parsley, balsamic vinegar ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Remove the stems from the caps, chop off the ends, and cut into large pieces. Cut the mushrooms into pieces no larger than 2 inches in size. Mix the olive oil with the garlic, herbs and seasonings in an ovenproof casserole dish large enough to fit all of the mushrooms. Add the mushrooms, and mix well, coating the mushrooms with the flavored oil. Bake for about 30 to 40 minutes, or until cooked through. Remove from the heat, and drizzle with the balsamic vinegar. ; name: ragu chili mac ; ingredients: olive oil, green bell pepper, ground beef, pasta sauce, chili powder, elbow macaroni ; preparation:In 12-inch nonstick skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat and cook green bell pepper, stirring occasionally, 3 minutes. Add ground beef and brown, stirring occasionally. Drain. Stir in ragu pasta sauce and chili powder. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer covered 10 minutes. Stir in macaroni and heat through. Serve, if desired, with sour cream and shredded cheddar cheese. ; name: honey coffee ; ingredients: brewed coffee, milk, honey, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, vanilla extract ; preparation:In small saucepan, combine the coffee, milk, honey, cinnamon and nutmeg. Cook and stir until heated through. Remove from the heat. Stir in vanilla. Pour into cups or mugs. Serve immediately. ; name: skier s beef stew crock pot ; ingredients: potatoes, carrots, beef stew meat, tomato sauce, water, onion soup mix ; preparation:

name: easy passionfruit slice bars ; ingredients: sugar, desiccated coconut, self-raising flour, butter, condensed milk, passion fruit pulp ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180c or 160c if using a fan-forced oven. Line a 22cm square pan or a slice tin. Combine all ingredients for the slice base and press into the prepared pan. Bake 12-15 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool in the pan for 15 minutes. The base is still soft while hot, but will harden as it cools. The base will be light in colour. Using a bowl, combine the can of condensed milk and the passionfruit pulp. Spread the passionfruit mixture over the slice base and return to the oven for about 12 minutes, or until the topping is just firm to the touch. Remove from oven, allow to cool 15 minutes and then chill until set. Cut into squares to serve. ; name: mujadara ; ingredients: olive oil, sweet onions, green lentil, brown basmati rice, water, salt ; preparation:Saute onion in oil until caramelized. While onions are cooking place lentils in saucepan and cover with water by an inch. Bring to boil over medium heat. Reduce to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes. Drain lentils and set aside. When onions are ready stir in rice, lentils, salt and 2 cups water. Bring to a boil, cover and reduce heat to a simmer. Simmer for 40 minutes or until rice is tender. ; name: mock pink champagne punch ; ingredients: white sugar, water, frozen concentrated lemonade, frozen orange juice, grenadine, ginger ale, fresh strawberries ; preparation:Combine water and sugar in a small saucepan. Heat on low and stir to dissolve. Do not boil. Combine lemonade, orange juice and grenadine in punch bowl. Add cooled water-sugar mixture. Chill. Just before serving add gingerale. Garnish with fresh strawberries. ; name: sunday dinner chicken ; ingredients: rice, broiler-fryer chicken, salt and pepper, onion soup mix, cream of mushroom soup, milk ; preparation:Grease a 2-3 quart casserole dish. Spread rice on bottom. Add chicken. Salt and pepper. Sprinkle onion soup mix over chicken. Mix cream of mushroom soup with milk. Pour over chicken. Bake at 325f for 2 hours. ; name: eggnog not just for holidays ; ingredients: eggs, icing sugar, salt, cinnamon, vanilla, milk, brandy, nutmeg ; preparation:Using a large mixing bowl beat eggs until very light and lemon coloured. Gradually beat in sugar, salt, cinnamon and vanilla. Stir in milk, using larger container if neccessary. Add liquor to taste. Refrigerate 24 hours before serving. To serve, run through a blender to foam up. To store keep covered in refrigerator up to 4 days. Strength may be adjusted by adding more or less liquor, or more or less milk. Garnish with nutmeg and serve in a pretty glass. ; name: goat cheese chicken rolls ; ingredients: chicken breast halves, goat cheese, white pepper, salt, garlic powder, spaghetti sauce, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:

name: sweet orange salmon ; ingredients: brown sugar, chili powder, orange rind, ground cumin, paprika, salt, ground coriander, black pepper, salmon fillets ; preparation:Preheat broiler. Combine brown sugar, chili powder, orange zest, cumin, paprika, salt, pepper, and coriander in a small bowl. Rub spice mixture over both sides of salmon fillets. Place salmon on a broiler pan coated with cooking spray. Broil for 8 minute or until salmon flakes easily when tested with a fork. ; name: soused fish ; ingredients: mullet fillets, brown onion, olive oil, salt, white vinegar ; preparation:Lay out the fish fillets in the bottom of a casserole dish. Sprinkle the salt on top. Slice the onion into rings and spread on top. Pour the oil on top. Add enough vinegar to just cover the fish fillets. Cover dish and cook for one hour at 180c. Cool and store in a sealed container in the refrigerator. The fish taste great fresh but get better after a few weeks. ; name: old fashioned walnut bread ; ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, egg, shortening, milk, vanilla, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Sift flour, sugar, baking powder and salt into large bowl. Add egg, shortning, milk and vanilla. Stir until all is moistened. Stir in the walnuts. Bake in a 9x5 loaf pan for 1 hour, 20 minutes, or until toothpick comes out clean. ; name: deep dark chocolate pudding cake ; ingredients: unbleached flour, baking powder, salt, unsweetened cocoa powder, sugar, water, vanilla, butter, pecans ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Whisk together first five ingreadients until there are no lumps. Add the water, vanilla, butter, and nuts. Slowly stir together until just combined. Pour into a lightly greased 8-inch square or 9-inch round cake pan. Bake the cake for 45 minutes. When the cake is done, the top will be set, and the bottom bubbly. ; name: turkish style mocha ; ingredients: ground coffee, ground cardamom, water, whole milk, sugar, chocolate syrup ; preparation:Combine the coffee and cardamom in a coffee filter. Brew coffee in a coffemaker with the water. Meanwhile, heat milk, sugar, and syrup in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the brewed coffee. Pour into 4 cups and serve. ; name: white bean tuna and tomato salad ; ingredients: chunk light tuna, small white beans, ripe olives, tomatoes, celery, green onions, italian parsley, red wine and vinegar salad dressing, lettuce leaf, hardboiled egg ; preparation:

name: island pork tenderloin ; ingredients: pork tenderloin, salt, pepper, chili powder, ground cumin, cinnamon, olive oil, brown sugar, fresh garlic, tabasco sauce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Stir together salt, pepper, chili powder, cumin and cinnamon. Coat the pork with the spice rub. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a 12 inch skillet, over relatively high heat, and brown pork, turning every 30 seconds for 4 minutes. Stir together brown sugar, garlic, and tabasco and pat onto top of the tenderloin. Place pork in roasting pan and cook for 20 minutes. ; name: roasted sweet potatoes with orange marmalade and balsamic glaze ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, extra virgin olive oil, honey, ground ginger, balsamic vinegar, orange marmalade, salt and black pepper ; preparation:Heat oven to 375. Lay the sweet potatoes out in a single layer on a roasting tray. Drizzle the oil, salt and pepper over the potatoes. Roast for 25 to 30 minutes in oven or until tender. In a saucepan reduce the vinegar by half, then add honey, marmelade and ginger. Stir to combine. When potatoes are roasted, remove and toss to coat with marmelade mixture. ; name: three cheese garlic bubble bread ; ingredients: frozen dinner rolls, asiago cheese, cheddar cheese, parmesan cheese, butter, garlic powder, garlic clove ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9x13 pan with cooking spray. Put thawed rolls in pan and cover with plastic wrap sprayed with cooking spray. Let rise for 1 hour. Melt butter in microwave with cracked clove of garlic. Mix cheeses together in a bowl. Remove garlic clove from butter. Dip each roll in butter then roll it around in the cheese mixture. Put each roll back in pan and sprinkle entire top with garlic powder. Sprinkle any remaining cheeses over top of rolls. Bake at 350 for about 30-45 min or until golden brown. ; name: pancake souffle ; ingredients: butter, eggs, milk, all-purpose flour, vanilla ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425. Place butter in bottom of 9x13 baking dish and melt in oven, while preheating. Place eggs in blender and beat on high. Add flour, milk and vanilla. Mix together for 30 seconds. Pour mixture into dish with melted butter. Bake for 20 minutes. ; name: broccoli cauliflower roast ; ingredients: broccoli florets, cauliflower florets, garlic, extra virgin olive oil, salt, fresh ground black pepper, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Toss the broccoli, cauliflower and optional garlic with olive oil. Spread on a baking sheet and bake in a preheated 450-degree oven for 20 minutes, or until browned and tender-crunchy. Stir once or twice. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese before serving. ; name: ground turkey and barley casserole ; ingredients: ground turkey, onion, celery, bell pepper, quick-cooking barley, tomato paste, beef broth, water, salt, pepper ; preparation:

name: baked garlic lemon tilapia ; ingredients: tilapia fillets, garlic cloves, butter, lemon juice, parsley, salt and pepper, cooking spray ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Melt butter on a low flame in a small sauce pan. Add garlic and saute on low for about 1 minute. Add the lemon juice and shut off flame. Spray the bottom of a baking dish lightly with cooking spray. Place the fish on top and season with salt and pepper. Pour the lemon butter mixture on the fish and top with fresh parsley. Bake at 400 until cooked, about 15 minutes. ; name: cherry tomato and zucchini saut ; ingredients: olive oil, zucchini, cherry tomatoes, green onions, balsamic vinegar, salt & freshly ground black pepper, fresh basil, pine nuts ; preparation:Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over high heat. Add zucchini and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add cherry tomatoes, green onions and balsamic vinegar. Cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes or until zucchini is crisp-tender and tomatoes are heated through. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with basil and pine nuts and serve immediately. ; name: blueberry cream cheese pie ; ingredients: pastry shells, blueberries, sugar, cornstarch, water, butter, lemon juice, cream cheese, whipped cream ; preparation:Spread softened cream cheese unto bottom of pie shell. Mix cornstarch with water and stir until dissolved. Combine 2 cups of berries, cornstarch liquid, sugar, butter and lemon juice in a medium saucepan. Slowly bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Let boil for one minute stirring constantly. Let cool slightly. Pour into pie shell and let cool. Top with more fresh berries. Serve with whipped cream. ; name: cranberry apple sweet potatoes ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, apple pie filling, cranberry sauce, apricot preserves, orange marmalade ; preparation:Cut fresh potatoes into bite size pieces. In a large saucepan cook potatoes, covered in enough boiling water to cover, about 15 minutes or until tender. Drain and set aside. Spread pie filling in an 8x8 inch baking dish. Arrange cooked fresh or canned sweet potatoes on top. In a small mixing bowl, stir together cranberry sauce, apricot preserves, and orange marmalade. Spoon over sweet potatoes. Bake uncovered in a 350f oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until heated through. ; name: colbys turkey breast cheese sandwich ; ingredients: turkey breast, butter, white bread, provolone cheese ; preparation:First butter all four slice of bread. Heat skillet on medium heat, the add the 2 slices of bread butter side down on skillet, add provolone, then turkey. Top with the other pieces of bread butter side up. Cook for about 3 minutes until toasted well but not burnt, flip and cook the other side for another 3 minutes or so. Cut in half and serve. ; name: lebanese hummus ; ingredients: chickpeas, garlic, extra virgin olive oil, sesame oil, lemon juice, turmeric, chili powder, cilantro, paprika, salt ; preparation:

name: sweet potato ravioli ; ingredients: sweet potato, garlic cloves, ground ginger, salt and pepper, wonton wrappers, water ; preparation:Mix sweet potatoes, garlic and ginger. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Spoon about 1 tablespoon potato mixture onto wonton wrapper. Brush edges of wrapper with water. Top with a second wonton wrapper and press edges together to seal. Repeat with remaining wonton wrappers and potato mixture. Heat 3 quarts of water to boiling. Add 4-6 ravioli. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, until ravioli float to surface and are cooked al dente. Remove with a slotted spoon and repeat the cooking procedure with the remaining ravioli. Serve topped with your favorite sauce. ; name: hawaiian sweet potato salad ; ingredients: bacon, sweet potatoes, pineapple chunks, mayonnaise, dijon mustard, fresh lime juice, pepper, macadamia nuts, lettuce leaf ; preparation:Fry bacon in skillet until crisp. Drain. Crumble bacon. Mix the bacon with sweet potatoes and pineapple in a large bowl. Combine mayonnaise, dijon mustard, lime juice and pepper in a small bowl. Mix well. Add to sweet potato mixture. Mix gently. Stir in nuts. Spoon into lettuce lined serving bowl and serve. ; name: yummy chili casserole ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, celery, chili, diced tomatoes with juice, taco sauce, corn, egg noodles, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large skillet over medium high heat, saute the beef and onion for 5 to 10 minutes, or until meat is browned and onion is tender. Drain fat. Add the celery, chili, tomatoes, taco sauce and corn. Heat thoroughly, reduce heat to low and allow to simmer. Meanwhile, prepare the noodles according to package directions. When cooked, place them in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Pour the meat mixture over the noodles, stirring well. Top with the cheese. Bake at 350 degrees f for 25 minutes, or until cheese is completely melted and bubbly. ; name: country bread abm ; ingredients: water, olive oil, honey, salt, sugar, white bread flour, whole wheat flour, yeast ; preparation:Add water, oil, honey, sugar and salt in container.
