name: zack s slow cooker baked beans and sausage ; ingredients: center-cut bacon, baked beans, smoked sausage, hickory flavored barbecue sauce, steak sauce, brown sugar ; preparation:Fry bacon and drain on paper towels. While frying bacon slice smoked sausage on the bias and place all remaining ingredients in crock pot or slow cooker. Using a small amount of the bacon grease brown the smoked sausage. Crumble bacon and place in cooker. Stir in smoked sausage. Cover and cook on low 4hrs. To save time i sometimes use the precooked bacon bits, bacon is a must for my family in this dish. ; name: quick drop cookies ; ingredients: sugar, salt, butter, milk, peanut butter, rolled oats, vanilla extract, instant chocolate drink mix ; preparation:Combine sugar, salt, butter and milk in a medium size sauce pan. Bring to a boil and let boil for 1 minute. Stir in peanut butter, oats, vanilla and chocolate drink mix. Drop by rounded teaspoons full onto waxed paper. Let set until cool. Store in airtight container. ; name: chili with ravioli ; ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, lean ground beef, dried oregano, chili powder, salt, chili beans, crushed tomatoes, cheese ravioli, sharp cheddar cheese ; preparation:Heat vegetable oil in a wide deep skillet or dutch oven. Add onion, and cook over medium-high heat for 5 mins until onion is translucent. Add ground beef and, using a large spoon or fork to break up, cook until the meat is browned. Add next 5 ingredients, rinsing out each can with a few tablespoons of water and adding the water to the pot. Cook for 15-20 minutes to let the flavors blend. Salt to taste. As the chili simmers, bring a large pot of water to boil and salt the water. When the water boils, add the frozen ravioli, and when the water returns to a boil, lower heat to simmer. Cook 4 or 5 mins until ravioli is cooked through. Place in serving bowls with chili over the top, sprinkled with grated cheese. ; name: almond crunch ; ingredients: almonds, butter, sugar, light corn syrup ; preparation:Line bottom and sides of an 8 or 9-inch pan with aluminum foil. Spray lightly with non stick spray. Set aside. Combine all ingredients in a 10-inch skillet. Over medium heat, bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Boil until mixture turn golden brown, 5-6 minutes. Quickly spread in prepared pan. Cool 15 minutes and break into bite sized pieces. ; name: warm spinach and rice chicken salad ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, italian salad dressing, chicken rice pilaf mix, fresh spinach, tomatoes, pitted ripe olives ; preparation:Brush chicken with 2 teaspoons of the salad dressing. Grill or broil chicken, turning once, for 20 to 25 minutes or until juices run clear. Meanwhile, prepare rice pilaf mix according to package directions. Combine hot cooked rice with remaining salad dressing, spinach, tomatoes and olives. Stir until spinach is slightly wilted. Spoon rice mixture onto serving plates. Top with sliced chicken breast. ; name: swedish rice dessert ; ingredients: mini marshmallows, rice, crushed pineapple, maraschino cherry, slivered almonds, heavy cream, sugar, vanilla ; preparation:

name: barbie s tuna sandwich ; ingredients: solid white tuna, mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, sweet pickle relish, onion flakes, curry powder, dried dill weed, garlic powder ; preparation:In a medium bowl, combine tuna, mayonnaise, parmesan cheese and onion flakes. Season eith remaining ingredients. Mix well. Chill. Serve on crackers or as sandwich spread. ; name: zesty hummus ; ingredients: garbanzo beans, tahini paste, garlic cloves, lime juice, warm water, extra virgin olive oil, sun-dried tomato, roasted red pepper, fresh basil leaves ; preparation:Cut off both ends of each clove of garlic and remove outer layer of skin. In a toaster oven or conventional oven roast garlic for 10-15 minutes at 350 degrees. Garlic will be slightly golden and a little soft. In food processor, blend until smooth lime juice, tahini, water, garlic, basil, and pepper. Add garbanzo beans gradually and blend for several minutes until mixture is a smooth, thick paste. Add roasted red peppers and sun dried tomatoes and process again until well combined. If necessary, stop processor and scrape sides with a spatula. Ideally, hummus be served at room temperature within an hour or two of making. To store, refrigerate for up to 1 week in a covered container. Garnish with drizzled olive oil and slices of roasted red peppers. Surround with warm pita wedges or crackers and serve with fresh vegetables. ; name: wisconsin monte cristo sandwich ; ingredients: egg, plain yogurt, salt, butter, white bread, ham, swiss cheese, cheddar cheese, powdered sugar ; preparation:In a wide shallow dish, whisk the egg, yogurt and salt. Brush one side of bread slices with melted butter. Layer the ham, swiss and cheddar on the buttered side of 2 slices of the bread. Top with remaining bread, buttered side inward. Melt 2 tablespoons of butter in a cast iron skillet over medium-low heat. Carefully dip both sides of the sandwich into the egg mixture, holding sides of sandwich together. Cover and cook in skillet until golden, then turn and cook other side until cheese is melted. Add additional butter to skillet as needed. Dust with powdered sugar and serve immediately. ; name: original chipits cookies ; ingredients: crisco shortening, brown sugar, granulated sugar, eggs, vanilla, flour, baking soda, salt, peanut butter chips, nuts ; preparation:Cream together shortening, brown sugar, and white sugar. Beat in 2 eggs and vanilla. Combine flour, baking soda and salt. Gradually blend into creamed mixture. Stir in chipits and nuts. Drop from spoon onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375f for 10-12 minutes. ; name: saffron raisin couscous with fresh mint ; ingredients: water, saffron thread, extra virgin olive oil, salt, couscous, raisins, of fresh mint ; preparation:In a saucepan, bring the water to a boil and add the saffron. Remove from the heat, cover, and let stand for 30 minutes. Return the pan to the heat, bring to a boil, and mix in the olive oil, salt, couscous, and raisins. Remove from the heat, cover, and let stand for 30 minutes. Using a fork and your finger. Taste and adjust the seasonings. Stir in the mint. Serve warm or at room temperature. ; name: golden chicken spaghetti casserole ; ingredients: yellow bell pepper, orange bell pepper, onion, mushrooms, cheddar cheese, chicken stock, cooked chicken, diced tomatoes, oil, spinach ; preparation:

name: easy yummy creamy chicken tetrazzini ; ingredients: cream of mushroom soup, chicken breasts, noodles, onion salt, milk, american cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cook noodles as directed on box. Partially thaw chicken, then dice. Cook chicken in skillet. In a separate small sauce pan, add cream of mushroom soup, milk, and cheese. Stir over low heat until melted. When noodles are done, strain, and return to sauce pan. Add the cooked chicken breast and cheese sauce mix. Stir together and simmer uncovered, on low heat about 10 minutes. Add salt and pepper at end to taste. ; name: flaky butter crust ; ingredients: salt, cold water, unsalted butter, all-purpose flour ; preparation:Dissolve the salt in the water and refrigerate. Place the butter cubes and flour in the food processor bowl. Chill the bowl, ingredients and blade in the freezer until well chilled, at least 30 minutes. Cut the butter into the flour using the pulse until the mixture resembles flakes of oatmeal. With the machine running, slowly pour in the cold salted water, mix just until the dough forms a ball. Divide the dough into three equal portions and shape each into a disk about 6 inches in diameter. Refrigerate disks for at least 30 minutes. Roll out each disk into 11 inch circles, place in a 9 inch pie pan and return the pan to the refrigerator until ready to bake or fill. Make sure the crusts are cold when they go into the preheated oven at 375f bake until the edges are lightly browned, about 20 minutes. Remove the rice or beans and the parchment, prick each crust several times with a fork, and return the crust to the oven to bake an additional 5 - 10 minutes. Remove and cool before filling. ; name: pumpkin butter no cook ; ingredients: butter, powdered sugar, canned pumpkin, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg ; preparation:Beat butter at medium speed of an electric mixer until creamy. Gradually add sugar, beating well. Add pumpkin, cinnamon and nutmeg. Mix well. Cover and chill at least 3 hours. Let butter stand at room temperature to soften before serving. ; name: blueberry honey jam ; ingredients: blueberries, sugar, liquid honey, lemon juice, liquid fruit pectin ; preparation:Place blueberries, sugar, honey and lemon juice into a non-reactive saucepan and bring to a boil, stirring. Boil hard for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Take off the heat, stir in the pectin and ladle into hot sterilized jars. Seal and process in a hot water bath for 10 minutes. Place hot jars on a towel on your counter and let cool overnight. Check seals. ; name: pork braciole but different ; ingredients: pork shoulder, salt and pepper, breadcrumbs, hard-boiled eggs, salami, romano cheese, flat leaf parsley, olive oil, pasta sauce ; preparation:Wash meat and pat dry. Pound very thin. Season with a little salt and pepper. For stuffing, mix bread crumbs, eggs, salami, cheese, parsley. Spread a thin layer of stuffing on each slice of meat. Roll up and tie with cooking or cotton string. Heat oil in pan over medium heat till hot. Brown the meat on all sides until cooked. Set aside to add sauce when ready to serve. Remove strings before adding sauce. ; name: brussels sprouts n potatoes ; ingredients: onion, butter, potato, brussels sprout, bay leaf, sweet red pepper, chicken stock, salt and pepper, parsley ; preparation:

name: no bake cherry balls ; ingredients: maraschino cherries, graham wafer crumbs, butter, icing sugar, orange juice, coconut ; preparation:Dry the cherries on paper towel. Cream the butter and gradually mix in the icing sugar and orange juice. Add coconut and mix well. Roll a small portion of the coconut mixture evenly around each cherry and then roll in graham wafer crumbs. Place on wax paper and keep cool. ; name: carolina panthers cheese dip ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, garlic cloves, pepper, velveeta cheese, cream of mushroom soup, pace picante sauce, jalapeno pepper ; preparation:Cook beef, onion and garlic in large skillet until well browned. Drain grease. Add remaining ingredients. Cook on medium till cheese is melted and mixture is heated through. Stir often. Serve warm with corn chips, nachos, potato chips, etc. This same recipe may be made in a crock pot. ; name: quinoa with toasted almonds and cranberries ; ingredients: quinoa, blanched slivered almond, boiling water, salt, cinnamon, bay leaf, dried cranberries ; preparation:Over med heat stir and toast almond slivers until golden. Add the quinoa and toast until quinoa begins to darken. Transfer the quinoa and almonds to a 2 quart sauce pan. Add the remaining ingredients. Bring to boil covered. Reduce the heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Then let stand for another 5 minutes. To serve fluff gently. There is approximately 5 ounces in a portion. ; name: bread chocolate pudding ; ingredients: bread, eggs, milk, sugar, salt, vanilla extract, chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f have ready a 9x13-inch baking pan. Spread the bread and chocolate chips in the pan. Beat together remaining ingredients. Pour this custard over the bread. Bake about 35 minutes, or until firm but not dry. Serve warm or at room temperature. ; name: touch of mint iced tea ; ingredients: boiling water, tea bags, of fresh mint, frozen lemonade concentrate, lemon slice, mint ; preparation:In a heat proof bowl or pitcher, pour boiling water over tea bags. Cool at least 15 minutes. Add mint and let tea bags steep for at least 5 minutes. Strain. Add lemonade concentrate. Stir well. Refrigerate. Serve with lemon slices and extra mint. ; name: cider roasted vegetables ; ingredients: beets, parsnips, baby carrots, brown sugar, olive oil, apple cider vinegar, shiitake mushrooms ; preparation:

name: breakfast bruschetta ; ingredients: bread, eggs, water, kosher salt, hot red pepper sauce, sweet butter, goat cheese, sun-dried tomatoes, fresh basil leaf, pesto sauce ; preparation:Toast the bread and keep while preparing the eggs. Combine the eggs, water, tabasco and salt in a bowl and whisk until smooth. In a large non-stick omelette pan, melt the butter and add the eggs, stirring with a spatula until the eggs are gently scrambled. Spread the soft goat cheese equally over the slices of toast. Add the scrambled eggs on top of the goat cheese and cut each of the toast slices in half. Garnish with sun dried tomatoes, basil leaves, and drizzle of pesto. ; name: grilled caesar chicken breasts ; ingredients: caesar salad dressing, olive oil, dijon mustard, garlic cloves, boneless skinless chicken breast halves ; preparation:In a large resealable plastic bag, combine the dressing, oil, mustard and garlic. Add the chicken. Seal bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight. Drain and discard marinade. Grill chicken, covered, over medium heat or broil 4 inches from the heat for 6-8 minutes on each side or until a meat thermometer reads 170. ; name: pecan truffles ; ingredients: brown sugar, butter, eggs, chocolate chips, pecans, pie crust ; preparation:Mix first 5 ingredients together. Unroll pie crust and cut into small rounds. Place in bottom of mini muffin pan. Put 1 teaspoons pecan and sugar mixture on each. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes. ; name: never fail fudge ; ingredients: sugar, evaporated milk, butter, marshmallow cream, salt, vanilla extract, walnuts, chocolate chips ; preparation:Butter one 13x9-inch pan or 2 9x9-inch pans. Combine sugar, evaporated milk, butter, marshmallow creme and salt in a 6-quart saucepan. Cook over medium heat. Boil slowly for 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract, walnuts and chocolate chips. Pour into buttered pan. Makes about 5 pounds. ; name: company rice ; ingredients: butter, long grain rice, consomme, green onions, water, button mushrooms, oregano ; preparation:Put washed rice in a 2 quart casserole. Add remaining ingredients and stir well. Cook, covered, at 350 for 30 minutes. Uncover and stir well. Replace lid and continue to cook for another 30 minutes. ; name: korean roast chicken thighs ; ingredients: chicken thighs, soy sauce, green onion, sesame oil, honey, garlic, ground ginger, black pepper ; preparation:

name: scarfies delicious baked carrots ; ingredients: carrots, butter, salt, pepper ; preparation:Grate carrots into casserole dish. Cover tightly. Bake at 160c for 30 minutes. Do not add water. Remove from oven and add butter, salt and freshly ground pepper. Serve immediately. ; name: macadamia crusted tilapia with pineapple salsa ; ingredients: flour, egg, macadamia nuts, tilapia fillets, fresh pineapple, red onion, jalapeno, cilantro ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Dredge fish in flour, then egg, then nuts. Place on oiled baking sheet. Bake 20 minutes until golden brown. Make the salsa as far ahead as possible to allow time for flavors to meld. Combine all salsa ingredients and refrigerate. Serve over fish. ; name: crab melt ; ingredients: cheddar cheese, butter, lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, garlic salt, crabmeat, chives, french bread ; preparation:Melt butter and cheese over low heat. Add lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, and garlic salt. Mix well. Process in blender until smooth. In bowl, fold in crabmeat and chives. Slice bread into half inch slices and spread on crabmeat mixture. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Serve immediately. ; name: maple fennel country sausage patties ; ingredients: coarse salt, coarse black pepper, fennel seed, ground pork, maple syrup, olive oil ; preparation:Combine salt, pepper, and fennel in the bottom of a bowl. Add pork and mix to combine spices. Pour syrup over pork and work through to combine. Form into patties, 2-3 inches round. Cook patties in 1 t oil in nonstick skillet over med-high, 4-5 min on each side. Drain on paper towels. ; name: cherry pineapple nut cake ; ingredients: crushed pineapple in syrup, cherry pie filling, yellow cake mix, pecans, margarine ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 13 x 9 baking dish. Spread pineapple with juice evenly in dish. Spread cherry pie filling over pineapple. Sprinkle dry cake mix over cherries, then spread pecans over cake mix. Cut margarine into thin slices and place over pecans. Bake for 50 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream, if desired. ; name: just like mc donald s sausage egg mc muffin copycat ; ingredients: sausage patties, english muffins, cheddar cheese, eggs, margarine, oil ; preparation:

name: garlic shrimp ; ingredients: vegetable oil, butter, garlic, shrimp, salt and pepper, lemons ; preparation:Heat oil and butter in a large skillet. Add garlic and shrimp. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Saute 2-3 minutes or until shrimp turn pink. Turn shrimp with spatula. Cook shrimp 2 minutes longer on other side. Remove shrimp to serving platter. Garnish with lemon wedges. We give this a little squirt with the lemon wedge. ; name: macaroni and beef casserole ; ingredients: macaroni & cheese dinner mix, lean ground beef, italian-style stewed tomatoes, dried oregano leaves, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Prepare macaroni dinner as directed on package, omitting the butter. Meanwhile, brown meat in a large nonstick skillet at medium-high heat. Then drain. Add tomatoes and oregano. Mix well. Bring to a boil. Add meat mixture to the prepared macaroni dinner. Spoon into 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and the casserole is heated through. ; name: mushroom and celery salad ; ingredients: fresh mushrooms, celery, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, sugar, white pepper, onion salt, garlic powder ; preparation:Combine mushrooms and celery in a salad bowl. Mix oil, lemon juice, salt, sugar, white pepper, onion salt, and garlic powder. Mix well. Pour over mushrooms and celery. Serve. ; name: ginger cabbage ; ingredients: canola oil, fresh ginger, ground cinnamon, ground cloves, red cabbage, granny smith apples, pure maple syrup, salt, cider vinegar, pumpkin seeds ; preparation:In a large heavy skillet with lid, warm canola oil over medium-low heat. Add the ginger, cinnamon, and cloves. Cook, stirring, for 10 to 15 seconds. Add the cabbage, apples, maple syrup, and salt. Stir, reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for about 30 minutes. After the 30 minutes, add the vinegar and increase heat to medium. Cook for about 5 minutes, or until most of the liquid evaporates. Sprinkle each serving of cabbage with 2 tablespoons of the pumpkin seeds. ; name: ww caprese rice salad ; ingredients: olive oil, balsamic vinegar, basil leaves, cherry tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, salt, pepper, onion, rice ; preparation:In a large serving bowl, mix together 2 tablespoons olive oil with the vinegar, basil, tomatoes, mozzarella, salt and pepper. Set aside while rice cooks. Heat remaining teaspoon of olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes. Add rice and pint water. Bring to the boil, cover and simmer until water is absorbed and rice is tender, about 15 - 20 minutes. Toss rice with tomato mixture. Serve warm or at room temperature. ; name: beef mushroom dijon ; ingredients: boneless beef top sirloin steak, vegetable oil cooking spray, sliced mushrooms, onion, cream of mushroom soup, water, dijon-style mustard, cooked rice, fresh parsley ; preparation:

name: cubano marinade ; ingredients: white onion, garlic cloves, orange juice, lime juice, lemon juice, water, dried oregano, cumin seed, salt ; preparation:Put onion, garlic, orange juice, lime juice, lemon juice and water in a blender. Set blender on liquify setting and process until smooth. Add remaining ingredients to blender. Process for one minute more. Marinate meat for at least one hour in mixture. It is better to marinate meats overnight. Marinate fish for no longer than 20 minutes, or it will toughen. Brush meat frequently with the sauce while cooking. ; name: chicken oregano ; ingredients: chicken breast halves, olive oil, butter, all-purpose flour, egg, salt, pepper, dried oregano, provolone cheese ; preparation:Heat oil and butter in a large skillet. Dredge chicken in flour and shake of excess. Dip in egg, allowing excess to drip off. Saut in skillet a few pieces at a time, turn once, browning on both sides. Arrange chicken in a buttered, shallow baking dish. Sprinkle with salt, pepper, oregano and cheese. Cover with foil, bake 15 minutes. Remove foil, baking until browned, about 15-20 minutes. ; name: easy peppermint candy canes ; ingredients: sugar, light corn syrup, water, cream of tartar, peppermint extract, red food coloring ; preparation:Blend together corn syrup, sugar, water, and cream of tartar. Stir, dissolving the sugar. Without stirring, cook until the hard ball stage. Remove from burner. Add peppermint oil, blend well. Divide into 2 porions. In one half, add red coloring. Pour over greased platters. Let cool. When cool enough to touch, pull each apart seperatly. Form into ropes and twist red with white candy mixtures. Cut into desired lengths and shapes. ; name: pepperoni breadtwists ; ingredients: bisquick baking mix, water, pepperoni, butter, parmesan cheese, pizza sauce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Mix baking mix, cold water and pepperoni until dough forms. Beat 20 strokes. Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead 5 times. Roll dough into a 10 inch square and cut in half. Cut each half crosswise into 14 strips. Twist ends of strips in opposite directions until pieces are twirled. Place on ungreased cookie sheet, pressing ends to sheet to fasten securely. Brush with melted butter and sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until light golden brown. Heat pizza sauce and serve with breadtwists for dipping. ; name: company breakfast bake ; ingredients: frozen hash browns, sausage, cheddar cheese, eggs, milk, dry mustard, salt, pepper ; preparation:Cover the bottom of a 9-inch square pan with frozen hash browns. Cover hash browns with sausage. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Stir together the remaining ingredients. Pour this mixture over everything. Refrigerate overnight. Bake at 350 degrees f for 30 minutes. Let stand for 30 minutes before cutting into squares and serving. ; name: bavarian german potato salad ; ingredients: onion, cucumber, radishes, all-purpose flour, cider vinegar, water, salt, ground pepper, potatoes ; preparation:

name: nopalitos wings ; ingredients: chicken wings, nopalitos, chipotle chile in adobo, lime juice, cilantro, scallion, oil, garlic cloves ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in a blender or a food processor and puree until it has reached a sauce like consistency. Set some marinade aside to brush on while grilling. Place chicken wings and marinade in a large sealable bag and try to get all the air out. Refrigerate for 4-24 hours, depending on how strong you want the flavor to be. Remove the chicken wings from the refrigerator and let sit at room temperature for 25-30 minutes while heating the grill. Grill over medium-high heat, flipping frequently and brushing with the marinade for 15-20 minutes or until cooked through. During the last 5 minutes of grilling do not brush on any more marinade to make sure all the juices cook through. ; name: smoked cabbage ; ingredients: butter, salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, cabbage ; preparation:In a small bowl combine first 5 ingredients. Core cabbage, cutting out a good size cavity and then place the seasoned butter in the cavity. Wrap cabbage with heavy duty aluminum foil. Place cabbage, cored end up, on top rack of grill, close lid and smoke until soft. Unwrap cabbage and discard any blackened leaves and then cut the cabbage into wedges. ; name: creamy swiss chard and pasta ; ingredients: swiss chard, olives, garlic, onion, sliced mushrooms, parmesan cheese, fettuccine pasta, pepper, salt, low-fat sour cream ; preparation:Wash the greens andcut into small pieces. Heat oil in large saucepan over med-high heat 1-2 minutes and add garlic, onion, and mushrooms and saute until tender, add the greens and cook 5-8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until greens are tender. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cook the pasta. Mix the cooked ingredients together. Top with the sour cream and parmesan mix. Serves 4 people. ; name: cheesecake pecan pie ; ingredients: cream cheese, egg, sugar, salt, vanilla, 9-inch deep dish pie crust, pecans, eggs, light corn syrup ; preparation:Combine first 5 ingredients. Beat at low speed until smooth. Pour into pastry shell. Sprinkle with pecans. Combine 3 eggs and remaining ingredients, mixing well. Spoon over pecan layer. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes or until set. ; name: chilli prawn linguine ; ingredients: linguine, olive oil, prawns, red chilies, garlic, flat leaf parsley, fresh lemon rind ; preparation:Cook linguine in a large pan of boiling salted water, uncovered, until just tender, drain. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large frying pan, add the prawns, chilli and garlic and cook, stirring, until the prawns are just cooked through. Remove from the heat and stir in the parsley and lemon rind. Combine the linguine with the prawn mixture and toss gently. This is great served with a simple green salad, if desired. ; name: crock pot balsamic chicken ; ingredients: garlic powder, dried basil, salt, pepper, instant minced onion, garlic cloves, extra virgin olive oil, balsamic vinegar, boneless skinless chicken thighs, fresh parsley ; preparation:

name: black bean and salsa soup ; ingredients: black beans, beef broth, thick & chunky salsa, cumin, sour cream, green onion ; preparation:In a food processor with a metal blade or a blender container, combine the beans, broth, salsa, and cumin. Process 1 minute, or until smooth. Heat bean mixture in a medium saucepan over medium heat, until thoroughly heated. To serve, ladle soup into 2 individual bowls. Spoon 1 tablespoon of sour cream on top of each. Swirl gently. Sprinkle with green onions. ; name: cheesy potato salad ; ingredients: red potatoes, sour cream, mayonnaise, white sugar, green onion, shredded cheddar cheese, bacon bits ; preparation:Place the potatoes into a pot, and fill with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, and cook for about 10 minutes, or until easily pierced with a fork. Drain, and set aside to cool. In a large bowl, mix together the sour cream, mayonnaise, sugar, half of the onions, and half of the cheese. Gently stir in the cooled potatoes. Top with remaining cheese and onions, and sprinkle bacon bits over the top. ; name: cheesy scalloped potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, white flour, onion, celery leaves, parsley flakes, butter, salt, pepper, milk, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Put flour, onion, celery leaves, parsley, butter, salt, pepper and milk into blender. Mix on high about 2 minutes. Arrange potatoe slices in buttered 2 quart baking dish. Pour onion mixture over potatoes. Sprinkle with grated cheese. Bake in 350 degree oven 1 hour. Uncovered. Can be frozen and reheated. I always make two at a time and stash one in the freezer. ; name: beer salmon ; ingredients: salmon fillets, garlic salt, brown sugar, butter, red onion, beer ; preparation:Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Using aluminum foil, create an oblong cooking tray to be placed directly on grill. Place salmon fillet in center of tray. Season first with garlic salt, sprinkle with brown sugar, and then cover with pieces of butter. Top with sliced red onions. Pour beer of choice into tray to just below the highest point of the fillet. Cover tray with aluminum foil to envelope fish completely. Place tray on grill, cover with lid, and grill for approximately 8 minutes or until just cooked through. ; name: jeanie s cake frosting ; ingredients: margarine, shortening, vanilla, powdered sugar, flour ; preparation:Whip margarine until smooth. Slowly add 1 cup shortening. Whip until fluffy. Add vanilla, powdered sugar and flour. Whip until smooth. May add up to one cup more powdered sugar to increase stiffness of frosting. Decorate cake as desired. ; name: date fruitcake ; ingredients: dates, walnut pieces, candied cherry, flour, salt, baking powder, sugar, eggs, vanilla extract ; preparation:

name: cheeseburger cups ; ingredients: refrigerated biscuits, catsup, mustard, ground beef, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Set oven at 425f. Spray muffin cups with non-stick vegetable spray. Roll out biscuits until each is big enough to fit into muffin tins with enough dough to cover. Mix together catsup and mustard with ground beef. Fill each biscuit cup with meat mixture. Sprinkle cheese over all. Fold dough over top. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: baked it my way potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, oil, salt, sour cream, parsley, cheese ; preparation:Prick potatoes all over with a fork. Rub all over with oil and then with salt. Put on plate, cook in microwave on high for 6 minutes, stand for 10 minutes. Slice top neatly off. Scoop out potatoe with teaspoon, leave shell intact. Mash it with sour cream and parsley. Spoon it back into shell. Put cheese on top. Cook on high for 90 seconds. ; name: eggnog ; ingredients: eggs, brandy, rum, bacardi light rum, peach brandy, apple brandy, sugar, milk, whipping cream, nutmeg ; preparation:Seperate the egg yolks from 2 dozen eggs, save and chill egg whites. Whip egg yolks until blended stirring constantly to prevent curdling. Add the fifth of brandy, myers rum, barcardi, apple brandy, and peach brandy, stir gently mixing in 2 lbs of sugar, milk, and whipping cream chill for 6 hour or overnight. Before serving beat the egg whites until a smooth consistency gently fold into egg nog serve with a dash of nutmeg and. Give your car keys to to someone not having the egg nog. ; name: curried beef and onions ; ingredients: flank steaks, oil, salt and pepper, ginger, garlic, onions, curry powder, coriander, diced tomatoes, plain yogurt ; preparation:Slice steak on diagonal. Heat oil in skillet or wok, add garlic, ginger, steak, salt& pepper, cook 3 minutes. Add curry coriander and onion, saute 3 minutes. Add tomatoes, simmer until liquid evaporates. Remove from heat. Add yogurt. Adjust seasonings to taste. ; name: loaded lemonade ; ingredients: fresh orange juice, prepared sweet-and-sour mix, tequila, triple sec, sprite ; preparation:Add first four ingredients to a pitcher or large bowl. Stir to combine. Chill for 2 hours. Right before ready to serve, add sprite. Stir to combine. Serve in ice-filled glasses. ; name: bacon and tomato grilled cheese sandwich ; ingredients: cooked bacon, butter, bread, monterey jack pepper cheese, tomatoes ; preparation:

name: lazy man s cabbage roll casserole ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, cabbage, salt and pepper, condensed tomato soup, water, long-grain rice ; preparation:In a skillet, brown onion and ground beef. Place in the bottom of a medium casserole dish. Salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle rice on top. Spread shredded cabbage on top of the rice. Mix water and soup together and pour over everything. Do not stir. Bake for 1 hour at 325f. ; name: peppermint meringues ; ingredients: egg whites, peppermint extract, cream of tartar, sugar, peppermint candy ; preparation:Preheat oven to 300 f. Beat egg whites, peppermint extract and cream of tartar on high speed with an electric mixer until soft peaks form. Gradually add sugar, one tablespoonful at a time, while continuing to beat until stiff peaks form. Drop by spoonfuls onto lightly greased cookie sheet. Sprinkle with crushed peppermint candies. Bake for 20 minutes, or until meringues are firm and their bottoms are very lightly browned. Cool to wire rack. ; name: finger licking sesame edamame ; ingredients: frozen edamame, vegetable oil, sesame oil, fresh ginger, garlic, salt, sesame seeds ; preparation:Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add edamame and continue boiling until beans are crisp-tender, about 6 minutes. Meanwhile mix remaining ingredients together. When done, run cold water over, or put in ice water, to stop cooking. Drain well. Pat excess moisture off, and toss in the dressing. Top with seeds. To eat, hold pod by stem end, and slide the individual beans out with your teeth. Discard pod. ; name: golden autumn soup low fat ; ingredients: fat-free chicken broth, cauliflower, carrot, onion, nonfat milk, ground nutmeg, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:In a large pot, combine broth, cauliflower, carrots, and onions. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 7 to 10 minutes, until vegetables are tender. Puree in a blender or food processor. Return to pan. Add milk and heat thoroughly, but do not boil. Stir in nutmeg and pepper. ; name: rhubarb cream dessert ; ingredients: rhubarb, water, strawberry jell-o gelatin dessert, sugar, frozen strawberries, vanilla ice cream, whipped cream ; preparation:In a large sauce pan, combine rhubarb and water. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer over medium heat until rhubarb is tender, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in gelatin and sugar until dissolved. Add frozen strawberries and ice cream. Alow to thaw, stirring occasionally. Pour into indivitual servind dishes. Refrigerate several hours or until firm. Serve with a garnish of whipped cream on top. ; name: rhubarb custard pie ; ingredients: sugar, all-purpose flour, ground nutmeg, salt, eggs, rhubarb, butter, pie crusts ; preparation:

name: spicy citrus grilled chicken ; ingredients: chicken pieces, lime, juice and zest of, orange, juice and zest of, olive oil, dried oregano, garlic cloves, jalapeno pepper, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Place chicken in a large zip-top plastic bag. In a bowl, whisk together lime juice and zest, orange juice and zest, oil, oregano, garlic, jalapeno. Pour marinade into plastic bag over chicken and lay flat in a shallow dish. Refrigerate for at least 90 minutes or up to 4 hours, turning occasionally. Remove chicken from marinade and season with salt and pepper. Grill chicken until browned and internal temperature reaches 165 degrees f. ; name: cod with fennel mushrooms tomato dill ; ingredients: vegetable oil cooking spray, red onion, mushroom, fennel bulb, cod, tomatoes, lemon, salt, pepper, dried dill ; preparation:Season cod with salt and pepper and squeese 2 lemon wedges over. Set aside. Spray nonstick frypan with veggie spray, heat over high heat, add mushrooms, fennel and onion, reserving 4 onion slices. Cook stirring until onions are soft, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to medium. Place the 4 pieces of cod on top of the veggies. Place one slice of tomato on top each piece of cod and one slice of reserved onion slices on top of tomato. Sprinkle with dill and squeese 2 more wedges of lemon over all. Cover and simmer until cod is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork, about 15 minutes. Garnish with remaining lemon wedges and sprigs of fennel leaves. ; name: roth prasad ; ingredients: plain flour, caster sugar, cardamom powder, ghee, milk ; preparation:Add sugar and cardamom to flour. Mix in ghee with your fingers. Add milk gradually, to form a soft, scone-like dough. You may need more or less, so dont pour all at one go. Divide dough into ten balls and flatten into discs, about 3 mm thick. You may have to use a rolling pin for this. Heat ghee on a medium flame. Fry roth on the medium flame till golden brown on both sides. ; name: crock pot bbq beef ; ingredients: chuck roast, water, barbecue sauce, worcestershire sauce, mustard, onion, salt and pepper ; preparation:Place roast in crock pot. Combine remaining ingredients in saucepan and bring to boil. Cover roast with sauce mixture. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. Chop meat and stir. ; name: quinoa corn and tomato salad with chive infused oil ; ingredients: water, quinoa, fresh corn kernels, cherry tomatoes, fresh flat-leaf parsley, oil, fresh lime juice, white wine vinegar, salt, garlic clove ; preparation:Combine water and quinoa in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 10 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat. Let stand 10 minutes. Fluff with a fork to separate and let cool a bit if time. While quinoa is cooking, combine corn, tomatoes, and parsley in a medium bowl. In a small bowl, whisk together oil and remaining ingredients. After quinoa has stood for 10 min., add to vegetable mixture, toss to combine, then drizzle dressing over it. Toss well to coat. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. ; name: cornbread chicken pot pie ; ingredients: cream of chicken soup, whole kernel corn, cooked chicken, corn muffin mix, milk, egg ; preparation:

name: lamb txilindron basque lamb stew ; ingredients: leg of lamb, drippings, white wine, olive oil, garlic cloves, onion, green bell pepper, red pepper flakes, pimientos ; preparation:Heat oil in a large heavy pot over medium heat. Add garlic, onions and pepper, cook for 5 minutes. Add pepper flakes and cook until they release their aroma. Add lamb pieces, wine and pan drippings. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 45 minutes. Add pimentos, cover pot and simmer until lamb is very tender, 2-3 hours more. ; name: brie and easy ; ingredients: brie round, green onion, walnuts, raisins ; preparation:Remove rind from top of cheese. Place cheese on a foil lined baking sheet. Top with onions, nuts, and raisins. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 minutes or until cheese softens. Serve warm with crackers or sliced granny smith apples. ; name: soft and yummy chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: margarine, brown sugar, white sugar, egg, vanilla, flour, salt, baking soda, chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream margarine. Add gradually and beat in brown sugar and white sugar. Beat in egg and vanilla. Sift and stir in flour, salt, baking soda. Add chocolate chips. Bake 10 minutes at 375. ; name: parmesan almond chicken ; ingredients: boneless chicken breasts, butter, parmesan cheese, almonds, oregano leaves, parsley, paprika, pepper, salt ; preparation:Heat oven to 400 degrees. Spray a cookie sheet with no stick cooking spray. Dip chicken in butter, coat with combined remaining ingredients. Place on cookie sheet. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or till tender. ; name: 1960 s catalina dressing ; ingredients: ketchup, sugar, red wine vinegar, onion, paprika, worcestershire sauce, salad oil, salt and pepper ; preparation:Add the ketchup, sugar, vinegar, onion, paprika and worcestershire to a food processor bowl. Pulse until blended. With the processor running, slowly add the oil. Check the seasonings. Cover and refrigerate until needed. ; name: chicken and broccoli spaghetti ; ingredients: broccoli florets, olive oil, garlic cloves, fresh lemon juice, cooked chicken, basil leaves, ground black pepper, thin spaghetti, tomatoes, parmesan cheese ; preparation:

name: pepperoncini cream cheese dip ; ingredients: pepperoncini peppers, cream cheese, parmesan cheese, sour cream ; preparation:Position knife blade in food processor bowl. Add first 3 ingredients. Pulse several times or until smooth. Stir in sour cream. Cover and chill until ready to serve. Serve with crackers. ; name: old fashioned butterscotch sauce ; ingredients: light brown sugar, light corn syrup, butter, evaporated milk, baking soda, vanilla ; preparation:In a medium saucepan combine sugar, syrup, and butter. Cook, stirring constantly, over medium heat until sugar has dissolved and mixture comes to a full rolling boil. Allow to boil, without stirring, for exactly 1 minute. Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes. In another bowl or large measuring cup, combine evaporated milk, baking soda, and vanilla. Stir into the slightly cooled sauce. Pour into jars, cover, and refrigerate. Place jar in a pan of warm water to reheat. ; name: healthy berry blue muffins ; ingredients: bisquick baking mix, skim milk, sugar, applesauce, liquid egg substitute, frozen blueberries ; preparation:Heat oven to 400 degrees. Grease 12 muffin cups or use muffin papers. Stir all ingredients except blueberries together in large bowl til moistened. Stir in blueberries. Divide evenly among cups. Bake 13-18 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: football bean dip ; ingredients: refried beans, velveeta cheese, chunky picante sauce, tabasco sauce ; preparation:Begin heating refried beans in a suacepan. Cut velveeta into cubes and add to beans. Heat until cheese is melted. Stir in picante sauce and as much tabasco as you like. Serve with chips, a cold beer, and a good football game. ; name: vegan whole wheat peanut butter pancakes ; ingredients: whole wheat flour, baking powder, banana, soymilk, peanut butter, light brown sugar, nonstick cooking spray ; preparation:Combine flour, baking powder, and sugar. In a separate bowl, mash the banana and add the soy milk and peanut butter. Combine flour mixture and peanut butter mixture. Let batter sit for 5 minutes while spraying the griddle and heating it. Pour 3 inch pancakes and cook for 2 minutes on each side. Serve with maple syrup, fruit spread, bananas, etc. ; name: chicken on lemongrass skewers ; ingredients: lemongrass, peanut oil, lime rind, coriander leaves, chicken breasts, lime juice, birds eye chiles, macadamia nut oil, raw sugar, garlic clove ; preparation:

name: valentine cookie pops ; ingredients: refrigerated sugar cookie dough, wooden popsicle sticks, vanilla frosting, decorative candies, ribbon ; preparation:Heat oven to 350f on ungreased cookie sheets, place cookie dough pieces 2 inches apart. Into side of each piece of dough, insert wooden stick 1 inch, overlapping wooden sticks as necessary. Bake 12 to 16 minutes or until edges are light golden brown. Cool 2 minutes. Remove from cookie sheets. Cool completely, about 10 minutes. Spread frosting on one side of each cookie. Decorate with candies. Tie 18 inches of red ribbon into bow around each stick next to cookie. ; name: rosemary parmesan sourdough bread ; ingredients: sourdough starter, milk, oil, honey, bread flour, parmesan cheese, fresh rosemary, salt, egg white, water ; preparation:Proof starter over night before making bread. To kitchen aid mixing bowl add all the ingredients. Using dough hook mix until a satin ball is formed. Adding additional flour as needed. Remove dough to greased bowl, turning once to coat. Cover and allow to rise until doubled. Form into 1 large or 2 smaller free-form loaves and place on parchment paper or pizza peel dusted with corn meal. Cover and allow bread to rise until double in size. Preheat oven to 375 dgrees. Lightly beat 1 egg white with 1 tablespoon water. Brush top of loaves with egg wash and then sprinkle with fresh parmesan. Bake a 375 deghrees for 30-45 minutes, depending on the size of the loaves. ; name: breaded broccoli ; ingredients: broccoli, eggs, salt and pepper, italian seasoned breadcrumbs, oil ; preparation:Cook the broccoli in water until al dente. Drain well. Dip into egg, then bread crumbs and fry in hot oil until golden brown. Drain. This can be made ahead of time and kept warm, uncovered, in the oven. ; name: fresh banana berry shake ; ingredients: bananas, strawberry, fresh orange juice, low-fat vanilla ice cream ; preparation:Combine first 3 ingredients in a blender. Process until smooth. Add ice cream. Process until smooth. Pour into glasses. Serve immediately. ; name: bacon and lettuce stuffed cherry tomatoes ; ingredients: cherry tomatoes, fresh chives, bacon, lettuce, mayonnaise, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cut the top off the tomatoes, scoop out the seeds& pulp. Use the seeds & puld in some other recipe. Salt the inside of the tomato and put them upside down on a paper towel to drain for about15 minutes. Meanwhile combine the bacon, chives, lettuce and mayo, season with salt and pepper. Fill the tomatoes just before serving. ; name: kielbasa pasta casserole ; ingredients: ziti pasta, polish sausage, oil, italian-style stewed tomatoes, tomato sauce, dried oregano, fresh parsley, ground black pepper, italian style breadcrumbs, monterey jack cheese ; preparation:

name: lebanese laban mutboukh cooked yogurt ; ingredients: plain yogurt, egg white, cornstarch, salt ; preparation:Place yogurt in a heavy saucepan. Blend beaten egg white into the yogurt. Add cornstartch& salt. Stir in the same direction until well blended. Place pan over medium heat and stir constantly with a wooden spoon. Heat until it starts to boil, always stir in the same direction. Lower heat and let it simmer 3-5 minutes until thick. Use as required in recipes. ; name: baked sweet savory mashed potatoes ; ingredients: baking potatoes, salt, sweet potatoes in syrup, cream cheese, bacon, sour cream, chicken broth, pepper ; preparation:Bring potatoes, 1 teaspoon salt, and water to cover to a boil. Cook 30 minutes, or until tender. Drain. Return potatoes to pan. Add sweet potatoes and cream cheese. Mush until smooth with potato masher. Stir in bacon, next 3 ingredients, remaining 2 teaspoons of salt. Spoon mixture into lightly greased 11x7-inch baking dish. Bake uncovered at 350f for 20 minutes. Garnish with the rest of the bacon. ; name: top secret recipes version of arby s sauce by todd wilbur ; ingredients: ketchup, water, garlic powder, onion powder, black pepper, salt, tabasco sauce ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in small saucepan and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the sauce begins to boil, 5-10 minutes. Remove sauce from the heat. Cover and allow to cool. Pour into a covered container for storage in the refrigerator. Keeps for 2 months. ; name: chile scalloped potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, green chilies, cream of celery soup, milk, bacon, cheese sauce mix, bell pepper, onion ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Mix the potatoes with chiles, soup, milk, bacon, and cheese sauce. Saute the bell pepper and onion in bacon drippings until tender. Add to potato mix. Cover and bake 1 hours. ; name: sukuma wiki ; ingredients: oil, onion, tomatoes, kale, water, salt ; preparation:Heat oil in a frying pan and add the onions. Saut about 2 to 4 minutes. Add tomato and greens and saut about 1 minute. Add cup water and then add salt to taste. Let the mixture simmer until the sukuma is tender. ; name: honey citrus iced tea ; ingredients: tea bags, water, navel oranges, lemons, orange juice, lemon juice, honey, ginger ale ; preparation:

name: cherry tomato and zucchini saut ; ingredients: olive oil, zucchini, cherry tomatoes, green onions, balsamic vinegar, salt & freshly ground black pepper, fresh basil, pine nuts ; preparation:Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over high heat. Add zucchini and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add cherry tomatoes, green onions and balsamic vinegar. Cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes or until zucchini is crisp-tender and tomatoes are heated through. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with basil and pine nuts and serve immediately. ; name: c hudson s ham potato casserole ; ingredients: cooked ham, potatoes, butter, green peppers, onion, flour, milk, mustard powder, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Saute the onion and green pepper in the butter. Gradually add flour, milk and mustard. Cook until thickened, stirring constantly. Put the ham and potatoes in a casserole dish. Pour sauce over. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Top with cheese. Bake uncovered in a 350 degree fahrenheit oven for 25 to 30 minutes. ; name: cranberry fluff ; ingredients: cranberries, miniature marshmallows, sugar, apples, walnuts, green grape, salt, heavy whipping cream ; preparation:Place cranberries in food processor. Cover and process until finely chopped. Transfer to a large bowl. Stir in marshmallows and sugar. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Just before serving, stir in the apples, grapes, walnuts and salt. Fold in the whipped cream. ; name: 3 minute whole wheat bread ; ingredients: dry yeast, milk, whole wheat flour, unbleached flour, flax seed, salt, sugar, vinegar ; preparation:In a medium bowl dissolve the yeast in warm milk. Add the rest of the ingredients and stir well. Pour dough into a 5 x 9 loaf pan. Place into a cold oven and turn the heat to 400f. Do not let this dough rise before putting into oven and oven is cold. Bake for 10 minutes then cut a slit in the top of the dough. After 40 minutes of baking you can brush the top of the loaf with butter or an egg wash. After 60 minutes reduce the heat to 350f then bake another 50 minutes. Remove the bread from the pan and bake another 15-30 minutes. Bread is done when it sounds hollow. ; name: bourbon mustard glazed pork chops ; ingredients: olive oil, pork chops, salt and pepper, grainy mustard, stock, honey, butter, bourbon ; preparation:Preheat oven 400. Place large oven skillet over medium high heat with 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Season the chops and sear until deep golden brown. When chops are seared, add 1 tablespoon olive oil along with the mustard, stock, honey and butter. When liquids come up to a bubble, pour bourbon into the skillet, remove from heat and carefully flame with a lighter. Or just continue boiling the sauce and the alcohol will cook away. Season the sauce with salt and pepper, and continue cooking until it starts to thicken, 2-3 minutes. Flip the chops over and transfer the entire pan to the oven to finish cooking, about 5 minutes. ; name: best bread machine bread ; ingredients: warm water, white sugar, bread machine yeast, oil, skim milk powder, white bread flour, salt ; preparation:

name: herb and garlic goat cheese truffles ; ingredients: cream cheese, goat cheese, fresh lemon juice, fresh chives, fresh basil, garlic, black pepper, pecans, fruit ; preparation:Beat the cream cheese, goat cheese and lemon juice with an electric mixer until smooth. Stir in chives, basil, garlic, and black pepper. Cover and chill for 2 hours or until firm. Shape cheese mixture into 24 balls. Roll each ball in the pecans. Cover and chill for at least 1 hour. Serve with fruit. ; name: persian lemonade ; ingredients: lemons, water, caster sugar, orange blossom water, ice ; preparation:Cut the lemons in half and juice half the lemons. Thinly slice the remaining lemons and place in a heatproof bowl. Combine the lemon juice, water and sugar in a large saucepan over low heat. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and pour warm juice over the lemon slices. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 4 hours to chill and develop the flavours. Stir through the orange blossom water. Divide ice evenly among serving glasses. Pour over the lemonade to serve. ; name: skillet chicken cacciatore ; ingredients: italian dressing, onion, green bell pepper, boneless skinless chicken breast halves, italian seasoning, sugar, stewed tomatoes ; preparation:In a large skillet, heat italian dressing. Add onion, bell pepper, and chicken. Mix well to combine, and cook over moderate heat for approximately 6 minutes, stirring occasionally. In a small bowl, combine italian seasoning, sugar, and undrained stewed tomatoes. Spoon this over the chicken evenly, and lower heat so chicken is just simmering. Simmer for about 12-14 minutes, stirring occasionally. When chicken is fork-tender, it is ready to be served over hot noodles. ; name: swedish coconut cookies ; ingredients: crisco shortening, butter, sugar, flour, baking soda, baking powder, coconut, vanilla, walnuts ; preparation:Set oven to 350 degrees. Cream butter, shortening and sugar with vanilla. Sift the flour, baking soda and baking powder. Add the flour mixture to the butter mixture along with the coconut and nuts. Mix to form a roll. Chill in the fridge for 2 or more hours. Slice and bake on a greased cookie sheet or drop by teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until lightly brown. ; name: old fashioned sugar pie ; ingredients: sugar, cornstarch, salt, milk, butter, vanilla extract, 8 inch pie shell ; preparation:Mix sugar, cornstarch and salt together in a microwavable bowl and stir in the milk. Microwave for 9 minutes, stopping to stir every 3 minutes. The object is to cook until it achieves a thick, pudding-like consistency, so it may take more or less time dependent upon the individual microwave. This can also be performed in a saucepan on the stovetop. Add the butter and vanilla into the mixture. Pour the thick mixture into the baked 8 inch pie shell and sprinkle the top with cinnamon. Serve at room temperature. ; name: 16 hour pulled pork ; ingredients: pork butt, onions, ginger ale, barbecue sauce ; preparation:

name: easy chicken teriyaki ; ingredients: boneless chicken breasts, onion, bell pepper, pineapple slices, teriyaki sauce, butter, aluminum foil, salt and pepper ; preparation:Place one chicken breast in center of a square of alumium foil and salt and pepper. Layer onion and bell pepper slices and 2 pineapple slices on top of each piece of chicken. Drizzle 1-2 tablespoons of bottled teriyaki sauce over chicken mixture. Put 1 tsp butter on top of pineapple slice. Seal up alumium foil by folding edges together. Bake at 375 degrees for approximately 45 minutes. You can also put these on the outdoor grill on indirect heat. Serve with rice. ; name: caribbean blue jello shots ; ingredients: jello gelatin, boiling water, cold water, light rum ; preparation:Bring water to a rolling boil, then remove from heat. Stir together boiling water and powdered gelatin in a mixing bowl. Stir constantly until gelatin is completely dissolved. Stir in cold water and alcohol. Pour mixture into, individual shot-size plastic or paper cups. To make the jello easier to consume, buy plastic cups that also have lids. Pour the mix into the cup, add the lid, then turn it upside down prior to refrigeration. Place shots on a tray in refrigerator. Chill until firm. Refrigerate until served. ; name: oriental wrap quick ; ingredients: chicken rice pilaf mix, oil, ginger, garlic, sliced mushrooms, tortillas, lettuce leaf, chicken, green onion, low sodium soy sauce ; preparation:Prepare rice mix according to package directions. While rice is cooking, heat oil in a small frypan. Saute ginger, garlic and mushrooms until tender. Fold into rice mixture. Lay tortilla flat and line with letuce leaves. Divide rice veggie mixture into 4 equal parts. Spreading on top of lettuce. Lay chicken strips and green onions on top of rice. Sprinkle with soy sauce. Wrap tortilla ends in and roll up. Serve immediately with a ginger conserve or your favourite fresh veggie salsa topping. ; name: french toast fondue ; ingredients: sugar, whole milk, eggs, unsalted butter, cinnamon, french bread, apricot jam, orange juice ; preparation:Heat oven to 375f in a bowl, whisk together sugar, milk, eggs, 3 tablespoons butter and cinnamon. Gently toss bread in mixture until coated well. Spread remaining butter on a rimmed nonstick baking sheet. Add bread cubes in a single layer and bake 12 to 15 minutes. Use a spatula to remove baked cubes from pan and serve immediately with syrup, dipping sauce and toppings. To make apricot dipping sauce, combine jam and orange juice and microwave 1 minute. Stir until smooth. ; name: spinach tortellini soup ; ingredients: tortellini, fresh spinach, chicken stock, garlic cloves, olive oil, white beans, salt, pepper, fresh nutmeg, parmesan cheese ; preparation:In large saucepan heat olive oil and saute garlic. Add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Add pasta and cook until desired tenderness. Add beans and heat. Add spinach. The heat should cook the spinach. Add seasonings. Ladle into bowls and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. ; name: stained glass window cookies ; ingredients: chocolate chips, margarine, mini marshmallows, nuts ; preparation:

name: sausage hamburger dip ; ingredients: bulk pork sausage, lean ground beef, hot salsa, cream of mushroom soup, tomatoes and green chilies, garlic powder, oregano, processed cheese ; preparation:In a large skillet, brown, cook sausage and ground beef for 15 minutes and drain. Place in a 4-5 quart slow cooker sprayed with vegetable cooking spray. Add salsa, mushroom soup, tomatoes, green chilies, garlic powder, and oregeno and stir well. Fold into cheese. Cover and cook on low for 1 hour or until cheese melts. Stir once during cooking. Serve from cooker. ; name: nanay s filipino fried chicken ; ingredients: whole chickens, garlic cloves, bay leaves, whole black peppercorn, soy sauce, distilled white vinegar, water, oil ; preparation:In a large pan combine the chicken, garlic, peppercorns, bay leaves, soy sauce, vinegar and water and bring to a boil. Simmer uncovered over low heat until chicken is cooked through. Remove chicken from pan and pat dry. In a large skillet heat the oil over medium heat until it is hot but not smoking. Then deep fry the chicken in batches until it is brown and the skin looks crispy. Serve with rice. Enjoy --. ; name: baked barbecue chicken ; ingredients: broiler-fryer chickens, onion, ketchup, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, liquid smoke ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Place chicken pieces in 13x9-inch baking dish coated with nonstick cooking spray. Arrange onion slices over top. In small saucepan, combine ketchup, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce, lemon juice and liquid smoke. Heat over medium heat 2 to 3 minutes or until sugar dissolves. Pour over chicken. Bake chicken 1 hour or until juices run clear. Discard onion slices. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. ; name: the queen s spread ; ingredients: pimento stuffed olives, garlic powder, paprika, pepper, cream cheese ; preparation:Set your cream out until soft and quarter. Chop olives. Add one quarter to the bowl and mix in a small amount of the chopped olives. After the second quarter add the rest of the ingredients. Add the rest of the cream and keep mixing ingredients until there seems to be equal amounts throughout the spread of all the ingredients. ; name: portabella mushroom pastries ; ingredients: refrigerated crescent dinner roll, portabella mushroom, garlic, butter, brie cheese ; preparation:Saute garlic and portabella mushrooms in butter. Separate crescent rolls into 4 rectangles. Cut each rectangle into fourths. Put crescent roll in greased mini muffin tins forming a cup. Spoon sauted mushroom and garlic into each. Stuff each with pieces of brie cheese. Bake at 375 for 12-15 minutes or until slightly browned. ; name: crock pot beef with red wine gravy ; ingredients: beef stew meat, onions, beef bouillon cubes, cornstarch, salt, pepper, dry red wine, cooked noodles ; preparation:

name: mayonnaise muffins ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, mayonnaise, milk ; preparation:Combine first 3 ingredients in a small mixing bowl. Add mayonnaise and milk, stirring with a fork until dry ingredients are moistened. Spoon into lightly greased muffin pans, filling three-fourths full. Bake at 450 for 10 to 12 minutes, or till golden brown. Serve warm with butter. ; name: lemon baked chicken ; ingredients: skinless chicken breast halves, butter, salt, paprika, fresh lemon juice, parsley ; preparation:Heat oven to 425. Place chicken breasts in ungreased baking pan, 9 x 9 x 2. Spread 1 tsp butter on each of the four chicken breasts. Sprinkle salt and paprika on the breasts. Drizzle all with the lemon juice. Bake uncovered 35- 45 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with snipped parsley and serve. ; name: hot mexican cider ; ingredients: apple cider, fresh lemon juice, salt, tequila, triple sec, lemon slice ; preparation:Add together the first three ingredients in a saucepan. Over medium heat, bring to a simmer. Add tequila and triple sec and stir occasionally until hot. Pour mixture into 8 mugs. Garnish with lemon slices if desired. ; name: uncle fritz s usa a 1 steak sauce ; ingredients: orange juice, raisins, soy sauce, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, orange zest, ketchup, chili sauce ; preparation:Juice oranges. In a small pot add 4 tbsp of the juice. Add the rasins, soy sauce, vinegar, dijon, and orange zest ketchup and chili sauce. Bring to boil. Let cook at medium heat for 2 minutes. Pour mixture into food processor or use a baton mixer and puree. This will keep for 3 months in the fridge. Just put in small sterized sealed jars. ; name: jicama apple salad ; ingredients: jicama, granny smith apple, carrot, mayonnaise, lemon juice, water, sugar, salt, pepper, cayenne pepper ; preparation:Peel jicama and cut into chunks. Wash apple, core and cut into chunks. Wash carrot, peel if needed, cut into chunks. Add above chunks to food processor and pulse until desired texture is reached. Transfer to bowl and set aside. Combine remaining ingredients, whisk until smooth. Taste for desired seasoning, adjust accordingly. Pour over vegetable mixture and toss. May be served immediately or refrigerate and let flavors meld. ; name: swedish hard candies knck ; ingredients: sugar, dark corn syrup, butter, cream, blanched almonds ; preparation:

name: lemon teriyaki chicken quick and easy ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast, lemon juice, soy sauce, sugar, brown sugar, water, minced garlic cloves, ground ginger ; preparation:Combine all ingredients, except the chicken, in a skillet. Cook on high for 3-4 minutes on the stove. Add the chicken. Simmer for 30 minutes. Serve over rice. ; name: breaded veal cutlet with brie ; ingredients: veal cutlets, butter, olive oil, brie cheese, flour, breadcrumbs, eggs, pasta, parmesan cheese, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Break eggs in a shallow bowl and beat with a little oil, salt and pepper. Place flour in a second bowl and bread crumbs in a third. If necessary, flatten cutlets between two sheets of plastic wrap. Place slices of brie on cutlets and fold in two. Dip in flour, then eggs and finally in bread crumbs. Cook in oil and butter 5 minutes on each side. Serve on a plate with fresh pasta, a slice of lemon and grated parmesan or sharp cheddar. ; name: better for you egg salad ; ingredients: hard-boiled eggs, celery, onion, green pepper, fat-free mayonnaise, spicy brown mustard, table salt, black pepper ; preparation:Peel and rinse eggs. Discard two of the egg yolks. Chop remaining 4 whites and 2 yolks. Mix remaining ingredients. Refrigerate any leftovers, or chill. ; name: bow tie pasta with pink cream sauce ; ingredients: bacon, red pepper flakes, diced onion, garlic cloves, italian plum tomatoes, whipping cream, salt, bow tie pasta, fresh parsley, parmesan cheese ; preparation:In heavy skillet over medium heat cook bacon, pepper flakes, onion and garlic and cook until onion is tender and bacon is done, about 7 minutes. Add tomatoes, cream and salt. Simmer until slightly thickened, about 15 minutes. Toss with cooked pasta. Add lots of parmesan cheese and sprinkle with parsley. ; name: calamari tomato and caper salad ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, garlic cloves, roma tomatoes, crushed red pepper flakes, kosher salt & freshly ground black pepper, calamari, lemon juice, capers, lemon, fresh parsley ; preparation:In a large skillet, heat oil over medium high heat and cook the garlic until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add tomatoes and red pepper flakes and cook about 2 minutes. Season calamari rings with salt and pepper, then add to the skillet. Saute, stirring, until cooked through, about 2 or 3 minutes. Transfer to a colander to drain a bit. Place the lemon juice, olive oil, capers, and lemon zest into a clean glass jar with a lid. Shake to combine, taste, and season with salt and pepper. Transfer the salad to a serving bowl, pour dressing over top and gently toss to coat with dressing. Garnish with fresh parsley. ; name: original cesar cardini caesar salad ; ingredients: garlic cloves, salt, pepper, parmesan cheese, olive oil, red wine vinegar, worcestershire sauce, egg yolk, bacon bits, romaine lettuce leaf ; preparation:

name: prawn avocado cous cous ; ingredients: couscous, shallots, fresh coriander, tomatoes, prawns, avocado, limes, juice and zest of, honey, extra virgin olive oil, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Place cous cous in a heatproof bowl. Add 2 cups warm water and set aside for 15 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Use a fork to separate the grains. Cut prawns lengthwise. Stir in the shallots, tomatoes, coriander, prawns and avocado. To make the lime dressing, combine the lime rind and juice, honey, oil and season with salt and pepper to taste. Pour over the cous cous mixture and toss well to serve. Once avocados are cut, squeeze some lemon juice over the flesh. This helps prevent the flesh from darkening when exposed to the air. ; name: paula deen s broccoli casserole ; ingredients: frozen chopped broccoli, mayonnaise, sharp cheddar cheese, condensed cream of mushroom soup, eggs, crackers, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Spray a 13 x 9 inch baking dish with cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine broccoli, mayonnaise, cheese, soup and eggs. Mix well. Place the mixture in pan. Top with crushed crackers and pour the melted butter evenly over crackers. Bake for 35 minutes or until set and browned. ; name: japanese inspired cucumber salad ; ingredients: english cucumber, purple onion, basil leaves, rice vinegar, white sugar, toasted sesame oil ; preparation:Peel, or partially peel, the english cucumber and slice in rounds as thin as possible. Peel and slice the purple onion as thin as possible. Cut the basil leaves into a very thin chiffonade. Combine the final three ingredients to make the dressing and add to the salad. If you want to let it marinate for a while, wait to add the basil until closer to serving time. ; name: double chocolate cake ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, brown sugar, cocoa, baking soda, salt, water, vegetable oil, vinegar, vanilla, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Heat oven to 350f. Mix flour, brown sugar, cocoa, baking soda, and salt with fork together. Mix in remaining ingredients except chocolate chips and pour into an ungreased 8x8x2-inch baking pan. Sprinkle chocolate chips over batter. Bake until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean, 35-40 minutes. Sprinkle with powdered sugar if desired. ; name: vegan chocolate orange jaffa cupcakes ; ingredients: cocoa powder, hot water, sugar, butter substitute, self-raising flour, baking powder, applesauce, orange juice, orange rind ; preparation:Blend cocoa powder and hot water. Combine the sugar, butter substitute, flour, baking powder and applesauce in a bowl. Beat for 3 to 4 minutes until pale and creamy. Put half the mixture into a second bowl. Fold the orange juice and rind into one bowl. Fold the cocoa-water into the other bowl. Spoon the two mixtures evenly into lined or greased cupcake tins. Draw a knife through the mixture to create a marble effect. Bake at 350f for 20 or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from the oven and leave to cool in the tin for 5 minutes. Cool completely on a wire rack. ; name: spicy caribbean chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, green onions, jalapeno peppers, lemon juice, honey, fresh thyme ; preparation:

name: zesty lemon olives ; ingredients: olives, kosher salt, black peppercorns, bay leaves, rosemary, fennel seed, garlic cloves, dried red pepper flakes, lemons, olive oil ; preparation:If using brine-packed olives, drain them. In a medium bowl, combine the olives, salt, peppercorns, bay leaves, herb sprigs, fennel seeds, garlic and red pepper flakes. Zest the lemons in whatever size zest you like--a mix of finely grated zest for the brightest flavor and larger strips for color. Add the zest and oil to the olives and mix well. Pour and scrape into a covered jar and refrigerate overnight to let the flavors mingle before serving. ; name: quick supper frit ; ingredients: potato, green onions, olive oil, eggs, milk, cheddar cheese, sausage ; preparation:In a medium sized non-stick skillet heat the olive oil. Saute the onion and potatoes until browned and tender. Pour eggs over the top and cook until almost set. Sprinkle cheese over top and cover until eggs are completely set and cheese has melted. Serve while hot. ; name: frozen lite chocolate cheesecake ; ingredients: light corn syrup, half & half light cream, semi-sweet chocolate chips, cocoa powder, sugar substitute, sugar, fat free cream cheese, vanilla extract, reduced-calorie whipped topping, chocolate cookie pie crust ; preparation:Heat syrup and half and half in a microwave-safe container for 1 minute. Stir in chocolate chips and heat for 30 seconds. Stir until smooth and well blended. Pour mixture into blender or food processor. Add cocoa, sucralose, sugar, cream cheese and vanilla. Blend on medium speed in blender until very smooth. Add whipped topping and mix until uniformly blended. Pour into crust. Cover and freeze for at least 6 hours. Remove from freezer and thaw for 15 to 30 minutes before serving. Garnish with additional whipped toopping and cocoa, if desired. For a mocha pie, stir 2 teaspoons instant coffee granules into the syrup mixture before it is microwaved. ; name: white cheese dip ; ingredients: white processed cheese, milk, canned jalapeno slices, garlic cloves, salt ; preparation:In saucepan heat milk to a simmer. Cube cheese. Add to milk and stir until melted. In blender jar add jalapenos and juice. Blend till minced. Add to melted cheese. Add garlic and salt. Serve with tortilla chips or use as a sauce for chimichangas or burritos. ; name: bow ties with sausage and peppers ; ingredients: bow tie pasta, hot italian sausage, sweet pepper, vegetable broth, coarse black pepper ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, cut sausage into bite-size pieces. In a large skillet cook sausage and peppers over med-high heat until sausage is brown. Drain off fat. Add broth & pepper to skillet. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Drain pasta and toss with sausage mixture. ; name: maismeel kadetjes cornmeal muffins ; ingredients: butter, salt, sugar, eggs, milk, baking powder, flour, cornmeal ; preparation:

name: last minute meatloaf ; ingredients: ground chuck, small curd cottage cheese, egg, quick-cooking rolled oats, catsup, prepared mustard, onions, salt, pepper, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Combine beef with first 8 ingredients. Mix well but lightly until well-blended. Press mixture loosely into an 8-inch square baking dish. Bake at 350-degrees for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with grated parmesan cheese. Return to oven and bake 10 minutes longer. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting into squares. ; name: new pickle ; ingredients: cucumbers, yellow onion, sugar, water, white vinegar, dried dill, garlic clove ; preparation:Peel and cut cucumbers into thin slices. Mix with the yellow onion and minced garlic. Bring to a boil the sugar, water, white vinegar, and dill. Pour over cucumber mixture, and chill for 1 hour before serving. This keeps for several days in the fridge. ; name: strawberry special blender dessert ; ingredients: strawberry, heavy cream, sugar, vanilla extract ; preparation:Put strawberries in a blender and blend until the berries are just mashed up. You may need to add a little of the cream to get the mixture going. Add the other remaining ingrediets and blend for 30 seconds or so. Put mixture into 4 individual serving dishes and chill. When ready serve, add whipped cream if desired. ; name: scandinavian cucumber salad recipe ; ingredients: sour cream, parsley flakes, tarragon vinegar, sugar, chives, cucumbers ; preparation:Thinly slice unpeeled cucumbers - use can use a mandolin or slicer for nice paper thin slices. Should be about 3 cups. Whisk sour cream, parsley, vinegar, sugar, and chives in a small bowl. Fold in sliced cucumbers. Cover and chill for at least two hours. ; name: grouper parmesan ; ingredients: grouper fillets, sour cream, parmesan cheese, lemon juice, onion, salt, liquid hot pepper sauce, paprika, fresh parsley ; preparation:Skin fillets if necessary and cut into serving size pieces. Place in a well-greased baking dish. Combine sour cream, parmesan cheese, lemon juice, onion, salt and liquid hot pepper sauce. Spread mixture over the fish. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake at 350 degrees f. For 25 to 30 minutes or until fish flakess easily when tested with a fork. Garnish with parsley. ; name: tangy crock pot beef roast ; ingredients: beef eye round, tomato paste, marsala wine, red wine vinegar, warm water, brown sugar, garlic cloves, onion soup mix, thyme, pepper ; preparation:

name: homemade apple butter bars ; ingredients: brown sugar, all-purpose flour, butter, quick-cooking oats, baking soda, almond extract, salt, apple butter ; preparation:Mix the first 7 ingredients together until crumbly. Spread half the mixture into a lightly greased 13x9 inch pan. Spread apple butter on top. Cover with remaining crumb mixture. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 20-25 minutes. Cool and cut into squares. ; name: curried peas ; ingredients: coconut milk, curry powder, olive oil, fresh ginger, onion, cinnamon, cumin, tomatoes, frozen peas ; preparation:In a small bowl, mix together coconut milk, and curry. In a saucepan, heat oil over medium. Add onion, cinnamon and cumin. Saut until onions are soft. Stir in tomatoes, peas and coconut milk. Reduce heat and simmer until peas are tender. Serve over rice and pass naan bread. ; name: spaghetti with summer tomatoes ; ingredients: cherry tomatoes, yellow cherry tomato, shallots, olive oil, red pepper flakes, salt, pepper, spaghetti, fresh basil ; preparation:In a large skillet combine cherry tomatoes, yellow cherry tomatoes, shallots, olive oil, red pepper flakes, salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Simmer for 5 minutes or until tomatoes are tender. Remove from heat. Bring a pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add spaghetti and cook according to package directions. Just before pasta is done reheat sauce. Slice basil leaves and add to the sauce. Drain pasta and return to pot. Add sauce to pasta and toss. Serve. ; name: peanut butter fudge ; ingredients: sugar, evaporated milk, butter, peanut butter, vanilla extract, marshmallow creme ; preparation:Butter a 9 x 13 inch pan. Mix sugar, evaporated milk and butter in large saucepan. Stir constantly over medium heat and bring to a full boil. Stir 4 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter, vanilla and marshallow. Spread in pan. Cool completely and cut into squares. ; name: tuscan avocado dip ; ingredients: avocado, fruit-fresh produce protector, plum tomatoes, white onion, feta cheese, italian dressing, crackers ; preparation:In a medium mixing bowl, combine avocado and procdue protector. Stir until avocadis is well coated. Add tomatoes, onion, feta cheese and salad dressing. Stir until combined. Serve with crackers or refrigerate until ready to serve. ; name: mean chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: unsalted butter, brown sugar, white sugar, eggs, vanilla, all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, chocolate chips, walnuts ; preparation:

name: vodka sauce with penne ; ingredients: garlic, olive oil, diced tomatoes, vodka, fish bouillon cube, heavy cream, dried tarragon, butter, dry penne pasta, parmesan cheese ; preparation:In a large frying pan, saute garlic in olive oil. Add the drained tomatoes, and bring to a boil. Add the vodka, and simmer for 5-10 minutes. Add the fish boullion, stir until dissolved. Add the cream and the tarragon. Simmer until thickened. Finish off with butter if desired. Toss with cooked pasta. Top with freshly grated parmesan cheese. ; name: smoky grilled asparagus ; ingredients: mayonnaise, extra virgin olive oil, fresh lemon juice, garlic clove, sweet smoked paprika, kosher salt, cumin seed, asparagus ; preparation:Light a grill. In a shallow dish, whisk the mayo with the oil, lemon juice, garlic, paprika, salt and cumin. Add the asparagus and toss. Let stand for 30 minutes. Grill the asparagus over moderately high heat, turning, until tender and blistered in spots, about 6 minutes. Serve warm. ; name: italian mixed vegetables ; ingredients: california-blend frozen vegetables, water, reduced-fat italian salad dressing, salt, basil, oregano ; preparation:In a large nonstick skillet, bring vegetables and water to a boil. Cover and cook for 10-12 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Uncover. Cook and stir until liquid is almost absorbed. Add the salad dressing, salt, basil and oregano. Cook and stir until heated through. ; name: kathleen s burgundy pork tenderloin ; ingredients: pork tenderloin, salt, ground black pepper, garlic powder, onion, celery, red wine, brown gravy mix ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place pork in a 9x13 inch baking dish and sprinkle meat with salt, pepper and garlic powder. Top with onion and celery and pour wine over all. Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes. When done baking, remove meat from baking dish and place on a serving platter. Pour gravy mix into baking dish with wine and cooking juices and stir until thickened. Slice meat and cover with the gravy. ; name: garlic rice india ; ingredients: cooked rice, garlic, chilies, cashews, almonds, cilantro, ghee, salt, pepper ; preparation:Using a heavy wok, heat it up and add the clarified butter. Then add the garlic and green chilies to it. Once garlic turns golden in color, add the dry fruits and roast for half a minute. Now add the cooked rice, sprinkle salt and pepper and mix well. Garnish the garlic rice with fresh coriander and serve. ; name: pesach banana cake ; ingredients: eggs, banana, salt, sugar, potato flour ; preparation:

name: pecan chocolate chip pound cake ; ingredients: sugar, butter, eggs, almond extract, all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, milk, miniature semisweet chocolate chips, pecans ; preparation:In a large mixing bowl, beat sugar, butter, eggs and almond extract on low just until mixed. Beat on high for 5 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally. In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt. On low speed, add flour mixture alternately with milk, mixing just until blended. Fold in chocolate chips. Sprinkle pecans in the bottom of a greased and floured 10-in. Tube pan. Carefully pour batter over pecans. Bake at 325 for 1 hour and 40 minutes or until cake tests done. Cool 20 minutes in pan before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. ; name: herb roasted mediterranean vegetables ; ingredients: vegetables, extra virgin olive oil, garlic cloves, dried rosemary leaves, salt, sugar, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Toss vegetables with oil, garlic, rosemary, salt and sugar. Place in 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Add a little water. Bake at 375 degrees f for 20 minutes. Stir and cover with aluminum foil. Bake another 20 minutes or until tender. Drain of any extra liquid before storing. Sprinkle with cheese. ; name: barbecue style chicken parmesan ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, italian seasoned breadcrumbs, eggs, mozzarella cheese, barbecue sauce ; preparation:Dip washed, boneless, skinless chicken breasts into beaten eggs. Roll chicken into italian bread crumbs - cover liberally. Brown chicken in large skillet in butter on medium heat. Lay a slice or two of mozzarella cheese on top of browned meat. Cover generously with sweet barbecue sauce.
