Cover skillet and simmer for approximately 20 minutes. ; name: christie s baked onion casserole ; ingredients: butter, sweet onions, potato chips, cheddar cheese, cream of mushroom soup, milk, cayenne pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Butter a 2 quart casserole dish. In a large pot, cover onions with water. Bring to a boil and cook until onions are just crisp tender, about 8-10 minutes. Remove from heat and drain well. Layer onion pieces, potato chips and cheese in prepared dish, beginning with onions & ending with cheese. Mix soup and milk together. Stir in cayenne pepper. Pour soup mixture over the top of the cheese. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes or until onions are completely tender. ; name: apple walnut salad ; ingredients: apples, walnut halves, lemon, juice of, fresh lemon zest, mayonnaise, mint leaf, honey ; preparation:Mix together apples, lemon juice, mint leaves and walnuts. In a separate bowl, mix mayonnaise and honey, then pour over apple mixture and toss. Refrigerate for 1 hour, then remove. Serve cold or at room temperature. Garnish with mint sprigs. ; name: crock pot cheese dip with a new twist ; ingredients: cheese spread, cream cheese, rotel, smoked sausage ; preparation:

name: baked margarita pie ; ingredients: prepared graham cracker crusts, margarita mix, egg yolks, sweetened condensed milk, sweetened whipped cream ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450 f and have ready a premade graham cracker pie shell or if you prefer, a baked& cooled regular pie pastry. Whisk together the margarita mixer, the eggs, and the sweetened condensed milk until smooth. Pour into the pie shell and bake for about 10-15 minutes, or until pie is almost set and the top is getting bubbly and edges of filling are just beginning to brown. I placed a pie shield over the crust edges to keep them from overbrowning- if you do not have one, you can cover the crust edges with some foil. Set pie onto a wire rack to cool to room temperature, then cover and place in fridge until fully cooled, at least 1 hour. Before serving, garnish with whipped cream. ; name: eggnog rice pudding ; ingredients: long grain white rice, salt, water, eggnog, nutmeg, dried cranberries ; preparation:Combine the rice, salt, and water in a large, heavy saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium high heat. Cover and reduce heat to low, and simmer until the water has been absorbed, about 15 minutes. Add the egg nog and nutmeg and cook over medium heat stirring continuously about 30 minutes. The rice is done when it becomes thick. Do not over cook the pudding or it will be gummy. Remove from heat. Stir in the cranberries, if desired. Can be served warm or cold. ; name: oklahoma dirt cake ; ingredients: oreo cookies, cream cheese, butter, powdered sugar, french vanilla instant pudding, cool whip, milk, vanilla ; preparation:Crush half the oreo cookies in bottom of pan. Mix margarine, sugar, cream cheese together. In separate bowl, mix pudding, vanilla and milk. Fold in cool whip. Mix both bowls together. Spread over cookies. Crush remaining cookies and sprinkle on top. ; name: shrimp and shallot linguini from trader s joes ; ingredients: shrimp, shallots, butter, olive oil, garlic, black pepper, lemon juice, fresh parsley, linguine ; preparation:Mix melted butter, olive oil, shallots, garlic, pepper, parsley and lemon juice in a bowl. Toss shrimp into mixture. Heat skillet on medium. Pour shrimp mixture into skillet and saute until shrimp turn pink in color. Serve over linguini noodles. ; name: salsa tex mex style ; ingredients: rotel, whole tomatoes, fresh jalapeno pepper, garlic clove, onion, fresh cilantro, fresh lime juice, white sugar, cumin, salt ; preparation:First blend the cilantro, onion, jalapeno and garlic clove in a couple ounces of water. Add the rotel and canned tomatoes and continue to blend. Finally, add the rest of ingredients and keep adjusting the seasonings to your liking. After all the ingredients are blended, pour into a saucepan and let it come to slow boil. This will blend the flavors of each ingredients. Refrigerate. Goes well with white corn tortilla chips. ; name: beet greens with bacon and onion ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic, yellow onion, beet leaves, white wine, bacon bits, salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:

name: mandarin orange bread ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, flour, salt, baking soda, quick-cooking oats, mandarin oranges, orange gelatin, nuts ; preparation:In a large bowl combine the eggs and sugar. Beat until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes. In a small bowl sift together the flour, salt, and baking soda. Add the flour mixture to the egg mixture and stir until smooth. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Spoon into greased and floured 9 x 5-inch loaf pans. Bake at 325-degrees for 1 hour. Remove from pans immediately. Let stand for 24 hours before slicing. Makes 2 loaves. ; name: big blast oatmeal cookies ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, rolled oats, sugar, baking soda, salt, ground cinnamon, unsalted butter, pure vanilla extract, egg white, raisins ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f line a baking sheet with parchment paper & set aside. Combine flour, oats, sugar, baking soda, salt and cinnamon in a medium bowl and stir with a fork to blend. Add butter and vanilla. Blend with fork until moist crumbs form. Add the egg white and beat with fork until stiff dough forms. Use your hands to mix in the raisins. Divide dough in half and place halves four inches apart on baking sheet. Bake until lightly browned. Remove sheet from oven & transfer the parchment to a cooling rack to cool for 15 minutes. Transfer cookies to wire rack and cool completely. ; name: diabetic best ever low fat baked chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, breadcrumbs, fat-free parmesan cheese, rosemary, basil, oregano, black pepper, parsley flakes, fat-free margarine ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 375. Mix bread crumbs, cheese and seasoning in shallow bowl. Dip each chicken breast in melted margarine, then in bread crumb mixture. Place each breast on baking sheet sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Bake for approximately 20-30 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. ; name: fig pine nuts and feta stuffed pork loin ; ingredients: pork loin, fresh figs, honey, pine nuts, fresh basil, feta cheese, salt and pepper, dry rub seasonings ; preparation:Preheat grill to medium high heat. Slice a very thin piece if each steak to cover the hole to hold in the filling, set aside. Slice a small entry along the side of each steak for the filling. Then slice the inside a little larger so to hold more of the filling. Rub each with a touch of olive oil. Season each steak inside and out with salt, pepper and optional rub, set aside. Mix the remaining ingredients together divide into four and fill into the cavity of each steak. Cover the hole with the slice of meat. Grill over direct heat to mark each side of steak then more to indirect heat standing the steaks with the cut side up. Close lid and grill till thermometer registers at 145 degrees. Remove and let rest covered with foil for 10 minutes and it will raise to 155 degrees which is medium. ; name: chocolate nut kentucky pie ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, flour, salt, bourbon, pecans, chocolate chips, pie crusts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Cream butter and sugar. Add beaten eggs, flour, salt, and kentucky bourbon. Add chocolate chips and nuts. Stir well. Pour into partially baked pie shell and bake for 30 minutes, or until center is set. Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream. ; name: toffee bar crunch pie ; ingredients: caramel ice cream topping, milk, instant vanilla pudding, cool whip, chocolate-covered english toffee bars, graham cracker pie crust ; preparation:

name: apricot cranberry sauce ; ingredients: dried apricot halves, cranberry juice cocktail, cranberries, sugar, fresh ginger ; preparation:In 2 qt. Saucepan soak apricots in cranberry juice for 10 minutes. Add cranberries, sugar, and ginger. Heat to boiling. Reduce heat and cook uncovered 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Cover and refrigerate till well chilled. ; name: aunt myrna s oatmeal chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: sugar, brown sugar, shortening, eggs, vanilla, flour, baking soda, salt, oatmeal, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Beat sugars, shortening, eggs & vanilla until fluffy. Mix in flour, soda & salt. Stir in oatmeal and chips by hand. Let the dough rest for about 10 minutes or so to moisten the oatmeal. Drop on cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees, 8 minutes on bottom rack and 8 minutes on top rack. ; name: crock pot slow cooker beef strips in mushroom gravy ; ingredients: steak, dry onion soup mix, mushroom soup, water, green capsicum, herbs, spices ; preparation:Combine all ingredients except meat in crock pot. Add meat. Cover and cook on low for 6 - 8 hours. Before serving, thicken gravy with flour or cornstarch mixed with a little water. Just before serving add 1 cup sour cream to gravy and stir well. Serve over noodles. ; name: birthday cookie ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, sugar, egg, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream butter and sugars. Add egg and vanilla. Mix on low speed, add dry ingredients. Mix well. Stir in chocolate chips or m&ms. Spray a 12 inch round pizza pan with pam and spread cookie dough evenly to the edges. Bake at 325 degrees f for 15 to 20 minutes, or until light golden brown. When cool, decorate as desired. ; name: vegetables au gratin ; ingredients: potatoes, courgette, aubergine, tomatoes, single cream, vegetable stock cube, salt and pepper, chives, jarlsberg cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180c and grease an oven proof dish. Bring the cream to the boil, add the stock cube and stir to dissolve. Add salt, pepper and chives. Blend in half the grated jarlsberg until it melts and the sauce is smooth. Layer all the vegetables in the dish and pour in the sauce. Sprinkle the remaining grated cheese on top. Bake in mid oven for 30 - 45 minutes. ; name: tropical glazed chicken strips ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, vegetable oil, pineapple-orange juice concentrate, butter, ground ginger, soy sauce ; preparation:

name: fiesta yellow squash ; ingredients: margarine, fresh onion, green pepper, yellow squash, salt, pepper, thyme, lemon juice ; preparation:Melt butter in skillet. Add onion and green pepper. Cook until tender. Add squash and seasonings. Mix well. Cook, covered, over moderately low heat for 10 to 15 minutes until crisp-tender. ; name: amazing vegan chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: whole wheat flour, baking soda, salt, margarine, brown sugar, vanilla extract, semisweet vegan chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat the oven t 375. Mix all of the dry ingredients, excluding the chocolate chips. Stir in the wet ingredients. Add the chocolate chips. If the batter is too dry, add 1tbs of soymilk. Bake tablespoon-sized cookies on a greased cookie sheet for 7-10 minutes. Be sure to place the cookies about 2 apart, because they expand as they bake. ; name: ham fried rice ; ingredients: cooked rice, oil, garlic, onion, soy sauce, eggs, ham, teriyaki sauce, peas ; preparation:In a wok or frying pan heat 2 tbsp oil. Add onions and garlic. Saut until onions are tender. Add rice, soy sauce, eggs, teriyaki sauce and ham. Let sit 10-15 minutes stirring occasionally. The less you stir it the more crunchiness there will be. Add peas, cover and let stand 5 minutes. Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds. ; name: sugarless apple cookies ; ingredients: dates, apple, raisins, water, all-purpose flour, ground cinnamon, baking soda, eggs, artificial sweetener ; preparation:In a large saucepan, combine dates, apple, raisins and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and cool. Combine flour, cinnamon and baking soda. Stir into apple mixture and mix well. Combine eggs and sweetener. Add to batter and mix well. Drop by tablespoonfuls onto a nonstick baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. ; name: bacon wrapped grilled chicken ; ingredients: teriyaki sauce, dry white vermouth, garlic, boneless skinless chicken breasts, vegetable oil, bacon ; preparation:In a ziplock bag, combine the teriyaki sauce, vermouth and garlic. Add chicken and coat with teriyaki mixture. Refrigerate at least 3 hours. Prepare bbq for medium high heat. Brush bbq rack with vegetable oil. Remove chicken from marinade and wrap each breast with 2 strips of bacon, covering completely and securing with toothpicks. Grill chicken until it is firm to the touch, about 15 minutes, turning occasionally. Serve. ; name: barley corn and cherry tomato salad ; ingredients: barley, salt, white wine vinegar, basil leaves, olive oil, corn kernels, cherry tomatoes ; preparation:

name: pacific fire shrimp ; ingredients: butter, creole seasoning, lemon pepper, rosemary, tabasco sauce, lemon juice, shrimp ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Mash the butter with the creole seasoning, lemon pepper, rosemary, tabasco sauce and lemon juice. Arrange shrimp in a baking dish and brush on the seasoned butter. Bake for 5 to 6 minutes. Serve hot. French bread goes well with this on the side. This can be made in advance, spread on the butter seasoning, refrigerate up to 8 hours. Heat and serve. ; name: mediterranean cauliflower salad ; ingredients: cauliflower, red bell pepper, fresh parsley, greek olive, capers, wine vinegar, olive oil, dried oregano, salt and pepper ; preparation:Steam cauliflower florets until just tender. Refresh under cold water to stop the cooking process. In a bowl, combine cauliflower, pepper, parsley, olives and capers, toss lightly. Whisk together the vinegar, oil and oregano and pour over vegetables. Marinate in the refrigerator for two hours or even overnight. Serve cold. ; name: lemon thyme rainbow trout ; ingredients: trout fillet, all-purpose flour, lemon rind, dried thyme, salt and pepper, lemon juice, vegetable oil ; preparation:Divide fish into 4 equal pieces if necessary. In shallow bowl, combine flour, lemon rind, thyme, salt and pepper. Dip fish into lemon juice. Dredge in flour mixture, turning to coat. In nonstick skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Cook fish, turning once, for 6 to 8 minutes or until flakes easily when tested with fork. ; name: cilantro grilled chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, dijon mustard, garlic cloves, fresh cilantro, seasoning salt, fresh coarse ground black pepper, limes, juice of ; preparation:Pound chicken breasts between wax paper enough to flatten. Combine oil, lime juice, vinegar, mustard, garlic, cilantro, salt and pepper in a bowl. Add chicken, coat well and marinate at least 1 hour. Grill or broil chicken breasts for about 6 minutes on each side, basting once with left over marinate mixture. Preperation time does not include marinate time. ; name: no bake coconut cake ; ingredients: angel food cake, instant vanilla pudding, coconut, cool whip, milk ; preparation:Crumble angle food cake in large dish. Mix instant pudding& milk according to the instructions on the package. Add coconut. Pour over cake and mix thoroughly. Top with cool whip, chill. ; name: bourbon mustard brisket crock pot ; ingredients: sweet onions, beef brisket, garlic salt, salt-free lemon pepper, spicy brown mustard, hickory and brown sugar barbecue sauce, bourbon, light brown sugar ; preparation:

name: low carb macadamia nut mock banana muffins ; ingredients: wheat bran, soy flour, splenda sugar substitute, baking powder, eggs, heavy cream, banana extract, club soda, macadamia nuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Spray muffin tin with vegetable oil spray. Mix wheat bran and 1 t soy flour, then coat the muffin tin with the mixture. Mix soy flour, splenda, baking powder, eggs, cream, and banana extract in a large bowl with a wire whisk. Whisk in club soda. Fold in nuts. Fill muffin tins evenly, and bake for 20 to 25 minutes, using the toothpick test for doneness. The tops will be golden brown, but it is a bit hard to tell by color change since soy flour is dark. ; name: better than starbucks blueberry muffins ; ingredients: ground almonds, ground walnuts, baking powder, salt, xylitol sweetener, eggs, butter, water, vanilla, blueberries ; preparation:Stir almonds, walnuts, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. In a separate bowl, lightly whisk the eggs, and, then, add the melted butter, water, vanilla, xylitol and whisk until combined. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until combined. Fold in frozen blueberries. Divide the batter among 8 muffin tins lined with paper cups and sprayed with pam. Bake at 350 f for about 20 minutes. ; name: lentils with chorizo red wine ; ingredients: green lentils, onions, garlic clove, chicken stock, red wine vinegar, red wine, chorizo sausage, parsley, thyme, salt and pepper ; preparation:Fry the onion and garlic in a little oil then add the lentils, red wine, stock, vinegar and thyme. Simmer gently for 30 minutes until tender, add the chorizo for the last 5 minutes of cooking time. Season with salt and pepper. Stir through the parsley. Serve with lots of crusty bread. ; name: low fat pumpkin scones ; ingredients: self-raising flour, sugar, butter, pumpkin, egg, salt, milk, cooking spray ; preparation:Preheat oven to 220c. Cream butter and sugar together. In a large bowl, place flour and salt. Add the egg, pumpkin, creamed butter and sugar and milk to dry mixture and mix with a wooden spoon until just combined. Depending on the wetness of the mixture, you may need to add a little more milk. Lightly grease muffin tray with canola spray and spoon mixture into tray. Bake at 220c for 10-15 mins, or until tops of muffins spring back when lightly touched. ; name: mexican cheddar skillet chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, oil, long-grain minute rice, whole tomatoes, chunky salsa, sharp cheddar cheese ; preparation:Cook chicken in skillet in hot oil 4 to 5 minutes or until browned. Stir in rice, tomatoes and salsa. Reduce heat to low. Cover. Simmer 8 to 10 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Continue cooking about 3 minutes or until cheese is melted. ; name: cinnamon walnut granola ; ingredients: rolled oats, walnuts, golden raisin, ground flax seed, brown sugar, olive oil, honey, cinnamon, vanilla ; preparation:

name: strawberry trifle ; ingredients: sponge cake, topping mix, non-fat strawberry yogurt, strawberry, kiwi fruits, slivered almonds ; preparation:Cut the cake vertically into halves. Slice the cake into fingers. Prepare topping mix as per instructions on the packet but using skimmed milk, or if using fresh cream, whip until stiff. Layer half the cake pieces, yoghurt, whipped topping, strawberries and kiwi in a 2 quart serving bowl. Repeat layers and sprinkle with almonds. Garnish with whole strawberries, if desired. Refrigerate for atleast 2 hours. For an alternative taste, grate the rind of an orange and a lemon and sprinkle over the sponge. Use orange flavoured yoghurt and top with tinned mandarines instead of strawberries. ; name: surprise bars ; ingredients: ritz cracker, condensed milk, skor chips, milk chocolate chips ; preparation:Heat oven to 350. Crush crackers to small pieces but not crumbs. Add skor bits and mix. Pour in condensed milk, mix thoroughly. Pat into 9 x 13 pan lined with parchment paper. Bake approx 15 minutess. Sprinkle chocolate chips over base. Return to the oven for about 2 minutes. Remove from oven,. Spread melted chocolate evenly over the top. Cool, cut into bars. ; name: oven baked panko breaded eggplant ; ingredients: eggplant, plain yogurt, panko breadcrumbs, extra virgin olive oil, cumin, paprika, lemon zest, italian seasoning, seasoning ; preparation:Slice eggplant lengthwise into fairly thin slices. Season yogurt and panko breadcrumbs with desired seasonings. Coat both sides of eggplant in yogurt. Press coated eggplant into panko bread crumbs pushing down into mixture to get even coating. Place onto cookie sheet. Drizzle both sides with of breaded eggplant with olive oil. Place in oven at 350f for 15 to 20 minutes take out and flip each eggplant and return to oven for 20 minutes or desired crispness. ; name: shrimp and strawberry salad ; ingredients: cooked rice, shrimp, celery, low-fat mayonnaise, low-fat strawberry yogurt, dry mustard, lemon juice, salt, fresh strawberries, romaine lettuce ; preparation:Combine rice, shrimp and celery in a large bowl. Whisk together mayonnaise, yogurt, mustard, lemon juice and salt in a medium bowl. Add yogurt mixture to rice mixture and stir until well combined. Fold in strawberries. Cover and chill until serving time. Arrange lettuce on individual serving plates. Top with chilled salad. ; name: grill pork with rosemary and lavender ; ingredients: pork loin, kosher salt, fresh coarse ground black pepper, dried lavender flowers, fresh thyme leaves, fresh rosemary leaf, garlic cloves, fresh lemon juice, extra virgin olive oil ; preparation:Combine salt, pepper, lavender, thyme, rosemary, garlic, lemon juice and olive oil. Rub mixture onto the pork chops. Cover the chops with plastic wrap and let sit 1 to 2 hours at room temperature. Preheat barbecue grill. Place pork chops onto hot grill. Cover barbecue with lid and grill 4 to 5 minutes. Turn and grill an additional 3 to 4 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 155f on a meat thermometer. Remove from barbecue and serve. ; name: lemon coconut bars ; ingredients: flour, powdered sugar, margarine, eggs, sugar, baking powder, lemon juice concentrate, flaked coconut ; preparation:

name: fooled you maple spread ; ingredients: brown sugar, all-purpose flour, milk, butter, maple extract ; preparation:In a saucpan, stir together brown sugar, flour, milk and butter. Turn heat to low and cook, stirring often, until mixture is lump-free and smooth. Remove from heat and stir in maple extract. Place in a bowl or jar and refrigerate until serving. After it is chilled you can bring it to room temperature if you wish, to make spreading easier. ; name: tortellini alfredo with prosciutto artichoke hearts ; ingredients: cheese-filled egg tortellini, whipping cream, parmesan cheese, prosciutto, marinated artichoke hearts ; preparation:Prepare tortellini according to package instructions. Drain. Heat cream in a large skillet over low heat. Gradually sprinkle in cheese, stirring constantly, until blended. Simmer, stirring occasionally, 15 to 20 minutes. Add tortellini, prosciutto, and artichoke hearts. Simmer, stirring occasionally, 5 to 10 minutes or until sauce is slightly reduced. Serve immediately. Serve with crusty italian bread, if desired. ; name: eggnog caramels ; ingredients: sugar, brown sugar, butter flavor shortening, light corn syrup, eggnog, ground nutmeg ; preparation:Line an 8x8-inch baking pan with a double-thickness of foil. Coat well with cooking spray. Place all ingredients in a heavy, deep-sided saucepan. Attach a candy thermometer to the side of the saucepan. Bring mixture to a boil over high heat, stirring constantly. Lower heat to medium and continue cooking, stirring constantly, until mixture reaches 245 degrees f. Immediately pour caramel mixture into prepared pan. Cool and refrigerate for 3 hours or more, until completely firm. Using foil, lift caramel slab from prepared pan. Pull the foil down from the sides of the caramel. Using a long knife, trim the edges off the caramel slab, and then cut the block of caramel into 8 rows. Cut each row into 8 squares. ; name: mandarin orange salad ; ingredients: romaine lettuce, cashews, mandarin oranges, radishes, mayonnaise, gingerroot, seasoned rice vinegar, white pepper ; preparation:Tear lettuce into small bite sized pieces. Combine lettuce, nuts and radishes in a large bowl. Mix the dressing ingredients in a small bowl. Toss the lettuce and dressing and place in serving bowls. Arrange the chilled mandarin orange sections on top and serve. ; name: john wayne s corn chowder ; ingredients: butter, white onion, chicken broth, potato, corn kernels, thyme, bay leaf, cream ; preparation:Saute onions in butter until they are tender and translucent. Add the corn, potatoes, chicken broth and herbs. Simmer for 25 minutes. Puree the soup in a blender. Return to pot. Before serving, add the cream and butter, stir, and check the seasonings. Add salt and pepper if necessary. ; name: blueberry lime jam bread machine ; ingredients: fresh blueberries, sugar, dry pectin, fresh lime juice, lime zest ; preparation:

name: ranch pasta primavera ; ingredients: carrot, broccoli, fettuccine, chicken broth, basil, ranch dressing, parmesan cheese, parsley ; preparation:Steam veggies together and cool. Cook pasta in broth. Drain and cool. Combine with veggies. Add basil and dressing and toss. Sprinkle with cheese and parsley. ; name: lower calorie chicken piccata ; ingredients: dijon mustard, egg, italian seasoned breadcrumbs, chicken breast, olive oil, chicken broth, lemon juice, parsley, lemon ; preparation:Combine the mustard and egg in a small bowl. Place the bread crumbs on a sheet of wax paper. Dip the chicken in the egg, then in the bread crumbs to cover. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook the chicken in the oil until golden and cooked through, about 5 minutes on each side. Transfer to a plate. Add the broth and lemon juice to the skillet. Simmer 30 seconds, stir in the parsley. Pour the sauce over the chicken and garnish with the lemon sliced, if desired. ; name: lemon crinkle cookies ; ingredients: shortening, brown sugar, egg, fresh lemon rind, all-purpose flour, baking soda, cream of tartar, ground ginger, salt, sugar ; preparation:Cream shortening and brown sugar until fluffy. Add egg and lemon rind, beating well. Combine flour, baking soda, cream of tartar, ginger, and salt. Stir into creamed mixture. Roll dough into 1-inch balls. Roll each in sugar. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes. ; name: championship hot dogs ; ingredients: bacon, beer, hot dogs, hot dog buns, spicy brown mustard, sweet onion, bell peppers ; preparation:Cook bacon over medium-low heat until crispy. Drain on clean paper towels. Crumble cooked bacon. Bring beer to a boil in an 8- to 10-inch skillet. Add hot dogs to boiling beer. Immediately reduce heat and simmer hot dogs for about 4 to 5 minutes or until an internal temperature of 160 degrees f is reached. Place hot dogs in buns and top with 1 tablespoon each of mustard, onions, peppers and bacon. ; name: ancient greek fish with coriander ; ingredients: coriander seeds, salt, cod fish fillets, olive oil, white wine vinegar ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 375f. Place the coriander seeds in a baking pan and bake them for 10 minutes. Let them cool for 5 minutes. Mash them with mortar & pestle together with the salt. In small bowl, whisk together olive oil and vinegar. Dredge cod fillets in oil mixture. Toss fillets with the coriander mixture and place them in a baking pan. Cover the pan and place it in the oven. Bake the fish for 20 25 minutes. Remove from the oven, sprinkle with vinegar and serve hot. ; name: stuffed strawberries ; ingredients: strawberries, cream cheese, walnuts, splenda sugar substitute, orange extract ; preparation:

name: lazy man s version of pharris peanut cookies ; ingredients: peanut butter cookie dough, wheat flakes cereal, salted peanuts, unbleached cane sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Break up cookie dough in a large mixing bowl. Stir in the crushed wheaties cereal. Stir in the chopped peanuts. Roll dough into 1-inch balls. Place sugar in separate small bowl. Dip balls in sugar. Place balls of cookie dough 2-3 inches apart on baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Flatten balls of cookie dough with the bottom of a glass. Bake cookies for 10-12 minutes, until edges are browned. Cool on wire rack. Store in air-tight container. ; name: buttermilk cheese bread bread machine ; ingredients: water, egg, sharp cheddar cheese, whole wheat flour, bread flour, dry buttermilk, salt, yeast, lemon pepper ; preparation:Place ingredients in bread machine pan in recommended order and set on dough cycle. Check consistency of dough and add additional water or flour, if necessary. At end of cycle, remove, shape, and let rise until approximately doubled. Bake in preheated 350 deg. Oven. For app. 30 to 40 minute. ; name: blood orange lemonade ; ingredients: water, sugar, oranges, juice of, lemons, juice of, orange blossom water ; preparation:In a pitcher, blend water and sugar until the sugar dissolves. Add orange blossom water, blood orange juice and lemon juice. Stir. Add what remains of one lemon and one blood orange. Let chill for 30 minutes. Serve over ice. ; name: chicken cordon bleu portabella in a white sauce ; ingredients: portabella mushrooms, chicken breasts, ham, provolone cheese, salt, cream of mushroom soup, whole milk, white wine, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray bottom of pan and arrange mushrooms in baking dish. Next take the chicken and stretch it out, dont tear though. Next, take your slice of ham and place it on the chicken, then your cheese on your ham. Take the small end of the chicken and gently roll the chicken tucking in the sides. Place the chicken on the mushrooms. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Next, mix all ingredients of the sauce together and pour over the chicken. Bake for 40-45 min or until chicken is done and juices run clear. ; name: low carb macaphony and cheese ; ingredients: firm tofu, sharp cheddar cheese, eggs, cream, onion powder, cayenne, garlic powder, dry mustard, paprika, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Drain tofu well. Mix all ingredients together mashing the tofu well,. Place in a buttered casserole dish. Sprinkle with parmesan and a little paprika. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes. The top should be golden brown. ; name: creole cabbage ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, green bell pepper, garlic cloves, butter, tomatoes, rotel tomatoes, tomato sauce, cabbage, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: asparagus parmesan pita rounds ; ingredients: asparagus, olive oil, garlic cloves, pita bread, plum tomatoes, dried basil, crushed red pepper flakes, salt, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450f. Steam asparagus, covered, 2 minutes or until crisp tender. Rinse with cold water. Drain. Combine oil and garlic. Brush over pitas. Arrange tomato slices and asparagus on pitas. Sprinkle with basil, pepper, and salt. Top evenly with parmesan cheese. Bake for 7 to 8 minutes or until edges are golden. ; name: buttercrumb parsnips ; ingredients: parsnip, milk, fine dry breadcrumb, salt, dry mustard, fresh ground pepper, butter ; preparation:Peel and trim parsnips. Boil whole until just tender in lightly salted water, about 10 minutes. Drain, pat dry. Pour milk into a small, shallow bowl, combine breadcrumbs with salt, mustard, and pepper in shallow pan. Melt butter in a medium frying pan over medium heat. Roll each parsnip first in milk, then in the breadcrumbs and place in butter. Fry, turning four time, until parsnips are golden and crisp all round. Watch carefully so as not to burn the butter and adjust heat as necessary. ; name: pumpkin pie crunch light version ; ingredients: solid pack pumpkin, evaporated skim milk, eggs, egg whites, splenda brown sugar blend, pumpkin pie spice, jiffy corn muffin mix, pecans, quick oats, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325. Spray 9x13 glass pan with non-stick spray. In a large bowl, combine first 6 ingredients. Pour into pan. Sprinkle boxed muffin mix on top of pumpkin. Then sprinkle with quick oats and pecans. Drizzle melted butter over all. Bake 325 degrees for 50 minutes, or until edges are golden and a knife inserted in the center tests clean. May serve with lite cool whip. ; name: cran raspberry waldorf salad ; ingredients: whole berry cranberry sauce, raspberry jell-o gelatin, boiling water, celery rib, apples, walnuts ; preparation:In a medium mixing bowl place jello and pour boiling water over. Stir till dissolved. Add cranberry sauce, stirring with a fork if necessary to break up. Stir till combined. Add in celery, apples and nuts. Stir to mix in fairly evenly. Pour into a 6-cup mold or 8-inch square pan. Chill till set, 2-3 hours. ; name: belgian endive and apple salad with cranberry vinaigrette ; ingredients: olive oil, frozen cranberry juice concentrate, white wine vinegar, belgian endive, apples, fresh cranberries, green onion, walnuts ; preparation:Whisk oil, cranberry juice concentrate and vinegar in small bowl to blend. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Combine endive and apples in medium bowl. Pour dressing over. Toss to coat. Sprinkle cranberries, green onions and walnuts over and serve. ; name: ancho chile marinade for meat ala chipotle ; ingredients: dried ancho chiles, black pepper, cumin powder, fresh oregano, garlic cloves, red onion, vegetable oil, chicken breasts ; preparation:

name: metric jester s famous homemade bread ; ingredients: warm water, sugar, salt, fast rising yeast, extra virgin olive oil, flour ; preparation:Dissolve sugar and salt in warm water, then stir in yeast. Allow yeast mixture to sit for 5 to 10 min. Place flour into mixing bowl, making a hole in the centre. Drizzle oil over flour, and then combine yeast and flour mixes. Knead on a floured surface until it creates a ball. Place in bread pan and allow to rise 2 hours. If dough is double in size, preheat oven to 350f. Bake until golden. If using a breadmaker, be sure to follow the proper directions for your bread maker, however i suggest you dissolve the sugar and salt in the water first. ; name: grilled pizza sandwiches ; ingredients: mayonnaise, dried italian seasoning, whole wheat bread, pepperoni, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Stir together mayonnaise and italian seasoning. Spread half of mixture on one side of each bread slice. Layer pepperoni and cheese on each of 4 slices of bread. Top with remaining bread slices. Spread half of remaining mayonnaise mixture on 1 side of sandwiches. Place sandwiches, mayonnaise side down, on a hot nonstick skillet or griddle. Cook over medium heat until bread is browned. Spread remaining mayonnaise mixture on ungrilled sides of sandwiches. Turn and cook until sandwiches are browned. ; name: banana pineapple jam ; ingredients: bananas, crushed pineapple with juice, sugar, liquid pectin ; preparation:Peel and mash the bananas, then add the pineapple to the bananas. Add the sugar to the fruit mixture and pour it into a large enameled pot. Stir over low heat until sugar dissolves. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring continuously. Boil mixture for 1 minute. Remove from heat, stir in pectin, and stir for 5 minutes. Skim and seal in hot sterilized canning jars. May be water bath processed for 10 minutes, if preferred. ; name: lu s chili mac ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, garlic clove, green pepper, diced tomatoes, chili powder, worcestershire sauce, red beans, salt and pepper, cooked macaroni ; preparation:Cook macaroni according to package directions. Brown ground beef in a large skillet. Drain fat. Add onions and garlic and cook until onion is soft. Add green pepper and tomatoes, chili powder and worcestershire sauce. Cover and simmer on low about 20 minutes. Stir in macaroni. Salt and pepper to taste. ; name: cheesy onion rye bread ; ingredients: unsalted butter, onion, plain flour, rye flour, fast-rising active dry yeast, salt, extra-sharp cheddar cheese, milk ; preparation:Melt a little butter, add the onion and fry for 4-5 minutes, until softened. Sift the flours together. Add the yeast, salt, cheese, onion and remaining butter and sufficient milk to mix to a dough. Knead until smooth. Place in a lightly oiled bowl, cover and leave in a warm place for 1- 2 hours to rise. Turn out, knead gently and shape into a round loaf. Place on a baking sheet and leave to rise for 45-60 minutes. Brush with water, sprinkle with a little flour, cut a criss-cross pattern on the top and bake at 425f 30-35 minutes. ; name: 7 30 salad ; ingredients: romaine lettuce hearts, baby spinach, hearts of palm, cucumber, carrot, tomatoes, red onion, frozen green pea, capers ; preparation:

name: easy overnight caramel rolls ; ingredients: frozen dough rolls, butterscotch pudding mix, brown sugar, butter, pecans ; preparation:Spray a bundt pan or an angel food cake pan with nonstick cooking spray. Place the rolls in the pan, sprinkle the whole package of butterscotch pudding mix over the rolls, sprinkle the brown sugar over the pudding mix, pour the butter over the brown sugar, and top with the pecans. Cover and place in the refrigerator overnight, or let rise for 4-5 hours before baking. Preheat oven to 350. Bake the rolls for 20-25 minutes. Let cool. ; name: weight watchers sauteed shrimp ; ingredients: olive oil, shrimp, fresh lemon juice, salt-free lemon & herb seasoning, table salt, black pepper, fresh parsley ; preparation:Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add shrimp and saut 1 minute. Add lemon juice, lemon herb seasoning, salt and pepper. Stir to coat shrimp. Saut until shrimp are bright pink and cooked through, about 3 minutes more. Remove from heat and stir in parsley. Yields about 3 ounces of shrimp per serving. ; name: roasted zucchini and garlic spread ; ingredients: cooking spray, zucchini, onion, garlic cloves, plain yogurt, fresh parsley, lemon juice ; preparation:Line a jelly roll pan with foil and spray with cooking spray. Arrange zucchini, onion and garlic in a single layer on the pan. Bake at 425 until vegetables are very tender, about 15-25 minutes. Cool. Process vegetables in a food processor, until coarsely chopped. Stir in yogurt and parsley. Season to taste with lemon juice, salt and pepper. ; name: grilled rosemary pork chops ; ingredients: olive oil, red wine vinegar, garlic clove, fresh rosemary, coarse sea salt, fresh coarse ground black pepper, worcestershire sauce, center-cut pork loin chops ; preparation:Mix oil, vinegar, garlic, rosemary, salt, & pepper, and brush on chops. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes or as long as overnight. Preheat grill. Grill 5-8 minutes on each side, depending on thickness. Let rest 1-2 minutes before serving. ; name: marinated boneless venison loin ; ingredients: venison loin, cooking oil, water, bay leaf, onion, thyme, red wine ; preparation:Place the meat in a glass dish and pour the cooled marinade over it. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. Remove the meat from the marinade and dry on paper towels. Heat the oil in a frying pan over high heat. Add the meat and fry it quickly for 2-3 minutes on each side. Serve immediately on heated plates. Marinade------------. Place the water, bay leaf, onion and thyme, in a pan, bring to boil. Lower heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Cool slightly and add the red wine, then cool the marinade in the fridge. ; name: hot or cold carrot soup ; ingredients: onion, extra virgin olive oil, fresh ginger, baby carrots, chicken broth, honey, salt ; preparation:

name: spicy sausage and pepper stew ; ingredients: reduced-fat italian sausage, green pepper, celery, flour, reduced-sodium beef broth, no-salt-added diced tomatoes, kidney beans ; preparation:Cook sausage, pepper and celery in large saucepan on medium-high heat 8 to 10 minutes or until sausage is no longer pink, stirring frequently. Drain. Add flour. Cook and stir 1 minute. Stir in broth, tomatoes with their liquid and beans. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover. Simmer 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve with crackers. ; name: ajvar eggplant aubergine peppers ; ingredients: eggplants, red sweet peppers, salt, pepper, garlic clove, lemon, oil, parsley ; preparation:Bake eggplants and sweet peppers at 350 f until tender when pierced with a fork. Peel skin from hot vegetables and chop or mince the vegetables. Season to taste with salt and pepper and stir in the garlic and lemon juice. Gradually stir in as much of the oil as the vegetables will absorb. Mix well. Pile into a glass dish and sprinkle with parsley. ; name: zesty potato soup ; ingredients: potatoes, water, garlic clove, salt, pepper, milk, american cheese, chicken bouillon granule, butter, dried parsley ; preparation:In large sauce pan, combine first 5 ingrediants. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 15 minute do not drain-- mash potatoes in liquid until almost smooth. Add remaining ingredients. Cook until cheese is melted. Stir continuously. I sprinkle with crumbled bacon and shredded cheddar cheese. Enjoy. ; name: moroccan tomato chicken with couscous ; ingredients: chicken legs, mixed spice, vegetable oil, brown onion, tomatoes, zucchini, couscous, chicken stock powder, parsley, lemon zest ; preparation:Toss chicken in spice mix. Heat oil in a large frying pan over moderate heat and add chicken and cook, turning for 3 minutes or until browned all over. Remove from pan and add onion to pan and cook and stir for 3 minutes or until soft and then add tomato and 1 cup boiling water and mix well. Add chicken and bring to a simmer, cover, cook stirring occasionally for 15 minutes. Add zucchini and cook for 5 minutes or until chicken is cooked. Meanwhile place couscous and stock powder in a medium heatproof bowl and stir in 1 cup boiling water, cover with plastic food wrap, set aside for 5 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and then using a fork, fluff and separate grains. Combine parsley and zest in a small bowl and then add half the parsley mix to the couscous and toss to combine. Spoon chicken and sauce over couscous and serve sprinkled with remaining parsley mix. ; name: the slim jim sandwich my way ; ingredients: hoagie rolls, lettuce leaves, tomatoes, brown sugar ham, swiss cheese, thousand island dressing, dill pickle slices ; preparation:On top halves of toasted buns, spread each with two teaspoons of salad dressing. Set aside. On a microwave safe plate, separate ham slices and heat through. Divide ham into two equal portions on the plate. Cover each portion with 2 slices of cheese overlapping each other. Heat until cheese is slightly melted. On bottom half of each bun, place in this order, 2 lettuce leaves, 2 tomato slices overlapping each other. Place cheese covered ham over tomato slices. Top with remaining bun. Cut sandwich on the slant. ; name: baked brown sugar squash ; ingredients: acorn squash, butter, brown sugar, ground cinnamon ; preparation:

name: renkon butter ; ingredients: butter, peanut oil, fresh lotus root, soy sauce, bonito flakes ; preparation:Over medium-high temperature, heat a saut pan. Add the butter and peanut oil, melt together, and simmer until the butter is almost browned. Add the lotus root slices and saut until edges are browned on each side. Add the soy sauce, stir, turn slices over, remove the pan from heat, and let sit for about 15 to 20 seconds. Move the lotus root to a shallow serving bowl and cover with the bonito flakes. Serve immediately. ; name: yogurt or sour cream crumb fruit topping ; ingredients: pumpernickel bread, butter, raw sugar, plain yogurt, apricots ; preparation:Slowly saute bread crumbs in butter until toasted and very crisp, stirring frequently. Allow crumbs to cool and drain on paper towel. Mix with sugar to sweeten. Whip chilled yogurt until smooth, turn into serving bowl and sprinkle with crumb mixture. Spoon over chilled fruits. ; name: homemade beefaroni ; ingredients: elbow macaroni, lean ground beef, garlic, onion, condensed tomato soup, water, sugar, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cook macaroni and drain. Brown together the ground beef, onion and garlic. Drain if needed. Mix in the soup, water and sugar to the beef mixture. Add the cooked macaroni and stir. Taste and add salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat for 15 minutes, stirring often. ; name: scalloped potatoes curdle free ; ingredients: butter, flour, milk, salt, potatoes ; preparation:Melt butter in a sauce pan, stir in flour, salt and add milk slowly, stirring constantly until sauce boils and thicken. Add potatoes and heat, stirring until the mixture boils again. Spoon potatoes into a shallow, greased casserole. Sprinkle 1 t diced butter over top. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes. ; name: coco nutty tropical treat bars ; ingredients: graham cracker crumbs, icing sugar, butter, sweetened condensed milk, crushed pineapple in juice, sweetened flaked coconut, almonds, white chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375, grease a 9x13 pan. In a medium bowl, mix graham crumbs and icing sugar, stir in butter until evenly blended. Press crumb mixture firmly into bottom of prepared pan. Bake until edges are golden brown about 10-12 minutes. In a large bowl stir condensed milk, pineapple, coconut& almonds. With a rubber spatula dollop pineapple mixture onto crumb crust and spread almost to the edges. Bake until just set, 10-15 minutes. Remove from oven& sprinkle with white chocolate chips, let stand until chocolate softens, 3-4 minutes. Then spread chocolate over surface. Cool completely, cut into bars. ; name: beef stroganov with mustard ; ingredients: filet of beef, salt & pepper, flour, butter, beef stock, tomatoes, prepared mustard, onion, white mushrooms, sour cream ; preparation:

name: spicy chicken fritters ; ingredients: chicken breasts, egg, onions, spring onion, red chile, salt, pepper, oil ; preparation:Place chicken in a bowl and add other ingredients. Mix well. Heat oil approx 2cm in depth. Drop teaspoonfuls of mixture into the hot oil. Deep fry for a few minutes until golden brown. Drain on paper towel. Serve with cucumber mint dip. ; name: easy peasy lemon squeezy pie ; ingredients: reduced fat graham cracker crust, fat-free sweetened condensed milk, eggs, fresh lemon juice, lemon zest ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. In a medium bowl, beat eggs until smooth. Add milk to eggs, then the lemon juice and zest. Mix until all ingredients are incorporated and mixture is smooth. Pour into pie crust. Bake pie for 15 minutes. Cool completely. Best served chilled. ; name: tuna alfredo casserole ; ingredients: rigatoni pasta, sun-dried tomato pesto, alfredo sauce, milk, solid white tuna, salt and pepper, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and return to the pan. In a bowl, mix together pesto, alfredo sauce, and milk. Add to the pasta, stirring to coat. Fold in the tuna. Add salt and pepper to taste. Pour into an ungreased 2 quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake at 425 degrees for 10-15 minutes or until thoroughly heated and cheese is melted. ; name: pineapple pork roast convection microwave ; ingredients: pineapple preserves, prepared mustard, prepared horseradish, soy sauce, pork roast ; preparation:Combine all ingredients except pork roast in small bowl. Set aside. Place roast on broiling trivet. Roast 14 to 16 minutes per pound on high mix setting or until internal temperature reaches 165f. Cover roast with sauce during the last 20 minutes of cooking. Cover and let stand 10 minutes before serving. Extra sauce may be heated and served with the roast. ; name: brussels sprouts in garlic butter ; ingredients: brussels sprouts, butter, olive oil, garlic, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Melt butter and olive oil in a medium skillet until butter is foamy. Reduce heat to medium, add smashed garlic and cook until lightly browned. Remove garlic and discard. Add sprouts cut side down, cover, and cook without stirring on medium-low heat 10-15 minutes or until tender when pierced with a knife. The cut side of the sprouts should get nice and browned, with a nutty, buttery flavor enhanced by garlic. Top with freshly grated parmesan and salt& pepper to taste. ; name: chicken divine ; ingredients: canadian bacon, chicken breast fillets, butter, flour, salt, white pepper, milk, cream, oregano, swiss cheese ; preparation:

name: skillet pork chops and rice ; ingredients: pork chops, long grain and wild rice blend, water, whole tomatoes, scallions, golden raisin ; preparation:In a large skillet, cook pork chops over medium high heat, turning once until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes. Remove to a plate. Add rice and seasonings from mix to skillet, along with water, tomatoes and their liquids, scallions and raisins. Mix well. Heat to boiling. Reduce heat and place pork chops on top of the rice. Cover and simmer for 45 minutes or until rice is cooked. ; name: teriyaki sirloin strips ; ingredients: sirloin steaks, soy sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar, onions, oil, garlic, ground ginger, salt and pepper ; preparation:Place steak strips into a large glass bowl. Combine all remaining ingredients. Pour over the meat and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate over night. Drain and discard the marinade. Thread meat loosely on skewers. Grill over coal for 7-10 minutes. Until meat reaches desired doneness. ; name: mayonnaise muffins ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, mayonnaise, milk ; preparation:Combine first 3 ingredients in a small mixing bowl. Add mayonnaise and milk, stirring with a fork until dry ingredients are moistened. Spoon into lightly greased muffin pans, filling three-fourths full. Bake at 450 for 10 to 12 minutes, or till golden brown. Serve warm with butter. ; name: fruit and wild rice pilaf ; ingredients: butter, onion, celery, reduced-sodium chicken broth, water, long grain and wild rice blend, raisins, pecans ; preparation:Melt butter in medium saucepan over med-high heat. Add onions and celery. Cook 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add broth, water, rice, contents of seasoning packet, and fruit. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to med-low. Cover and simmer 25 minutes, or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in pecans and serve. ; name: gigi s strawberry rhubarb salad ; ingredients: rhubarb, water, sugar, strawberry jell-o gelatin dessert, orange juice, orange rind, strawberries ; preparation:Combine rhubarb, water and sugar in pan and cook until rhubarb is tender. Place jello in glass bowl. Add hot rhubarb mixture and stir until jello has dissolved. Add orange juice and orange peel. Chill until syrupy, then fold in strawberries. Pour into an oiled 1 qt mold. Chill until set. Unmold and garnish with fresh strawberries. ; name: orange pilaf ; ingredients: butter, celery, green onion, long-grain rice, orange juice, salt, orange, slivered almonds ; preparation:

name: diabetic bottomless chicken pot pie ; ingredients: condensed cream of chicken soup, nonfat milk, chicken breasts, frozen peas and carrots, black pepper, pie crust ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 425f. Combine the soup, milk, chicken, and peas & carrots in a large bowl. Pour the filling mixture into a 9-inch deep-dish pie plate. Cover with the pie crust and press the edges to seal. Make several slits in the crust for venting. To avoid spills, place on a baking sheet and bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until heated through and the crust is golden. Let sit for 5 minutes then cut into wedges and serve. ; name: pasta masquerade ; ingredients: extra lean ground beef, water, onion, carrot, zucchini, spaghetti sauce, rotini pasta, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Brown meat in large skillet. Water, vegetables, spaghetti sauce and pasta. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium. Simmer 20 min., stirring occasionally. Stir in cheese just before serving. ; name: apple nut cookies ; ingredients: light brown sugar, shortening, egg, flour, salt, nutmeg, apple, walnuts ; preparation:Cream together sugar and shortening. Beat in egg. Sift together dry ingredients, and add to mixture. Beat until well blended. Stir in apples and nuts. Drop in the shape of a ball on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375, for 12-15 minutes. ; name: frozen berry melon pops ; ingredients: watermelon, raspberries, sugar, lemon juice, light corn syrup ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in a blender. Cover and blend until smooth. Press fruit mixture through a fine-mesh strainer over a bowl to extract juices. Discard solids and pour mixture into 3-ounce paper or plastic drink cups or pop molds. Cover cups with foil. Cut a slit in the foil and insert wooden sticks. Freeze several hours or overnight until pops are firm. Remove from cups or molds to serve. ; name: tabasco cheddar biscuits ; ingredients: baking soda, cake flour, baking powder, salt, unsalted butter, sharp cheddar cheese, low-fat buttermilk, red pepper sauce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees f, and coat baking sheet with cooking spray. Whisk together flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt in large bowl. Stir in butter and cheese. Stir in buttermilk, and mix until dough just comes together. Scrape out onto well-floured work surface, and pat dough to -inch thickness. Cut out biscuits with 2 -inch diameter round cutter. Repeat with remaining scraps of dough until you have 8 biscuits, and transfer biscuits to prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle red pepper sauce on tops of biscuits. Bake 12 to 15 minutes, or until puffed and golden. Serve hot. ; name: quick easy taco burger casserole ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, taco seasoning, water, sweet corn, condensed tomato soup, cheddar cheese, macaroni noodles, green pepper, black olives ; preparation:

name: vegetable barley bake ; ingredients: sweet red peppers, mushrooms, onions, butter, vegetable broth, pearl barley, pepper ; preparation:In a large non-stick skillet, saute the peppers, mushrooms, and onions in butter until tender. Transfer to a 13-inch by 9-inch by 2-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Stir in the broth, barley, and pepper. Cover and bake at 350f for 50 minutes. Uncover and bake for another 5-10 minutes or until barley is tender and liquid is absorbed. ; name: hickory house deviled eggs ; ingredients: eggs, red potatoes, salt, sweet pickle relish, mayonnaise, prepared yellow mustard, chives ; preparation:Put eggs and potatoes into medium pot and add enough cold water to cover them by 1 inch. Add salt and simmer over medium-high heat for 10-15 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low and gently simmer for 9 more minutes. Remove potatoes with slotted spoon and place in medium bowl. Put eggs under cold running water to let cool 3 minutes. Add mayonnaise, relish and mustard to potatoes, thoroughly mashing together with a fork. Set aside. Peel and cut eggs in half lengthwise. Carefully scoop out yolks add them to the potato mixture and mash together with a fork. Spoon filling onto hard-cooked whites, mounding filling slightly and covering whole cut side of egg. Garnish with chopped chives. ; name: columbian gold ; ingredients: strong coffee, half-and-half cream, coffee liqueur, chocolate liqueur, cinnamon schnapps, whipping cream, fine sugar, chocolate ; preparation:Make 1 cup of strong coffee, keep warm. In a small pot add half and half cream with chocolate and coffee liquers. Heat on low about 3 minutes, whisking constantly to blend flavours. Pour cinnamon liquer and white sugar onto small plates. Rim your glass first in cinnamon liquer and then dip your glass into the white sugar to coat rim evenly. Reserving any left over liquer and sugar for garnishing. Add warm liquer mixture to coffee and stir. Pour the coffee & liquer mixture into the prepared glass and top with whipped cream. Slowly drizzle the reserved cinnamon liquer over the whipped cream and then sprinkle with sugar and chocolate flakes. ; name: french clafouti ; ingredients: fruit, eggs, flour, sugar, milk, vanilla extract, rum ; preparation:Grease and flour circular deep dish glass pie plate. Beat together eggs, sugar and flour. Add the vanilla and milk gradually. Arrange the fruit in the bottom of the pan. Pour the batter mixture over the fruit. Optional, strew dots of unsalted butter over the clafouti halfway though baking. Bake at 400 degrees f, for 30 to 40 minutes. ; name: roasted red pepper provolone panini ; ingredients: bread, prosciutto, roasted red pepper, provolone cheese, olive oil ; preparation:Place prosciutto, pepper, and cheese on bread. Heat grill pan and have something heavy near by to weigh down the lid. Lighty oil pan and add panini. Press down on top with another pan or heavy plate, cook untill ightly browned. Flip and cook other side. Enoy. Add whatever additions. ; name: mile high all butter pound cake ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, sugar, lemon juice, salt, butter, eggs ; preparation:

name: chewy irresistible caramel popcorn ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, corn syrup, baking soda, salt, popcorn ; preparation:Pop the popcorn kernels and put into a greased large bowl. Melt butter on medium heat in a medium size saucepan. Turn heat down to low, and add brown sugar, stir until blended together well. Making sure that the sugar does not burn turn the heat back up to medium, and add corn syrup. All the while stirring and making sure there is no sticking. Add the salt and baking soda. This will make the sugar double in size be careful not to let it go over the sides of the pot. Immediately pour onto popcorn. Stir until the caramel has covered popcorn completely. Transfer onto a cookie sheet with wax paper, and let cool. ; name: basmati rice with turmeric and mushrooms ; ingredients: butter, onion, fresh garlic, turmeric, basmati rice, chicken broth, canned mushroom slices, salt, pepper ; preparation:Rinse the rice under cold water very well. Place the rice in a large bowl covered with cold water and let it soak for 30 minutes before proceeding with the recipe. Melt butter in a heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add in onion, garlic and tumeric powder. Saute until just beginning to brown. Add in rice, broth, mushrooms, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover with a tight fitting lid and simmer until the rice is tender. ; name: greek rice casserole w feta and artichokes ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic, chopped tomatoes, basil, oregano, red chili pepper flakes, salt, artichoke hearts, cooked white rice, feta cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet. Add garlic and saut for 2 minutes. Add drained tomatoes, basil, oregano, chili flakes and salt. Bring to a simmer. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring frequently and breaking up the tomatoes as they cook. In a medium bowl, toss artichoke quarters, rice and feta together. Pour into a medium oiled casserole dish when tomato sauce is ready, pour over the rice mixture, shaking the dish so the tomato sauce settles. Cover and bake for 20 minutes. Uncover and bake an additional 20 minutes. Serve immediately. ; name: country style scrambled eggs ; ingredients: bacon, red potatoes, onion, green pepper, eggs, milk, salt, pepper, cheddar cheese ; preparation:In a large skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp. Using a slotted spoon, remove to paper towels to drain. Cook and stir potatoes in drippings over medium heat for 12 minutes or until tender. Add onion and green pepper. Cook and stir for 3 or 4 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain. Stir in the reserved bacon. In a large bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Add to skillet. Cook and stir until eggs are completely set. Sprinkle with cheese and let stand until cheese has melted. ; name: roast honey chicken with apple cream sauce ; ingredients: chicken pieces, honey, apple cider, dry mustard, salt and pepper, green apple, thickened cream, brandy ; preparation:Place honey, cider, mustard, salt and pepper in a bowl. Beat well until combined. Place chicken in a lightly greased baking dish. Pour honey mixture over chicken. Cook chicken 45 minutes. Place on plates. Pour any pan juices in baking dish in saucepan. Add cider, apple slices and brandy. Bring to boil. Lower heat, simmer until it has reduced slightly. ; name: marinated mushrooms with shallots and thyme ; ingredients: button mushroom, shallots, olive oil, red wine vinegar, salt, dried thyme ; preparation:

name: creamy asparagus leek and potato soup ; ingredients: leeks, butter, potatoes, asparagus, chicken stock, salt, pepper, evaporated milk ; preparation:Cut leeks in half lengthwise, wash and thinly slice. In large pan lightly saut leeks in butter. Add potatoes. Saute for about 3 minutes. Add asparagus, chicken stock, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer gently for about 20-30 minutes, until all vegetables are soft. Put contents in blender or processor and pure. Add evaporated milk and adjust salt and pepper for seasoning. Serve warm with garlic or herb flavored crutons, or toasted bread slices. ; name: sesame bok choy ; ingredients: bok choy, green onion, ground ginger, rice wine, light soy sauce, brown sugar, canola oil, sesame seeds ; preparation:Wash bok choy. Cut stems and tops into about 1-inch pieces. In a large bowl, combine last 7 ingredients and mix well. Add bok choy to the dressing and toss to coat. Place in a hot wok or large pan and stir-fry over med-high heat for about 8 minutes or until desired tenderness is reached. ; name: simple strawberry cake ; ingredients: fresh strawberries, sugar, gelatin, mini marshmallows, yellow cake mix, eggs, water, canola oil ; preparation:Toss berries with sugar. Place in bottom of a 9x13 baking dish. Sprinkle gelatin over berries. Sprinkle marshmallows in pan. Combine eggs, cake mix, water and oil. Beat with electric mixer 2 minutes. Pour evenly in pan. Bake at 350 for 30-35 minutes. Let cool, and invert pan onto serving platter. ; name: tanner s brownies ; ingredients: oleo, sugar, flour, eggs, cocoa, vanilla ; preparation:Melt oleo in medium saucepan. After melted. In same pan add all the other ingredients. Stir well and pour into a 8x8 pan. Bake at 325 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes. ; name: hpnotiq blue mojito ; ingredients: white rum, hpnotiq liqueur, simple syrup, lime wedges, mint leaves, soda water ; preparation:Muddle mint leaves, 1 lime wedge and simple syrup. Add ice, rum and hpnotiq. Shake. Pour into collins glass. Top with soda water. Garnish with lime wedge. ; name: garlic tuna linguine ; ingredients: linguine, garlic cloves, olive oil, tuna, chicken broth, parsley, cayenne pepper ; preparation:

name: herb cheese pizza ; ingredients: cornmeal, pizza crusts, olive oil, garlic clove, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, dried oregano leaves, dried basil leaves ; preparation:Heat oven to 425. Grease 12-inch pizza pan. Sprinkle with cornmeal. Unroll dough and press in pan. In small bowl, combine oil and garlic. Drizzle over dough. In small bowl, combine cheese, oregano and basil. Sprinkle over oil. Bake at 425 for 13 to 16 minutes or until crust is deep golden brown. Serve immediately. ; name: day after the holiday turkey soup ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, carrots, celery, chicken stock, corn, turkey, salt, pepper, lemon ; preparation:In a heavy saucepan, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and add finely diced onions, carrots, and celery. Cook until soft and golden brown, about 5 to 6 minutes. Add corn, turkey, salt and pepper and the chicken stock then bring to a boil. Let the soup simmer uncovered for 10 to 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Before serving squeeze in the juice of a lemon. Leftover rice may be substituted for the corn. ; name: zucchini chayote and yellow squash ; ingredients: butter, white onions, garlic, chayotes, zucchini, crookneck yellow squash, chives, fresh cilantro ; preparation:Melt butter in large pot over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Saut 2 minutes. Add all squash. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover. Cook until just tender, stirring occasionally, about 25 minutes. Mix in herbs. Season with salt and pepper. ; name: world s best pizza crust ; ingredients: yeast, sugar, warm water, flour, salt, oil ; preparation:Dissolve yeast and sugar in water. Beat in flour. Add salt, oil and rest of flour. Rise in oiled bowl. Place on greased pan. Add sauce, cheese, etc. Bake at 450 20 -25 minutes. ; name: corned beef and cabbage bake ; ingredients: butter, cabbage, onion, caraway seed, deli corned beef, swiss cheese, thousand island dressing, refrigerated buttermilk biscuits ; preparation:In a large skillet, melt the butter. Stir in the cabbage, onion, and caraway seeds. Cover and cook over medium heat for 8-10 minutes or until the cabbage is crisp tender, stirring occasionally. Set aside. Meanwhile, in a large bowl, combine the corned beef, swiss cheese, and salad dressing. Seperate the biscuits. Place 10 biscuits in each of two ungreased 9-inch round baking pans. Press the biscuits onto the bottom and halfway up the sides of the pans. Add cabbage mixture. Top with the corned beef mixture. Bake, uncovered, at 350 f for 20-25 minutes or until heated through and biscuits are golden brown. Cut into wedges. ; name: yummy cucumber and tomato salad ; ingredients: cucumbers, cherry tomatoes, yellow pear tomatoes, fresh lemon juice, apple cider vinegar, flax seed oil, dijon mustard, garlic clove, fresh dill ; preparation:

name: caprese stuffed avocado ; ingredients: tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, olive oil, garlic clove, fresh basil, avocados, balsamic vinegar, salt and pepper ; preparation:Place the tomatoes, mozzarella, basil, garlic and oil in a bowl. Mix well. Can be used immediately or refrigerated until ready to assemble the avocados. Cut the avocadoes in half lengthwise, remove pits and carefully peel the avocado halves. Place the peel avocado halves on a plate. Spoon the tomato mozzarella caprese filling into the avocado halves. Drizzle with the balsamic vinegar and serve immediately. ; name: garlic piperade soup ; ingredients: garlic cloves, onions, sweet pepper, olive oil, tomatoes, beef stock, bread, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Blanch the garlic in boiling water for thirty seconds. Run under cold water and drain. Peel and slice the cloves of garlic. Cook the onions and peppers in the oil for ten minutes until the onions are golden and the peppers are soft. Add the garlic and tomatoes. Cover the pan and cook over low heat for thirty minutes. Pour in the broth and bring to a boil. Tear the bread into large pieces and add to the boiling soup where it will disintegrate and thicken the broth. Adjust the amount of bread and broth to the desired thickness of the soup and salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot with grated cheese if you wish. ; name: creamy swiss chard and pasta ; ingredients: swiss chard, olives, garlic, onion, sliced mushrooms, parmesan cheese, fettuccine pasta, pepper, salt, low-fat sour cream ; preparation:Wash the greens andcut into small pieces. Heat oil in large saucepan over med-high heat 1-2 minutes and add garlic, onion, and mushrooms and saute until tender, add the greens and cook 5-8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until greens are tender. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cook the pasta. Mix the cooked ingredients together. Top with the sour cream and parmesan mix. Serves 4 people. ; name: weight watchers sauteed shrimp ; ingredients: olive oil, shrimp, fresh lemon juice, salt-free lemon & herb seasoning, table salt, black pepper, fresh parsley ; preparation:Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add shrimp and saut 1 minute. Add lemon juice, lemon herb seasoning, salt and pepper. Stir to coat shrimp. Saut until shrimp are bright pink and cooked through, about 3 minutes more. Remove from heat and stir in parsley. Yields about 3 ounces of shrimp per serving. ; name: sand tarts ; ingredients: butter, sugar, pecans, all-purpose flour, powdered sugar ; preparation:Cream butter until soft. Add sugar, pecans, and flour, mixing well. Shape into balls and bake at 300 degrees on ungreased cookie sheet for 45 minutes. While hot, roll balls in powdered sugar. Roll in sugar again after all have been rolled once. ; name: banana blaster smoothie ; ingredients: bananas, milk, coconut milk, ice cubes, pure vanilla extract ; preparation:

name: birthday caramel chicken ; ingredients: skinless chicken breasts, real butter, white sugar, sweet onions, parsley, lemon pepper, garlic salt, lemon juice ; preparation:Clean the chicken and cut into 6 serving pieces. Pat chicken dry and place into a long glass baking dish. Set aside. Using a cast-iron fry pan melt butter on medium and quickly stir in the sugar stirring constantly until melted and caramel color. Lower heat and add the onions or leeks. Stir to coat onions then pour directly over the chicken. Add the parsley, lemon pepper, garlic salt and lemon juice. Bake at 350 for 60 minutes. ; name: three bears porridge ; ingredients: water, oats, brown sugar, milk ; preparation:Combine water and oats in medium saucepan over a medium heat. Cook, stirring about 5 minutes or until porridge is thick and creamy. Place in bowl. Add a bit of milk so it goes around the edges and covers slightly. Sprinkle with brown sugar. Place the brown sugar on table and let kids add if you trust them. If you want a creamier porridge make with milk instead of water. ; name: walnut and raisin oatmeal cookies ; ingredients: shortening, eggs, oatmeal, baking soda, vanilla, sugar, raisins, flour, salt, english walnuts ; preparation:Cream sugar and shortening thoroughly. Add eggs and mix well. Add ground raisins and nuts. Mix well. Sift together dry ingredients and add to shortening mixture. Add vanilla and mix all together. Roll in 1-inch balls. Place on greased cookie sheet 2 inches apart and flatten with a fork. Bake at 350 for 10 to 12 minutes. ; name: white overnight buns ; ingredients: water, sugar, yeast, flour, salt, eggs, vegetable oil ; preparation:Combine c. Warm water, 1tsp sugar and yeast stir and let rise app. 10 min. In a large bowl combine flour, sugar and salt. Combine oil, egg mixture and yeast mixture, pour over dry ingredients and mix well. Knead until smooth. Let rest 5min., knead and place into a well oiled bowl. Let rise 6 7 hours, punch down and make into buns. Let rise overnight and bake in the morning. ; name: ham in a crock pot ; ingredients: boneless ham, parmesan cheese, ground cloves, pineapple slices ; preparation:Place ham in crock pot. Cook on low for 4 to 6 hours. Sprinkle parmesan cheese and ground cloves on top of ham. Pour can of pineapple slices and juice on top. Cover and cook on low for an additional two hours. ; name: spring muffins ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, egg, milk, vegetable oil, fresh strawberries, fresh rhubarb ; preparation:

name: crunchy trail mix ; ingredients: corn chex, rice chex, pretzel, almonds, raisins, cinnamon, sugar-free syrup, vegetable oil, vanilla extract ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. In large bowl, combine cereal, pretzels, almonds, raisins and cinnamon. Mix well. In small bowl, combine syrup, oil and vanilla. Slowly pour over cereal mixture. Stir will to coat evenly. Spread on 15x10-inch baking ban coated with vegetable cooking spray. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown, stirring frequently. Cool. Store in airtight container. ; name: mexi cheeseburger quiche ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, diced green chilies, eggs, mayonnaise, water, heavy cream, cumin, cayenne pepper, mexican blend cheese ; preparation:Cook ground beef in skillet until done. Drain. Add onions and chiles and cook for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, mix the rest of the ingredients in a bowl. Put beef mixture into a pie dish. Pour cheese mixture over it. Bake at in a 350 oven for 35-40 minutes or until cheese is puffed and slightly brown. ; name: umyum rings with emphasis on yum ; ingredients: sweet onion, fine dry breadcrumb, dried thyme, morton lite salt, paprika, ground pepper, egg whites ; preparation:Peel, slice and separate onions into rings. Combine crumbs and seasonings, mix well. Dip onion rings in egg whites then in crumb mixture to coat each piece. Place onions in single layer on greased baking sheet. Bake at 400f for 20 minutes or until onions are crisp and tender. ; name: creamy cheddar potatoes ; ingredients: butter, potatoes, salt, fresh ground black pepper, milk, cheddar cheese, parsley ; preparation:In large, nonstick skillet, melt butter. Add potatoes and cook over medium heat until almost tender and lightly browned. Add salt, pepper, and milk, continuing to cook until milk is absorbed and potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with cheese, heating until melted. Stir well, sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve. ; name: easy chahan japanese fried rice ; ingredients: rice, egg, green onion, carrots, bacon, soy sauce, sake, salt, pepper, olive oil ; preparation:Chop long green onions, carrots, and bacon into little pieces. Put 400g warm rice into a bowl and mix raw egg with it throughly, make sure the egg is coating the rice totally. Fry the egg and rice mix with olive oil in a frying pan. When the rice starts to spatter, add all the other ingredients except soy sauce and sake. Fry all of the contents. Add soy sauce and mix it throughly. Add sake and mix it throughly. Lastly, add salt and pepper to taste. ; name: white trash cheese souffle ; ingredients: bread, sharp cheddar cheese, eggs, milk, salt, dry mustard, pepper ; preparation:

name: oaties ; ingredients: sugar, butter, milk, vanilla, cocoa, rolled oatmeal, coconut ; preparation:Melt together sugar, butter and milk. Take off heat and mix in vanilla and cocoa until smooth. Stir in oatmeal and coconut. Drop by spoonfuls on waxed paper or foil. Chill. Can also be frozen. ; name: simply delicious skillet dinner ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, parsley, tomato paste, water, sugar, salt, pepper, egg noodles, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Brown beef and onion, drain and add parsley. Combine tomato paste, water. And spices in a bowl. Add to ground beef. Cover and simmer 10 minutes. Add noodles and cover and cook until tender, stirring occasionally. Remove. From heat and sprinkle with cheese. ; name: roast beef sandwiches au jus ; ingredients: french onion soup, beef consomme, deli roast beef, provolone cheese, hoagie rolls, garlic powder, mayonnaise ; preparation:In a medium pot simmer roast beef slices, consomme, and soup until fully cooked. Meanwhile, slice hoagie rolls in half lengthwise, sprinkle with garlic and toast until golden brown. Once the meat has heated through and cooked down, place on half of the hoagie rolls and top with slices of cheese as needed to cover meat. Broil until cheese melted and bubbly. Spread mayo on other half of hoagie rolls and top, cutting sandwich in half diagonally. Cut on a diagonal and serve with au jus on the side. ; name: jalapeno pepper mac n cheese ; ingredients: salt and pepper, cavatappi pasta, extra virgin olive oil, jalapenos, serrano chilies, garlic cloves, whole milk, cream cheese, dried onion flakes, monterey jack cheese ; preparation:Bring a large pot of water to a boil, salt it, add the pasta and cook until al dente. Drain and return to the pot. In a skillet, heat a drizzle of evoo over medium heat. Add the jalapenos, serranos and garlic and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add to the pasta. Preheat the broiler. In a saucepan, combine the milk, cream cheese and onion over medium-low heat. Cook, stirring, until smooth, 5 minutes. Stir into the pasta. Stir in the jack cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer the pasta to a baking dish and broil until browned, about 3 minutes. ; name: pasta salad kabobs ; ingredients: cheese tortellini, canned artichoke hearts, grape tomatoes, olives, broccoli florets, salami, italian dressing, stick ; preparation:Cook the cheese tortellini, drain and rinse with cold water. Put the cooked tortellini, artichoke pieces, tomatoes, olives, broccoli and salami in separate containers. Add italian dressing to each of the containers and stir to mix. Let the ingredients marinate for 1 hour. The salami should marinate in the fridge. When ready to make up the kabobs, take wooden skewers and thread them with the 6 ingredients. You can vary what you put on the kabobs to make each one slightly different, or you can make each of them the same. To put the salami on the skewers, lightly fold each slice in half and then punch the skewer through the meat. As you finish the kabobs, put them in something like a one-layer cake pan. Cover the pan and chill in the fridge until serving time. You can do a similar kind of kabob using different kinds of fruit. ; name: stuffing coated chicken ; ingredients: seasoned stuffing mix, parmesan cheese, butter, garlic clove, boneless skinless chicken breast halves ; preparation:

name: suzie s oatmeal chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: margarine, granulated sugar, brown sugar, eggs, water, vanilla, flour, baking soda, oatmeal, chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream the margarine and sugars. Add the eggs and mix. Add the water and vanilla, mix. Mix together the flour and baking soda and add to the mixture fold in the oatmeal and chocolate chips. Spoon on a cookie sheet and bake at 350 until they just start to turn brown, if you like them chewy. ; name: sweet party chex mix with berries ; ingredients: corn chex, rice chex, pretzels, sliced almonds, brown sugar, butter, light corn syrup, baking soda, dried cranberries ; preparation:Combine corn and rice cereals, pretzels, and almonds together in large roasting pan or baking dish, set aside. Bring to boil while stirring in a medium saucepan the brown sugar, butter, and corn syrup. When mixture comes to boiling point stop stirring and let boil for an additional 5 minutes over medium heat. Remove from heat and stir in the baking soda. Pour immediately over cereal mixture. Stir gently to evenly coat cereal mixture. Bake for 15 minutes in 300 degree oven. Stir and bake for an additional 5 minutes. Remove from oven, stir in dried fruit, and spread mixture on buttered foil to cool. Break into bite size pieces and store in airtight container. ; name: irish brown scones ; ingredients: whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, wheat bran, baking soda, salt, butter, brown sugar, buttermilk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f lightly dust a baking sheet with some flour. Put the whole wheat flour and wheat germ into a large mixing bowl. Sift the all-purpose flour, salt and baking soda into the bowl. Mix the ingredients well together with fingers. Next, rub in the butter to pea-sized pieces. Then mix in the sugar. At this stage, put the lightly dusted tin into the oven to preheat. Stir in enough buttermilk to make a soft dough. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and gently knead for a few seconds. Cut out scones with a round cookie cutter. Put the scones on the preheated baking sheet and bake for about 15 minutes or until risen and a golden brown. Cool on a wire tray. ; name: maple pots de creme ; ingredients: heavy cream, maple syrup, salt, egg yolks, vanilla extract ; preparation:Bring the cream, maple syrup and salt to a simmer in a sauce pan. Mix the egg yolks and vanilla in a large bowl. Mix the cream mixture into the egg yolks a little at a time. Strain the mixture through a fine sieve. Pour the mixture into 4 ramekins. Place the ramekins in a baking dish and fill the baking dish with hot water until it come halfway up the ramekins. Bake in a preheated 300f oven until set, about 50-60 minutes. Remove from hot water bath and let cool to room temperature. ; name: oriental steak ; ingredients: sirloin steaks, soy sauce, honey, cider vinegar, sesame oil, ground ginger, garlic cloves ; preparation:In a small bowl combine all of the marinade ingredients. Put the steak in a plasic bag. Pour in the marinade. Close the bag and place in a shallow baking pan. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours or overnight. Preheat the broiler. Remove steak from bag and discard marinade. Place on broiling pan.
