Cover and process until smooth. Gradually add ice, blending until slushy. Pour into chilled glasses. Garnish with whipped topping, chocolate syrup and cherries. ; name: cream cheese walnut drop cookies ; ingredients: butter, cream cheese, milk, sugar, vanilla, flour, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. In a mixing bowl, beat together butter, cream cheese and milk. Beat in sugar and vanilla. Gradually mix in flour. Stir in walnuts. Drop by tablespoonful 2-inches apart on to ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375f for 10 minutes or until edges begin to slightly brown. ; name: daikon carbonara ; ingredients: daikon radish, ham, dry parmesan cheese, daikon sprouts, egg, butter, salt, pepper ; preparation:Cut the daikon and ham slices into oblong shapes. Melt 1 tbsp of butter in a frying pan and fry the ham and daikon. When the daikon becomes soft, add a little salt and pepper. Crack the egg into a bowl and mix the powdered cheese into the same bowl. When the egg becomes thicker add it to everything on the pan and fry everything together and put it onto a dish. Boil the daikon leaves and cut them down to bite size and sprinkle them on top of the daikon carbonara. ; name: peaches in sauternes ; ingredients: peaches, sugar, sauternes wine, orange-flavored liqueur ; preparation:Bring a pot of water to a boil and immerse the peaches for a minute or two, until the skins come off easily. Remove them with a slotted spoon and place them in a bowl of cold water to stop the cooking. Peel the peaches, then slice into wedges off the pit and into a bowl. Stir in the sugar, sauternes, and orange liqueur. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight. Serve cool, but not cold. ; name: arugula pear and parmesan salad ; ingredients: pears, lemon juice, hazelnut oil, arugula, parmesan cheese, fresh ground black pepper, blue cheese, walnuts ; preparation:

name: wildcat scramble ; ingredients: diced onion, tortilla chips, green chili, canned black beans, sour cream, chorizo sausage, eggs, cilantro, salt and pepper, cheese ; preparation:Mix eggs, sour cream, salt and pepper and set aside. Saute onions and sausage. Drain fat. Add all ingrediants to eggs except cheese. Pour into greased, oversized, muffin tins, makes 12 large. Sprinkle grated cheese on top. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until set. ; name: dale earnhardt s fish and vegetable rolls ; ingredients: asparagus spears, carrots, mayonnaise, seasoned dry bread crumbs, country-style dijon mustard, fresh dill, tabasco sauce, flounder fillets ; preparation:In a 12-inch skillet over high heat, combine asparagus, carrots, and enough water to cover vegetables. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer 2 to 3 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Drain. Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, bread crumbs, mustard, dill and tabasco sauce. Spread half of mixture on top sides of fish fillets. Top each fillet with one-fourth of cooked asparagus and carrots. Roll fish around vegetables and place seam side down in a greased 12 x 8 x 2-inch baking dish. Spread remaining mustard mixture on tops of fish rolls. Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Makes 4 servings. ; name: hearty herb chicken soup ; ingredients: oil, boneless skinless chicken breast, onion, flour, cannellini beans, chicken broth, garlic & herb salad dressing mix ; preparation:Heat oil in large saucepan on medium-high heat. Add chicken and onion. Cook and stir 8 minute or until chicken is cooked through. Stir in flour. Add beans, broth and salad dressing mix. Mix well. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover. Simmer 20 min., stirring occasionally. ; name: ripieni zucchini and eggplant rolls ; ingredients: olive oil, eggplant, zucchini, ricotta cheese, prosciutto, pesto sauce, arugula, parmesan cheese, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a griddle or frying pan. Add a single layer of sliced vegetables and cook until the underside is golden. Turn over and cook the other side. Repeat with remaining slices and leave to cool. Spread a thin layer of ricotta over 1 side of the eggplant and zucchini slices. Arrange the prosciutto on top of half the slices and season to taste. Spread the pesto over the remaining slices and top with a few torn arugula leaves. Roll up, enclosing the fillings and arrange on a bed of arugula leaves. Top with the parmesan shavings and drizzle over the remaining oil. Add extra seasoning to taste. ; name: turkey cranberry bites ; ingredients: light mayonnaise, honey mustard, pepper, turkey breast, celery, fresh parsley, dried cranberries, swiss cheese, walnuts, miniature phyllo cups ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Measure mayo, mustard and black pepper into bowl. Add chopped turkey, chopped celery, chopped parsley, chopped cranberries, shredded cheese, and walnuts. Stir to combine. Spoon into mini phyllo cups and bake for 12 to 15 minutes until heated through. ; name: turkish apricot compote kayisi kompostosu ; ingredients: fresh apricots, sugar, water, almond extract, almonds ; preparation:

name: bran muffins low cal ; ingredients: natural bran, buttermilk, raisins, unsweetened applesauce, splenda granular, molasses, eggs, whole wheat flour, salt, baking soda ; preparation:In medium bowl stir together bran, buttermilk and raisins, let soak for 10 minutes. Spray muffin tins with non stick cooking spray, preheat oven to 350. In mixing bowl add splenda, molasses, applesauce, eggs and mix on low speed till well blended. Add buttermilk mixture and mix on medium speed for 1 minute. Add flour, baking soda and salt and mix on low speed till incorporated. Increase speed to medium and mix for 3 minutes. Divide mixture into 12 muffin tins, bake for 15 - 20 minutes. ; name: authentic polish cucumber salad mizeria ; ingredients: cucumbers, salt, pepper, sour cream, cider vinegar, dill ; preparation:Place cucumbers in a medium bowl. Add salt. Mix lightly until salt adheres evenly to cucumbers. Cover and refrigerate for one hour. Drain juice from limp cucumbers. In a small bowl, combine the remainder of the ingredients. Add to cucumbers, mixing gently. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. ; name: orange glazed green beans ; ingredients: water, garlic, fresh green beans, orange marmalade, dried rosemary, orange zest, salt, butter ; preparation:Trim beans and break into 1 inch lengths, wash. In medium saucepan bring water and garlic to a boil. Add green beans, reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes or until beans are crisp tender. If any water remains at end of cooking, drain and return beans to pan. Turn up heat to medium add remaining ingredients and heat to boiling, stirring occasionally. Serve immediately. ; name: best sausage gravy for biscuits and gravy ; ingredients: bulk pork sausage, margarine, all-purpose flour, milk, salt, pepper ; preparation:In a saucepan, cook the sausage over medium heat until no longer pink. Stir in butter until melted. Sprinkle with flour. Gradually stir in milk, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir for 3 minutes. Serve over biscuits. ; name: tahini chicken ; ingredients: fat-free chicken broth, tahini, soy sauce, honey, garlic, fresh ginger, hot pepper sauce, cooked chicken breasts, cooked brown rice ; preparation:Bring the broth to a boil in a 2 quart saucepan over medium heat. Reduce heat to low. Whisk in tahini, soy sauce, honey, garlic, ginger, and hot-pepper sauce until smooth. Stir in the chicken and heat through. Serve over rice. ; name: lemon poppy seed bread ; ingredients: lemon cake mix, eggs, vegetable oil, instant lemon pudding, water, poppy seed ; preparation:

name: tex mex kraft dinner ; ingredients: kraft macaroni and cheese, butter, low-fat milk, lean hamburger, taco seasoning, salsa ; preparation:Cook kraft dinner according to package directions, including butter and milk. Meanwhile borwn hamburger. Add taco seasoning. Mix hamburger into kraft dinner. Stir in salsa. ; name: barbie s tuna sandwich ; ingredients: solid white tuna, mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, sweet pickle relish, onion flakes, curry powder, dried dill weed, garlic powder ; preparation:In a medium bowl, combine tuna, mayonnaise, parmesan cheese and onion flakes. Season eith remaining ingredients. Mix well. Chill. Serve on crackers or as sandwich spread. ; name: strawberry cheesecake oatmeal ; ingredients: oat bran, light cream cheese, strawberries, vanilla extract, graham cracker squares, sugar substitute ; preparation:Pour oat bran in a large bowl and add enough water to cover, stir. Microwave for about 2 minutes. Add light cream cheese and stir until smooth. Add vanilla extract. Add sugar substitute. Stir in strawberries. Crush graham crackers in your hands and sprinkle over the oatmeal. ; name: easy delicious grilled teriyaki chicken ; ingredients: chicken drumsticks, dijon mustard, soy sauce, teriyaki sauce ; preparation:Mix dijon mustard, soy sauce and teriyaki sauce into ziploc bag or bowl. Add chicken and marinate overnight or 4 hours. Let chicken sit out while heating up the grill. Grill for about 20 minutes or until done. Basting frequently. ; name: blazin venison steaks ; ingredients: venison steak, portabella mushroom caps, vegetable oil, jalapeno peppers, worcestershire sauce, garlic cloves, salt, dry red wine, dry mustard, ground cinnamon ; preparation:Place steaks in a casserole dish and arrange the mushrooms on top of each. Set aside. In a skillet, over medium heat, add the oil and sautee the jalapenos until slightly tender. Then, add the worcestershire sauce, garlic and salt -- heat until it sizzles a bit. Remove from the heat and add the wine, mustard and cinnamon -- whisk until blended. Pour the skillet contents over the steaks, cover with cling wrap and allow to marinate in the refrigerator overnight. After marinating overnight, remove them from the dish and grill the steaks and portabellos over hot charcoal. Baste with the marinade, grilling the steaks for about 6 minutes to a side and allowing the portabellos slightly longer. Do not baste for the final 3 minutes and discard any extra marinade. Serve with some buttery garlic noodles as a side dish. ; name: dillsas dill sauce ; ingredients: butter, flour, chicken stock, fresh dill, vinegar, sugar, egg yolk, salt ; preparation:

name: carrot marmalade ; ingredients: lemon, seville oranges, water, carrots, sugar ; preparation:Wash the lemon and orange and shred them finely. Keep all the seeds from both, and put them in a clean new tea ball, or sew them into a scrap of cheesecloth. Put the canning jars in a large kettle with enough water to come to an inch above the rims. Turn the heat on just after you add the sugar and carrots to the marmalade- jars must be boiled 10 minutes to be sterilized. Put the lemon and orange shreds and juice in a large, broad pot with the water and the seeds, and boil for ten minutes. Wash, peel and grate the carrots. Add the carrots and sugar to the peels. Continue boiling until the marmalade is thick and forms a sheet when poured from the spoon, about 30 minutes longer. Fish out the seeds, draining them well. Seal the marmalade in sterilized jars and process in boiling water for 5 minutes. ; name: overnight eggnog french toast ; ingredients: eggs, half-and-half, sugar, nutmeg, vanilla, rum extract, french bread, powdered sugar ; preparation:Grease two 15x10 inch baking pans. In a large bowl combine the eggs, half-and-half, sugar, nutmeg, vanilla and rum extract. Beat until well blended arrange bread slices in greased baking pans. Pour egg mixture over the bread in the pans. Lift and move bread slices until all egg mixture is absorbed. Cover with foil and refrigerate overnight or freeze up to 1 week. Heat oven to 500 degrees. Remove pans from refrigerator or freezer. Remove foil. Bake one pan at a time for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. ; name: no bake chocolate cookies chokladbollar ; ingredients: quick-cooking oatmeal, sugar, butter, cocoa powder, vanilla extract, coffee, coconut ; preparation:Combine butter, sugar, oats, cocoa powder, vanilla, and coffee. Roll into balls about the size of a meatball. Roll balls in coconut or pearl sugar to decorate. Eat right away, or refrigerate, or freeze if you prefer a harder consistency. Makes about 15. On pearl sugar. Pearl sugar is coarsely ground sugar used for decorating baked goods. ; name: lower fat cream cheese and ricotta stuffed mushrooms ; ingredients: mushroom cap, low-fat cream cheese, part-skim ricotta cheese, garlic, cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Mix cream cheese, ricotta and garlic. Spoon cheese mixture into mushroom caps. Sprinkle shredded cheese on top. Bake for 10 minutes, or until shredded cheese is well melted. I suggest putting aluminum foil on a cookie sheet for easy clean-up, since the cheese may ooze over a bit. ; name: simmered sirloin with gravy ; ingredients: boneless beef top sirloin steaks, onion, sliced mushrooms, garlic, butter, beef stock, worcestershire sauce, all-purpose flour, cold water ; preparation:In large nonstick skillet, cook beef, onions, mushrooms and garlic in butter over medium heat for 5-7 minutes or until meat is brown and no longer pink. Add the beef broth, worcestershire sauce and bring to boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for one hour. Combine flour and water until smooth. Add to beef mixture. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. ; name: cranberry special meatballs ; ingredients: ground beef, seasoned stuffing mix, eggs, onion, salt, black pepper, whole berry cranberry sauce, chili sauce, light brown sugar, ground ginger ; preparation:

name: stained glass crepes ; ingredients: flour, sugar, egg, milk, vanilla, lolly pops ; preparation:Mix the dough according to taste by muffin method. Form dough into the shape you want the crepe to be. Add the crushed lollipops into the spaces between the dough spaces that are open. Bake for 30 minutes to a hour or until the lollipop pieces are molten. Wait until they are cool enough to touch and then remove with spatula. ; name: halva ; ingredients: olive oil, semolina flour, sugar, water, lemon wedges, cinnamon stick, almonds ; preparation:Heat the oil and cook the semolina in the oil until golden. Place the almonds to brown with the semolina. In the meantime, warm the water, but do not boil, and dissolve the sugar in it and throw in the lemon and the cinnamon stick. Pour the water into the semolina mix and stir well while pouring. Keep heating until the mixture becomes thick. Pour the mix into a bundt pan and garnish with sesame seeds and cinnamon. Let stand and serve at room temperature. ; name: creamy avocado with bacon dip ; ingredients: avocado, sour cream, hot sauce, imitation bacon bits, lemon juice, onion powder ; preparation:Pit, peel, and mash the avocado with a fork. Blend in the lemon juice, blending well and then add the sour cream, blending well. Mix in remaining ingredients. Cover and chill for at least an hour. Cooking time is chilling time. Give a good stir before serving to make sure ingredients are well blended. Serve with tortilla chips. ; name: delicious georgia pear relish ; ingredients: pears, vidalia onions, red bell peppers, green bell peppers, granulated sugar, kosher salt, apple cider vinegar, allspice ; preparation:Put through food grinder all the ingredients. When everything is ground up, mix all together. In a large canning kettle. Cook for 40 minutes. Put in jars and seal. ; name: south african melktert milk tart ; ingredients: sweetened condensed milk, milk, eggs, margarine, cornstarch, sugar, custard powder, vanilla, cinnamon ; preparation:Mix sweetened condensed milk, 1 tin milk, egg yolks, corn starch and custard powder in a large microwave proof casserole dish. Whisk together until mixed well. Add the rest of the milk and mix well again. Cook at high power in microwave for 3 minutes. Stir well and add margarine and vanilla. Cook for 3 minutes, stir well, continue cooking in two or three minute intevals until mixture is thickened and smooth. It takes about 8 minutes total in my microwave. Allow to cool slightly. Beat reserved egg whites until stiffly beaten. Fold in egg whites into cooked milk mixture. Pour into three baked pie crust - use pat in pan pie crust as a good pie crust for this pie. Sprinkle cinnamon on top of pie. ; name: blt on croissant ; ingredients: shortcut bacon, croissants, tomatoes, butter lettuce leaves, mayonnaise, garlic clove, flat leaf parsley ; preparation:

name: asian pea pods casserole microwave ; ingredients: frozen pea pods, sliced water chestnuts, green onions, butter, soy sauce, cornstarch, salt, ground ginger, pepper ; preparation:Microwave pea pods in 1-qt. Covered glass casserole for 2 minutes, or until thawed. Stir in remaining ingredients. Microwave, uncovered, 4 minutes, or until pea pods are crisp tender. Stir again, adjust seasonings if necessary, and serve. ; name: chocolate covered saltine crackers ; ingredients: saltine crackers, butter, brown sugar, mini chocolate chips, nuts, toffee pieces, candy sprinkles, raisins, mint ; preparation:Arrange 40 saltine crackers on a non-stick foil in a jelly roll pan. Melt butter and brown sugar in pan and boil 3 minutes. Pour over crackers. Bake at 350f for 5 minutes. Pour chocolate chips over and let stand 5 minutes to melt. Spread around with knife and then sprinkle nuts and toffee bits over top and or raisins. Garnish with colored sprinkles. Place in refrigerator until hard. Break into bite-size pieces. ; name: easiest chicken pot pie ; ingredients: mixed vegetables, cream of mushroom soup, cream of celery soup, cooked chicken breasts, crescent rolls, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut chicken into small cubes. In large pot mix vegetables, soups, butter and chicken. Cook on medium heat for 10 minutes. Put soup mixture in 10 x 13 inch baking dish. Unroll cresent rolls and cover mixture with unrolled cresents. Bake for 20 minutes or until cresent cover is golden brown. Let cool pie cool down for about 5 minutes before serving. ; name: laab salad ; ingredients: ground chicken, fresh lime juice, fish sauce, sugar, hot chili pepper, rice flour, green onions, fresh cilantro, red onions, of fresh mint ; preparation:Brown meat in wok over medium heat without any oil. Transfer to a bowl and mix with lime juice, fish sauce and hot pepper. Add the ground rice and remaining ingredients and combine mixture. Place mixture on a bed of shredded lettuce. Garnish with cucumber, carrot and cabbage. Serve at room temperature. ; name: dried cherry and pecan oatmeal ; ingredients: water, nonfat milk, whole oats, dried cherries, salt, brown sugar, butter, ground cinnamon, vanilla extract, pecans ; preparation:Bring the first 5 ingredients to a boil. Lower heat and simmer, stirring occasionally for 20 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in 4 tablespoons brown sugar and the next 3 ingredients. Spoon 1 cup of oatmeal into each of 6 bowls. Sprinkle evenly with pecans and the remaining brown sugar. Serve immediately. ; name: seafood layer dip ; ingredients: cream cheese, ranch salad dressing, seafood cocktail sauce, cheddar cheese, imitation crabmeat, shrimp, green pepper, tomatoes, green onions ; preparation:

name: gerry s sauced hamburgers ; ingredients: hamburger patties, hamburger buns, catsup, water, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce, dry mustard ; preparation:Pan fry or grill the hamburger patties. Drain patties on paper towel. Put prepared patties in a casserole dish or a roaster. Prepare sauce in a medium pot add the sauce ingredients and blend smooth with a whisk. Cook gently over medium heat, stirring until heated through. Pour over the prepared patties. At this point you may cover and refrigerate until ready to heat for your meal. If preparing this at mealtime, place in a 300 degree oven for 25 minutes or until nicely heated through. I like serving marinated onions, sliced tomatoes, pickles and all the extras that make for a loaded burger. ; name: fiesta shrimp and avocado salsa ; ingredients: avocados, roma tomatoes, baby shrimp, spring onions, minced garlic cloves, chili sauce, serrano pepper, lime, cilantro, salt and pepper ; preparation:Mix all ingredients except for avocados. Blend well to incorporate flavors. Finally mix in avocados. Chill till serving. We serve with flour tortillas cut into triangles and deep fried till lightly browned. ; name: lemon ice cream without ice cream maker ; ingredients: lemon juice, lemon zest, sugar, whole milk, heavy cream, salt ; preparation:Combine lemon juice, lemon zest, and sugar in a mixing bowl. Gradually stir in milk, heavy cream and salt. Pour into an 8 inch glass baking dish, cover and freeze until firm. Remove ice cream one half at a time and run through a food processor until nearly smooth. Pour into a plastic bowl, with lid. Top ice cream mixture with plastic wrap and seal with lid to bowl. Will keep up to one week. ; name: chinese sweet and sour sauce ; ingredients: catsup, apple cider vinegar, orange juice, red wine vinegar, granulated sugar, dry mustard, hot sauce, cornstarch, water ; preparation:Combine cornstarch and water. Set aside. In saucepan heat all remaining ingredients until sugar is dissolved and liquid is hot. Slowly add the cornstarch and water mixture, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens, about 1 minute. Remove from heat. Serve warm or room temperature. ; name: home style macaroni and cheese ; ingredients: vegetable oil cooking spray, elbow macaroni, salt, alfredo sauce, sharp cheddar cheese, olive oil, breadcrumbs ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Lightly mist an 11x7 inch glass or ceramic baking dish with vegetable oil cooking spray and set aside. Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add salt, if using, and stir in the macaroni. Reduce heat to medium-high and cook uncovered about 8 minutes. Reserve 1 cup of the pasta cooking water, then drain the macaroni well in a colander. Transfer the macaroni to the prepared baking dish. Add the pasta sauce, 2 cups of the cheese, and the reserved pasta cooking water, and stir until ingredients are well combined. Scatter the remaining 1 cup of cheese over the top. In a small bowl, toss the olive oil with the bread crumbs, and then scatter on top of the cheese. Bake until the macaroni and cheese is bubbly and the crumbs are lightly brown, 25 to 30 minutes. ; name: cucumber red onion and radish salad ; ingredients: cucumber, red onion, red radishes, vegetable oil, white wine vinegar, sugar, dry crushed red pepper ; preparation:

name: super easy chicken pot pie ; ingredients: ready-made pie crusts, healthy request cream of chicken soup, russet potatoes, frozen peas and carrot, frozen cut green beans, chicken breast ; preparation:Lay the bottom crust in a deep-dish pie plate and press in lightly. Arrange the vegetables and chicken in the crust and cover with the condensed soup. Cover with the top crust and seal the edges. Cut a couple of vents in the top crust and bake as if for a two-crust pie until golden brown and bubbly. Put some foil or a cookie sheet underneath the pie plate to prevent this. ; name: roast salmon with lime salsa ; ingredients: limes, red onion, cilantro, jalapeno, canola oil, sugar, sea salt, salmon fillets, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 425. Using a sharp knife, carefully peel the limes. Be sure to remove all of the bitter white pith. Working over a bowl, cut in between the membranes to release the lime sections into the bowl. Cut each section crosswise into quarters. Return the limes to the bowl and stir in the onion, cilantro and jalapeo. Add 1 tablespoon of the oil, the sugar and a pinch of salt and toss well. Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil in an ovenproof skillet until shimmering. Season the fillets on both sides with salt and pepper and add to the skillet, skinned side up. Cook over moderately high heat until golden brown on the bottom, about 2 minutes. Transfer the skillet to the oven and roast the salmon for 5 minutes, or until just cooked through. Transfer to 4 dinner plates, spoon the salsa on top and serve. ; name: smoked salmon and potato salad ; ingredients: potatoes, green beans, mayonnaise, eggs, shallots, salmon, water, salt and pepper ; preparation:Place potatoes in a saucepan and cover with cold water and bring to the boil over high heat and then reduce heat to medium and cook uncovered for 10 minutes or until tender,. Add beans for the last minutes and then drain and transfer to a large bowl. Combine mayonnaise, egg. Eschalots and 1 tablespoon cold water in a small bowl and season with salt and pepper. Add mayonnaise mixture and salmon to potato mixture and toss to combine and serve. Salad can be served warm or cold. ; name: cajun pumpkin seeds ; ingredients: pumpkin seeds, cajun seasoning, paprika, salt, worcestershire sauce, butter ; preparation:Rinse seeds. Pat dry with paper towel. Toss with seasoning. Combine butter and worcestershire and stir in. Bake on 300 degrees for 45-60 minutes until brown and crunchy. ; name: polenta primavera ; ingredients: water, yellow cornmeal, fontina, heavy whipping cream, parmesan cheese, salt, ground black pepper, primavera pasta sauce ; preparation:Grease 9-inch pie plate. Bring water to a boil in medium saucepan. Slowly add cornmeal over medium heat, stirring constantly, for 2 to 3 minutes or until slightly thick. Stir in fontina cheese, cream, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper. Cook, stirring constantly, for additional 2 minutes or until very thick. Spread into prepared pie plate. Cool for 1 hour or until firm. Cut into wedges. Serve topped with sauce or tomatoes. ; name: green bean and carrot soup vegan gluten free ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, carrots, green beans, vegetable stock, almond milk, salt, dried herbs, fresh parsley ; preparation:

name: honolulu eggnog ; ingredients: egg, sugar, salt, coconut milk, pineapple juice, cream, whipped topping, maraschino cherry ; preparation:Separate the egg, and beat the white until stiff. Combine egg yolk, sugar and salt. Fold whites into yolk mixture. Add coconut milk and pineapple juice then cream. Top with whipped cream and garnish with a cherry. ; name: easy tuna melt casserole bake ; ingredients: tuna, onion, celery, mayonnaise, bread, swiss cheese, cream of chicken soup, half-and-half ; preparation:Set oven to 350 degrees. Toast the bread slices. Line the bottom of a greased baking dish with 6 slices of bread, set 6 slices of bread aside. In a bowl, mix together the tuna, chopped onion, celery and mayo. Spread the mixture on the bread in the baking dish. Place the remaining bread slices on top of the tuna mixture. Place the slices of cheese over the bread. Mix together the undiluted soup and the half and half. Pour over the cheese slices, spreading with the back of a spoon to coat evenly. Bake for 20-25 minutes. ; name: fresh tomatillo salsa verde ; ingredients: tomatillo, jalapeno, garlic cloves, fresh cilantro, lime juice, sugar, salt, olive oil ; preparation:Husk and wash tomatillos. Chop the tomatillos into very course chunks. Set aside. Depending on how hot you like your salsa, either remove the seeds and veins from the jalapenos or leave them intact. Chop the jalapeno into small chunks and put into blender or food processor. Peel the garlic, put into blender. Take the cilantro, remove the leaves from the stems and put into blender. Put lime juice, salt, sugar and olive oil into the blender. Last, put the tomatillos into blender and blend until smooth. Serve chilled. Be sure to experiment with different amounts of jalapeno, lime juice, salt, etc. ; name: cocoa fudge 1965 ; ingredients: white sugar, brown sugar, salt, cocoa powder, corn syrup, sour cream, butter, vanilla extract, walnuts ; preparation:Mix sugars, salt, cocoa, syrup, and sour cream in a large buttered saucepan. Cook without stirring until candy temp. Reaches 235 degrees f. Or until a soft ball forms in very cold water. Add butter. Stir just til blended. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. Let sit until cool. Add chopped nuts. Beat until creamy, and just until it starts to loose its glossy appearance dulls slightly. Pour into prepared buttered 8 x8 inch pan. Cut into squares while still soft and warm. ; name: quick drop cookies ; ingredients: sugar, salt, butter, milk, peanut butter, rolled oats, vanilla extract, instant chocolate drink mix ; preparation:Combine sugar, salt, butter and milk in a medium size sauce pan. Bring to a boil and let boil for 1 minute. Stir in peanut butter, oats, vanilla and chocolate drink mix. Drop by rounded teaspoons full onto waxed paper. Let set until cool. Store in airtight container. ; name: apple corned beef brisket for the slow cooker ; ingredients: red potatoes, onion, apple, corned beef brisket, cabbage, apple cider, brown sugar, dijon mustard, ground cloves, black pepper ; preparation:

name: crispy squid with capers ; ingredients: baby calamari, capers, plain flour, fine salt, vegetable oil ; preparation:Place the flour, salt and capers in a strong plastic bag, shake vigorously to coat. Cut the squid into rings approx 1cm wide. Pat dry and add these, and the tentacles, to the flour and capers. Shake again until completely covered. Deep-fry in small batches for a couple of minutes until slightly golden. Remove from the oil with a slotted spoon and allow to drain on kitchen towel. Sprinkle with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper, if desired, before serving. ; name: ham stroganoff ; ingredients: cooked ham, onion, butter, mushrooms, cream of mushroom soup, sour cream, flour, medium egg noodles ; preparation:Saute onion butter and ham until onions are clear. Add mushrooms and flour. Add mushroom soup and sour cream. Hheat thru but do not boil. Cook noodles as directed drain but do not rinse. Add to sauce. Let set for about 10 minutes with cover on before serving. ; name: sammy s grilled chicken salad with balsamic dressing ; ingredients: lettuce, gorgonzola, walnuts, basil, chicken breast, balsamic vinegar, canola oil, salt, pepper, fresh basil ; preparation:Place chopped lettuce in bowl. Add cheese, walnuts and basil and toss. Serve with chicken on top. For dressing, add all ingredients to blender and blend. Refrigerate until ready to serve salad. Makes 3 cups, so there will be some to save. ; name: zucchini rounds side dish sandra lee semi homemade ; ingredients: zucchini, italian seasoning, extra virgin olive oil, parmesan cheese, salt, ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425. Spray a rimmed baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine zucchini, italian seasoning, olive oil, cheese, salt, and pepper. Spread zucchini in a single layer on prepared baking sheet. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes, turning once. Serve immediately. ; name: baked sole fillets ; ingredients: sole fillets, onion, sour cream, white wine, all-purpose flour, lemon, juice of, paprika, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f degrees. Butter a shallow baking dish and arrange fish pieces in it. Cover fish with onion slices. In a small bowl, whisk together sour cream, wine, flour, lemon juice and the seasonings. Pour over the fish and onions. Bake, uncovered, for 25 minutes or until fish is tender. Do not overcook or fish will dry out. ; name: kremidotiganites greek onion fritters ; ingredients: onion, flour, of fresh mint, oil, salt and black pepper, water ; preparation:

name: chilli spare ribs ; ingredients: spareribs, peanut oil, garlic, dry sherry, chili bean paste, water, hoisin sauce, sugar, soy sauce ; preparation:Place the pork in a large pot with water to cover. Bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes. Drain well. Place all the remaining ingredients and the pork ribs in a wok. Cover and simmer for 45 minutes. Drain, reserving 1 cup liquid. Heat a clean wok and sear the pork until browned. Add the reserved liquid and cook over medium until it glazes. Chop the pork into bite size pieces and serve. ; name: apricot crisp ; ingredients: apricots, all-purpose flour, walnuts, sugar, butter, ground cloves, ground cardamom, ground cinnamon ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Slice apricots in half and discard stone. Cover bottom of a shallow, buttered oven proof dish with two layers of apricots. Place flour, walnuts, sugar, butter, cloves, cardamom, and ground cinnamon into a food processor and blend until it is like breadcrumbs. Spread mixture on top of apricots. Bake in preheated 375f oven for approximately 50 minutes or until lightly browned on top. Serve with custard or cream. ; name: easy apple pudding ; ingredients: apples, self raising flour, cinnamon, butter, sugar, egg ; preparation:Peel, core and slice apples into bite-size pieces. Wash and place them in a saucepan. Combine the dry ingredients with the egg and sprinkle the mixture on top of the apples. Melt butter and pour over the topping. Cover and heat the pan over medium heat for 15-20 minutes. Reduce heat and cook for 15 minutes. This yummy pudding can be served hot or cold. ; name: old south blue cheese dressing or dip ; ingredients: buttermilk, mayonnaise, onion, blue cheese, pimento stuffed olive ; preparation:In food processor, grind onions. Remove. Then grind olives. Return onions to processor and add mayo and buttermilk. Pulse until well blended. Add blue cheese crumbles. Stir. Pour into jar. Cover and refrigerate at least one hour to blend flavors before serving. ; name: tlayuda with black bean puree aka mexican unpizza ; ingredients: black beans, salt & freshly ground black pepper, garlic, onion, chili powder, cumin, corn tortillas, mozzarella cheese, cabbage, fresh cilantro ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450 degrees. If using dried beans, add salt, pepper, garlic, onion, chili powder and cumin in last few minutes of cooking. Place mixture in blender or food processer with enough liquid to allow machine to do its work and roughly puree. If using canned beans, add seasonings and warm mixture gently in a saucepan, stirring, to take the edge off of the garlic and onion. Then roughly puree with a little of the liquid as necessary. Place the tortillas on pizza peel or baking sheet and evenly spread with the bean mixture and then the cheese. Bake for 5 minutes, then sprinkle with cabbage and cilantro if using. Bake another 5 minutes until the topping is hot and tortilla is crisp on the edges. Cut into wedges if desired. ; name: kraft bacon tomato cheese crescents ; ingredients: crescent rolls, cream cheese, tomatoes, bell pepper, bacon ; preparation:

name: low fat garlic prawns ; ingredients: green shrimp, white wine, skim evaporated milk, cornflour, shallot, garlic ; preparation:Spray pan with cooking spray. Saute prawns for 2- 3 minutes and then add garlic, wine and shallots and cook 5 minutes. Mix cornflour with evaporated milk, add to pan and stir constantly until thickens. Season to taste. Serve with boiled rice as an entree. ; name: jack o lantern oranges ; ingredients: navel oranges, apple, red seedless grapes, slivered almonds, whole cloves ; preparation:Choose the side of each orange that will be the face. If necessary, cut a slice off the bottom of each orange so it will rest flat. Cut a small slice off the top of each and spoon out the pulp. Chop pulp and mix with the apple and grapes. Set aside. Cut faces on orange skins and decorate with almonds and cloves. Spoon the fruit salad into the oranges. ; name: salmon fusilli salad ; ingredients: tri-colored fusilli, miracle whip, dried dill weed, dried onion flakes, chives, sweet red pepper, lime juice, salt, fresh ground pepper, sockeye salmon ; preparation:Cook pasta in salted boiling water till al-dente. Rinse in cool water and set aside to drain. In the meantime, mix together miracle whip, dill, onion flakes, chives, red pepper, lime juice, salt and pepper. Add the dressing mixture to the pasta and mix thoroughly. Gently fold in the salmon. Cover and chill for 2 hours before serving. ; name: buttered noodles with fresh sage ; ingredients: egg noodles, butter, onion, fresh sage leaves, salt, black pepper, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain. Melt butter in the empty pot. Simmer onion and sage leaves 5 minutes. Add salt and pepper. Toss with noodles. Top with parmesan cheese just before serving. ; name: fresh orange yogurt parfaits with granola ; ingredients: plain yogurt, currants, granola cereal, pure vanilla extract, honey, orange, zest of, orange juice, orange ; preparation:Line a sieve with cheesecloth or paper towels and suspend it over a bowl. Pour the yogurt into the sieve and allow it to drain, refrigerated, for 3 hours or overnight. Place the thickened yogurt into a medium bowl and stir in the currants or raisins, vanilla, honey, and orange zest. Thin with orange juice until it is a desirable consistency. Divide yogurt among 4 dessert dishes or parfait glasses, spooning yogurt in alternating with granola. Garnish with sections of orange and serve. ; name: cranberry ginger pudding ; ingredients: butter, caster sugar, eggs, self raising flour, gingerroot, orange, juice and zest of, ground ginger, fresh cranberries, dried cranberries ; preparation:

name: mom s chicken livers ; ingredients: chicken liver, bacon, mushrooms, onion, garlic cloves, chicken stock, marsala wine, balsamic vinegar, butter, olive oil ; preparation:Slice the mushrooms and onion and chop the bacon. Heat the oil and butter in a skillet. Add the bacon, onion and garlic and cook until onion is tender. Add the mushrooms and cook until browned. While the bacon, onion and mushrooms are cooking clean the chicken livers and chop into small pieces. Add the chicken livers. After the chicken livers have had time to cook and get brown add the wine, balsamic vinegar and stock. Simmer, uncovered until the livers are done. Serve alone or with with egg noodles. ; name: almond crunch ; ingredients: almonds, butter, sugar, light corn syrup ; preparation:Line bottom and sides of an 8 or 9-inch pan with aluminum foil. Spray lightly with non stick spray. Set aside. Combine all ingredients in a 10-inch skillet. Over medium heat, bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Boil until mixture turn golden brown, 5-6 minutes. Quickly spread in prepared pan. Cool 15 minutes and break into bite sized pieces. ; name: cowboy soup ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, green pepper, enchilada sauce, vegetable soup, ranch style beans, whole kernel corn ; preparation:Combine ground beef, onion, and green pepper in large saucepan. Cook till onion and pepper are tender. Drain off fat. Add enchilada sauce, soup, beans, and corn to ground beef and onion mixture. Stir to combine. Simmer for 15 minutes. ; name: dutch leek soup ; ingredients: whole wheat flour, beef bouillon cubes, water, milk, ground mace, leeks, whipping cream, gouda cheese ; preparation:Blend together flour, bouillon cubes and water. Stir in milk and mace. Bring to a boil. Immediately reduce heat to simmer. Simmer 10 minutes. Add leeks and cream. Simmer 10 minutes. Serve cheese with soup at the table. ; name: quick and easy clam sauce for pasta ; ingredients: onion, garlic, butter, flour, minced clams, milk, dry fettuccine, parsley, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Saute onion and garlic in butter. Blend in flour. Drain clams and reserve juices. Add minced clams and milk to the onion and garlic. Simmer 10 minutes, season with salt and pepper to taste. If you desire a thicker sauce, make a slurry of cornstarch and milk. Add a little at a time to the sauce, stirring, until the desired thickness. Use the reserved clam juices to thin the sauce if need be. Meanwhile, cook pasta al dente in boiling salted water. Serve sauce over pasta. Top with parsley. Pass grated parmesan. ; name: baked chicken fajitas ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast, diced tomatoes with green chilies, onion, green pepper, red pepper, canola oil, chili powder, ground cumin, salt, flour tortillas ; preparation:

name: potato salad with mustard and honey ; ingredients: baby potatoes, bacon, spring onions, white wine vinegar, honey, coarse grain mustard, olive oil ; preparation:Cut any larger potatoes in half, then cook until tender. Drain and cool. Put the baking on a baking tray and grill until crisp. Cool and break up into pieces. Thinly slice the spring onions on the diagonal. Mix together the potato, bacon and spring onions in a bowl. To make the mustard and honey dressing, put all ingredients into a screw top jar and shake until well mixed. Pour over the potato salad. ; name: wheat beer bread ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, baking powder, salt, brown sugar, beer ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan. In a large mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, baking powder, salt and brown sugar. Pour in beer, stir until a stiff batter is formed. It may be necessary to mix dough with your hands. Scrape dough into prepared loaf pan. Bake in preheated oven for 50 to 60 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into center of the loaf comes out clean. ; name: peach and raspberry jam ; ingredients: frozen raspberries, peaches, lemon juice, sugar, liquid fruit pectin ; preparation:Thaw berries according to package directions. Peel, pit and crush peaches. Measure thawed berries and add enough crushed peaches to make 4 cups fruit. Place in kettle, add lemon juice and sugar, mixing throughly. Bring to a full rolling boil over high heat and let boil hard for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heat, add pectin, stirring vigorously. Stir and skim alternately for about 5 minutes. Ladle quickly into hot sterilized jars. Seal 5 minutes in boiling water bath using 2 piece lids. ; name: summer peach salad ; ingredients: cream cheese, mayonnaise, heavy cream, fresh peaches, pecans, lemon juice ; preparation:Beat cream cheese and heavy cream until fluffy. Stir in mayo and lemon juice. Fold in peaches and pecans. Pour into 9x9x2 glass dish and freeze for 3-4 hours. Using warm knife, cut into squares. ; name: mouthwatering chinese chicken drumsticks ; ingredients: dark soy sauce, oyster sauce, orange juice, sesame oil, cooking sherry, pancake syrup, garlic, chicken drumsticks ; preparation:Combine all ingredients for the marinade in a zip-lock bag. Add chicken. Marinade overnight. Pre-heat oven to 400 degrees. Line a medium-sized baking pan with aluminum foil and sprinkle the bottom of the pan with salt. Dump the contents of the bag into the pan. Arrange the drumsticks so that they are not touching each other. Cover pan with aluminum foil and bake for forty-five minutes. Remove the top layer of foil and turn the chicken over. Bake for an additional fifteen to twenty minutes, until the top of the chicken is nicely browned. Remove from oven. I always serve this with white rice, and pour the drippings from the chicken over the rice. ; name: navy beans ; ingredients: dried navy beans, virgin olive oil, onion, garlic, bay leaf, fresh thyme, chicken stock, salt, black pepper ; preparation:

name: vera cruz tomatoes ; ingredients: bacon, diced onion, fresh spinach, sour cream, hot pepper sauce, tomatoes, fresh mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Cut tops off tomatoes and scoop out centers, leaving tomato bowls. Sprinkle salt inside tomato to draw out some moisture, set aside. Cook the bacon till crisp in a frying pan. Drain. Reserving 2 tablespoons of the drippings. Crumble the bacon, set aside. Cook onion in drippings, stir in fresh spinach. Cover and cook till tender about 3-5 minute remove from heat. Stir in sour cream, pepper sauce, and bacon. Pour any juice out of tomato bowls, fill with spinach mixture. Bake in pan at 375 for 20-25 minute. Top with cheese and heat till cheese melts and is bubbly. ; name: smashed red potatoes with parmesan basil butter ; ingredients: red potatoes, olive oil, salt, pepper, unsalted butter, parmesan cheese, fresh garlic, fresh basil ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. To a mixing bowl, add red potatoes, olive oil, salt and pepper. Toss to coat potatoes. Place on a baking sheet. Cook potatoes until largest potatoes are soft, about 25-30 minutes. While potatoes are cooking use a mixer to whip the butter, shredded parmesan, chopped garlic, chopped basil and salt and pepper. Add the roasted potatoes to bowl and smash potatoes to a coarse mash. ; name: lemon thyme rainbow trout ; ingredients: trout fillet, all-purpose flour, lemon rind, dried thyme, salt and pepper, lemon juice, vegetable oil ; preparation:Divide fish into 4 equal pieces if necessary. In shallow bowl, combine flour, lemon rind, thyme, salt and pepper. Dip fish into lemon juice. Dredge in flour mixture, turning to coat. In nonstick skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Cook fish, turning once, for 6 to 8 minutes or until flakes easily when tested with fork. ; name: weiners on a stick ; ingredients: vegetable oil, barbecue sauce, pancake mix, yellow cornmeal, sugar, water, hot dogs, wooden skewers ; preparation:Heat oil to 375 degrees f on a deep fry thermometer. In a small saucepan, heat bbq sauce. Keep warm. Combine pancake mix, cornmeal, sugar, and water. Beat until just smooth. Let stand 10 minutes. Dip weiners in the batter so they are coated all over. Fry coated weiners, a few at a time, until crisp and golden brown all over. Lift out carefully with a slotted spoon and drain well on paper towels. Insert a skewer in one end of each weiner. Serve immediately with warmed bbq sauce for dipping. ; name: tuna stuffed piquillo peppers tapas ; ingredients: piquillo pepper, tuna in vegetable oil, green onions, parsley, sherry wine vinegar, garlic clove, olive, egg, sweet smoked paprika ; preparation:Drain tuna and flake with a fork. Mix all ingredients except peppers into tuna, lightly. Stuff peppers with tuna mixture. Refrigerate at least 20 minutes. Serve cold. For the egg, put egg in pot of cold water on high heat. When it comes to a boil, cover and turn off heat. Let sit 10 minutes. Peel under cold running water,. ; name: cranberry apricot truffles ; ingredients: dried apricot, dried cranberries, orange zest, dark chocolate ; preparation:

name: parmesan white pizza sauce ; ingredients: butter, onion, garlic clove, all-purpose flour, chicken broth, milk, dried basil leaves, parmesan cheese ; preparation:In 1-quart saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Cook onion and garlic in butter about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until soft. Stir in flour until blended. Gradually stir in broth, milk and basil. Cook about 3 minutes, stirring constantly, until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in cheese. Use immediately or store in refrigerator up to 1 week. ; name: picnic orange apricot yogurt soup ; ingredients: plain yogurt, apricots, milk, orange juice, oranges, mint ; preparation:Combine the yogurt, apricots, milk& orange juice in a blender and blend at medium speed for 1 minute. Refrigerate until well chilled. Pour into a well chilled thermos. Carry orange slices and mint separately. Float orange& mint on the soup when serving. ; name: woody s pizza crust ; ingredients: water, active dry yeast, sugar, olive oil, salt, pizza seasoning, all-purpose flour, cornmeal ; preparation:In a mixing bowl add yeast and sugar to hot water. Then add oil, salt and pizza seasoning and mix thoroughly. Add flour and mix up to 30 revolutions. Let rise in a warm and moist place for 20 minutes. When dough is done rising, begin preheating oven to 425 degrees. Punch down dough and kneed in hands and bowl. Keep moving. Sprinkle cornmeal in a thin layer over pizza pan and roll dough out on pan as thick or thin as you like. Add desired sauce, meat, veggies and cheese. Bake in 425 degree oven for 15-20 minutes. ; name: peach mint salsa ; ingredients: peaches, red onion, green pepper, jalapeno pepper, honey, salt, lime, juice and zest of, of fresh mint ; preparation:Combine peaches, onion, peppers, honey, salt, line rind and juice in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat, reduce heat and boil gently, uncovered for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in mint and cook for 1 minute. Ladle salsa into jars. Process 10 minutes for pint jars in boil water bath. ; name: parmesan garlic damper rolls ; ingredients: self-raising flour, butter, parmesan cheese, chives, garlic cloves, water, milk ; preparation:Sift flour into a bowl, rub in butter with finger. Make a well in the centre of the mixture, add combined water & milk all at once reserving about 2 teaspoons. Mix quickly to a soft dough, turn onto a lightly floured surface, knead gently & form into 6 rounds. Arrange on a baking paper lined tray. Cut a cross in the top of each roll & brush with remaining milk mixture, sprinkle with extra cheese. Bake at 220. C for 15-20 mins or until hollow when tapped. ; name: peanut butter chicken with chile ; ingredients: skinless chicken, olive oil, onions, garlic, natural-style peanut butter, ground coriander, red pepper flakes, tomato sauce ; preparation:

name: not just for campout beanie weenies ; ingredients: pork and beans, ketchup, mustard, brown sugar, onions, frankfurters ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Mix together first 5 ingredients in a bowl and pour into greased baking dish. Slice frankfurters into chunks and place on top of bean mixture. Cover and bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Remove cover for last 15 minutes to brown the franks. ; name: gg s garlic cheese biscuits ; ingredients: milk, mayonnaise, sugar, self rising flour, sharp cheddar cheese, garlic powder, butter ; preparation:Combine milk, mayonnaise, sugar and flour. Beat with electric mixer for about 1 minute, until smooth and completely combined. Add cheese to dough. Drop batter into paper lined muffin tins. Muffins tend to triple in size so fill lightly. Melt butter. Mix in garlic and brush tops of dough. You can shake 1 tsp additional cheese on each muffin. Bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes. Serve hot. ; name: garlicky steak marinade ; ingredients: fresh parsley, of fresh mint, fresh rosemary, garlic cloves, fresh lemon juice, soy sauce, olive oil, kosher salt, black pepper ; preparation:Combine parsley, mint, rosemary and garlic in food processor and pulse until finely chopped. Add lemon juice, soy sauce, salt & pepper and process until smooth. With the motor running, add olive oil in a thin stream. Pour marinade over steak and turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight, turning occasionally. ; name: chewy chocolate cookies ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, light corn syrup, egg whites ; preparation:Heat oven to 350f. Spray cookie sheet with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine flour, sugar, cocoa, baking soda and salt. Stir in corn syrup and egg whites until throughly blended. Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls, about 1 inch apart onto prepared sheets. Bake 7 to 9 minutes, or until set. Remove cookies to wire rack to cool completely. ; name: cinnamon peanut butter brownies ; ingredients: butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, ground cinnamon, baking powder, salt, crunchy peanut butter ; preparation:Preheat over to 350 degrees. In a bowl combine butter and sugars. Add eggs and vanilla and beat until smooth. Combine the dry ingredients in a bowl. Add to butter mixture and stir until moistened. Stir in peanut butter. Spread in a greased 7x11-inch greased baking pan. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until it is set in the center. Cool completely and cut in squares. ; name: parsley soup with chive cream ; ingredients: leeks, fresh curly-leaf parsley, butter, floury potatoes, chicken stock, double cream, salt & freshly ground black pepper, chives ; preparation:

name: porcupine beef ; ingredients: ground beef, instant rice, eggs, dry onion soup mix, sweet green pepper, stewed tomatoes, light beer, chili powder, flour ; preparation:Mix together the ground beef, rice, eggs, dry soup mix and pepper. Shape into 6 large balls. Set aside. Combine tomatoes, beer and chili powder in a large, heavy, deep skillet. Heat to boiling over medium heat. Carefully drop meatballs into hot tomato mixture. Cover and simmer for 45 to 55 minutes. Lift out meatballs and thicken sauce with 3 tbsp flour mixed with cold water, if desired. Serve meatballs with sauce in deep bowls with cornbread or crusty bread. ; name: lemon turkey breast ; ingredients: turkey breast cutlets, lemon pepper, lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, dijon mustard, parsley, nonstick cooking spray ; preparation:Coat a large skillet with cooking spray. Heat for 30 seconds. Add turkey. Sprinkle with lemon pepper. And cook for 3 to 5 minutes on each side until browned and no longer pink in center. Combine remaining ingredients in a small bowl, mixing well. Add to pan and cook until heated through. Garnish with parsley. ; name: pecan pie topped brownies ; ingredients: cocoa, oil, vanilla essence, eggs, flour, baking powder, salt, butter, pecans, brown sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f and ligthly grease a large baking tin, approximately 9 x 12 inches. Melt the butter or margarine over low heat in a small saucepan. Add the flour and stir until smooth. Add the vanilla, sugar and eggs and stir constantly for 5 or so minute. Remove from heat and stir in nuts. Set aside. Mix brownie ingredients together in a large bowl. Spread into baking pan. Spread topping over. Bake for 35-40 minute be careful not to overbake. Cool and cut into bars. ; name: peachy chicken with orzo ; ingredients: unsweetened sliced peaches, boneless skinless chicken breasts, white wine, onion, red bell pepper, orzo pasta, water, olive oil, salt substitute, garlic cloves ; preparation:Drain the peaches. Reserve the liquid. In a large skillet, bring the wine to a boil. Add in the chicken and brown. Stir in the onion and bell pepper and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add in the reserved peach liquid, orzo, water, oil, and seasonings. Bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat. Allow to simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until orzo is cooked. Stir in the peaches. Heat through. Adjust seasonings and serve. ; name: mahi mahi with blood orange avocado and red onion salsa ; ingredients: blood oranges, avocado, red onion, red jalapeno chiles, fresh lime juice, olive oil, mahi mahi fillets ; preparation:Using a small sharp knife, cut peel and white pith from orange, working over small bowl, cut between membrane to release segments. Add avocado, onion, jalapeo and lime juice to bowl with orange. Stir gently to blend. Season salsa to taste with salt. Heat oil in heavy medium skillet over medium-high heat. Sprinkle fish with salt and pepper. Add fish to skillet and saut until brown and cooked through, about 5 minutes per side. Place one fillet on each of the 2 plates. Spoon salsa over fish and serve. ; name: my stuffed bell peppers soup ; ingredients: lean ground beef, green bell peppers, onion, jalapenos, chopped tomatoes, tomato paste, beef broth, steamed rice, onion soup mix ; preparation:

name: hot ham and cheese dip ; ingredients: cream cheese spread, smoked ham, cheddar cheese, ritz cracker ; preparation:Mix cream cheese, cheddar cheese and ham until well blended. Spoon into oven proof crock or 9 inch. Pie plate. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes or until puffed and lightly browned. Serve warm as a spread with crackers. ; name: cheese stuffed cherry tomatoes ; ingredients: cream cheese, feta cheese, green onion, dried oregano, plain yogurt, cherry tomatoes, black pepper, paprika ; preparation:In a food processor or blender, blend the cream cheese, feta cheese green onion, pepper and oregano, until smooth, scrape down the sides, add the tablespoon of either yogurt or sour cream. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Rinse the cherry tomatoes and remove stems. With a sharp knife, cut a slice fron the non-stem end of each tomato. With a small spoon scoop out as much of the seeds and pulp and you can, arrange the hollow tomatoes on paper towel lines plate to drain. After the cheese mixture has chilled for 1 hour, transfer the it to a small zipper-top plastic bag, squeeze out air. Snip off one corner, squeeze the cheese filling into each tomato, arrange on serving dish and sprinkle with paprika. ; name: mama s mayonnaise biscuits by virginia willis ; ingredients: canola oil, self-rising flour, mayonnaise, milk, sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Brush 12-cup muffin tin with the oil. Combine remaining ingredients in a bowl. With an ice cream scoop or spoon, spoon dough into each muffin cup, filling about half full. Bake 15 to 20 minutes, until golden brown. Transfer to a wire rack to cool slightly, then invert biscuits onto the rack. Serve warm. ; name: baked parmesan oysters ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic clove, cracker, parmesan cheese, oysters, sherry wine ; preparation:Preheat oven 375f oil a 13x9x2-inch baking dish. In a small bowl, combine olive oil and garlic. In another bowl, combine crackers and parmesan cheese. Dip oysters into oil mixture then coat with crumb mixture until evenly coated. Arrange in baking dish. Sprinkle with sherry and any remaining cracker mixture. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes to brown. ; name: amazing coconut pie ; ingredients: milk, sugar, biscuit mix, eggs, butter, vanilla, flaked coconut ; preparation:Combine all of the ingredients, except the coconut, together in a blender. Cover and blend on low speed for 3 minutes. Pour into a greased 9-inch pie pan. Let stand about 5 minutes then sprinkle with coconut. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Serve warm or cool. ; name: freezer orange sherbet ; ingredients: unflavored gelatin, orange juice, sugar, lemon juice, whipping cream ; preparation:

name: mouthwatering chinese chicken drumsticks ; ingredients: dark soy sauce, oyster sauce, orange juice, sesame oil, cooking sherry, pancake syrup, garlic, chicken drumsticks ; preparation:Combine all ingredients for the marinade in a zip-lock bag. Add chicken. Marinade overnight. Pre-heat oven to 400 degrees. Line a medium-sized baking pan with aluminum foil and sprinkle the bottom of the pan with salt. Dump the contents of the bag into the pan. Arrange the drumsticks so that they are not touching each other. Cover pan with aluminum foil and bake for forty-five minutes. Remove the top layer of foil and turn the chicken over. Bake for an additional fifteen to twenty minutes, until the top of the chicken is nicely browned. Remove from oven. I always serve this with white rice, and pour the drippings from the chicken over the rice. ; name: pickled oysters or mussels ; ingredients: mussels, white vinegar, clove, allspice, red pepper, mace, bay leaf, lemon slice ; preparation:Prepare the shellfish first by scrubbing shells. Steam the shellfish just enough so that the shells become open. Strain the liquid from steaming and cool in the refrigerator. Remove the meat from the shells. Put all the ingredients in a large pan, and simmer for 10 minutes. Leave to cool. Pack the cooled meat into sterilized jars, adding a bay leaf, some cloves and a slice of lemon to each jar. Pour the cooled vinegar mixture over the meat to cover. Seal firmly and store in the refrigerator. ; name: fiesta corn ; ingredients: frozen corn, nonstick cooking spray, margarine, red onion, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, green chilies, paprika ; preparation:Cook the corn according to package directions. In a nonstick skillet sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Melt the margarine. Add the onion and bell peppers. Saute gently, do not let the onion brown. Drain the corn and return it to the sauce pan. Add the onions and peppers to the corn. Add the chilies. And warm through. Sprinkle with smoky paprika and serve. Serve. ; name: sweet sour watermelon cucumber salad ; ingredients: cider vinegar, water, sugar, poppy seed, green onion, seedless watermelon, english cucumbers, salt and pepper ; preparation:Mix together the vinegar, water, sugar and poppy seeds in a bowl and season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the chopped green onion. Place the watermelon and cucumber in a serving bowl and pour the marinade over the top. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate a couple of hours before serving. Toss gently before serving. ; name: macaroni tuna casserole ; ingredients: macaroni and cheese mix, milk, butter, condensed cream of celery soup, canned tuna, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Prepare macaroni and cheese according to package directions. Stir in soup, tuna and milk. Pour into a greased 2-qt. Baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake, uncovered, for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted. ; name: cajun spiced popcorn ; ingredients: popped popcorn, butter, chili powder, onion powder, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, salt, lemon pepper ; preparation:

name: chive sauce for steak ; ingredients: chives, cognac, fresh parsley, dijon mustard, worcestershire sauce, beef broth, butter ; preparation:Heat skillet over medium high heat. Add chives and cook about 10 seconds. Add cognac and stir. Add parsley, mustard, and worcestershire sauce. Add beef broth and stir. Swirl in 1 tablespoon butter and serve. ; name: potato and carrot salsa ; ingredients: carrots, potatoes, tomatoes, fresh oregano, jalapeno chiles, orange, juice of, salt ; preparation:Wash and peel the carrots and potatoes. Cook separately in boiling water until tender. Dice and put into a bowl. Set aside. In blender, liquify tomatoes, oregano jalapeos, and salt. Add to carrot and potato mixture along with the orange juice. ; name: strawberry special blender dessert ; ingredients: strawberry, heavy cream, sugar, vanilla extract ; preparation:Put strawberries in a blender and blend until the berries are just mashed up. You may need to add a little of the cream to get the mixture going. Add the other remaining ingrediets and blend for 30 seconds or so. Put mixture into 4 individual serving dishes and chill. When ready serve, add whipped cream if desired. ; name: whole onions for the grill ; ingredients: onions, butter, beef bouillon cubes, fresh ground black pepper, garlic powder ; preparation:Slice a small section off of one end of each of the onions, then make a small hole into the center. Fill the center hole with 1 bouillon cube and 2 tablespoons butter. Sprinkle the tops with fresh ground black pepper and a small amount of garlic powder if desired. Replace the tops of the onions. Wrap each onion in heavy foil. Place the onions on a preheated grill over indirect heat. Close the lid. Cook for about 1 hour or until the onions are tender. Remove the tops and cut into small pieces and serve with the juice from the foil. ; name: speck und bona ham and green beans ; ingredients: ham, fresh green beans, potatoes, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cover a 3 pound piece of fat ham with cold water. Simmer for 3 hours, adding more water if necessary to keep at least a quart of broth at all times. Add green beans and quartered potatoes. Cook for 30 minutes longer. Slice ham and serve hot with vegetables and broth. ; name: flourless and sugar free peanut butter cookies ; ingredients: peanut butter, splenda sugar substitute, egg, vanilla ; preparation:

name: onion beer soup ; ingredients: oil, onions, sugar, flour, dark beer, chicken stock, salt & freshly ground black pepper, crusty bread, fresh parsley, gruyere cheese ; preparation:Heat oil. Add onions& sugar, cover and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, for 20- 25 minutes or until the onions are slightly coloured. Sprinkle flour over onions& stir in. Slowly add the beer, pour in chicken stock and season to taste. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Place toast slices in ovenproof soup bowls. Pour broth into each bowl, sprinkle with some parsley& top with grated cheese. Place under broiler for a couple of minutes to melt cheese. ; name: pasta with avocado pesto ; ingredients: pasta, avocados, garlic, fresh lemon juice, cilantro, tomatoes, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook pasta until al dente. Combine avocado, garlic, lemon juice and cilantro in a food processor. Process about 1 minute or until smooth. Stir in chopped tomatoes. Drain pasta and pour pesto over it tossing well. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. ; name: couscous with mushrooms ; ingredients: water, butter, chicken bouillon granules, salt, pepper, couscous, mushroom stems and pieces ; preparation:In a large sauce pan, bring water, butter, bouillon, salt, and pepper to a boil. Stir in couscous and mushrooms. Cover and remove from the heat. Let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. ; name: long beans with tomatoes ; ingredients: fresh green beans, ghee, gingerroot, garlic clove, turmeric, cayenne, ground coriander, tomatoes, vegetable stock ; preparation:Blanch beans in boiling water and rinse in cold running water. Melt ghee in saucepan add ginger root, garlic, stir add turmeric, cayenne, and ground coriander. Stir 1 minute. Add tomatoes, tossing them until coated in spices. Add stock, bring to boil and cook over medium-high for 10 minutes until sauce thickened stirring occasionally. Add beans reduce heat and cook 5 min stir occasionally. Serve immediately. ; name: cherry date skillet cookies ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, dates, egg, crisp rice cereal, sweetened flaked coconut, maraschino cherry, vanilla ; preparation:Melt butter in 10-inch skillet. Stir in brown sugar and dates. Remove from heat. Stir in egg. Return to heat. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture comes to a full boil. Boil, stirring constantly, 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir in 1 cup coconut and all remaining ingredients until moistened. Let stand 10 minutes. Shape rounded teaspoonfuls into 1-inch balls. Roll in remaining coconut. ; name: sweet and sour kielbasa kabobs ; ingredients: brown sugar, cornstarch, apple juice, cider vinegar, orange zest, kielbasa, green bell pepper, onion, pineapple chunk ; preparation:

name: mermaid s artichoke dip ; ingredients: artichoke hearts, diced green chilies, mayonnaise, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Drain artichoke hearts and chilies. Mix together in glass bowl or pan with mayo. Cover with cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with tortilla chips. ; name: tomatoe rice ; ingredients: olive oil, butter, onion, garlic cloves, tomatoes, vegetable stock, long grain rice, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat olive oil and butter in saucepan until butter melets in a medium saucepan add the onion and garlic and saut for about 5 minutes or until onion is softened. Add the tomatoes, mix well, cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the stock, rice, salt and pepper, mix well and bring to the boil. Cover and simmer very gently for about 20 minutes. Serve hot or cold. ; name: asian chili pork tenderloin ; ingredients: pork tenderloin, sweet chili sauce, soy sauce, fresh orange juice, green onion, fresh ginger, sesame seeds, honey, vegetable oil ; preparation:Mix all the ingredients except the oil in a large plastic zip lock bag, mix well so the meat is coated. Place in the fridge for at least 2 hours or overnight. Remove pork from marinade -save marinade. Heat oil in a skillet and saute the pork over medium high heat for 3 minutes, flip and continue cooking for another 3 minutes or until the pork is nicely browned on both sides. Pour in the marinade cook for an additional 3 minutes or until the sauce has thickened. ; name: meatloaf ; ingredients: breadcrumbs, milk, ground beef, egg, brown sugar, salt and pepper, catsup ; preparation:Add bread crumbs to milk and let set a few minutes. Mix in egg, brown sugar, salt and pepper. Add meat and mix. Finally, add catsup. Pat into 2 loaves. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour and 15 minutes. ; name: asparagus soup with lemon creme fraiche ; ingredients: butter, shallot, asparagus, ground coriander, vegetable broth, creme fraiche, fresh lemon juice, lemon peel ; preparation:Melt butter in heavy large saucepan over medium heat. Add shallots. Saute until soft, about 5 minutes. Add asparagus and corander. Stir 1 minute. Add broth. Simmer until asparagus is tender, about 5 minutes. Cool slightly. Either work in batches and puree soup in blender or use and immersion blender in same pot. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir creme fraiche, lemon juice and lemon peel in small bowl. Ladle soup into bowls, top with dollop of lemon creme fraiche. ; name: banana cream protein pie ; ingredients: 9-inch low-fat pie shell, sugar-free fat-free banana cream pudding mix, skim milk, vanilla protein powder, banana, sugar-free cool whip ; preparation:

name: shrimp addie ; ingredients: bacon, tomatoes, green peppers, garlic cloves, shrimp ; preparation:Cook bacon in a heavy skillet until brown and crisp. Remove from skillet and set aside. Add tomatoes, green peppers, and garlic to skillet. Simmer until peppers are tender and tomatoes are reduced to about one-half. This takes about 40 minutes. Add shrimp, and simmer 5 minutes until heated through. Serve with hot rice or grits. ; name: beer baked ham ; ingredients: ham, clove, bay leaf, dry mustard, brown sugar, water, beer ; preparation:Score ham. Stud top with cloves and bay leaves. Make smooth paste of mustard, sugar and water. Add additional water if necessary to produce prepared mustard consistency. Spread over entire surface of ham in baking pan. Pour in beer. Bake, covered, in 400 degree oven for 2 hours. ; name: haddock steamed with veggies ; ingredients: haddock, red cabbage, spanish onion, tomatoes, sharp cheddar cheese, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Bring water in a steamer to a boil, lower heat to a simmer. Layer ingredients in the steamer. Cabbage, break the slice up a little, the slice of onion, broken into rings. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon cheese over evenly, add the slice of tomato. Season the fish with salt and pepper and place the fish fillets evenly over the tomato and top with the other tablespoon of cheese. Steam for approximately 10 minutes or until the cabbage is tender crisp and the fish is flaky. Try to retain the layers to remove to plate. ; name: quick lemon chicken soup ; ingredients: onion, carrot, garlic, boneless skinless chicken breast, basil, chicken stock, dry pasta, olive oil, butter, lemon juice ; preparation:Heat the oil in a medium size pan, melt the butter in the oil and then saute onions until transparent. Add garlic and the chicken. Stir until meat turns white. Add carrots, basil, and chicken stock, and simmer for 30 minutes or until the carrots are tender. Add pasta and simmer for an additional 15 minutes. After the soup has been poured into a bowl, add one tablespoon of lemon juice to each serving. ; name: indian style mung beans ; ingredients: mung beans, vegetable oil, turmeric, cumin, black mustard seeds, ground coriander, onion, tomatoes, mushrooms ; preparation:Wash and soak the mung beans overnight. Rinse and drain and then place in a pot with enough water to cover them. Bring to boil and then simmer for 45 minutes. Heat the oil in a pan and add the tumeric, cumin and coriander and fry until they turn brown. Add the mustard. Add onion, mushrooms and tomato and cook for 5 minues. Add the mixture to the mung beans and cook for 15-20 minutes. ; name: smashed potatoes with green garlic butter ; ingredients: yukon gold potatoes, heavy cream, salt, butter, garlic, fresh parsley, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: pickled beetroot ; ingredients: beetroots, vinegar, water, sugar, peppercorn, clove, bay leaf, mustard seeds, cinnamon stick, salt ; preparation:Wash the beetroot well, and cook in boiling salted water until tender. Strain and cool beetroot and remove skins. Slice beetroot into julienne strips and set aside. Place all pickling ingredients into a pan and bring to boil when boiling bring back mixture to a simmer for about 5 minutes and then strain mixture. Spoon beetroot into hot sterilized jars, and top with the vinegar mixture. Seal jars, and store in a cool place. ; name: fudge crispy treats ; ingredients: crisp rice cereal, semi-sweet chocolate chips, powdered sugar, corn syrup, butter, real vanilla extract ; preparation:Combine the cereal and sugar in a large bowl an set aside. Place chocolate chips in a 1-qt microwave-safe dish. Microwave uncovered, on high for about 1 minute. Stir gently until smooth. Stir in vanilla. Pour over cereal mixture and mix well. Spoon into a greased 9x13 baking pan. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, then cut into squares. ; name: apple graham cracker dessert ; ingredients: light apple pie filling, butter, splenda sugar substitute, eggs, vanilla extract, graham cracker crumbs, baking powder, salt, nonfat milk, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 9x9-inch cake pan with non-stick spray. In a large bowl, cream butter and splenda. Beat in eggs and vanilla. In a separate bowl, mix graham cracker crumbs, baking powder, salt. Add dry ingredients to wet, mix well to combine. Add milk and walnuts, stirring until just combined. Spread half of mixture into prepared cake pan. Spread half of pie filling over top. Spread remaining batter carefully over apples and arrange remaining apple pie filling over top. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes. Place cake pan on a wire rack and let set for at least 10 minutes before removing from pan. ; name: strawberry rhubarb custard pie ; ingredients: rhubarb, strawberries, white sugar, butter, egg, flour, pie shell, brown sugar ; preparation:Place rhubarb in a bowl and cover with boiling water for about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, with a mixer, mix sugar, egg, butter and flour until smooth. Strain rhubarb well. With wooden spoon, add strawberries and rhubarb to batter and mix. Pour into uncooked pie shell. Mix topping ingredients with a fork, and sprinkle over uncooked pie. Bake at 375 for 50 minutes or until set. Top with whipped cream if desired. ; name: german home fried potatoes ; ingredients: red potatoes, red onion, garlic clove, canola oil, olive oil, chives, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cook potatoes in their jackets, until done. Cool slightly and peel. Cut into thin slices while still warm. In a non-stick skillet, add a mixture of canola oil and olive oil- just enough to coat the bottom of pan. Heat oil and add potato slices, garlic, and onion. Season with salt and pepper. Saute until golden brown. Sprinkle liberally with chopped chives or parsley. ; name: happy hour mushrooms ; ingredients: mushrooms, butter, garlic, monterey jack cheese, dry white wine, soy sauce, fine cracker crumb ; preparation:

name: shrimp provencal over rice ; ingredients: olive oil, large shrimp, mushroom, garlic cloves, tomatoes, lemon juice, salt, pepper, fresh parsley, cooked rice ; preparation:In 12-inch skillet over medium heat, in 2 tablespoons hot oil, cook shrimp stirring frequently, until shrimp turn pink, about 3 minutes. Remove from pan and set aside. In same skillet, in remaining tablespoon of hot oil, add mushrooms and garlic and cook until mushrooms are tender, about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add tomatoes, lemon juice, salt, and pepper and cook 3 minutes more. Return shrimp to skillet and heat through. Sprinkle with parsley and serve over rice. ; name: syrian feta spread ; ingredients: feta cheese, ricotta cheese, butter, garlic clove, dill, parsley, scallion, lemon juice ; preparation:Process feta until it is crumbly. Add garlic, dill, parsley, scallions, lemon juice and process until almost smooth. By hand, blend in the ricotta and butter. Mix well. Can be served at room temperature or chilled. ; name: cilantro hummus with crispy garlic pita ; ingredients: garlic cloves, red chilies, fresh cilantro, garbanzo beans, lime, juice of, olive oil, salt and pepper, fresh parsley, pita breads ; preparation:Place the garlic, chillies and cilantro in a food processor and whizz until finely chopped. Add the garbanzos and whizz until well blended. With the motor running, squeeze in the lime juice and drizzle in the olive oil to make a fairly coarse paste. Season well to taste and spoon into a serving bowl. Meanwhile, mix together the olive oil, garlic and parsley and season. Heat one side of the pita breads under a hot broiler for about 1 minute until well browned. Turn over the bread, then use a knife to slash the softer surface 4-5 times without cutting through the bread. Brush with the herb and oil mixture and return to the broiler until bubbling and toasted. When cool, break into pieces and serve with the hummus. ; name: fresh tomato sandwiches saturday lunch on longmeadow farm ; ingredients: fresh tomatoes, white onion, butter, white bread, fresh chives ; preparation:Slice onions, tomatoes, and chives if using. Spread butter on 4 slices of bread. Top this bread with onions, tomatoes, and chives in this order. Top with other 4 slices, and lightly but firmly pressed top bread onto tomato topped bread. Slice in half, on the diagonal, and eat immediately. Serve with fresh iced tea or lemonade. Sit under a tree and let the warm breezes lull you into total enjoyment. ; name: hamburger casserole ; ingredients: hamburger, green beans, onion, sharp cheddar cheese, egg, tomato soup, potatoes ; preparation:Cook and mash potatoes, add egg to potatoes while mashing. Set aside. Brown hamburger and onion, drain. Add beans and soup, stir well. Place in a greased casserole dish. Put mashed potatoes on top of meat mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 350 for 35-40 minutes. ; name: chris grilled jalapeno wraps ; ingredients: jalapenos, turkey bacon, cream cheese, cheddar cheese ; preparation:

name: no cook tabbouleh ; ingredients: quick-cooking couscous, olive oil, lemon juice, cilantro, of fresh mint, tomatoes, bell pepper, onion, salt and pepper ; preparation:Stir together the couscous, olive oil and lemon juice in a very large bowl. Let it rest at room temperature to soften and plump-en-up to an a texture like finely chopped nuts. Add the remaining ingredients and stir well. Add more lemon juice to taste. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours or so. ; name: jamaican pepper shrimp ; ingredients: jumbo shrimp, lime, garlic cloves, scotch bonnet pepper, thyme, butter, salt, canola oil, scallion ; preparation:Squeeze of lime over shrimp and rinse. Heat canola oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add thyme and pepper, heat for 1 minute. Add garlic and shrimp, stir. Cook for 3 minutes then turn shrimp. Add butter and salt, cook for an additional 2 minute. Squeeze the other half of lime over the shrimp, remove from heat. Sprinkle with scallion to garnish. ; name: chicken salad burritos ; ingredients: cooked chicken, cucumber, cheddar cheese, ranch dressing, 7-inch flour tortillas, lettuce ; preparation:Drain canned chicken, put inot bowl and break up with fork. Chop cucumber and add to meat. Stir in cheese and dressing. Mix well. Spoon one-forth of the mixture on edge of tortilla, top with one forth of the lettuce. Fold the edge nearest the filling over the filling till it is covered. Then roll up the tortillia. Repeat to make three more burritos. ; name: pork chops sliven style ; ingredients: pork chops, carrots, salt and black pepper, onion, white wine, garlic cloves, mushrooms, tomatoes, celery ribs ; preparation:Season the chops with salt and pepper and brown in a frying pan. Remove from pan and set aside. In the same pan, cook the rest of the ingredients for 5-10 minutes. Arrange the chops in an oven dish, cover with the vegetable mixture and cook in an preheated oven for about 20 minutes.
