name: imitation crab stir fry ; ingredients: onion, raw cauliflower, fresh garlic cloves, red cabbage, snow peas, tomatoes, imitation crabmeat, olive oil, soy sauce, ginger ; preparation:Prepare all fresh veggies and place into individual bowls. Sprinkle a pinch of ground ginger and salt on onions, cauliflower, cabbage, snow peas and tomatoes. Coat bottom of frying pan or wok with olive oil. When oil is hot add onions and sear for 5 minutes on high. Add garlic, cabbage, snow peas and cauliflower. Stir all ingredients together and add soy sauce to taste. Decrease heat and cover pan. Let simmer for about 15 minutes. Add imitation crab, toss ingredients to mix and cover. Simmer for an additional 15 minutes. Serve as is or over a bed of white rice. ; name: cool peppermint pattie pie ; ingredients: peppermint patties, milk, frozen non-dairy topping, chocolate wafer pie crust ; preparation:Place peppermint patties in a microwave-safe bowl and add milk. Microwave high 30-45 seconds. Stir until candy is melted and mixture is smooth. Cool 5 minutes. Fold in non-dairy whipped topping. Spread into crust. Cover and place in freezer for at least and hour. ; name: cranberry scones ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, ground cloves, butter, whipping cream, fresh cranberries ; preparation:Combine first 5 ingredients. Cut in butter with pastry blender until mixture is crumbly. Reserve 1 tbsp whipping cream. Add remaining whipping cream and chopped cranberries to dry ingredients, stirring just until dry ingredients are moist. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead 5- 6 times. Shape into an 8-inch circle. Cut into 8 wedges, and place on a lightly greased baking sheet. Prick wedges with a fork 3- 4 times, and brush with reserved 1 tbsp whipping cream. Bake at 425 for 18 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve warm with whipped cream drizzled on top. ; name: french toast fondue ; ingredients: sugar, whole milk, eggs, unsalted butter, cinnamon, french bread, apricot jam, orange juice ; preparation:Heat oven to 375f in a bowl, whisk together sugar, milk, eggs, 3 tablespoons butter and cinnamon. Gently toss bread in mixture until coated well. Spread remaining butter on a rimmed nonstick baking sheet. Add bread cubes in a single layer and bake 12 to 15 minutes. Use a spatula to remove baked cubes from pan and serve immediately with syrup, dipping sauce and toppings. To make apricot dipping sauce, combine jam and orange juice and microwave 1 minute. Stir until smooth. ; name: campfire onions ; ingredients: sweet onions, butter, honey, salt, pepper, garlic salt ; preparation:Cut each onion into 12 wedges. Divide between eight pieces of double-layered heavy-duty foil. Top onions with butter, honey and seasonings. Fold foil to seal packets tightly. Grill, covered, over medium-hot heat for 20 minutes or until onions are tender, turning once. ; name: mimi s pound cake ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, cake flour, vanilla ; preparation:

name: tomato topper for burgers ; ingredients: red onion, tomatoes, olive oil, lemon juice, fresh basil, salt and pepper ; preparation:Soak onions in ice water for 10 to 15 minutes. Drain well. Combine in dish with tomatoes. In small bowl, blend dressing ingredients with wire whisk. Pour over sliced tomatoes and red onions, and toss. ; name: chicken in many mustards marinade for the grill ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, apple juice, dijon mustard, whole grain mustard, sweet-hot mustard, white wine vinegar, vegetable oil, lemon juice, shallot ; preparation:Combine apple juice, mustards, vinegar, oil, lemon juice and shallot in a medium bowl and mix well. Place chicken in a single layer in a shallow non-reactive pan. Pour marinade over, cover and refrigerate 8 hours or overnight. To cook, drain chicken, reserving marinade. Place chicken over medium-hot coals and grill 6-7 minutes per side, until internal temperature is 165 degrees fahrenheit. While chicken is grilling, place reserved marinade in a saucepan over medium heat and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 8 minutes, or until chicken has finished cooking. Spoon sauce over chicken and serve. ; name: mushrooms with sour cream ; ingredients: fresh mushrooms, butter, all-purpose flour, sour cream, salt, pepper, dill weed ; preparation:Cook and stir mushrooms in butter for 3 minutes. Stir in flour. Cook and stir for 1 minute. Stir in sour cream, salt and pepper. Heat, stirring occasionally, just until hot. Sprinkle with dill weed. ; name: jana s church enchiladas ; ingredients: flour tortillas, ground beef, onion, taco seasoning, cream of chicken soup, milk, green chilies, velveeta cheese, green onion dip ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Brown ground beef and onion. After meat is finished, add taco seasoning. In a saucepan, combine soup, milk, green chilies, velveeta and onion dip. Heat on low till creamy. Fill tortillas with spoonful of meat, roll and put seamside down. Pour creamy mixture over tortillas in a 9x13 pan. Cook at 350 for 20-30 minutes. ; name: ambrosia sweet potatoes ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, orange, lemon, crushed pineapple, brown sugar, butter, shredded coconut, maraschino cherry ; preparation:Place sweet potatoes in a baking dish. Slice orange and lemon into thin slices. Alternate layering slices on top of sweet potatoes. Combine drained pineapple, brown sugar and melted butter. Pour mixture over sweet potatoes. Sprinkle with shredded coconut. Decorate with cherries. Bake in a 350f oven for 30 minutes. ; name: lovely lemon fondue ; ingredients: sugar, cornstarch, water, butter, lemon juice, lemon rind, strawberry, shortbread cookie, cake, meringue ; preparation:

name: cooked potato or pasta salad dressing ; ingredients: sugar, flour, salt, ground mustard, eggs, water, half-and-half, white vinegar, black pepper, mayonnaise ; preparation:In a medium saucepan mix all ingredients together. Bring to a light boil, whisking constantly until thickened. Remove from heat, cool slightly then whisk in mayo. Season with salt and pepper. Cool completely before adding to you potato or pasta salad. ; name: pineapple cheese ball or spread ; ingredients: cream cheese, crushed pineapple, pecans, green pepper, onions, salt ; preparation:Mix cream cheese and add pineapple, pecans, green pepper, onion and salt. Mix and form into ball. Refrigerate overnight. Serve with crackers. Will not form ball, but makes a creamy spread. ; name: comforting cold and flu tea ; ingredients: water, fresh ginger, sage leaves, rosemary sprigs, fresh thyme sprigs, lemon, juice of, cinnamon sticks, honey ; preparation:Place all ingredients in a large pot. Bring to a boil. Turn off heat and steep for about 10 minutes. Strain into a pitcher. Stir in honey while still warm. Store pitcher in refrigerator. Reheat one cup at a time in the microwave, adding more honey to taste, if desired. Drink twice a day, breathing steam through nose, for maximum benefit. ; name: english muffin bread ; ingredients: flour, yeast, sugar, baking soda, milk, water, salt, cornmeal ; preparation:Combine flour, yeast, sugar, salt and soda in a large bowl. Heat together milk and water until very warm. Add dry ingredients and beat well. Stir in remaining flour to make a stiff batter. Spoon into 2 loaf pans that have been greased and sprinkled with cornmeal. Sprinkle cornmeal on top. Cover and let stand in warm place for 45 minutes. Bake at 400 for 25 minutes. ; name: green pea and potato soup ; ingredients: frozen peas, potatoes, chicken stock, water, olive oil, onion, garlic, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat oil in a large saucepan, add onion and garlic, cook, stirring until the onion is soft. Pour the chicken stock into the saucepan with the onion and garlic and bring to the boil. Add the potatoes, boil uncovered for 5 minutes. Stir in the peas, bring to the boil and cook for a further 5 minutes or until the chopped potatoes are tender. Blend potato and pea mixture in batches until smooth. Serve soup with sprinkled with parmesan cheese. ; name: red cabbage salad with apples raisins honey dressing ; ingredients: red cabbage, apple juice, salt, apples, golden raisin, cider vinegar, honey, oil ; preparation:

name: potato and cucumber soup ; ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, potato, chicken broth, water, cucumber, heavy cream, ear of corn, fresh parsley, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat and cook onions until they begin to soften, about 5 minutes. Add potatoes, chicken broth, and water. Cover and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes. Working in batches, puree potato mixture with cucumbers and return to pot. Stir in cream. Meanwhile, heat a heavy skillet over medium high heat, and add the corn and cook until golden. Scrape corn from cob and add to soup. Stir in parsley, salt and pepper. If desired, chill soup in refrigerator before serving. ; name: carrot potato and onion gratin ; ingredients: butter, russet potatoes, onions, carrot, salt, fresh ground black pepper, chicken stock, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350f generously butter a medium-size gratin dish. Make a layer of one-third of the potato slices in the bottom of the prepared gratin dish. Add a layer of half the onions and then half the carrots. Dot with 2 tablespoons of the butter and season well with salt and pepper. Repeat the layers and finish with the remaining one-third of the potato slices. Dot with the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter and season with salt and pepper. Pour in the stock. Cover with aluminum foil and bake until the vegetables are tender, about 45 minutes. Uncover and sprinkle with the cheese. Bake 10 minutes longer, until the cheese is golden brown. Serve very hot. Makes 6 to 8 servings. ; name: dandelion honey ; ingredients: dandelion flowers, water, lemons, vanilla bean, granulated sugar ; preparation:Pick dandelion flowers during the daylight while in full bloom, remove petals, then measure petals only. Discard the green stem parts. Place petals in a heavy saucepan along with the water, lemon slices, and vanilla bean. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and let steep for 6 hours. Strain dandelion tea through cheesecloth and discard solids. Place remaining liquid in a heavy saucepan and bring to a low boil. Gradually add sugar while stirring until sugar is dissolved. Lower heat and let simmer to desired syrupy thickness. Pour into jars and enjoy. ; name: hot salami sandwiches ; ingredients: hamburger buns, hard salami, american cheese, onions, barbecue sauce ; preparation:Layer bottom of hamburger buns with salami, cheese, onion. Spread barbecue sauce on top half of bun, and cover rest of sandwich. Wrap each sandwich in aluminum foil and bake in preheated 400 degree oven until cheese melts. About 5-10 minutes. May wrap sandwiches in paper toweling and microwave on half power until cheese melts, if desired. ; name: pizza with honey caramelized onions cheese and mushrooms ; ingredients: olive oil, onions, honey, balsamic vinegar, fresh mushrooms, boboli pizza crusts, feta cheese, dried thyme ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Heat olive oil over medium heat, add onions and saute until tender, about 10 minutes. Add honey and vinegar, reduce heat and saute until onions are golden brown, about another 8 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Place pizza crust on pizza stone or baking sheet, sprinkle with cheese and thyme. Top this with onion mixture, then mushrooms. Cook for about 15 minutes or until cheese is melted. ; name: turnip cream with caramelized onions ; ingredients: onions, butter, turnips, milk, french baguettes, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: gooey rolls ; ingredients: sugar, cinnamon, large marshmallows, margarine, crescent rolls ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Coat 8 muffin cups with pam. Mix sugar and cinnamon in small bowl. Dip each marshmallow in melted margarine and roll in sugar mix. Separate dough into triangles. Wrap one triangle around each marshmallow and pinch dough together. Place each one in a muffin cup. Drizzle extra margarine over rolls. Bake 8-12 minutes. ; name: bettyo s rigatoni ala vodka ; ingredients: scallions, garlic clove, butter, vodka, half-and-half, tomato sauce, pecorino romano cheese, basil, garlic powder ; preparation:In a skillet saute butter and finely chopped garlic and scallions until tender. Remove from heat. Ignite and let vodka cook down,. In a sauce pot add tomato sauce, half and half, pecarino romano, basil, and garlic powder. Then add vodka and chopped scallion and garlic butter mixture into the sauce. Cook over medium heat, stirring. Pour over cooked rigatoni. Garnish with fresh parsley. I recommend pouring the sauce over each individual dish it goes further. ; name: lehmonade ; ingredients: lemons, brown sugar, water, white sugar, ice ; preparation:Pour water into a pot. Squeeze the halved lemons into the water. Drop the already-squeezed lemons into the pot. Put in brown sugar and mix well. Start boiling the mixture. Boil for about 2 minutes. Leave to cool. Add white sugar. Serve over ice. ; name: spanish chicken with vegetables and olives pollo a la chilindr ; ingredients: broiler-fryer chickens, butter, tomatoes, green peppers, onions, garlic clove, smoked ham, pitted ripe olives, salt, pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375. Truss your chicken. Brush with butter salt and pepper. Place chicken breast up in dutch oven. Cook, uncovered until thighs test done. Add rest of ingredients, cover and bake until veggies are tender., about 30 minutes. Remove chicken to a serving platter, surround with vegetables. Serve with rice. ; name: easiest and cheesiest stove top macaroni and cheese ; ingredients: water, butter, salt, elbow macaroni, evaporated milk, velveeta cheese ; preparation:Bring water, butter and salt to rolling boil. Add macaroni. Cook over medium heat for 8 to 10 minutes or until water is cooked down a bit and pasta is ready. Take off heat. Do not drain. Add evaporated milk and velveeta cheese. Stir, then cover pot and allow to sit for a few minutes until cheese is melted. Uncover and stir again. If too dry, add more evaporated milk. Serve. ; name: pumpkin shaped cheese ball ; ingredients: cheddar cheese, cream cheese, solid-pack pumpkin, pineapple preserves, ground allspice, ground nutmeg, pretzel stick, cracker ; preparation:

name: georgia hash ; ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, corned beef, frozen hash browns, cajun seasoning ; preparation:In electric frying pan or large skillet saute onions and peppers until onions soften. Add corned beef. Continue to cook until cubes fall apart. Add frozen hash browns. Add seasoning if desired. Cook, stirring often until potatoes are done and start to brown. ; name: cajun spiced pecans ; ingredients: unsalted butter, pecan halves, light brown sugar, paprika, chili powder, ground cumin, cider vinegar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. In a large skillet over medium heat melt butter. Add the pecans - saute until lightly browned, about 3 minutes. Add the brown sugar and cook until caramelized. Stir in the paprika, chile powder and cumin. Add the vinegar and cook until all the liquid has evaporated. Season with salt. Spread the pecans on a cookie sheet and bake in an oven until crisp, about 3 to 5 minutes. ; name: spinach monterey jack dip ; ingredients: frozen chopped spinach, cream cheese, monterey jack pepper cheese, garlic ; preparation:Prepare spinach according to package directions. I usually cook it in the microwave about 3-4 minutes. Drain or blot with paper towels to absorb some of the excess water. Add monterey jack cheese, cream cheese and garlic. Continue cooking until cheese is melted. Serve with fritos scoops. ; name: christmas cheese ball ; ingredients: cream cheese, sharp cheddar cheese, onion, pimiento, green pepper, worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, pecans, cracker ; preparation:Combine the first seven ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Shape into 2 balls. Roll in the pecans. Cover and chill. Remove from refrigerator 15 minutes before serving. Serve with crackers. ; name: sugar crusted almond pastries ; ingredients: refrigerated crescent dinner rolls, butter, almonds, sugar ; preparation:Heat oven to 375 degrees f. Unroll dough into large rectangle on ungreased baking sheet. Seal perforations. Melt butter in saucepan, cooking and stirring until light golden brown. Add almonds and sugar. Stirring to coat. Spoon and spread this mixture evenly over the dough. Bake for 12 to 16 minutes until crust is deep golden brown. Cool 10 to 15 minutes. Cut into triangles and serve. ; name: braised fennel ; ingredients: fennel bulbs, butter, garlic clove, thyme, salt & freshly ground black pepper, dry white wine, chicken stock ; preparation:

name: gluten free cocoa brownies ; ingredients: butter, cocoa powder, sugar, eggs, vanilla, gluten-free flour, salt, xanthan gum ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees and grease an 88x2 pan or 12 muffin tins. Melt butter in a sauce pan or in a 1 quart container in the microwave. Remove from heat. Add cocoa until blended, then add sugar and mix well. Add eggs, one at a time. Stir in vanilla, flour, salt & xanthan gum do not overmix. Bake 25-30 minutes. Cool and serve. ; name: chipotle lime chicken wings ; ingredients: chicken wings, chipotle barbecue sauce, honey, lime, zest of, lime juice, flour, cornstarch, seasoning salt ; preparation:Combine barbecue sauce, honey, lime juice and zest and set aside. Combine flour, corn starch and seasoning salt in a bowl. Dust each wing with flour mixture and set aside on wax or parchment paper. Heat deep fryer or potted oil to 325 - 350f. Dust a few wings at a time- second time and fry for 7 - 8 minutes - let cool on wire rack. When all the wings have been fried - heat 2 -tablespoons of butter in a deep pan. Add the sauce mixture and combine well with the butter. Add the wings and mix to make sure each wing is completely saturated with sauce & rewarmed. Serve --. ; name: cotter s kettle ; ingredients: chicken stock, carrots, leek, rutabagas, bratwursts, salt and pepper ; preparation:Bring the vegetables to a boil in chicken stock. Reduce heat to simmer and cook for 15 to 20 minutes or until vegetables are fork tender. Remove the skin from sausage, cut in thick slices, and add to vegetables. Adjust salt and pepper to taste and simmer covered for a few minutes. Serve with coarse grain mustard, dark rye bread and boiled potatoes. ; name: southern living mexican casserole ; ingredients: ground chuck, onions, cream of chicken soup, tomatoes and green chilies, ranch style beans, corn tortillas, processed cheese ; preparation:Cook gound chuck and diced onion in a dutch oven, stirring until meat crumbles and is no longer pink. Drain meat mixture, and return to dutch oven. Stir in chicken soup, diced tomato and green chiles, and beans. Layer half of the tortillas evenly into 2 lightly greased 13 x 9 inch baking dishes. Top each with one-fourth of meat mixture and one-fourth of cheese cubes. Repeat layers with remaining tortillas, meat mixture, and cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until cheese is melted. ; name: barefoot contessa s challah french toast ; ingredients: challah, whole milk, eggs, salt, honey, orange zest, vanilla, butter, oil ; preparation:In a shallow dish large enough to hold three slices of challah side by side, whisk eggs and milk. Add orange zest, honey and vanilla. Add salt. Place three slices of the bread in the egg mixture and let soak about three minutes each side. Meanwhile melt one tbsp of butter and oil each in a large frying pan. Transfer challah to pan and cook 3 minutes on each side or until nicely browned. Add a little more butter for each round of bread. If you are making the other recipes transfer french toast to oven until rest of meal is complete. ; name: basic potato salad ; ingredients: baking potatoes, eggs, salad dressing, onion, sweet gherkins, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: glazed crackers ; ingredients: butter, sugar, vanilla extract, pecans, crackers, semi-sweet chocolate chips, white chocolate chips ; preparation:Arrange crackers on two baking sheets. In a small saucepan over medium heat on stovetop, combine butter and sugar. Bring to a boil and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in vanilla and chopped pecans. Spoon pecan mixture over crackers. Bake at 325 degrees for 6 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle chocolate chips over crackers. Return to oven and bake for 2 minutes more, or until chocolate chips are melted. Remove from oven and let cool briefly. Using a spatula, transfer crackers to a serving plate or an airtight container. ; name: garlic lover s shrimp ; ingredients: garlic cloves, extra virgin olive oil, butter, crushed red pepper flakes, large shrimp, coarse salt, cracked black pepper, toothpick ; preparation:Process garlic in food processor to finely chop. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add oil and butter. Add garlic and crushed pepper flakes to oil and butter. Season shrimp with salt and toss to coat. Add shrimp to the pan and cook, stirring frequently, until pink and heads curl to tails. Add black pepper, to your taste. Serve immediately. ; name: chorizo chowder ; ingredients: butter, onion, garlic cloves, floury potatoes, leek, cayenne, vegetable stock, chorizo sausages, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Heat the butter in a large pan and cook the onion, garlic and potatoes for 5 minutes until lightly golden. Add the leek and cayenne and cook for a further 1 minute. Add the stock, bring to the boil and simmer for 20 minutes until the potatoes are very soft and beginning to break up into the soup. Using a potato masher, roughly mash the potatoes into the soup. Stir in the chorizo and simmer gently for 5 minutes until the orange coloured oil from the chorizo rises to the surface of the soup. Check the seasoning, ladle into bowls and garnish with a sprig of flat leaf parsley. Serve with lots of crusty bread for mopping up. ; name: best of all macaroni cheese ; ingredients: macaroni, egg, small curd cottage cheese, sour cream, cheese, salt and pepper, basil ; preparation:Combine egg, cottage cheese, sour cream, cheese, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Add cooked pasta and mix together. Place in any casserole dish. Cook at 350 degrees for a half an hour. Sprinkle with basil for extra flavor. ; name: french canadian tourtiere i ; ingredients: ground pork, onions, salt, garlic cloves, allspice, pepper, boiling water, potatoes, pie crusts ; preparation:Combine pork, onion, seasonings and the boiling water. Simmer uncovered stirring occasionally until the meat is cooked. Cool and skim off any fat. Stir in the potatoes. Line pie plate with a pie crust. Fill with the cooked mixture. Cover with second crust. Seal the pastry edges & cut vents. Bake 10 minutes at 230c then lower temp to 180c for 30 minutes or until golden. ; name: basic omelet ; ingredients: eggs, milk, salt, pepper ; preparation:

name: homemade eggnog ; ingredients: evaporated milk, water, powdered milk, sugar, egg yolks, egg whites, whiskey ; preparation:In large pot, heat up all ingredients except whiskey and eggs. Separate eggs. Return yellows to milk mixture. Beat egg whites with a little sugar to form peak. Return to milk mixture. Add whiskey to taste. ; name: cucumber cheese melt ; ingredients: cream cheese, blue cheese, multigrain bread, apricot fruit spread, cucumber, swiss cheese, cooking spray ; preparation:Mix cream cheese and blue cheese. Spread on 4 slices of bread. Spread 1 tablespoon of apricot fruit spread over cheese. Top each with 4 cucumber slices, a slice of swiss cheese and remaining bread slices. Spray a large skillet with cooking spray. Cook sandwiches over medium heat until golden on bottoms, about 5 minutes. Spray tops of sandwiches with cooking spray and brown on the other side. ; name: bbc cocktail baileys banana coco lopez frozen dessert drink ; ingredients: baileys irish cream, banana liqueur, coco lopez, ice, chocolate syrup ; preparation:In blender, combine all ingredients except the chocolate syrup. Blend until smooth. You can adjust amount of alcohol vs. Coco lopez & ice to suit your liking to make it more or less strong. Serve immediately in chilled martini glasses drizzled with the chocolate syrup. ; name: red onion borscht ; ingredients: butter, red onions, beets, red wine vinegar, flour, chicken broth, port wine, salt & freshly ground black pepper, sour cream, fresh chives ; preparation:Melt butter in a large pot, add onions, beets and vinegar. Cook vegetables over low heat, 25-30 minutes or until soft. Add flour, cook and stir 1-2 minutes until flour is incorporated. Remove pot from heat, gradually add broth while stirring. Return pot to stove, increase heat to medium high and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, simmer 10 minutes, add port and season with salt and pepper. Ladle into soup bowls and top with sour cream and chives. ; name: grilled eggplant with ricotta and tomato ; ingredients: eggplant, olive oil, cherry tomatoes, garlic cloves, capers, ricotta cheese, salt & freshly ground black pepper, fresh basil leaves ; preparation:Heat the grill to high. Brush the eggplant slices with some of the oil. Grill the eggplant slices on both sides until brown, then place them in the bottom of a lightly greased, small shallow baking pan that will fit under the grill, and set aside. Over a medium heat, add the rest of the oil to a small saut pan, add the cherry tomatoes and garlic and saut for a couple of minutes, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes begin to soften. While still stirring, add the capers and leave the pan over the heat for an additional minute. Remove the pan from the heat. Cover the eggplant slices with the tomato, garlic and capers, season to taste and spoon the ricotta over the tomatoes. Place the baking pan under the grill until the ricotta starts to bubble. Scatter the basil leaves over the top and serve. ; name: taiwanese pork chops ; ingredients: pork chops, soy sauce, garlic, sugar, white wine, chinese five spice powder, vegetable oil, cornstarch ; preparation:

name: 1 potato 2 potato ; ingredients: mashed potatoes, sour cream, cheddar cheese, garlic cloves, salt and black pepper, frozen potato wedges, bacon, green onions, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Spray a quiche dish with nonstick cooking spray. Mix mashed potatoes, sour cream, cheddar cheese, and garlic in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Stir to blend. Spread mashed potato mixture evenly into the quiche dish. Arrange the frozen potato wedges in a spoke wheel fashion on top of the mashed potatoes. For curly fries, make a random pattern, breaking in half any large fries. Sprinkle with bacon bits, green onion and parmesan cheese. Bake for 25-30 minutes. Cut into wedges and serve. ; name: cranberry sauce with dried cherries ; ingredients: cranberries, dried cherries, shallot, red wine vinegar, fresh orange juice, orange zest, gingerroot, dark brown sugar ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in a medium saucepan and cook over medium heat intil cranberries pop. Reduce heat to low. Cook, stirring occasionally, until cranberries release their juices, about 15 minutes. If the cranbgerry sauce becomes too thick, add water until the desired consistency is reached. Transfer to a bowl to cool. ; name: light scalloped potatoes with cream cheese ; ingredients: red potatoes, onion, butter, flour, fat-free half-and-half, fat free cream cheese, salt, pepper ; preparation:Wash potatoes well and slice very thin. Melt butter in saucepan. Whisk in flour, salt and pepper. Mix in half and half and stir until hot and well blended. Mix in cream chesse, stir till melted. Stir in onions. Spray casserole with cooking spray. Layer potatoes and sauce in casserole, finishing with sauce. Bake at 350 for 1 hour 15 minutes. ; name: a different crock pot vegetable casserole ; ingredients: rice, zucchini, yellow squash, onion, green pepper, tomatoes, brown sugar, olive oil ; preparation:Spray crock pot with cooking spray. Layer ingredients in order as listed, except brown sugar and olive oil. Sprinkle brown sugar over all the vegetables. Drizzle olive oil over all. Cook 6 hours on low. ; name: chunky salmon chowder ; ingredients: salmon, cream-style corn, water, potatoes, evaporated milk, onion, dried dill weed, lemon pepper seasoning, salt, butter ; preparation:Melt butter in large saucepan over medium heat until hot. Stir in onions, stirring constantly for 2-3 minutes until tender. Stir in water, corn, potatoes, salt and milk, mix well. Bring to a boil. Simmer at reduced heat for 10 minutes. Add salmon and lemon-pepper seasoning, cook another 10 minutes. Stir in dill and serve. ; name: parsnip and herb crisps ; ingredients: parsnips, sunflower oil, salt, herbs ; preparation:

name: roasted apples with fig hazelnut stuffing ; ingredients: dried figs, hazelnuts, orange zest, allspice, granny smith apples, brown sugar, butter, fresh orange juice ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 180c. Combine the chopped figs, hazelnuts, orange zest and allspice. Using an apple corer, remove the apple cores. Place the apples in a baking dish and loosely press the fig mixture into the centre of the apples. Combine the sugar, butter and orange juice and drizzle it over the apples. Bake the apples for 25 minutes or until tender, then set aside for 10 minutes for the sauce to thicken slightly. Serve with the sauce spooned over the apples with cream or icecream. ; name: southern hospitality pie ; ingredients: pecans, coconut, butter, cream cheese, sweetened condensed milk, cool whip topping, graham cracker pie crust, caramel ice cream topping, ice cream topping ; preparation:Melt butter or margarine in skillet over low heat. Add pecans and coconut stirring constantly to brown. Cool. Mix cream cheese and sweetened condensed milk until smooth. Fold in non dairy whipped topping. Pour evenly into crust. Sprinkle with coconut and pecan mixture. Drizzle with the caramel and chocolate toppings. Cover and freeze until frozen hard. Remove from freezer 10 -15 min before serving. ; name: garlic lime chicken breasts ; ingredients: fresh lime juice, olive oil, garlic, salt, black pepper, chicken breast halves, lime wedge ; preparation:Whisk together lime juice, oil, garlic, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Add chicken, turning to coat. Marinate chicken, covered and refrigerated, turning once or twice, for at least 2 hours and up to 8 hours. Put a rack in the upper third of the oven and preheat to 400 degrees. Remove chicken from marinade and arrange skin side up, without crowding, in a shallow baking dish. Season with salt and pepper. Roast until just cooked through, 25 to 30 minutes. If chicken has a skin, turn oven to broil. Broil chicken about 2 inches from the heat until skin is crisp, about 2 minutes. Serve with lime wedges. ; name: chamomile pomegranate tea ; ingredients: chamomile tea bags, boiling water, pomegranate juice, splenda sugar substitute, mint sprig ; preparation:Place tea bags in a large heat-proof measuring cup or pitcher. Pour boiling water over tea bags. Steep 1 hour, or until cooled to room temperature. Remove and discard tea bags. Add pomegranate juice and splenda, stirring until it dissolves. Serve over ice. Garnish with mint sprigs. Makes 4, 1 cup servings. ; name: captain d s batter dipped fish ; ingredients: pollock fillets, flour, dry yeast, egg, beer, hot water, salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper ; preparation:In a bowl mix the yeast and beer. In another bowl beat together the egg, hot water and salt. Add the egg mixture to the beer. Slowly beat in the flour until batter is consistency of light pancake batter. Roll or dust fish with flour. Drop fish into batter and cover thoroughly. Fry in hot oil. Drain on baking rack or broiling pan. ; name: felicia s cheesecake ; ingredients: low fat cottage cheese, eggs, powdered milk, lemon juice, honey, vanilla, almond essence ; preparation:

name: mellow yellow jello salad ; ingredients: crushed pineapple, lemon jell-o gelatin, 7-up soda, pineapple juice, flour, butter, eggs, whipped topping ; preparation:Mix the pineapple, jello, and 7up. Pour into a 9x13 dish. Put into refrigerator to set. In saucepan, mix juice, flour, butter and eggs. Cook and stir, on med, bring to a boil. Boil for 1 minute. Allow to cool, while jello sets. Mix the cooled cooked mixture with the whipped topping. Spread over the jello. ; name: tofu steak ; ingredients: tofu, minced garlic cloves, plain flour, olive oil, salt and pepper ; preparation:Drain the tofu and wrap in kitchen paper. Place in a sieve with a weighted plate on top to remove as much liquid as possible, leave for 30 minutes. Slice into 4 and season with salt, pepper and minced garlic. Dust with the flour. Heat the oil in a pan to a high temperature add the tofu and turn when crispy. Serve. ; name: indian rice pudding ; ingredients: cooked long-grain rice, whole milk, heavy cream, coconut milk, sugar, ground cardamom, golden raisins, pistachios ; preparation:In a large nonstick saut pan over medium heat, combine cooked rice and whole milk. Heat until mixture begins to boil. Decrease heat to low and cook to a simmer, stirring frequently, until mixture begins to thicken, approximately 5 minutes. Increase heat to medium, add heavy cream, coconut milk, sugar, and cardamom. Continue to cook until mixture just begins to thicken again, approximately 5-10 minutes. Use a whisk to prevent the cardamom from clumping. Once mixture begins to thicken, remove from heat and stir in raisins and pistachios. Transfer the mixture to individual serving dishes or a glass bowl and place plastic wrap directly on the surface of the pudding. Serve chilled or at room temperature. I like my rice pudding a little sweet, so i also added a little bit more sugar than the 2 oz. Called for in the recipe to suit my personal taste. ; name: monti s roman bread ; ingredients: yeast, warm water, granulated sugar, flour, salt, onion, canola oil, dried rosemary ; preparation:In a warmed glass or metal bowl combine water, yeast and sugar. Completely dissolve yeast. Add flour, salt and onion, and knead until smooth. Place dough in an oiled bowl and let rise until it doubles in size. Remove from bowl and roll out to desired size brush oil on surface liberally and sprinkle with rosemary. Bake in hot oven approximately 15 to 20 minutes. Serve hot. ; name: pesto tuna salad sandwiches ; ingredients: albacore tuna, pesto sauce, red onions, celery, black olives, mayonnaise, salt, pepper ; preparation:Mix tuna and mayo. Add pesto. Add remaining ingredients. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve on a good quality bread. Of course you can adjust the amount of ingredients to your preference. ; name: cool cannoli pudding ; ingredients: ricotta cheese, semisweet mini chocolate chips, maraschino cherry, pecans, sugar, whipping cream ; preparation:

name: spiced broccoli and tomatoes ; ingredients: fresh broccoli, tomatoes, gingerroot, red pepper, salt and pepper ; preparation:Separate the broccoli heads into small florets. Peel and slice the stems. Blanch the florets and stems in boiling salted water 3-4 minutes until crisp-tender. Drain thoroughly and set aside. Cut tomatoes lengthwise into eighths. Set aside. Stir-fry ginger for a few seconds. Add broccoli, tomatoes, and red pepper. Stir fry 2-3 minutes or till vegetables are heated through. Add 1-2 tbsp water and continue to stir fry for about 30 seconds. Serve hot, room temperature, or chilled. ; name: beans and burger hillbilly chili ; ingredients: lean ground beef, baked beans, onion, barbecue sauce ; preparation:Brown beef in a large high-sided skillet or soup pot. Drain the fat from the beef and discard. Return the cooked beef to the pot and add the onion, beans, and barbecue sauce. Cook for about 30 minutes over medium heat, stirring occaisionally. Serve with corn muffins, fried potatoes, hot sauce, or diced raw onion. ; name: melon sorbet ; ingredients: melon, sugar, white wine, mint sprig ; preparation:Puree chopped melon in blender. Set aside. Combine the sugar and wine in a saucepan and simmer till sugar is dissolved. Mix in melon puree. Pour into loaf pan and freeze 4 hours till hard. Puree again for 30 minutes before serving. Return to freezer till time to serve. Garnish and serve. ; name: chocolate walnut pie ; ingredients: semisweet chocolate, 9 inch pie shell, eggs, light corn syrup, sugar, butter, vanilla, walnuts, whipped cream ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350f. Melt the chocolate in the microwave or in a heavy pot on low heat. Pour it evenly into the unbaked pie shell. In a large bowl, mix the eggs, corn syrup, sugar, butter, and vanilla well. Stir in the walnuts. Pour the mixture into the chocolate-lined pie shell and bake until the filling is set, 45 to 50 minutes. Remove to a rack and let cool. The pie may be made ahead several days, or frozen for up to 3 months. Serve with whipped cream if desired. ; name: cabbage potato and smoked sausage skillet ; ingredients: head of cabbage, onion, smoked sausage, potatoes, chicken broth, seasoning salt, paprika, pepper ; preparation:Heat pan and add onion, smoked sausage, and potatoes. Season with the seasoned salt lightly, and add the paprika. Cook and stir over medium heat until potatoes are cooked about halfway through. Next add the chopped cabbage and 1 cup of chicken broth. Cook, stirring occasionally until cabbage is crisp-tender and most of the liquid evaporates. ; name: cranberry port sauce ; ingredients: ruby port, cinnamon stick, dried cranberries, fresh cranberries, water, sugar ; preparation:

name: buffalo style chicken nachos recipe ; ingredients: cooked chicken, hot sauce, butter, tortilla chips, cheddar cheese, green onions, ranch dressing ; preparation:In a bowl, toss chicken with hot sauce and butter. Layer chips, chicken mixture and cheese in baking dish. Sprinkle with green onions. Bake nachos at 350f for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Splash on more hot sauce to taste. Serve with ranch dressing on the side for dipping. ; name: saki shrimp kabobs ; ingredients: soy sauce, oil, sake, ground ginger, garlic, large shrimp, mixed mushrooms, onion, cherry tomatoes, rice ; preparation:Combine soy sauce, oil, saki, garlic and ginger. Marinate shrimp about 2 hours. If you like softer grilled veggies, microwave them first to your taste. Skewer shrimp with a combination of mushrooms, onions and tomatoes. Grill or broil 10 to 12 minutes, turning frequently. Serve over rice pilaf. ; name: soft serve vanilla ice cream ; ingredients: milk, vanilla instant pudding mix, sugar, cool whip, vanilla flavoring ; preparation:Place milk in electric mixing bowl. Make pudding according to directions on box. Add pudding & sugar to mixer, blend well. Add cool whip and vanilla to mixer, blend well. Pour mixture into 1 gallon ice cream maker. ; name: cipherbabe s chicken rotini ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken thighs, olive oil, rotini pasta, broccoli florets, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cut broccoli and then chicken into bit-size pieces. Heat oil in a skillet to medium heat. Saute chicken until done. Set aside. Boil rotini according to package directions. Add broccoli to boiling water during the last 2-4 minutes. Combine noodles, broccoli and chicken. Serve with cheese, salt and pepper. ; name: curried pork tenderloin ; ingredients: pork tenderloin, brown sugar, curry powder, dry mustard, hungarian paprika, salt, pepper ; preparation:Trim fat from pork. Mix sugar and spices in a small bowl. Rub pork with spice mixture. Place pork on a broiler pan coated with cooking spray. Insert a meat thermometer in the thickest part. Bake at 425 degrees for about 25-35 minutes, or until the thermometer registers 160 degrees. Let stand 5 minutes before slicing. Serve with mango chutney. ; name: cornmeal jambuster muffins ; ingredients: cornmeal, buttermilk, flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, eggs, margarine, jam ; preparation:

name: cheesy beef noodles ; ingredients: ground beef, tomato sauce, taco seasoning, sharp cheddar cheese, egg noodles ; preparation:Brown and drain ground beef. Cook and drain noodles. Mix ground beef, tomato sauce and taco seasoning. Spread noodles in the bottom of a 9x13 pan. Spread beef mixture over noodles. Mix slightly. Cover with cheese. Bake 350 for about 20 minutes until heated though and cheese is melted. ; name: microwave spiced nuts ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, nutmeg, cinnamon, salt, water, nuts ; preparation:Melt butter in 3 qt microwave bowl on high, approx 30 seconds. Stir in sugar, spices, salt, water. Microwave on high 1 minute. Stir in nuts to coat. Microwave 4-5 minutes more, stirring every minute. Pour onto parchment paper and separate nuts. Cool completely. ; name: hungarian cheese spread liptauer ; ingredients: cream cheese, cottage cheese, capers, caraway seed, dry mustard, paprika ; preparation:Cream together all ingredients. Place into a bowl or pretty mold covered with plastic wrap. Cover top of cheese with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours overnight is best. Unmold on to a serving plate and surround with rye bread squares, fresh veggies, or crackers. ; name: split pea and zucchini soup ; ingredients: split peas, onion, vegetable oil, zucchini, water, vegetable bouillon granules, turmeric, pepper, salt ; preparation:Soak the split pea overnight in cold water, or at least 6 hours. Cook the onion in the oil until soft. Add the zucchini to the pan stirring for 2-3 minutes. Add the water, split pea, veg bouillon, tumeric, salt and pepper and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat, then cover and simmer for 30-40 minutes, or until the split peas are tender. ; name: jalapeo cheese and smoked paprika bread bread machine ; ingredients: water, bread flour, jalapeno cheddar cheese, smoked paprika, garlic clove, sugar, salt, active dry yeast ; preparation:Place ingredients in bread machine according to your machines directions. Select setting for white bread. Select setting for crust type. Select rapid for faster cooking. Hit start. Enjoy. ; name: ting a lings ; ingredients: whole wheat cereal, peanuts, butterscotch chips, chocolate chips ; preparation:

name: portabella burgers with aioli ; ingredients: portabella mushrooms, gouda cheese, olive oil, garlic cloves, hamburger buns, light mayonnaise, italian seasoning, dijon mustard, dill weed ; preparation:First make the aioli sauce. Just add all the aioli ingredients and whisk together. Chill for approximately 20 minutes. Then lightly clean the portobello mushrooms and remove the stems. Mix the olive oil and garlic and brush all over mushrooms. Broil mushrooms for 3-5 minutes with rib side down. Turn over and top with cheese. Broil an additional 3 minutes. Place on hamburger bun and top with aloe or anything you would prefer. Put on a bib as these burgers are extremely juicy. And enjoy. ; name: mulled pomegranate and red wine punch slow cooker ; ingredients: pomegranate juice, red wine, cinnamon sticks, cardamom pods, honey ; preparation:Stir together all ingredients in a 4 to 6 quart slow cooker. Cover. Cook until very hot, about 1 hour on high or 2 hours on low. Once hot keep warm on low heat up to 4 hours. A serving is 1 cup. ; name: outrageously good broiled shrimp ; ingredients: shrimp, butter, garlic salt, unseasoned breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, dried parsley ; preparation:Butterfly shrimp and place on non-stick baking pan or line pan with aluminum foil for easier cleanup. Brush shrimp with melted butter. Sprinkle lightly with garlic salt. Mix together bread crumbs, parmesan cheese and parsley. Sprinkle lightly over shrimp. Drizzle lightly with additional melted butter. Broil until light brown. ; name: easy au gratin s ; ingredients: half-and-half cream, milk, salt, garlic powder, potatoes, pepper, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Bring cream, milk, salt and garlic powder to a boil. Add potatoes. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes, until potatoes are tender. Remove from heat. Stir in pepper. Pour into greased casserole dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake, uncovered, at 400 for about 5 minutes, until cheese is melted. ; name: greek fried cheese sandwich ; ingredients: feta cheese, butter, pita bread round, cucumber, diced tomato, lettuce, plain yogurt, garlic clove ; preparation:Blend yogurt and garlic together and set aside. Warm the pita. In a small skillet melt butter and saute feta just until heated through. Fill the pita with the diced cucumber, diced tomato and shredded lettuce. Add the feta cheese. Top with the yogurt. Makes 1 sandwich. ; name: chicken reuben sandwiches in a crock pot ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, sauerkraut, swiss cheese, thousand island dressing, pumpernickel bread ; preparation:

name: cheddar cheese potato broccoli soup ; ingredients: butter, onion, potatoes, boiling water, chicken bouillon cubes, frozen chopped broccoli, cheddar cheese ; preparation:In a 3 quart saucepan, melt butter and saute onions. Add potatoes, water, and bouillon cubes. Cover and bring to a boil then reduce heat to medium. Cook just until potatoes are tender. Meanwhile, place frozen broccoli and cheddar cheese in crock pot on low to start melting and thawing. Once the potatoes are done, using a hand blender, blend contents of saucepan to desired consistency and then pour into the crock pot. Heat on low until warmed. ; name: crock pot orange honey chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, orange juice, chicken broth, honey, dry mustard, teriyaki sauce, broccoli floret, cauliflower floret, carrot ; preparation:Place frozen breasts in crock pot. Mix juice, broth, honey, dry mustard and teryiaki sauce. Pour over chicken in crock. Cook on low for four hours. Add vegetables about one hour before serving. Place on top of chicken and do not stir. Cook the additional hour and serve over rice. ; name: best cream of tomato soup ; ingredients: tomato paste, tomatoes, potatoes, onions, beef broth, pepper, basil, flour, milk ; preparation:In a large pot cook the tomatoes, potatoes, onions, pepper, basil and tomato paste in the beef broth for 30 minutes or until very soft. Make the cream sauce while the vegetables are cooking. Over low heat add the flour to the milk and cook to thicken. Stir almost constantly. Working carefully and in small batches transfer the broth and vegetables to a blender and puree. This is hot do not burn yourself. Return to the pot and add the cream sauce. Stirring well. Adjust pepper and basil to taste. ; name: roasted snap peas with shallots ; ingredients: sugar snap pea, shallot, extra virgin olive oil, salt, pepper, cooked bacon ; preparation:Preheat oven to 475 degrees f. Toss peas, shallot, oil, salt and pepper in a medium bowl. Transfer to a baking sheet and spread in a single layer. Roast in the oven, stirring once halfway through, until the peas are tender and beginning to brown slightly, 12 to 14 minutes. Serve warm, sprinkled with bacon if desired. ; name: buffalo potato wedges ; ingredients: potatoes, olive oil, salt, pepper, garlic powder, butter, hot pepper sauce, bleu cheese salad dressing ; preparation:Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Arrange potato wedges on sheet and drizzle with olive oil sprinkle with salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes until tender. Remove pan from oven. Combine the hot sauce and butter in a microwave safe bowl and microwave on high until melted. Stir to combine. Drizzle mixture over potato wedges and return to oven for an additional 15 minutes. Serve with salad dressing for dipping. ; name: hoppin john soup ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, kielbasa, black-eyed peas, navy beans, brown rice, chicken broth, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, thyme ; preparation:

name: smoked salmon fettuccine ; ingredients: butter, sour cream, flour, scotch, milk, smoked salmon, parsley, pasta ; preparation:Melt butter and whisk in flour. Gradually add milk and sour cream. Season with salt and pepper. Stir until thick. Add scotch or bourbon, salmon and parsley. Cook pasta and drain. Combine salmon mixture with pasta. Sprinkle with paprika and parmesan cheese. ; name: chicken with cordon bleu gravy ; ingredients: breaded chicken patties, bacon, flour, milk, swiss cheese, salt, pepper, garlic powder ; preparation:Cook chicken patties according to package. Meanwhile in a small to medium saute pan, cook the bacon until crisp over medium heat. Remove the bacon from the pan and crumble. Pour enough of the fat in the pan out to leave 2 tablespoons in the pan. Whisk the flour into the bacon drippings and cook, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes. Whisk in the milk and bring to a simmer. Remove pan from heat and stir in the cheese, salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Pour over the sauce over cooked chicken patties, sprinkle on the crumbled bacon, and serve. ; name: no flour no sugar pancakes ; ingredients: yogurt, banana, old-fashioned oatmeal, walnuts, cinnamon ; preparation:Mix oatmeal with yogurt and set aside. Mash banana and chop the walnuts. Mix all ingredients together. Cook as you would other pancakes. Sprinkle with more cinnamon if desired, or top with applesauce. ; name: chili cheese popcorn ; ingredients: margarine, chili powder, garlic salt, onion powder, popcorn, parmesan cheese ; preparation:In a small saucepan over low heat, melt margarine. Add chili powder, garlic salt, and onion powder. Stir to mix well. In a large bowl, pour margarine mixture over popped popcorn. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and toss to coat well. ; name: swiss steak pressure cooker ; ingredients: round steaks, flour, salt and pepper, cooking oil, onions, green peppers, tomato juice ; preparation:Season flour with salt and pepper, pound flour into beef. Heat cooker and add oil, brown meat. Add remaining ingredients. Close cover securely. Place pressure regulator on vent pipe and cook 15 minutes at 15 pounds pressure. Let pressure drop of its own accord. ; name: favorite pumpkin pie ; ingredients: unbaked pastry shells, fresh pumpkin, milk, egg yolks, egg whites, salt, clove, cinnamon, sugar ; preparation:

name: polenta crackers ; ingredients: boiling water, polenta, mixed herbs, salt, soy margarine ; preparation:Bring water to a boil. Add polenta and herbs, and cook until creamy. Remove from heat, and add salt and margarine. On a well-oiled cookie sheet, spread out batter until thin. Score into pieces with a sharp knife. Bake in a 350 degree oven 30-55 minutes, until crispy and brown. Cool and serve. ; name: juanita roberts blueberry cake ; ingredients: sugar, egg, butter, flour, baking soda, salt, vanilla, sour milk, blueberries ; preparation:Cream sugar, egg and butter together until fluffy. Sift the flour, baking soda and salt together and gradually beat into the butter mixture along with the vanilla and milk. Beat cake batter until smooth. Stir in berries. Pour cake into a greased 9x13 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees fpr 45-60 minutes. ; name: poppy seed bundt cake ; ingredients: butter recipe cake mix, sour cream, sugar, oil, eggs, poppy seeds ; preparation:Mix all ingredients together. Pour into greased bundt pan. Bake at 335 degrees between 40 - 50 minutes. This is how this cake turns out best in my oven. Start looking at the cake at 35-40 minutes to see if it finished. It should be light to medium brown and mostly set when jiggled. ; name: low fat fried chicken strips ; ingredients: flour, dry breadcrumbs, garlic powder, dried thyme, salt, black pepper, chicken tenders, low-fat buttermilk, olive oil ; preparation:Combine the first 6 ingredients in a shallow dish, and set aside. Combine the chicken and the buttermilk in a plastic zip-top bag. Seal and marinate in refrigerator 30 minutes. Remove the chicken and discard the marinade. Pour olive oil in skillet to just barely covering the entire bottom of the pan. Heat oil over medium heat. Dredge a few chicken strips at a time in breadcrumb mixture, tossing to coat. Add chicken to the pan, and cook 3 minutes on each side or until done. ; name: coconut protein bars ; ingredients: sweetened flaked coconut, quick oats, whey protein powder, skim milk, fat-free sugar-free instant chocolate pudding mix ; preparation:Mix all ingredients together in a bowl. Spread half of mixture evenly in bottom of pan. Add layer of coconut. Spread 2nd half of mixture over coconut layer. Place in fridge overnight and cut into 8 individual squares. ; name: herb zucchini and lemon pasta ; ingredients: rotini pasta, light butter, red onion, zucchini, parmesan cheese, tomatoes, lemon juice, dried basil leaves, salt, pepper ; preparation:

name: bistro garden butternut squash soup ; ingredients: butternut squash, butter, leek, chicken stock, sugar, curry powder, ground cumin, salt, white pepper, whipping cream ; preparation:Cut squash in halves. Clean and roast at 450 degrees until very tender, about 1 hour. Scoop out flesh with spoon and set aside. In large soup pot, saute onions in 1 tablespoon butter over medium heat until tender. Add leek and squash and cook 5 minutes. Add chicken stock, sugar, curry powder, cumin, salt and white pepper to taste. Place soup mixture in blender, a batch at a time, blending until smooth, and return to pot. Blend last batch with 1 tablespoon butter and cream. Return to remaining soup, stirring, and heat through. Adjust seasoning and thickness. ; name: cinnamon applesauce easy microwave recipe ; ingredients: granny smith apples, sugar, fresh lemon juice, ground cinnamon, coarse salt ; preparation:In a 2 quart microwave- safe dish with a lid, combine apples, sugar, lemon juice, cinnamon, and a pinch of salt. Cover, and microwave on high until very tender, 10- 15 minutes, stirring halfway through. Mash apples with the back of a spoon. Serve warm. Or cover, refrigerate at least 1 hour, and serve chilled. Store, covered, in the refrigerator for up to 1 week. ; name: old bay steak fries ; ingredients: baking potatoes, oil, old bay seasoning, salt ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Coat baking sheet with cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine potato wedges with oil, seasoning, and salt. Toss to coat well. Spread potatoes in a single layer on the baking sheet. Bake without turning until tender and browned, about 40-45 minutes. ; name: honey chipotle glazed wings ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, salt, black pepper, chicken wings, canola oil, unsalted butter, honey, tabasco brand chipotle pepper sauce ; preparation:Combine flour, salt and pepper in a medium-sized plastic bag. Remove. Place chicken pieces one at a time in the bag and shake to coat well. Remove wings to a clean piece of parchment or waxed paper and set aside. Heat 2 inches of oil in a deep-sided skillet to 350 degrees. Fry chicken in batches until crisp and golden brown, turning occasionally, 12-15 minutes. Once fried, place chicken on parchment-lined baking sheet and keep warm in the oven. Melt butter. Add the honey and tabasco chipotle sauce to hot butter and stir until well combined. Transfer to a large bowl. Add the wings and toss to coat. Serve immediately. ; name: yakitori japanese grilled chicken skewers ; ingredients: chicken breast, green onions, soy sauce, chicken stock, sake, sugar, mirin ; preparation:Bring yakitori sauce to a boil for 5 min then set aside. Thread the chicken alternately with the green onions onto the skewers. Grill chicken in a preheated griller, turning every now and then and basting at the same time to keep it moist. Drippings can be returned to baste the chicken until it is cooked. Baste the yakitori again and serve with left over sauce. ; name: mum s monday macaroni ; ingredients: butter, onion, elbow macaroni, tomatoes, water, salt, pepper, breadcrumbs ; preparation:

name: rich banana pudding ; ingredients: condensed milk, instant vanilla pudding, vanilla wafer, cool whip, banana, water ; preparation:In a mixing bowl, put condensed milk and water. Add pudding and mix with mixer until blended. Put in refrigerator for 5 minutes. Add 1 cup cool whip to mixture and mix with mixer. Put vanilla wafers in dish, pudding next, sliced bananas and repeat. Top with cool whip. ; name: creamy rotel dip ; ingredients: cream cheese, buttermilk ranch salad dressing mix, green onions, black olives, pimentos, rotel tomatoes ; preparation:Melt cream cheese in a microwave bowl. Stir well. Add the rest of the ingredients. Stir well. Heat in microwave before serving. Can be stored in the refrigerator and then heat up when needed. ; name: cabin corn chowder ; ingredients: bacon, fresh chives, onion, fresh parsley, green pepper, fresh dill weed, cream-style corn, cream of potato soup, milk ; preparation:Cook the bacon in saucepan until tender. Add onion and green pepper. Continue to saute until onion is tender. Add corn, potato soup and 2 empty soup cans of milk to the bacon mixture. Simmer 10 minutes or until smooth. Add the herbs just before spooning into bowls. ; name: pork chops with tangy creole mustard pineapple sauce ; ingredients: olive oil, pork chops, salt, pepper, chicken broth, pineapple preserves, creole mustard, cider vinegar, tabasco sauce, light brown sugar ; preparation:In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Sprinkle pork chops with salt and pepper and add to the skillet. Cook the chops, turning, until well browned. Add the chicken broth. Cover and continue cooking for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, combine remaining ingredients. Add the sauce to the pork chops, turning to coat well. Cook the chops, uncovered, for 15 minutes longer, turning occasionally. ; name: scalloped potatoes and vegetables ; ingredients: cream of onion soup, milk, frozen diced potatoes, frozen mixed vegetables, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Stir together soup and milk in a large mixing bowl. Stir in potatoes, mixed vegetables, and 1 cup cheese. Pour into a greased 13x9 casserole dish. Bake, covered at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Uncover and bake for 30 more minutes, until potatoes are tender. Remove from oven and sprinkle with remaining 1 cup cheese. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. ; name: no egg no dairy pierogie dough ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, salt, oil, water ; preparation:

name: chorizo sausage chihuahua dogs ; ingredients: chorizo sausage, hot dog buns, mexican blend cheese, salsa, onion ; preparation:Prepare your sausages grilled, baked, broiled, on your outdoor grill, or pan-fried. A 1 lb package will contain 5 sausages. I cooked mine with the onion slices on my george foreman indoor grill. Warm up the grill for 5 minutes with the onions inside. Always spray your indoor grill with pam prior to the warm-up period. Line the sausages up across the grates so you get grill marks on them. Close the grill and set your timer for 5 minutes. While the sausages are cooking, spread your hot dogs bun, sprinkle a layer of shredded cheese inside, then insert them in your toaster oven until the cheese is slightly melted. Insert your cooked chorizo chihuahua dogs into each bun on top of the bed of melted cheese. Top with your sliced onions and 2 tablespoons or more of your favorite salsa. You can also top with chili or other toppings of your own choosing. ; name: slow cooker pulled pork ; ingredients: pork tenderloin, root beer, barbecue sauce, hamburger buns ; preparation:Place the pork tenderloin in a slow cooker. Pour the root beer over the meat. Cover and cook on low until well cooked and the pork shreds easily, 6 to 7 hours. Drain well. Stir in barbecue sauce. Serve over hamburger buns. ; name: stove top cream cheese and velveeta mac and cheese ; ingredients: macaroni noodles, velveeta cheese, cream cheese, butter, flour, milk, sharp cheddar cheese, salt, white pepper ; preparation:Boil noodles and drain. While boiling, melt butter in saucepan on low -medium slowly add the flour well continuously stirring. Slowly add the milk will continuously stirring. Add the cheeses, salt and white pepper, increase heat to medium while continuously stirring until all cheese is melted. Remove from heat and let cool 10 minutes. Poor over noodles and mix well. ; name: crock pot stuffed steak ; ingredients: round steaks, salt, garlic powder, black pepper, prepared stuffing, cream of mushroom soup, dry onion soup mix, water ; preparation:Pound the salt, garlic powder and black pepper into the steak. Lay the stuffing on top of the steak and roll up jelly-roll style. Place toothpicks in steak to hold in place. Place the steak in the crock pot. Mix the cream of mushroom soup, dry onion soup mix and water in bowl until smooth. Pour over the steak in the crock pot. Cook on low for about 6 hours. Thicken the broth for gravy if you like. Serve with mashed potatoes, if desired. Slice the steak into serving pieces. ; name: raspberry topped lemon pie ; ingredients: 9-inch graham cracker crust, frozen raspberries in light syrup, cornstarch, egg yolks, eagle brand condensed milk, realemon juice, yellow food coloring, whipped topping ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 deg. In saucepan, combine raspberries and cornstarch. Cook and stir until thickened. In bowl, beat egg yolk. Stir in sweetened condensed milk, realemon juice and food coloring if desired. Pour over crust. Bake 8 minutes. Spoon raspberry mixture over top. Chill 4 hours. Spread with whipped topping. Garnish as desired. Refrigerate leftovers. ; name: cream cheese scrambled eggs 309cals per serve ; ingredients: eggs, low-fat cream cheese, chives, milk, salt and pepper, vegetable oil ; preparation:

name: fresh pea soup with mint ; ingredients: olive oil, scallions, celery rib, onion, reduced-sodium chicken broth, fresh peas, fresh mint leaves, peapods, mint leaf, nonfat yogurt ; preparation:In a large pot or dutch oven heat oil over medium-high heat. Add scallions, celery, and onions, stir until vegetables are wilted, approximately 5 minutes. Add broth and bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and add peas, simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and carefully transfer to bowl of food processor or blender, do this in batches if necessary. Add mint, season to taste with salt and black pepper and puree until smooth. Chill for 1 hour and serve with yogurt in center and garnished with mint leaves and a peapod if desired. ; name: steamed lentils with saffron ; ingredients: brown lentils, olive oil, onion, prosciutto, dry white wine, saffron thread, vegetable stock, salt ; preparation:Rinse the lentils well. Heat the vegetable stock in a small pot. Meanwhile, in a different medium pot heat the olive oil. Add the onion and cook until translucent, 5 to 8 minutes, then add the prosciutto and cook for a few more minutes. Add the lentils, cook for another 2-3 minutes, and pour the white wine. Add the saffron and cook until the alcohol has evaporated, 4-5 minutes. Add the stock, salt to taste, and cook over low heat for 50 minutes to 1 hour, covered. Add water or more stock if necessary. ; name: portabellas stuffed with spinach and blue cheese ; ingredients: portabella mushrooms, fresh spinach, onion, blue cheese, garlic cloves, olive oil, balsamic vinegar ; preparation:Remove stems from mushrooms and chop. Bake portabella caps for about 10 minutes in 400 degree oven. Remove and cool. Saute onions and garlic in 1t oil until onions are translucent. Add spinach to onions and garlic and saute until spinach is wilted. Spoon this mixture into portabella caps. Sprinkle blue cheese on top. Bake 15 minutes at 400 degrees. Mix remaining olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Drizzle over the cooked portabellas and serve. ; name: mushroom bacon burgers ; ingredients: ground beef, sliced mushrooms, bacon, green onions, worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, salt, pepper, hamburger buns, cheese slice ; preparation:Mix together first 8 ingredients in a bowl. Shape mixture into 4 patties. Grill over medium-high heat for 10-12 minutes or until done, turning once. Just before taking off the grill, place cheese slice on each patty. Serve on buns with lettuce, tomato, etc. ; name: crab and shrimp dips ; ingredients: cream cheese, mayonnaise, ketchup, worcestershire sauce, tabasco sauce, onion, crabmeat, baby shrimp ; preparation:In a mixing bowl, using an electric mixer, beat cream cheese and mayonnaise until well blended. Add ketchup, tabasco sauce, worcestershire sauce and beat again until well incorporated. Add onions and mix well using a fork. Adjust tabasco sauce to taste. Divide mixture equally into 2 serving bowls. Add crab to one bowl and mix well using a fork. Add shrimp to the other bowl and mix well using a fork. Serve with potato chips or vegetable crackers. Refrigerate any unused portions. ; name: creamy baked apples ; ingredients: granny smith apples, butter, cinnamon sugar, flour, sugar, milk, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg ; preparation:

name: hot quinoa drink ; ingredients: quinoa, soymilk, apples, light brown sugar, ground cinnamon, vanilla extract ; preparation:Place quinoa and 2 cups water in a medium saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer 15 minutes or until quinoa is tender. Drain well and return quinoa to saucepan. Add soymilk, apples, sugar and cinnamon. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium and simmer 5 minutes. Transfer mixture to a blender, add vanilla and puree until smooth. Serve hot. ; name: becky s popped corn ; ingredients: popped corn, cereal, salted peanuts, almond bark, peanut butter ; preparation:Mix popped corn, rice krispies and salted peanuts in a bowl. Melt almond bark in the microwave - be careful not to burn. Stir peanut butter into melted almond bark. Spread on a sheet of wax paper. After mixture cools and hardens, break up and store in covered container. ; name: baby new potatoes with creamy parmesan sauce ; ingredients: new potatoes, butter, flour, milk, salt, black pepper, ground nutmeg, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cover potatoes with water, bring to a boil, lower heat, cover and simmer until tender, about 8 minutes. Drain and cover to keep warm. In saucepan over medium high heat, melt butter, whisk in flour, then milk, stirring constantly until thick. Season sauce with salt, black pepper and nutmeg. Stir in cheese. Pour sauce over potatoes and stir to coat. ; name: mandarin orange bread ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, flour, salt, baking soda, quick-cooking oats, mandarin oranges, orange gelatin, nuts ; preparation:In a large bowl combine the eggs and sugar. Beat until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes. In a small bowl sift together the flour, salt, and baking soda. Add the flour mixture to the egg mixture and stir until smooth. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Spoon into greased and floured 9 x 5-inch loaf pans. Bake at 325-degrees for 1 hour. Remove from pans immediately. Let stand for 24 hours before slicing. Makes 2 loaves. ; name: japanese inspired cucumber salad ; ingredients: english cucumber, purple onion, basil leaves, rice vinegar, white sugar, toasted sesame oil ; preparation:Peel, or partially peel, the english cucumber and slice in rounds as thin as possible. Peel and slice the purple onion as thin as possible. Cut the basil leaves into a very thin chiffonade. Combine the final three ingredients to make the dressing and add to the salad. If you want to let it marinate for a while, wait to add the basil until closer to serving time. ; name: vegan lemon curd ; ingredients: lemon juice, water, granulated sugar, cornstarch, salt, soymilk, margarine ; preparation:

name: hidden valley broiled fish ; ingredients: hidden valley ranch dressing mix, lemon juice, olive oil, white wine, white fish fillets ; preparation:Mix all ingredients, except fish, in shallow dish. Add fish and coat all sides with mixture. Cover and refrigerate for 15 to 30 minutes. Remove fish from marinade. Broil 9 to 12 minutes or until fish begins to flake. ; name: mexican red beans and rice ; ingredients: brown rice, olive oil, onions, chili powder, red kidney beans, salsa, hot water, sour cream ; preparation:Cook rice according to package directions. To prepare the beans, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add onions and saute until tender. Sprinkle on chili powder and cook 1 minute, stirring frequently. Add beans, salsa, and water and cook about 5 minutes. Serve beans over rice, with sour cream on top. ; name: garlic piperade soup ; ingredients: garlic cloves, onions, sweet pepper, olive oil, tomatoes, beef stock, bread, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Blanch the garlic in boiling water for thirty seconds. Run under cold water and drain. Peel and slice the cloves of garlic. Cook the onions and peppers in the oil for ten minutes until the onions are golden and the peppers are soft. Add the garlic and tomatoes. Cover the pan and cook over low heat for thirty minutes. Pour in the broth and bring to a boil. Tear the bread into large pieces and add to the boiling soup where it will disintegrate and thicken the broth. Adjust the amount of bread and broth to the desired thickness of the soup and salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot with grated cheese if you wish. ; name: grilled orange and bourbon salmon fillets ; ingredients: bourbon, fresh orange juice, low sodium soy sauce, brown sugar, green onions, fresh chives, fresh lemon juice, fresh garlic, salmon fillets, salt and black pepper ; preparation:In a bowl whisk together the first 8 ingredients. Pour into n a large heavy ziploc plastic bag. Add in the salmon fillets. Seal bag tightly, and turn bag to coat evenly. Place in the refrigerator for 2 hours. Remove the fillets from the bag and reserve the marinade. Place the fillets on a preheated outdoor grill or under the oven broiler. Cook for about 6 minutes on each side, basting with reserved marinade until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Season with salt and pepper. ; name: smucker s thumbprint cookies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, vanilla extract, flour, salt, jam ; preparation:Cream butter& sugar, stir in vanilla. Mix in flour and salt. Chill dough 2 hours. Shape rounded teaspoons of dough into balls. Place on ungreased cookie sheet, flatten shighlty. Indent centers and fill with jam. Bake at 375 for about 12 minutes. Watch the bottoms as they are alot like shortbread cookies and the bottoms get brown quickly. ; name: seared sea scallops with tropical salsa ; ingredients: pineapple, mango, cucumber, red bell pepper, cilantro, fresh lime juice, jalapeno, salt, pepper, sea scallops ; preparation:

name: cake mix cake plus ; ingredients: cake mix, eggs, flour, sour cream, sugar, milk, margarine ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan or 12-cup fluted tube pan with non-stick cooking spray. In large mixing bowl, combine cake mix, eggs, flour, sour cream, sugar, milk and margarine. Beat to mix well. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour, or until done. ; name: grandma s spaghetti sauce ; ingredients: ketchup, tomatoes in puree, tomato puree, hamburger, tabasco sauce, garlic, oregano, onion, mushroom pieces ; preparation:Brown hamburger and onion in dutch oven. Drain fat. Combine remaining ingredients in pot. Let simmer 3-4 hours stirring occasionally. Use meatballs instead of hamburger for a tasty variation. ; name: blue cheese pasta salad ; ingredients: penne pasta, plain nonfat yogurt, low-fat mayonnaise, blue cheese, salt, fresh ground pepper, olive oil, garlic, round steaks, cherry tomatoes ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, combine yogurt, mayonnaise, blue cheese, salt and pepper in large bowl. Heat large non-stick skillet, swirl in oil, then add garlic. Saute 30 seconds. Add beef in two batches, cook til just browned, about 2 minutes. Drain pasta, add to bowl with yogurt dressing. Add steak and tomatoes, toss to coat. Serve immediately. ; name: meatball pancakes ; ingredients: egg yolks, ground beef, baking powder, salt, pepper, lemon juice, parsley, onion, egg whites ; preparation:Beat until light the 3 egg yolks. Then blend in the ground beef, baking poweder, salt, dash of pepper, lemon juice, parsley, and onion mix well. Then fold in the 3 egg whites that have been stiffly beat. Drop spoonfuls on hot greased griddle when puffed and brown, turn and brown on other side. Serve with mushroom gravy. ; name: mandarin orange bread ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, flour, salt, baking soda, quick-cooking oats, mandarin oranges, orange gelatin, nuts ; preparation:In a large bowl combine the eggs and sugar. Beat until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes. In a small bowl sift together the flour, salt, and baking soda. Add the flour mixture to the egg mixture and stir until smooth. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Spoon into greased and floured 9 x 5-inch loaf pans. Bake at 325-degrees for 1 hour. Remove from pans immediately. Let stand for 24 hours before slicing. Makes 2 loaves. ; name: dawn s special brownies ; ingredients: butter, cocoa, eggs, sugar, flour ; preparation:

name: dijon caper chicken and pasta sauce ; ingredients: butter, chicken breasts, flour, chicken broth, half-and-half, dijon mustard, tomatoes, fresh parsley, frozen peas, capers ; preparation:Melt butter or olive oil in a large skillet. Add chicken breasts and cook until done and lightly browned, about 20 minutes. Remove chicken to a warm serving platter. Stir flour into pan drippings in skillet, cook for 1 minute. Add the chicken broth, half and half. Stir and cook until the sauce thickens and bubbbles, add in mustard, capers and frozen peas. Return chicken to skillet, cover and heat for 10 minutes. Garnish with tomatoes and sprinkle with parsley. We typically serve with tortolini or other pasta and cover with extra dijon sauce. ; name: roasted pork loin with mustard garlic and herbs ; ingredients: boneless pork loin, garlic cloves, dijon mustard, herbes de provence, salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Slice small slits all over the pork loin. Insert the garlic slivers into the holes. Spread the dijon mustard evenly over the entire loin, using your hands or a spatula. Sprinkle loin with the herbes de provence, the salt and the pepper. Place on a roasting rack set in a roasting pan and bake for about 1 hour, or until meat thermometer reaches 155 degrees. Remove from the oven, and let rest for 5-10 minutes before slicing. ; name: pear honey ; ingredients: pears, pineapple, lemon, juice and rind of, sugar ; preparation:Run the pears through a food chopper using fine blades. Combine all ingredients. Cook on low heat, stirring frequently, until the mixture is thick and clear. Pack in hot jars and seal. Process in a water bath for 10 minutes. ; name: monie s taco puffs ; ingredients: refrigerated biscuit, taco seasoning mix, cheddar cheese, ground chuck ; preparation:Cook ground beef until done, drain fat and add seasoning to beef. If you need to add alittle water using a spoon until mix is moist not runny. Remove biscuits from container and on flat surface flatten to 6 inches around. Place mix and about 2tbl spoons of cheese on one side of flattened biscuit and fold over edges use a fork to crimp together. Place in oven according to refrigerated package instructions. I though of this one day thinking of what to make quick for lunch to serve my kids. They loved it and its so easy to make. ; name: grilled lemon herb shrimp ; ingredients: large shrimp, olive oil, lemon peel, lemon juice, oregano, thyme, salt and pepper, skewer ; preparation:Pour olive oil, lemon peel, lemon juice, herbs, and s&p into a large ziplock bag. Add shrimp. Toss gently to coat. Marinate at least two hours or overnight. Grill for 2 minutes per side. ; name: bbq pork steak ; ingredients: pork steaks, olive oil, salt, hot paprika, sage, garlic ; preparation:

name: orzo and snap pea salad ; ingredients: coarse salt, orzo pasta, sugar snap pea, yellow squash, lemon juice, olive oil, parmesan cheese, ground pepper ; preparation:In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook orzo 5 minutes. Add sugar snap peas and squash. Cook until orzo is al dente and vegetables are crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Drain well. Return to pot. Add lemon juice, olive oil, and parmesan. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine and serve. ; name: ranch sausage and rice casserole ; ingredients: bulk sausage, onion, celery, carrot, white rice, cream of mushroom soup, chicken broth, water, dry ranch dressing mix, salt ; preparation:In a large saucepan brown sausage, drain well and crumble. Set aside. In same pan saute onion and celery in 1 teaspoon oil. Mix in carrots and sausage. Place uncooked rice in bottom of a 9 x 9 or 3 quart baking dish. Place sausage mixture in baking dish on top of uncooked rice. In a medium size bowl mix soup, chicken broth, water, dry ranch mix and salt. Pour over sausage mixture and cover with foil. Bake in a 350 degree oven for approximately 50 minutes. ; name: vanilla pound cake ; ingredients: sugar, unsalted butter, eggs, vanilla, all-purpose flour, baking powder, milk ; preparation:Heat oven to 350f. Combine sugar and melted butter in large bowl. Beat at medium speed, scraping bowl often, until creamy. Add eggs,, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add vanilla. Beat until well mixed. Stir together flour and baking powder in small bowl. Gradually add flour mixture alternately with milk to butter mixture, beating at low speed until well mixed. Pour batter into greased and floured 10-inch angel food cake pan. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes. Remove from pan. ; name: 20 minutes chicken parmesan with spaghetti ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, egg, seasoned dry bread crumb, margarine, spaghetti sauce, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, dried parsley flakes, cooked spaghetti ; preparation:Flatten chicken to even thickness using palm of hand or meat mallet. Dip chicken in egg, then coat with crumbs. In 10-inch skillet over medium heat, heat margarine and cook chicken until brown on both sides. Add spaghetti sauce. Reduce heat to low and cover, simmer for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with cheeses and parsley. Cover and allow to simmer 5 more minutes or until cheese melts. Serve over hot spaghetti. ; name: italian chicken with sauce ; ingredients: chicken pieces, condensed tomato soup, tomato paste, onion salt, garlic salt, oregano, mushroom pieces, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Remove skin from chicken& place in an 12 by 8 inch microwave safe dish with the meatiest portions towards the outside of the dish. In a mixing bowl, stir together soup, tomato paste, spices, & mushrooms. Spoon over chicken. Microwave on high for 20 to 22 minutes, rotating dish if necessary, halfway through. Sprinkle cheese over chicken& microwave on medium for 2 to 4 minutes, or till cheese melts. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. ; name: ramen noodle egg drop soup ; ingredients: water, eggs, onion, celery, green bell pepper, chicken-flavored ramen noodles ; preparation:

name: mustard roast beef ; ingredients: apricot preserves, spicy brown mustard, reduced-sodium worcestershire sauce, light brown sugar, prepared horseradish, caraway seed, ground allspice, black peppercorns, sirloin tip roast ; preparation:Mix all ingredients except beef in medium bowl. Spread on all surfaces of meat. Place meat on rack in roasting pan. Roast at 350 degrees f. Until meat thermometer registers 140 degrees, or 160 degrees, 30 to 45 minutes. ; name: basic rice pilaf ; ingredients: butter, onion, rice, salt, black pepper, chicken stock, parsley ; preparation:Melt butter in saucepan and cook onion over medium heat until golden.
