name: cod portuguese ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, garlic clove, green pepper, chopped tomatoes, paprika, orange, juice of, cod fish fillets, salt and pepper, fresh parsley ; preparation:Heat the oil in a heavy fry pan and saute the onion, garlic and pepper for about 5-7 minutes until softened. Add the tomatoes, paprika and orange juice. Season, stir well and simmer for a further 5 minutes. Lay the fish fillets on top, cutting them to fit the pan if necessary. Season lightly, cover and simmer gently for 12-15 minutes or until the fish is cooked but still firm. Transfer to serving dishes and sprinkle with parsley. Serve. ; name: broccoli pesto ; ingredients: broccoli florets, fresh basil leaf, garlic, pine nuts, coarse salt, ground black pepper, olive oil, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Place broccoli in container of blender. Add basil, garlic, pine nuts, salt, pepper, and oil. Process until smooth. Transfer to a bowl and stir in cheese. To serve, toss into warm buttered pasta. Can be refrigerated in a tightly covered jar for a week. May be frozen, but then it is best not to stir in cheese until after defrosting. ; name: easy texas rice ; ingredients: white rice, oil, onion, bell pepper, chicken stock, diced tomatoes, chili powder, garlic salt ; preparation:In a saute pan, brown the rice in oil over low to medium heat, stirring constantly. When the rice is brown, add the onion, bell pepper, chili powder and garlic salt. Turn the heat to high, and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add the tomatoes, and then chicken stock. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce the heat, and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat, and let stand for 15-20 minutes. ; name: big and chewy chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: light brown sugar, white sugar, margarine, eggs, vanilla, flour, salt, baking soda, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream together sugars and margarine until fluffy with mixer. Blend in eggs, 1 at a time. Blend in vanilla. Combine flour, salt and baking soda. Add flour, combining with a spoon. Add chocolate chips. Use an ice cream scoop for measurement and place on shiny cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated 350f oven for 18-20 minutes or until golden. ; name: amazing and fast pressure cooker short ribs ; ingredients: beef short ribs, light olive oil, beef broth, red wine, sweet onion, garlic cloves, honey, brown sugar, coarse salt, black pepper ; preparation:Heat oil in heavy pan then brown short ribs in the oil. Put short ribs in pressure cooker. Put in pressure cooker red wine, beef broth, onion,. Garlic, honey, brown sugar, salt and pepper. Bring to high pressure. Cook at high pressure for one hour. Turn off and let steam come down naturally -- do not open cooker until steam is completely released. Serve. ; name: mozzarella tuna melts ; ingredients: tuna in water, celery, onion, mayonnaise, hamburger buns, mozzarella cheese, tomatoes, lettuce leaves ; preparation:

name: frozen peppermint pie ; ingredients: pie crusts, cream cheese, sweetened condensed milk, creme de menthe, red food coloring, whipped topping ; preparation:Beat cream cheese until fluffy. Gradually beat in milk. Stir in creme de menthe. Fold in whipped topping. Pour into crust. Freeze for 4 hours. ; name: birthday caramel chicken ; ingredients: skinless chicken breasts, real butter, white sugar, sweet onions, parsley, lemon pepper, garlic salt, lemon juice ; preparation:Clean the chicken and cut into 6 serving pieces. Pat chicken dry and place into a long glass baking dish. Set aside. Using a cast-iron fry pan melt butter on medium and quickly stir in the sugar stirring constantly until melted and caramel color. Lower heat and add the onions or leeks. Stir to coat onions then pour directly over the chicken. Add the parsley, lemon pepper, garlic salt and lemon juice. Bake at 350 for 60 minutes. ; name: seasoned chicken with soup gravy ; ingredients: chicken tenders, creole seasoning, olive oil, cream of mushroom soup, cream of chicken soup, chicken broth ; preparation:Coat the chicken with the seasoning, and let sit in the refridgerator for at least an hour. After marinating, brown the chicken in olive oil in a large pan. In a separate bowl, mix together the soups with the chicken broth, stir until smooth. Add the soup mixture to the pan, mix well. Let simmer for 10-15 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve with the soup gravy. ; name: lea s peach pie cobbler ; ingredients: peaches, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, dry tapioca, butter, cinnamon sugar ; preparation:Drain peaches, reserving 1 cup of syrup for recipe. Combine peaches, syrup, cinnamon, nutmeg & tapioca in large sauce pan. Bring mixture to a boil, and boil for one minute. Remove from heat and cool. Prepare 9x13 pan lined with pie crust. Prepare lattice topping for cobbler. Place peach mixture in crust lined pan. Dot mixture with butter portions, spaced evenly. Arrange lattice topping, crimping into top edge of crust. Sprinkle crust with cinnamon-sugar mixture for color. Place, uncovered, in 450f oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 400f and bake 60 minutes, or until golden brown. ; name: healthy butternut squash muffins ; ingredients: butternut squash, wheat flour, all-purpose flour, baking powder, brown sugar, salt, pumpkin pie spice, milk, egg, applesauce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly grease a 12 cup muffin pan. In a medium saucepan with enough water to cover, boil squash 20 minutes, or until tender. Remove from heat, drain, and puree in a food processor. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, sugar, salt and pumpkin pie spice. In a medium bowl, thoroughly mix together milk, egg and applesauce. Stir in squash. Fold the squash mixture into the flour mixture just until moistened. Spoon batter into the greased muffin pan, filling cups about full. Bake 20 minutes. ; name: traditional bahraini cardamom coffee ; ingredients: water, coffee, ground cardamom, saffron, rose water ; preparation:

name: mexican grilled cheese sandwiches ; ingredients: bread, jalapeno jack cheese, taco seasoning mix, salsa, butter ; preparation:Heat a griddle, sandwich maker, or a skillet over medium heat. In small bowl, mix butter and taco seasoning mix. Spread half of mixture on one side of each piece of bread. Put cheese slices onto bread and top with remaining bread slices. Place the sandwiches, buttered sides down, on hot griddle. Spread top sides with remaining butter mixture. Cook until golden brown on both sides and cheese is melted. Serve with salsa as a dip. ; name: tangy braised cabbage ; ingredients: sunflower oil, shallots, cabbage, prepared horseradish, garlic clove, fresh ginger, sugar, white wine vinegar, fresh lemon juice, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:In a heavy saucepan, heat the sunflower oil over medium heat. Add the shallots, cabbage, horseradish, garlic and ginger and saute for 5 to 8 minutes, or until the cabbage starts to wilt. Stir in the sugar and cook to caramelize the cabbage lightly. Add the vinegar and lemon juice and stir to scrape up the browned bits from the bottom of the pan. Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately. ; name: simple italian bean salad ; ingredients: spring onions, garlic cloves, red chile, cannellini beans, butter beans, olive oil, white wine vinegar, salt and pepper, flat leaf parsley ; preparation:In a large bowl, combine the spring onions, garlic and chili. Add the three cans of beans and mix thoroughly. Whisk together the olive oil and white wine vinegar and season. Drizzle over the bean salad and stir in with the parsley. Serve straight away or refrigerate until ready. ; name: grouper parmesan ; ingredients: grouper fillets, sour cream, parmesan cheese, lemon juice, onion, salt, liquid hot pepper sauce, paprika, fresh parsley ; preparation:Skin fillets if necessary and cut into serving size pieces. Place in a well-greased baking dish. Combine sour cream, parmesan cheese, lemon juice, onion, salt and liquid hot pepper sauce. Spread mixture over the fish. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake at 350 degrees f. For 25 to 30 minutes or until fish flakess easily when tested with a fork. Garnish with parsley. ; name: chocolate chip blondies ; ingredients: brown sugar, butter, eggs, vanilla extract, flour, baking powder, salt, milk chocolate chips ; preparation:In a large bowl, combine brown sugar, butter, eggs and vanilla just until blended. Combine flour, baking powder and salt. Add to brown sugar mixture. Stir in chocolate chips. Spread into a a greased 13x9 pan. Bake at 350 for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack. Cut into bars. ; name: i m broke mac and cheese ; ingredients: macaroni and cheese mix, milk, butter, broccoli cheese soup, meat ; preparation:

name: ear wax wieners on q tips ; ingredients: margarine, cocktail franks, mustard, mayonnaise, toothpicks, cotton balls ; preparation:Melt the margarine in a small pan over low heat. Place the franks on a broiling pan and brush them with the melted butter. Broil the franks until they are evenly browned. Combine the mustard and mayo in a small bowl and set aside-- this will be the ear wax. Stick each frank on a tooth pick. Wet the cotton balls slightly in order to compact them and stick one on the other end of the tooth pick-- this is your q-. Place the small bowl of ear wax in the middle of a platter and arrange the franks on q-. Dip franks in ear wax to eat. ; name: cucumbers in dill cream ; ingredients: sour cream, fresh dill, cider vinegar, salt, hot red pepper sauce, white onions, seedless cucumber ; preparation:Mix sour cream, all but 1 t. Of the dill, the vinegar, salt, and red pepper sauce in small mixing bowl. Make 3 or 4 layers of onion, cucumber, and sour cream mixture in a 2-quart serving bowl. Refrigerate covered 1-2 hours, spooning juice from bottom of bowl over top several times. Sprinkle remaining 1 t. Dill over top and serve cold. ; name: garlic mashed creamed rice ; ingredients: water, chicken bouillon cube, white rice, fat free sour cream, lowfat parmesan cheese, garlic powder, ground black pepper ; preparation:Bring 1 cup water & bouillon or chicken broth to a boil in saucepan. Add rice, cover, and place on low heat for 15-18 minutes. After rice has reached desired hardness, remove cover and add sour cream, parmesan, garlic powder and black pepper. Mix well and continue to let simmer. If rice fails to soften anymore to your preferred texture, add small amounts of water and stir until preferred texture is reached. ; name: tri color peppers in garlic onions and tomatoes ; ingredients: olive oil, green peppers, red bell peppers, yellow bell peppers, garlic cloves, red onion, parsley, cilantro, fresh tomatoes, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat olive oil in large frying pan. Add peppers and onions and cook gently for 2-3 minutes, stirring frequently. Add parsley, cilantro and garlic and cook another 2-3 minutes. Add chopped tomatoes and their juice to the pan, stir and season with salt and pepper. Cover the pan and simmer for about 20 minutes or until the peppers are tender but somewhat crisp. The sauce should be somewhat thick. If too much liquid remains when the peppers are crisp tender, remove the peppers and onions and boil rapidly to reduce the liquid. Check the seasoning again at this point. Add the peppers and onions back into the sauce, if necessary. Serve immediately. The dish may be made ahead of time and rewarmed when served. ; name: apple cinnamon pork tenderloin ; ingredients: pork tenderloin, cornstarch, ground cinnamon, brown sugar, apples, dried cranberries ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place the tenderloin in a roasting pan or casserole dish. Combine the remaining ingredients together and stir. Spoon the apple mixture around the tenderloin, cover and bake for 30 minutes. Remove the lid and spoon the apple mix over top of the tenderloin. Place back in the oven and bake 15 to 20 minutes or until tenderloin registers at least 155 to 160 degrees on a meat thermometer. ; name: grilled shrimp ; ingredients: shrimp, fresh parsley, olive oil, oregano, lemon juice, garlic, hot sauce, salt, tomato paste, pepper ; preparation:

name: kicked up bacon cheese mashed potatoes ; ingredients: baking potatoes, salt, half-and-half, butter, pepper, bacon, sharp cheddar cheese, sour cream, chives ; preparation:Place potatoes and 1 tsp salt in a saucepan, cover with water, bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer. Cook until potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes. Drain, return to pot. Add half and half, butter, remaining salt, pepper. Place pan over medium low heat, mash for 4-5 minutes. Add bacon, cheese, sour cream, chives and stir. ; name: portobello pizzas with tomato bruschetta ; ingredients: mushroom caps, garlic clove, olive oil, tomatoes, part-skim mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f remove the mushroom stems and scrape the gills out with a spoon. Stir the garlic into the oil and brush it all over both sides of the mushroom caps. Place the mushrooms bowl-side-up on a baking sheet and bake for 8 - 10 minutes, or until tender. Take the mushrooms out of the oven and over up to 450f. Top mushrooms with bruschetta and sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 5-10 minutes, until the cheese melts. ; name: sassy meatloaf weight watchers ; ingredients: lean ground beef, low-sodium salsa, quick-cooking oatmeal, carrot, plum tomatoes, mushroom ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Spray a loaf pan with cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine beef, salsa, oatmeal, carrot, tomatoes, and mushrooms. Shape the mixture into a loaf. Place the loaf in the pan. Bake until browned and knife inserted in center comes out clean and hot, about 1 hour and 5 minutes. Let stand about 10 minutes before slicing. ; name: kay s banana nut cake ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, instant banana pudding mix, eggs, banana, oil, water, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat eggs until thick. Add cake mix, pudding, water, oil, and bananas. Beat with electric mixer at medium speed for 10 minutes. Add walnuts, mix to incorporate. Pour into ungreased bundt pan. Bake for 50 minutes. Do not remove from pan until cooled. Sprinkle for powdered sugar for garnish. ; name: fruity bread pudding for two ; ingredients: stale bread, apple, dried cranberries, egg, granulated sugar, vanilla extract, milk, butter, ground cinnamon ; preparation:In a lightly greased 2 cup baking dish, toss together the bread cubes, apple and dried fruit. In a small bowl, whisk together the egg, sugar and vanilla. In a small saucepan, heat the milk with the butter just until steaming. Gradually whisk into the egg mixture in a slow, steady stream. Pour over the bread mixture. Let stand for 5 minutes. Press gently to moisten the bread evenly. Sprinkle with cinnamon to taste. Bake at 350 degrees f for about 30 minutes or just until puffed and a knife inserted in the centre comes out clean. Broil for about 2 minutes or until golden and crusty. ; name: rice pudding gonzo ; ingredients: whole milk, long-grain white rice, sugar, unsalted butter, vanilla, salt, eggs, heavy cream, cinnamon ; preparation:

name: bacon tomato presto pasta ; ingredients: bacon, cherry tomatoes, chive & onion cream cheese, milk, parmesan cheese, cooked penne ; preparation:Cook bacon in skillet 5 minute or until bacon is crisp, stirring occasionally. Drain skillet, leaving bacon in skillet. Stir in cherry tomatoes. Add cream cheese spread, milk and parmesan cheese. Mix well. Cook until hot and bubbly, stirring frequently. Stir in pasta. ; name: cheddar garlic biscuits ; ingredients: bisquick baking mix, milk, cheddar cheese, margarine, garlic powder ; preparation:Heat oven to 450f. Stir baking mix, milk and cheese until soft dough forms. Drop by 9 spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 8-10 minutes or until golden brown. Stir together margarine and garlic powder. Brush over warm biscuits. ; name: gluten free egg free cheesecake recipe ; ingredients: cream cheese, sweetened condensed milk, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, cornstarch, lemon juice, vanilla, light sour cream ; preparation:Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Using an electric mixer on medium, beat the cream cheese, condensed milk, baking soda, baking powder, cornstarch, lemon juice, and vanilla until smooth. Blend in sour cream. Pour into ungreased round baking pan. Bake for one hour. Insert a knife into the outer perimeter of cake. It should come out clean. Let cake cool for 2-3 hours, then cover with plastic wrap and place in refrigerator. ; name: rum mustard glazed ham ; ingredients: ham, brown sugar, dark rum, dijon mustard, maple syrup ; preparation:Lightly score the ham- criss-cross and place in a roasting pan. Mix remaining ingredients. Spoon sauce over the ham and bake in 425f oven for 30 minutes. Lower temperature to 375f and continue to roast for another hour. Baste frequently. The top should be well browned and crispy in texture. Allow to sit for 30 minutes covered with foil before carving. ; name: hearty mexican spaghetti ; ingredients: ground chicken, onion, low-sodium taco seasoning, diced tomatoes, chilies, angel hair pasta, cheddar cheese ; preparation:In a large saucepan, cook chicken and onions until chicken is no longer pink. Add taco seasoning mix, tomatoes, corn, and chiles. Cook over medium heat until heated through. Fold in cooked spaghetti and cheese. Mix well and serve. ; name: creole poached chicken breasts ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, celery, carrot, stewed tomatoes, low sodium chicken broth, ground thyme, salt, cayenne pepper, boneless skinless chicken breasts ; preparation:

name: savory organic golden beets with greens ; ingredients: garlic clove, water, beet, salt, limes ; preparation:Clean and dice beets. Clean green tops of beets. Crush and chop the garlic clove. Add the beets, garlic, salt into a hot fry pan. There is no need for oil because you are trying to braise the beets to keep the flavor. Turn the heat down to medium, once the beets start to brown add the water until the beets are soft and can push a fork into them - about 20 minutes. The water will evaporate down, chop and add the greens and squeeze the lemon or lime into the dish cover and cook on medium heat until wilted. Serve right away and enjoy. ; name: pesto beef sandwich in the round ; ingredients: deli roast beef, french bread, light mayonnaise, pesto sauce, fresh lemon juice, roasted red peppers, mixed baby lettuces and spring greens, feta cheese, pepper ; preparation:Cut bread loaf horizontally in half. Remove center of bread, leaving 1-inch thick shell. In small bowl, combine mayonnaise, pesto sauce and lemon juice. Spread mixture on cut surfaces of both halves. Layer roast beef, roasted peppers, salad greens and cheese on bottom half. Season with pepper, if desired. Close with top bread loaf half. Cut into 6 wedges. Serve immediately. Makes 6 servings. If not available, sandwich may be made with t wo 6- to 8-inch round loaves or one long italian bread loaf. ; name: wasabi ginger dressing ; ingredients: gingerroot, garlic, white wine, canola oil, sugar, wasabi powder ; preparation:Place all ingredients but oil in blender. Blend for 2 minutes. With blender still running slowly drizzle in the oil until well blended. Refrigerate. Will keep for 2-3 weeks. ; name: southern green beans ham potatoes ; ingredients: ham hock, bacon, onions, salt, sugar, garlic, cayenne pepper, parsley, fresh green beans, potato ; preparation:Place ham hock and bacon in large dutch oven pot or soup pot. Cover with water. Bring to a rapid boil. Turn burner to medium to medium-high and let it come to a medium boil. Add the sliced onion. Let this cook while you wash and snap your beans. Wash beans, cut off ends and break in half. Add beans, salt, sugar, garlic, pepper and parsley to the ham hocks. Let it come to a boil, then turn burner to medium, to medium-low. Let it slow boil for about an hour or more or less, depending on how well you like your beans cooked. About 15-20 minutes before done, add your potatoes. Boil until tender. ; name: green bean stir fry ; ingredients: green beans, sunflower oil, ground star anise, garlic cloves, soy sauce, clear honey, tabasco sauce ; preparation:Heat the oil in the wok until very hot. Stir fry beans for 2 to 3 minutes. Add star anaise and garlic then fry for 1 minute. Add remaining ingredients then fry for 1 minute. Serve immediately. ; name: marinated tomatoes with lemon ; ingredients: fresh tomatoes, fresh lemon juice, sugar, extra virgin olive oil, fresh savory, salt, ground red pepper, garlic clove ; preparation:

name: bacon mushroom chicken ; ingredients: butter, chicken breast halves, seasoning salt, garlic clove, bacon, mushroom, heavy cream ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Pour melted butter into a 9x13-in baking dish. Add chicken, skin side down, sprinkle with seasoning salt and garlic. Turn chicken over, season and lay bacon strips on top. Sprinkle with mushrooms. Bake in the preheated oven for 45-60 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear. Remove chicken, bacon and mushrooms to a platter and keep warm. Pour juices from baking dish into a small saucepan and whisk together with cream over low heat until thickened. Pour sauce over chicken and serve warm. ; name: herb cheese pizza ; ingredients: cornmeal, pizza crusts, olive oil, garlic clove, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, dried oregano leaves, dried basil leaves ; preparation:Heat oven to 425. Grease 12-inch pizza pan. Sprinkle with cornmeal. Unroll dough and press in pan. In small bowl, combine oil and garlic. Drizzle over dough. In small bowl, combine cheese, oregano and basil. Sprinkle over oil. Bake at 425 for 13 to 16 minutes or until crust is deep golden brown. Serve immediately. ; name: lemon garlic chicken over angel hair pasta ; ingredients: flour, parmesan cheese, garlic powder, boneless skinless chicken breast, butter, lemon, juice of, white wine, hot water, chicken bouillon cube, angel hair pasta ; preparation:Combine flour, parmesan, and garlic powder. Dredge chicken in mixture. Melt butter in large skillet. Add chicken and brown. Add liquid. Stir until thickened. Meanwhile cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta and place in large serving bowl. Pour chicken and sauce over pasta. Toss gently. Top with grated cheese. Garnish with fresh lemon slices and fresh parsley. ; name: my ticket to heaven spinach and artichoke dip ; ingredients: spinach, artichoke hearts, cream cheese, mayonnaise, mozzarella cheese, garlic powder ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Drain spinach well before using. Mix spinach, artichokes, cream cheese, mayonnaise, mozzarella cheese and garlic powder in a large bowl. Spoon dip into a oven-safe dish and bake until bubbly and heated through. Serve warm with crackers, fresh bread, toasted bread or with a spoon. ; name: jen s chicken ; ingredients: chicken breasts, italian salad dressing, onion, sliced mushrooms, red pepper, tomatoes, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Put chicken in a pan with enough salad dressing to cover chicken and cover, till done, drain. Keep warm. In another skillet add olive oil to pan and saute onion and mushrooms and red pepper, till tender. Top chicken with saute mixture, top with sliced tomatoes, then top with cheese. Put a lid on the chicken till the cheese melts, then serve. ; name: pineapple apricot cheese spread ; ingredients: crushed pineapple, dried apricot, mango chutney, apricot brandy, ground ginger, reduced-fat cheddar cheese, fat free cream cheese, reduced-calorie stick margarine ; preparation:

name: sara belle s veg all casserole ; ingredients: mixed vegetables, water chestnuts, onion, mayonnaise, sharp cheddar cheese, butter, butter flavored crackers ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine first 5 ingredients in a large bowl. When well combined, transfer to a casserole dish. Combine butter and crackers. Place cracker mixture on top of vegetable casserole. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until bubbly around edges. ; name: macaroni and cottage cheese ; ingredients: macaroni, cottage cheese, milk, vegetable oil, salt, egg, garlic clove, cracker crumb ; preparation:Cook the macaroni according to directions. Stir cottage cheese with milk until smooth. In a seperate bowl, beat the egg, then beat the oil into it. Add salt and garlic to the cheese mixture. Now mix this with the cooked and drained macaroni, pour it in a baking dish, sprinkle with crumbs, and bake at 350 till set, about 25 minutes. ; name: quinoa mac and cheese ; ingredients: quinoa, vegetables, salt, seasoning salt, garlic cloves, eggs, soymilk, cheddar cheese, panko breadcrumbs ; preparation:Lightly saute any veggies you would like in this dish. Cook quinoa to packaged instructions until fully cooked. Preheat oven to 350f coat 13x9 inch dish with cooking spray. Whisk together eggs and milk in large bowl. Fold in quinoa mixture and cheese. Stir very well and let some of the cheese melt. Transfer to prepared baking dish and if using panko crumbs or bread crumbs add now and bake 30-35 mins, until bread crumbs are browned. ; name: nacho potato appetizers ; ingredients: black olives, waffle-shaped french fries, refried beans, mexican cheese, chunky salsa, sour cream ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f degrees. Line baking sheet with aluminum foil. Arrange potatoes in a single layer on prepared baking sheet. Bake 18-20 minutes. While fries are baking, microwave refried beans for 3-4 minutes until hot. Cool beans about 5 minutes. To assemble potatoes, evenly space potatoes on a microwave safe plate and top each with 1 tablespoon beans, and a sprinkle of cheese. Microwave, uncovered 1 minute until cheese is melted. Then top each stack with 1 teaspoon salsa, 1 teaspoon sour cream and an olive slice. ; name: sauted arugula with balsamic beef ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic paste, fresh rosemary needles, beef, shallot, red wine vinegar, balsamic vinegar, arugula ; preparation:Heat olive oil in a skillet on medium heat. Add garlic, rosemary, and beef. Brown beef on all sides, then add shallot, red wine vinegar, and balsamic vinegar. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove beef with tongs and place in a bowl quickly saut arugula in remaining juices for approximately 5 seconds. Plate arugula and top with beef and liquid. ; name: fiesta corn bake casserole ; ingredients: sour cream, flour, sugar, mexican-style corn, ground beef, onion, cheddar cheese, seasoning ; preparation:

name: baked reuben chicken ; ingredients: chicken thighs, fresh sauerkraut, thousand island dressing, swiss cheese ; preparation:In heavy skillet, sear thighs 5 to 6 minutes on each side. Spread kraut into 3 qt baking dish. Place thighs on top, skin side up. Place cheese slices evenly over entire dish. Spread dressing evenly over cheese. Cover with foil and bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Remove foil and bake additional 20 minutes. Cut breasts so 2 pieces equal a serving portion. Lightly salt and pepper the chicken. Do not skillet brown. Increase cooking time 8-10 minutes. ; name: raspberry zing syrup ; ingredients: raspberries, sugar, raspberry vinegar, water ; preparation:Bring all ingredients to a boil in saucepan and stir until sugar is dissolved. Reduce heat simmer uncovered for 20 minutes. Stir occasionally. Strain with a fine mesh sieve into bowl by pressing gently. Discard solids. If more than 1 cup syrup reduce by boiling. Cool, then chill covered. ; name: aunt ginny s thanksgiving stuffing ; ingredients: long grain and wild rice blend, onion, celery, butter, cornbread, bread, salt, dried sage, dried thyme, ground black pepper ; preparation:Prepare rice mix according to package directions. Set aside to cool. Cook onion and celery in butter in a large skillet until tender, stirring occasionally. Combine breads, salt, sage, thyme and pepper in a large bowl. Add butter mixture to bowl and mix lightly but thoroughly. Add about two-thirds of the prepared rice mixture to the bowl and toss lightly to combine. Stuff turkey just prior to roasting. Or place stuffing in a greased casserole, cover and bake at 325f for 45 minutes or until heated through. Do not use a sweet-type cornbread. ; name: brown rice consomme ; ingredients: beef consomme, onion, butter, brown rice, fresh mushrooms, ground black pepper ; preparation:Bring first 3 ingredients to a boil in a medium saucepan. Stir in rice. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 30 minutes. Add mushrooms. Cover and simmer 20 more minutes or until all liquid is absorbed. Stir in pepper. ; name: baked seasoned beet crisps ; ingredients: beets, balsamic vinegar, sugar, allspice, parsley, garlic powder, onion powder ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Peel beets and slice into very thin slices. Mix the remaining ingredients together in a small bowl. In a large ziploc bag place the beets and contents of bowl. Shake well to make sure beets are completely coated with liquid. Place beets on a baking sheet coated with nonstick cooking spray and bake for 45 minutes to an hour turning beets halfway through. Keep an eye on them to make sure they dont burn. ; name: raw broccoli salad reduced calorie low fat ; ingredients: broccoli florets, red onion, artificial sweetener, cider vinegar, light mayonnaise, sunflower seeds, seedless raisins ; preparation:

name: farfalle and pesto salad ; ingredients: farfalle pasta, new potatoes, green beans, pesto sauce, garlic, best olive oil, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cook the pasta. Drain, reserving a couple tablespoons of cooking water. Keep the pasta warm. Coordinate the cooking so the potatoes are ready at the same time. They will probably need to boil in a separate pan of water for 15 minutes. Drain. Cut the beans in half and boil them in salted water for two minutes. Drain. While the beans, potatoes and pasta are cooking,. Mix the garlic into the pesto, along with the olive oil and the two tablespoons cooking water. Put the pasta, potatoes and beans into the bowl. Toss and serve. ; name: bisquick chocolate chip cookies just 6 ingredients ; ingredients: unsalted butter, brown sugar, egg, vanilla extract, bisquick, chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream the shortening and brown sugar together in a mixing bowl with an electric mixer. Beat in the egg and vanilla. Gradually beat in the bisquick until fully incorporated. Carefully beat in the chocolate chips. Grease a cookie sheet with cooking spray, and pour on tablespoons of dough about 2 inches apartl. Bake at 375f for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown at the edges. ; name: salisbury meatballs with caramelized onions ; ingredients: butter, sweet onions, brown sugar, meatballs, mushroom beef gravy ; preparation:In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add onions and brown sugar to the skillet. Saute and stir frequently for 15-20-30 minutes or until onions are golden brown and caramelized. Add meatballs and gravy. Stir to combine. Cover and cook 5-8 minutes or until meatballs are well heated. Stir as needed. My family enjoyed these meatballs over noodles. ; name: turkish beef casserole ; ingredients: lean beef, yellow onion, green bell pepper, tomatoes, extra virgin olive oil, salt, beef stock, ground thyme ; preparation:Heat oil in a saucepan, add onion and saute until soft. Remove seeds and rib of pepper, chop, add to saucepan and cook for 5 minutes. Add beef cubes and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Cut tomatoes into small pieces, add to suacepan and cook for about 5 minutes. Add stock and thyme. Season with salt and simmer for about half an hour. Serve with cooked rice. ; name: aesop s fabled chicken ; ingredients: creamy peanut butter, butter, peach juice, chicken cutlets, corn flake crumbs, powdered ginger, pepper, salt ; preparation:In a bowl, mix peanut butter, melted butter and juice. To make it easier to mix with juice, peanut butter and butter may be put in microwave at low temperature to soften. Add chicken, cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour, turning once. In a shallow bowl, mix the cornflake crumbs, ginger, salt and pepper. Remove the chicken from the marinade and reserve remaining marinade. Coat the chicken in the dry mixture and place on rack of a baking pan. Drizzle chicken with remaining marinade. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until chicken is done. ; name: fantastic cinnamon raisin bread ; ingredients: oil, warm water, honey, maple-flavor syrup, salt, cinnamon, oatmeal, bread flour, raisins, active dry yeast ; preparation:

name: herby redcurrant lamb chops ; ingredients: red wine vinegar, red currant jelly, fresh rosemary, garlic cloves, lamb loin chops, olive oil ; preparation:In a shallow, non-metallic dish, mix together the red wine vinegar and redcurrant jelly. Strip the leaves from the rosemary stalks, set a few aside to garnish, and finely chop the remainder. Stir into the redcurrant mixture with the garlic. Add the lamb and turn in the mixture. Then allow to marinate for 5-10 minutes. Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan over a medium heat, then add the lamb with its marinade and cook for 15-20 minutes, turning halfway through, until the lamb is done to your liking and the sauce has reduced to a sticky consistency. Serve the lamb with mashed potatoes and steamed snow peas. Garnish with the reserved rosemary. ; name: black and white grape salad ; ingredients: seedless black grapes, sour cream, mayonnaise, cinnamon, brown sugar, powdered sugar ; preparation:In a large bowl, combine the sour cream, mayo, cinnamon. Add 2 tablespoons of each sugar to the mix. If the grapes are not as sweet as you desire, add the remaining sugar. If the grapes are sweet, you can leave it out. Cut the grapes in half and add to the dressing, stirring gently to coat the grapes. Refrigerate covered until chilled. Serve in parfait cups and garnish with mint for a beautiful fancy dessert. ; name: skewered garlic shrimp ; ingredients: shrimp, soy sauce, pineapple chunks, oil, garlic cloves, crushed red pepper flakes, green onions ; preparation:Combine soy sauce, pineapple chunks, pineapple juice, oil, garlic, crushed red pepper and green onions in plastic bag. Add shrimp. Marinate at least 1 hour. I usually let it marinate a few hours. Place shrimp, pineapple and green onions on skewers. Grill until pink. ; name: sesame wedges ; ingredients: bisquick, water, margarine, sesame seeds ; preparation:Heat oven to 400f grease cookie sheet. In medium bowl, stir bisquick mix and water with fork until soft dough forms. Pat dough into 10-inch circle on cookie sheet. Brush with margarine. Sprinkle with sesame seed. Press firmly into dough with rubber spatula. Cut dough into 12 wedges. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm. ; name: rhubarb date chutney ; ingredients: rhubarb, onions, dates, malt vinegar, water, white sugar, salt, ground ginger, cayenne pepper, garlic cloves ; preparation:Place all the ingredients in a large saucepan and bring to the boil over medium heat. Reduce the heat and simmer gently until the chutney has a jam-like consistency and there is no excess liquid on the surface. Stir from time to time to prevent sticking. Spoon into hot sterilized jars and seal down. Label and store for 6-8 weeks before use. ; name: tuscan sausage vegetable soup ; ingredients: italian sausage, zucchini, summer squash, onion, tubettini pasta, water, pasta sauce, garbanzo beans, beef bouillon cube ; preparation:

name: apple squares ; ingredients: rolled oats, flour, shortening, baking soda, brown sugar, sliced apples, butter, cinnamon, white sugar ; preparation:Mix rolled oats, flour, shortening, soda and brown sugar together and put half of mixture in bottom of baking pan. Mix together sliced apples, butter, cinnamon and white sugar. Spread over first layer of rolled oats. Cover with remaining rolled oat mixture. Bake in 350 degree oven 35- 40 minutes til done. ; name: irish mist whiskey carrots ; ingredients: butter, carrots, whiskey, brown sugar ; preparation:Melt butter. Add carrots. Cook for a minute. Remove from heat. Add whiskey off the stove. Add brown sugar. Return to stove. Cook covered for 5 minutes or until carrots are as tender as you like them. ; name: gg s garlic cheese biscuits ; ingredients: milk, mayonnaise, sugar, self rising flour, sharp cheddar cheese, garlic powder, butter ; preparation:Combine milk, mayonnaise, sugar and flour. Beat with electric mixer for about 1 minute, until smooth and completely combined. Add cheese to dough. Drop batter into paper lined muffin tins. Muffins tend to triple in size so fill lightly. Melt butter. Mix in garlic and brush tops of dough. You can shake 1 tsp additional cheese on each muffin. Bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes. Serve hot. ; name: german green beans ; ingredients: bacon, onions, flour, sugar, salt, pepper, vinegar, green beans, bacon bits ; preparation:Fry the bacon in a large cast-iron skillet until crisp, then drain on paper towels, leaving the fat in the pan. Add the onion and cook until light golden and tender, then add the flour and stir, cooking for about 1 minute. Add the sugar, salt, pepper, bean liquid or water, and vinegar, stir, and bring to a rolling boil. Allow to boil for about 3 minutes to thicken the sauce. Add the bacon bits at this time. Add the green beans and cook until heated through, about 7--8 minutes. Transfer the beans and sauce to a serving bowl and top with crumbled bacon. ; name: panko salmon ; ingredients: olive oil, salmon fillets, salt and pepper, honey mustard, fresh thyme, panko breadcrumbs, italian parsley, sweet hungarian paprika ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 400f. Set the salmon on a foil-lined baking sheet skin side down. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. In a small bowl, combine the honey mustard and 1 teaspoon of the thyme. In another small bowl, mix the panko with the remaining 1 teaspoon of thyme, 4 teaspoons of olive oil, parsley, and paprika. Add salt and pepper. Using a small spoon, spread the mustard mixture on the salmon. Top with the bread crumb mixture. Roast the salmon for 12-14 minutes or until it is almost completely firm to the touch and flakes when poked with a fork. Serve at once. ; name: beefy seitan log ; ingredients: vital wheat gluten, nutritional yeast, ground cumin, onion powder, garlic powder, mushroom stock, soy sauce, vegetarian worcestershire sauce ; preparation:

name: bleu cheese omelet ; ingredients: butter, eggs, water, black pepper, green apple, blue cheese, fresh chives ; preparation:To make filling, melt butter in a small skillet and cook apple over a low heat for 2-3 minutes or until just heated through. Remove pan from heat. Set aside and keep warm. To make omelet, melt butter in a small skillet. Place eggs, water and black pepper to taste in a small bowl and whisk to combine. Pour egg mixture into pan and cook over medium heat, continually drawing in the edge of the omelet with a fork during cooking, until no liquid remains, and the omelet is lightly set. Top half of the omelet with apple slices, cheese, and chives and fold in half. Slip onto a plate and serve immediately. ; name: crescent roll up sandwiches ; ingredients: crescent rolls, meat, cheese, mustard ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Seperate the crescent roll dough into the 8 triangles. Spread the mustard on the dough. Put 1 piece of meat and 1 piece of cheese on each roll, folding the meat over the cheese to copy the crescent triangle. Roll up the crescent roll, wide to narrow, and place on a cookie sheet with the point of the crescent on the bottom. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until golden. Serve warm. ; name: golden baked fish ; ingredients: fish fillets, pepper, egg white, salt, mayonnaise, dill weed, onion juice, fresh dill, lemon wedge ; preparation:Place fish in a greased 13-in x 9-in x 2 baking dish. Sprinkle with pepper. Beat egg white with salt if desired until stiff peaks form. Fold in mayonnaise, dill and onion juice, spoon over fish. Bake uncovered at 425 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes or until topping is puffed and golden and fish flakes easily with a fork. Garnish with dill and lemon if desired. ; name: chapel hill shrimp cucumber salad rounds ; ingredients: cream cheese, mayonnaise, ketchup, prepared mustard, garlic powder, shrimp, cucumber, onion, cracker ; preparation:Blend together the cream cheese, mayonnaise, ketchup, mustard, and garlic powder. Gently fold in the shrimp, chopped cucumber, & chopped onion. Chill for at least 3 hours in the refrigerator. When ready to serve, spread crackers or toast rounds with the spread, then garnish each with a cucumber round and a shrimp. This spread also makes a wonderful sandwich. ; name: vanita s mexican chicken breast ; ingredients: boneless chicken breasts, evaporated milk, taco seasoning mix, cream of celery soup, cream of chicken soup, green chilies, cheddar cheese, tortilla chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Line bottom of a 9x13 pan. Put raw chicken breast on top of tortilla chips. Mix soups, milk, taco seasoning, and chilies. Pour over chicken in pan. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese on top of soup mixture. Bake at 350 for 40-50 minutes. ; name: spanish garlic soup ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, chicken broth, salt, pepper, bread cubes, egg ; preparation:

name: b l a bacon lettuce apple bites ; ingredients: bacon, bibb lettuce, sharp cheddar cheese, apple, lemon juice, mayonnaise, flour tortillas ; preparation:Toss apples with lemon juice. Cook bacon in large skillet till crisp. Drain on paper towel. Spread 1 tbl. Mayonnaise on each tortilla. Divide cheddar cheese, lettuce, bacon, and apples between each tortilla. Roll tightly. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate 30 minutes. Slice into inch rounds and serves. ; name: cajun fried cucumbers ; ingredients: cucumbers, salt and pepper, cajun seasoning, eggs, breadcrumbs, bacon drippings ; preparation:Season cucumbers with salt, pepper and cajun seasoning. Dip the slices in the beaten eggs. Coat the slices with breadcrumbs. Heat the bacon drippings and fry the cucumbers until brown on both sides. Drain and serve hot. ; name: baked ham california style ; ingredients: ham, orange peel, brown sugar, olive oil, dry mustard, pepper, whole cloves, grape juice ; preparation:Rinse ham thoroughly. Pat dry and cut slits randomly with a paring knife. Remove pith of orange peel and discard, cut remaining orange skin into small pieces and insert into slits. Combine next four ingredients and rub over entire surface of ham. Insert cloves in a regular pattern across the surface of the ham. Place in a covered roasting pan and bake at 325f, allowing 22 minutes per pound. Baste every 15 minutes during baking with grape juice. Uncover during last 45 minutes to brown. ; name: hickory house deviled eggs ; ingredients: eggs, red potatoes, salt, sweet pickle relish, mayonnaise, prepared yellow mustard, chives ; preparation:Put eggs and potatoes into medium pot and add enough cold water to cover them by 1 inch. Add salt and simmer over medium-high heat for 10-15 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low and gently simmer for 9 more minutes. Remove potatoes with slotted spoon and place in medium bowl. Put eggs under cold running water to let cool 3 minutes. Add mayonnaise, relish and mustard to potatoes, thoroughly mashing together with a fork. Set aside. Peel and cut eggs in half lengthwise. Carefully scoop out yolks add them to the potato mixture and mash together with a fork. Spoon filling onto hard-cooked whites, mounding filling slightly and covering whole cut side of egg. Garnish with chopped chives. ; name: asian beef and cabbage salad ; ingredients: ground beef, plum sauce, napa cabbage, scallions, carrots, cilantro, rice vinegar, canola oil, salt and pepper ; preparation:Brown ground beef. Stir in plum sauce. Toss together cabbage, scallions, carrots, cilantro, vinegar, and oil. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with the beef. ; name: sour cream and chive potato bake ; ingredients: potatoes, sour cream, cream, parmesan cheese, cheddar cheese, chives, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: ice cream rolls ; ingredients: refrigerated biscuits, butter, sugar, brown sugar, vanilla ice cream, ground cinnamon, raisins ; preparation:Spray 13 x 9 pan with cooking spray. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut biscuits in half. Place in pan in 1 layer. Pour butter evenly over biscuits. Sprinkle sugars evenly over biscuits and butter. Pour ice cream evenly. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool slightly. Turn pan over onto serving platter. ; name: puffed pancake ; ingredients: eggs, milk, unbleached flour, granulated sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, butter ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 425f. You will need a 12-inch cast iron skillet, or oven-proof skillet, and a blender. In a blender at medium speed, mix together the eggs, milk, flour, granulated sugar, vanilla, and cinnamon, until just combined, about 15 seconds. The batter should be a little bit lumpy. Melt the butter or margarine in a 12-inch cast iron skillet by putting it in the hot oven for about 30 seconds. Remove the skillet from the oven, spread the butter to coat the bottom and sides of the skillet, and pour in the batter. Return the skillet to the center oven rack and bake for about 20 minutes, or until the pancake is puffed and lightly browned. ; name: thai poached salmon ; ingredients: long grain rice, thai red curry paste, coconut cream, salmon fillets, green beans, fresh cilantro leaves ; preparation:Cook rice according to the packet instructions. Meanwhile, heat a medium frying pan. Add curry paste and cook, stirring, for a few seconds. Gradually stir in a coconut cream and bring to a simmer. Add salmon fillets, cover and simmer for 7-8 minutes, turning the fish over halfway. Meanwhile, blanch green beans in a pan of simmering water until just tender. Drain and divide between 2 hot serving plates. Stir some fresh cilantro leaves into the sauce. Top the beans with the salmon, spooning over the sauce. Garnish with cilantro and serve with the cooked rice. ; name: baked beans on toast au fromage ; ingredients: bread, butter, vegetarian baked beans, cheese ; preparation:Heat beans. Toast bread, spread with butter. Arrange on a plate and pour over the hot beans. Top with cheese and place under the grill until cheese is melted. Serve immediately. ; name: key lime tarts ; ingredients: cookies, cream cheese, egg, sugar, key lime juice, key lime zest, whipped cream ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Fill 2 mini muffin tins with paper cups and spray with cooking spray. Place 1 key lime cooler cookie in the bottom of the cup, flat side down. Beat together cream cheese, egg, sugar, lime juice and zest until well mixed. Fill the cups to the top. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove tarts to cool. When completely cool, top with whipped cream. ; name: two sisters chicken salad ; ingredients: cooked chicken, celery, onion, salt, lemon juice, seedless grapes, mayonnaise, mandarin oranges, toasted almond, romaine lettuce ; preparation:

name: curried chicken rice salad ; ingredients: raw rice, cooked chicken, canned pineapple, celery, green pepper, mayonnaise, peach preserves, curry powder, salt and pepper, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Combine cool rice, chicken, pineapple, celery and green pepper in biggish bowl. Combine peach preserves, mayonnaise and curry powder. Stir into the chicken mixture. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Chill for at least 2-3 hours. Serve topped with grated cheese, or not --. ; name: my mom s fried chicken ; ingredients: roasting chickens, all-purpose flour, salt, pepper ; preparation:Wash chicken pieces. Combine flour, salt and pepper in a paper bag. Add a few pieces of chicken at a time shaking to coat with flour. In a large cast iron skillet over moderate heat melt enough lard or vegetable shortening to measure about 1 inch deep. When cooking liquid has reached frying temperature you can see a little steam rising up. Cook chicken 30 minutes on each side. Lay cooked chicken on a paper towel lined platter and cover the top with paper towel also. This helps top keep the chicken from sweating and to stay crisp. ; name: brussels sprouts extraordinaire ; ingredients: onion, butter, flour, sugar, tomato juice, salt, pepper, frozen brussels sprouts, shredded cheddar cheese ; preparation:In a skillet, saute onion in butter until tender. Remove onion and set aside. Blend flour into the drippings. Add tomato juice. Cook and stir over low heat until thickened and smooth. Stir in the sugar, salt, pepper and onion. Arrange the brussels sprouts in a greased 1 quart baking dish. Top with the tomato sauce. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. ; name: cajun alfredo sauce ; ingredients: butter, heavy cream, garlic, parmesan cheese, cajun seasoning ; preparation:Melt butter. Add garlic. Saute till you smell the garlic. Add cream. Hard simmer for 20 - 30 or until desired consistency. Add cheese and cajun seasoning. Cook until melted. Pour over favorite pasta. ; name: memphis style turkey legs alton brown ; ingredients: smoked turkey legs, seasoning salt, barbecue sauce, dark brown sugar, fresh lemon juice ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 450f. Place the legs in a 13x9-inch baking pan and sprinkle with the seasoned salt. Pour 1 cup of water into the bottom of the pan and cover tightly with aluminum foil. Bake on the middle rack of the oven for 1 hour. After 1 hour, gently uncover the pan and turn the legs over. Continue to bake for another hour. Remove from the oven and drain off any remaining water. Combine the barbecue sauce, brown sugar, and lemon juice in a medium saucepan over high heat and bring to a boil. Remove from the heat and glaze the turkey legs with the sauce. ; name: milo choc chip cookies ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla essence, self-raising flour, chocolate chips, milo ; preparation:

name: lemon cranberry pie ; ingredients: whole berry cranberry sauce, cornstarch, light brown sugar, condensed milk, lemon juice, egg yolks, pastry shells ; preparation:Heat oven to 325 degrees. Prepare pastry. In small sauce pan, combine cranberry sauce, cornstarch, and sugar over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Spoon into pastry shell. In small mixing bowl, beat the condensed milk, lemon, and egg yolk until well-blended. Spoon evenly over cranberry mixture. Bake 30 minutes, cool, then chill thoroughly before serving. ; name: brown sugar glazed carrots ; ingredients: baby carrots, butter, brown sugar, salt ; preparation:In a medium saucepan cook carrots, covered, in a small amount of boiling salted water for 8 to 10 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain. Remove carrots from pan. In the same saucepan combine butter, brown sugar, and salt. Cook and stir over medium heat until combined. Add carrots. Cook and stir about 2 minutes or until glazed. ; name: crock pot dilly beef sandwiches ; ingredients: boneless beef chuck roast, dill pickles, chili sauce, garlic cloves, hamburger bun ; preparation:Cut roast in half and place in a 3 quart or larger crock pot. Add pickles with juice, chili sauce and garlic. Cover and cook on low 7 to 9 hours or until beef is tender. Discard pickles. Remove roast. When cool enough to handle, shred the meat. Return meat to sauce and heat through. Using slotted spoon, fill buns with desired amount. ; name: quick shrimp scampi bake ; ingredients: butter, white wine, fresh lemon juice, garlic, fresh parsley, salt, medium raw shrimp ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the butter, white wine, lemon juice, garlic, and parsley. When the butter melts completely, remove from heat. Arrange shrimp in a shallow baking dish. Pour the butter mixture over the shrimp. Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes or until the shrimp are pink and opaque. Serve over rice or pasta. ; name: hearty german farmer s breakfast bauernfruhstuck ; ingredients: bacon, potatoes, green pepper, onions, salt and pepper, cheddar cheese, eggs, milk ; preparation:In a skillet over low heat, cook bacon until crisp. Remove to paper towel. Reserve 2 tablespoons drippings. Add potatoes, green pepper, onion, salt and pepper. Cook and stir over medium heat until the potatoes are golden brown. Stir in eggs and milk, and cook and stir until eggs are almost set, about 2 minutes. Reduce heat to low. Add cheese and bacon, stirring gently until heated through and eggs are set. Serve immediately. Leftovers are tasty the following day. Good wrapped in a flour tortilla for a breakfast burrito, breakfast on the go. Serves 4 to 6. ; name: white cranberry peach banana smoothie ; ingredients: cranberry-peach juice, banana, vanilla yogurt, ice ; preparation:

name: frangelico coconut cake ; ingredients: frangelico, yellow cake mix, sugar, eggs, water, almond extract, heavy cream, frosting, shredded coconut ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine frangelico, cake mix, eggs, water, and almond extract. Pour batter into two prepared 8 inch cake pans. Bake for 25 - 30 minutes. Turn onto a cooling rack. Beat cream with the sugar until stiff. Split the cake layers in half. Spread with whipped cream and stack on a serving plate. Frost the top and sides of the cake with your choice of frosting or frangelico frosting. Sprinkle with coconut. ; name: smoked cheese gouda or alps potato salad ; ingredients: potatoes, deli ham, smoked cheese, eggs, celery ribs, green onions, mayonnaise, lemon juice, salt & pepper ; preparation:Mix first 6 ingredients together. Mix lemon juice, mayo and salt and pepper. Mix into salad. Chill for 1 hour. Enjoy. ; name: mexican tuna salad ; ingredients: albacore tuna in water, tomatoes, red onion, cilantro, fresh lime juice, jalapeno peppers, salt, boston lettuce, baked corn tortilla chips ; preparation:Place tuna in a medium bowl and break into large pieces with a fork. Add tomatoes, onion, cilantro, lime juice, peppers, and salt. Stir to mix. Cover and refrigerate 30 minutes or up to 6 hours. Line plates with lettuce leaves and top with tuna salad. Serve with chips. ; name: mint iced tea ; ingredients: water, peppermint tea bags, orange pekoe tea bags, orange, zest of, mint leaves, whole cloves, superfine sugar, pink grapefruit juice, ice cube, mint sprig ; preparation:Bring water to boil in a tea kettle. In a large tea pot, place tea bags, orange zest, mint leaves and cloves and then pour boiling water over all. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Cover and let steep until cool. Strain tea through mesh strainer into a large pitcher filled with ice. Stir in grapefruit juice. Serve over ice in large glasses, garnished with mint sprigs, if desired. ; name: easy corn fritters ; ingredients: corn, egg, sugar, salt, butter, baking powder, flour, milk, canola oil ; preparation:Thaw frozen corn by placing it in a strainer in the sink and run cold water over it, stirring occasionally, until it is completely thawed. While corn is thawing, mix all of the remaining ingredients except oil in a large bowl. Add thawed corn to batter and mix well. Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet on medium-high. Drop spoonfuls of batter into skillet. Brown on both sides. Drain on paper towels before serving. ; name: noel pecan logs ; ingredients: powdered sugar, marshmallow cream, vanilla, caramels, margarine, pecans ; preparation:

name: peanut butter scotchies ; ingredients: refrigerated sugar cookie dough, creamy peanut butter, dark brown sugar, vanilla extract, butterscotch chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Spray cookie sheets with non-stick cooking spray. Break up cookie dough into large bowl. Let stand 10-15 minutes to soften. Add the peanut butter, brown sugar, vanilla and butterscotch morsels. Mix well. Drop dough by teaspoon, two inches apart onto sheets. Bake 10-13 minutes or until just set and golden at edges. Transfer cookies to rack and let cool. ; name: easy ham and cheese puffs appetizer ; ingredients: refrigerated buttermilk biscuits, tomato sauce, ham, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 450 degrees. Spray a small baking sheet with nonstick spray coating. Set aside. Open the biscuit carton, and separate the biscuits. Place them on the baking sheet in a single layer without crowding together. With a small spoon, spread the tomato sauce on the biscuits, dividing the mixture evenly. Top with the ham and cheese, dividing evenly. Bake in the center of the oven for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden. Serve hot. ; name: quaker steak and lube s beer cheese dip ; ingredients: cream cheese, sharp cheddar cheese, garlic clove, worcestershire sauce, dry mustard, cayenne powder, beer ; preparation:Combine cream cheese and cheddar cheese in an electric mixer beat on medium until smooth. Add garlic and spices. Beat well. Gradually add beer, beating until blended. Chill 1 hour. Serve with potato chips, crusty bread or crackers. ; name: carrot and almond soup vegan ; ingredients: onions, garlic cloves, carrots, celery ribs, vegetable bouillon granules, fresh cilantro, fresh parsley, ground almonds ; preparation:Place the onions, garlic, carrots, and celery in a large saucepan. Add 1. 25 litres boiling water and the bouillon powder. Bring to a boil and add the herb stalks. Lower the heat and simmer for 30 minutes until vegetables are tender when pierced with a knife. Remover from the heat and allow to cool slightly. Strain, reserving the stock. Remove the herb stalks, then blend the vegetables in a food processor or with a hand-held blender until smooth. Return the mixture to the pan and add the ground almonds and enough of the reserved stock to make a soup-like consistency. Re-heat, then divide between warmed soup bowls and serve garnished with fresh cilantro and parsley. ; name: granny s hamburger casserole ; ingredients: lean ground beef, vidalia onions, red potatoes, cheddar cheese, condensed cream of mushroom soup, water, salt ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a dutch oven, brown hamburger meat. Drain off fat. In the dutch oven, top meat with all of the sliced onions, then the potatoes. Salt the potatoes. Top with shredded cheese. Combine soup and soup can of water in a bowl and blend with spoon until smooth. Spread soup mixture over the cheese. Bake covered at 350 for about an hour. ; name: spinach cheese casserole ; ingredients: frozen spinach, onion, garlic cloves, butter, eggs, low fat cottage cheese, all-purpose flour, low-fat sharp cheddar cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: sugar free sweet cole slaw ; ingredients: coleslaw, diced onions, light salad dressing, vegetable oil, sugar substitute, white vinegar, salt ; preparation:Combine the coleslaw mix and onion in a large bowl. Whisk together the salad dressing, vegetable oil, sugar substitute, vinegar, and salt in a medium bowl. Blend thoroughly. Pour dressing mixture over coleslaw mix and toss to coat. Chill at least 2 hours before serving. ; name: macaroni cake ; ingredients: spaghetti, eggs, whole milk, cream, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, butter ; preparation:Cook the macaroni aldente and drain. Wisk eggs, milk, cream, sugar, vanilla, and cinnamon in a large bowl. Add cooked and drained macaroni. Pour into rectangle baking pan. Bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes. ; name: lamb with spinach ; ingredients: lamb, salt and pepper, olive oil, onion, garlic clove, bouillon, fresh spinach, oregano, lemon juice, feta cheese ; preparation:Sprinkle salt and pepper over the cubed lamb, heat the oil in a dutch oven and brown the meat on all sides. Add the onion and garlic and fry until the onion gets translucent. Add the stock, bring to the boil, lower the heat, cover and simmer slowly for 40- 50 minutes or until the meat is tender. Was the spinach and cook for about 5-7 minutes, without adding any water, drain very well and chop roughly. When the lamb had its cooking time, add the spinach together with the oregano and the lemon juice. On a medium heat and stirring regularly, cook until most cooking juices have evaporated, but it should still be moist. Transfer to a serving dish and sprinkle with the feta cheese. ; name: turkey philly sandwiches ; ingredients: butter, onion, green bell pepper, black pepper, deli turkey, sandwich buns, low-sodium mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375. Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and bell pepper. Saut 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in black pepper. Divide onion mixture and turkey evenly among bottom halves of rolls. Top each serving with 1 cheese slice. Cover with top halves of rolls. Place sandwiches on a baking sheet. Bake at 375 for 5 minutes or until cheese melts. ; name: nachos ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, taco sauce, refried beans, cream of mushroom soup, taco seasoning, salt, velveeta cheese, tortilla chips, sour cream ; preparation:Brown beef and onions in saucepan. Drain. Combine all ingredients except tortilla chips and sour cream in slow cooker. Cover and cook on high 1 hour stirring occasionally until cheese if fully melted. Serve warm with chips and sour cream. ; name: healthy spinach and cannellini bean dip ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, garlic cloves, spinach, cannellini beans, lemon juice, balsamic vinegar, salt, ground black pepper ; preparation:

name: easy chocolate coconut bars ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, coconut, egg, flour, baking powder, cocoa, icing sugar, milk ; preparation:Combine all of the ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Press mixture firmly into a greased 19cmx29cm rectangular slice pan. Bake in a 350 degree f oven for 20 minutes. Whilst baking make the icing by sifting together the icing sugar and cocoa. Stir in the butter and enough milk to make it spreadable. Remove the slice from the oven and spread with the icing while still hot. Cool in pan. Cut into bars or squares to serve. ; name: garlicky asparagus ; ingredients: asparagus, olive oil, salt, pepper, garlic powder, toasted sesame seeds ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375. Spray baking tray with non-stick spray. Place asparagus stalks on baking tray. Drizzle with olive oil. Add salt, pepper and garlic powder. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until stalks are tender. Sprinkle on sesame seeds before serving. ; name: chocolate chippers cookies ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, caster sugar, egg, vanilla essence, self-raising flour, salt, miniature chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180c. Line 2 large baking trays with baking paper. Place butter and sugar in bowl and, using an electric beater beat for 3 minutes or until light and fluffy. Add egg and vanilla and beat till well combined. Add flour, salt and chocolate also add nuts now is using. Mix well until combined. Taking heaped teaspoonfuls roll into balls and flatten slightly between palm of hands. Place on prepared tray 5cm apart and bake for 10-15 minutes or until golden around the edges. Remove from oven and cool for a few minutes on tray before removing to cooling racks. ; name: lemon ice cream without ice cream maker ; ingredients: lemon juice, lemon zest, sugar, whole milk, heavy cream, salt ; preparation:Combine lemon juice, lemon zest, and sugar in a mixing bowl. Gradually stir in milk, heavy cream and salt. Pour into an 8 inch glass baking dish, cover and freeze until firm. Remove ice cream one half at a time and run through a food processor until nearly smooth. Pour into a plastic bowl, with lid. Top ice cream mixture with plastic wrap and seal with lid to bowl. Will keep up to one week. ; name: tropical green beans ; ingredients: olive oil, fresh green beans, yellow onion, garlic cloves, salt, balsamic vinegar, hearts of palm, sun-dried tomato, pine nuts, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Brush a large baking dish with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Put green beans, onion, and garlic in dish, drizzle with remaining oil and sprinkle with salt. Bake for 25 minutes, stirring beans at least 3 times. When tender, remove beans from oven and transfer to bowl. Immediately drizzle with vinegar. Add hearts of palm, tomatoes, pine nits and pepper to taste and toss. Serve warm or room temperature. ; name: salt cod with scrambled eggs ; ingredients: salt cod fish, bacon, green pepper, tomatoes, eggs, black pepper ; preparation:

name: banana lumpia ; ingredients: spring roll wrappers, bananas, sugar, cinnamon, canola oil ; preparation:Combine sugar and cinnamon in a bowl and coat bananas with the mixture. Take 1 spring roll wrapper and place 1 banana strip on bottom of wrapper. Fold in left and right side and roll up from bottom. Deep-fry on each side until golden brown. Drain on paper towels and serve while still warm. ; name: cod with miso glaze ; ingredients: yellow miso, rice vinegar, sugar, soy sauce, cayenne pepper, vegetable oil, cod fish fillets ; preparation:Preheat broiler. Blend miso, vinegar, sugar, soy sauce and cayenne pepper in food processor. With machine running, gradually pour in oil and blend until smooth. Place cod in a large bowl and pour half of miso mixture over fish, toss to coat and transfer to a rimmed baking sheet. Broil cod about 8 inches from heat until beginning to brown, about 3 minutes, reduce heat to 450 degrees and finish baking, about 5 minutes more. When fish is opaque, remove from oven and serve drizzled with remaining half of miso mixture. ; name: prawns with chilli and garlic ; ingredients: prawns, garlic, bay leaves, dried red chilies, extra virgin olive oil, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat a grill to moderate high. Place the prawns, bay leaves, chillies and garlic in one large or two medium sized oven proof serving dishes. Pour the olive oil over the prawns and add a little salt and pepper. Place the dish or dishes under the preheated grill. Cook the prawns until they are pink and cooked through 3-5 minutes. Remove them from under the grill and serve. ; name: white chocolate macadamia caramel bars ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, vegetable oil, water, eggs, caramel ice cream topping, refrigerated white chocolate chip macadamia nut cookie dough ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 f. Combine cake mix, oil, water and eggs with electric mixer on low speed until smooth. Spread into ungreased 13x9-inch pan. Bake 18-22 minutes until top is golden brown. Remove partially baked crust from oven. In 1-cup measuring cup, microwave caramel topping about 15 seconds or until warm and pourable, and drizzle over crust. Crumble cookies over crust. Bake 18-22 minutes longer or until golden brown. Cool completely and cut into bars. ; name: broiled salmon fillet with mustard dill sauce ; ingredients: salmon fillets, soy sauce, bay leaf, fresh thyme sprig ; preparation:Preheat broiler. Rinse salmon and pat dry. Arrange salmon, skin side down, in a foil-lined jelly-roll pan and rub thoroughly with soy sauce. Season salmon with salt and pepper and broil about 4 inches from heat 12 to 15 minutes, or until just cooked through. Transfer salmon to a platter and garnish with herbs. Serve salmon warm or at room temperature with mustard dill sauce. ; name: roasted eggplant dip with thai flavors ; ingredients: eggplant, palm sugar, soy sauce, salt, chili paste, lime juice, fresh cilantro, green onions, cilantro leaf ; preparation:

name: creamsicle jello shots ; ingredients: orange jell-o, boiling water, orange juice, water, triple sec, vodka ; preparation:Dissolve jello in boiling water. Stir for about 3 minutes. Add remaining ingredients and pour into shot containers. Chill for 4 hours and enjoy. If you have fresh squeezed oj that is the way to go. ; name: marinated green olives ; ingredients: green olives in brine, fresh rosemary, fennel seed, peppercorn, dried chilies, preserved lemons, olive oil ; preparation:Crush the fennel and peppercorns in a pestle and mortar. Chop the chillies into smallish pieces. Discard the flesh of the preserved lemon and rinse the skin to remove excess salt. Cut into fine strips. Drain the olives and give them a rinse off in water. Place the olives in a clean jar and add the remaining ingredients. Cover with olive oil and leave to marinate. I have left them as little as a couple of hours and up to a few weeks. Pop them in the fridge, but bring back to room temperature before serving. ; name: georgia cornbread cake ; ingredients: sugar, brown sugar, eggs, vegetable oil, self-rising flour, vanilla, pecans ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease and flour a 9x13-inch baking dish. Stir together sugar, brown sugar,, eggs and oil in a medium bowl until smooth. Stir in flour and vanilla. Add pecans and stir until evenly mixed. Spoon into prepared pan and bake for 30 to 35 minutes. Good served with a dollop of whipped cream, enjoy. ; name: savory egg casserole ; ingredients: cheddar cheese, butter, cream, prepared mustard, salt, pepper, eggs ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Sprinkle cheese in 9x9 inch square baking dish. Dot with butter. Mix cream, mustard, salt, and pepper, and pour half of the mixture over the cheese. Pour eggs on top. Pour remaining cream mixture over the eggs. Bake 25 minutes. Serve immediately. ; name: ox yoke inn poppy seed muffins ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, vegetable oil, milk, eggs, almond extract, poppy seeds ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease two 12-cup muffin tins. Combine flour, sugar baking powder and salt in large bowl. Whisk oil, milk, eggs and extract in another large bowl until smooth. Add dry ingredients and mix only until evenly moistened. Stir in poppy seeds. Divide batter between prepared tins. Bake until muffins are golden brown, or about 30 minutes. Serve muffins warm or at room temperature. ; name: roasted asparagus shiitake mushrooms ; ingredients: fresh asparagus, shiitake mushroom, extra virgin olive oil, coarse salt, balsamic vinegar, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:

name: more more apple pear jigglers ; ingredients: unflavored gelatin, milk, cream cheese, yogurt, apple, pear ; preparation:In a food processor or blender, process the gelatin and milk for 30 seconds or until gelatin is disolved and mixture is smooth. Add the cream cheese and yogurt and process for 10 seconds. Add the fruits and blend until thoroughly pured. Spray an 8-inch square baking pan with nonstick spray. Pour gelatin mixture into pan and chill until firm. Once chilled, cut into squares or creative shapes using cookie cutters and serve. ; name: hello dolly bars ; ingredients: butter, graham cracker crumbs, shredded coconut, semi-sweet chocolate chips, white chocolate chips, walnuts, sweetened condensed milk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a 13 by 9 inch baking pan mix together butter and graham cracker crumbs. Press into bottom of pan. Sprinkle coconut, chocolate chips, and walnuts in layers evenly over crust. Drizzle sweetened condensed milk over the top. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes. Let cool completely before cutting into squares. ; name: cheese vegemite mini quiches ; ingredients: bread, butter, vegemite, bacon, sliced mushrooms, tasty cheese, eggs, cream, chives ; preparation:Spread each slice of bread with butter then very thinly with vegemite. Press bread into non-stick muffin pans, vegemite sides facing up. Cook bacon and mushrooms in a frying pan for 2 minutes. Combine bacon, mushrooms, cheese, eggs, cream and chives. Spoon savoury egg mixture into bread cases and bake at 210c for 15 minutes or until set. Serve hot or cold. ; name: quick easy piping gel icing ; ingredients: white corn syrup, cold water, cornstarch, white vanilla, food coloring paste ; preparation:In microwaveable bowl, mix cold water and cornstarch together. Add corn syrup and white vanilla, and stir until combined. Microwave on high for 1min 30sec - 2 min until mixture boils and turns clear. Remove from microwave and let cool. Add food dye to make desired color. Put in piping bag and use to decorate cakes, cookies, etc. ; name: crumb coated baked chicken ; ingredients: buttermilk, hot pepper sauce, seasoned bread crumbs, yellow cornmeal, salt, dried cilantro, chili powder, cayenne pepper, ground cumin, skinless chicken breasts ; preparation:Line a 15x10 inch baking pan with foil. Coat the foil with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside. In a shallow bowl, combine buttermilk and hot pepper sauce. In another bowl, combine the bread crumbs, cornmeal and seasonings. Dip chicken in buttermilk mixture, then roll in crumb mixture. Place bone side down in prepared pan. Spritz chicken with nonstick cooking spray. Bake at 425 degrees fahrenheit for 15-20 minutes. Remove from oven. Spritz again with nonstick cooking spray. Bake 15 to 20 minutes longer or until a meat thermometer reads 170 degrees fahrenheit. ; name: coconut cream oatmeal ; ingredients: flaked coconut, morton lite salt, water, quick-cooking oats, fat-free sweetened condensed milk, coconut extract ; preparation:

name: lobster fondue red lobster copycat ; ingredients: velveeta cheese, milk, cayenne pepper, paprika, lobster tails, sweet red pepper, fresh parsley, french bread ; preparation:Take the cap off the bread and hollow it out being careful to do it in chunks you can serve with the fondue. Spray the inside of the bowl and extra pieces of bread with light olive oil and broil till golden. Combine all other ingredients except red pepper and parsley in a sauce pan. Heat on medium low till cheese is melted. Stir in pepper. Pour as much as will fit into bread bowl. Garnish with parsley and serve hot with fondue forks. You will need a bread knife to cut the bread bowl up into chunks toward the end. ; name: my cuppa tea plain ; ingredients: water, milk, sugar, tea leaves ; preparation:Bring water to a boil. Add sugar and tea leaves. Bring to a boil again and reduce heat. Keep simmering for around 2 minutes. Add milk and bring to boil again. Reduce heat and simmer for a minute. Take off the gas and strain into 2 cups. Enjoy some kadak chai indian ishtyle and fay ishtyle too. ; name: pecan crusted honey chicken ; ingredients: dijon mustard, honey, lemon juice, boneless skinless chicken breast halves, pecans, dry breadcrumbs, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375. Mix mustard, honey and lemon juice. Brush mixture onto both sides of chicken breasts. Place chicken breasts in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Combine pecans, bread crumbs, and butter. Sprinkle evenly over chicken, press lightly into chicken to secure. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. ; name: chocolate wagon wheel cookies ; ingredients: vegetable oil, unsweetened chocolate, sugar, eggs, flour, baking powder, vanilla, powdered sugar ; preparation:Combine oil, chocolate, and sugar. Add eggs to this mixture, one at a time, and beat well. Stir in vanilla. Sift flour and baking powder and fold into egg combination. Chill dough several hours or overnight in refridgerator. Roll into balls size of walnuts, then roll in powdered sugar. Bake on greased cookie sheet 7-10 minutes at 350 oven. If you like your cookies soft and chewy, bake only 7 minutes. ; name: annie s pecan pralines ; ingredients: white sugar, baking soda, buttermilk, salt, butter, pecan halves ; preparation:Combine in a large pan the sugar, soda, buttermilk and salt. Cook briskly, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes. Add butter and pecans. Cook for approximately 5 minutes more, or until mixture reaches softball stage. Remove from heat and beat until just creamy. Drop by spoonsful onto waxed paper. Store in airtight containers. ; name: chicken saffron risotto low fat ; ingredients: arborio rice, chicken stock, chicken breasts, leek, saffron strands, lemon, zest of, lemon juice, frozen peas ; preparation:

name: roasted eggplant for pasta and recipes ; ingredients: eggplants, olive oil, fresh ground black pepper, eggplant, garlic powder ; preparation:Place eggplant cubes on a plate and sprinkle with salt then let them sit for 30 minutes to remove bitterness. Rinse off the cubes in a collander then pat them dry with a paper towel. Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Place eggplant cubes onto a nonstick baking sheet and drizzle the oil over them. Grind the fresh pepper over the eggplant to give them all a light dusting. Sprinkle the just under 1 tsp salt over the cubes. Sprinkle the garlic powder over the cubes. Bake for 30 minutes, give it a stir midway thru. ; name: taverns ; ingredients: water, onion, ground beef, ketchup, chili powder, yellow mustard, hamburger buns ; preparation:Add onions to water in medium saucepan. Boil on medium heat until onions are transparent. Add ground beef and ketchup. Continue cooking on medium heat for 15 minutes. Add mustard and chili powder. Serve on hamburger bun. ; name: easy 1lb meatloaf ; ingredients: ground beef, egg, oatmeal, onion, garlic powder, chili powder, lemon pepper, kosher salt, ketchup ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In medium mixing bowl, break beef into small chunks. Add egg, oatmeal, onion, spices, and ketchup. Mix until well blended. Smooth mixture into regular sized bread pan. If you like having a sauce on top, smooth some extra ketchup over the top of the uncooked meatloaf. Place in oven for 35 to 40 minutes, or until meat is cooked all the way through. Let sit for 5-10 minutes before serving. ; name: pork chops with apples and swiss ; ingredients: pork chops, cloves, dry white wine, celery leaves, bay leaves, celery ribs, butter, apples, brown sugar, swiss cheese ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 375f and butter a baking pan. Press a clove into each chop, then add the chops to the pan, followed by the wine, celery leaves, and bay leaves. Bake the chops for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, heat the butter in a frying pan and saute the diced celery for 5 minutes, tehn add the apples and brown sugar. Turn the heat to low and cook for 10 minutes, or until just tender. After 30 minutes, remove the pork chops, discard the bay and celery leaves and sprinkle cheese on each chop. Baste with juices and broil a few minutes to brown. Add a few pan juices to the apple-celery mixture, and serve as a side with the pork chops. ; name: roasted eggplant for pasta and recipes ; ingredients: eggplants, olive oil, fresh ground black pepper, eggplant, garlic powder ; preparation:Place eggplant cubes on a plate and sprinkle with salt then let them sit for 30 minutes to remove bitterness. Rinse off the cubes in a collander then pat them dry with a paper towel. Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Place eggplant cubes onto a nonstick baking sheet and drizzle the oil over them. Grind the fresh pepper over the eggplant to give them all a light dusting. Sprinkle the just under 1 tsp salt over the cubes. Sprinkle the garlic powder over the cubes. Bake for 30 minutes, give it a stir midway thru. ; name: chicken and cheese pie ; ingredients: chicken breasts, cooked rice, cream of chicken soup, sharp cheddar cheese ; preparation:

name: glazed carrots with ginger ; ingredients: unsalted butter, baby carrots, sugar, chicken broth, gingerroot, golden raisins, salt, black pepper ; preparation:Melt butter in a large skilloet over medium heat, tilting pan to coat completely. Add carrots and cook for 1 minute. Add sugar and stir to combine, cook for 1 minute. Add chicken broth, grated ginger, raisins, salt and pepper and cook for 20 minutes or until carrots are tender when pierced with a fork. Serve warm. Makes 4 servings. ; name: grilled cheddar and bacon on raisin bread ; ingredients: unsalted butter, raisin bread, extra-sharp cheddar cheese, bacon ; preparation:Butter one side of each raisin bread slice and turn slices over. Arrange cheddar on unbuttered sides of bread and top 4 slices with bacon. Flip remaining bread onto bacon.
